A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, HARMONY N BLESSED will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Was slow to begin.  When questioned, K De Melo stated that his mount was fractious in the barriers and as a consequence jumped awkwardly and lost ground at the start.  He said due to his mount’s mannerism in the barriers, he had not had the opportunity to fit his goggles and as a result after travelling approximately 200 Metres fitted his goggles.  When questioned regarding his riding on the Home Turn as to whether there was an opportunity to improve to the outside of EXPLOSIVE WITNESS sooner than what he did, K De Melo stated that from the 550 Metres his mount was not travelling well enough to make a forward move and as a consequence he elected to remain racing to the outside of EXPLOSIVE WITNESS.  He added that when EXPLOSIVE WITNESS then shifted out to improve on the Home Turn, this resulted in KYRUS DRAGON being taken wider before he was able to shift his mount back to the inside to secure clear running at the 300 Metres.  K De Melo was advised that whenever possible he must ensure all equipment is properly fitted before the start of a race.

Became fractious whilst parading, examined by the Veterinary Officer on arrival at the Start and passed suitable to race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

Jumped awkwardly and then was bumped shortly after the start.  After the race, C Y Ho stated that whilst his mount was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event, when he had concern that there might be something amiss with SPORTS LEGEND, he did not ride it out to the finish.  Trainer J Richards stated that SPORTS LEGEND had pleased him in its three barrier trials since arriving in Hong Kong, however, in retrospect SPORTS LEGEND may have needed some more time to climatise to Hong Kong.  He added that as a result he now intends to send SPORTS LEGEND to Conghua to freshen it up before its next race start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of SPORTS LEGEND was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, SPORTS LEGEND will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Was sent for sampling post-race.

Was slow to begin.  Near the 550 Metres commenced to race keenly and shifted out when being steadied away from EXCELLENT PEERS.  C Y Ho was found guilty of a charge under Rule 100(2) in that he failed to ride his mount out all the way to the end of the race to the satisfaction of the Stewards.  Having considered precedent penalties, Jockey Ho’s record in relation to like offences and the nature of the breach in circumstances where his mount dead-heated for first placing, the Stewards believed the appropriate penalty was for C Y Ho’s licence to ride in races be suspended for a period to commence on Wednesday, 18 October 2023 and to expire on Monday, 20 November 2023 on which day he may resume race riding (10 Hong Kong racedays).  Was sent for sampling post-race.

Shortly after the start became unbalanced.  When questioned, L Hewitson stated that he had expected to take up a forward position, preferably with cover.  He said in the early stages when EURO ROCKS was caught wide, he elected to continue forward on his mount to cross LUCKY ARCHANGEL and as a consequence settled outside the leader ALLGREEKTOME.  He added that EURO ROCKS, which was having its first start at Happy Valley tonight, may not have appreciated the circuit and in addition was not comfortable on the "Good to Firm” track conditions.  He further stated that, in his opinion, EURO ROCKS would be better suited on the All Weather surface.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Raced wide and without cover until near the 1000 Metres when it was allowed to stride forward and race outside the lead.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported. <16/10/2023 Additional Veterinary Reports>RING BELLS, which performed poorly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time the horse was found to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported. RING BELLS was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer K H Ting this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its right front leg. Before being allowed to race again, RING BELLS will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

A Atzeni (JOYFUL CHAMPION) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 400 Metres he directed his mount out when there was insufficient room to do so, resulting in SPLENDID STAR being crowded for room when racing to the inside of KYRUS UNICORN and causing SPLENDID STAR to be checked when it lost its rightful running.  A Atzeni was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 1 November 2023 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent race riding record.  When questioned regarding the disappointing performance, Z Purton stated that SPLENDID STAR settled comfortably in the early stages in a forward position.  He said after the pace increased from the 1600 Metres, his mount was crossed by RING BELLS in the Back Straight and came under pressure from the 1000 Metres.  He added with SPLENDID STAR stepping up in weight today and the pace of the event being quicker than at its last start, SPLENDID STAR, although interfered with at the 400 Metres, was still disappointing.  Trainer D J Whyte concurred with the views offered by Jockey Purton and stated that SPLENDID STAR may not have appreciated racing within two weeks from its last start and may not also have appreciated the step-up in distance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of SPLENDID STAR, favourite for the race and a last start winner, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, SPLENDID STAR will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Was sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned, K Teetan stated that after following SUPER COMMANDER in the early stages, whilst a run became available to that runner’s inside near the 400 Metres, he was reluctant to shift to the inside as his mount, which was having its first race start in Hong Kong, was travelling comfortably.  He added that after remaining racing behind SUPER COMMANDER near the 250 Metres, RUBY SAILING shifted out, resulting in the run to the inside of SUPER COMMANDER closing and HAYDAY then being held up for clear running between the 250 Metres and the 200 Metres. When questioned, K Teetan stated that he was instructed to hold a forward position, but not to make use of his mount in the early stages.  He said from barrier 6 MR MAJESTIC jumped well, but was caught wide in the early stages.  He said having regard to his instructions and the genuine pace that the event was run at in the early stages, he was of the opinion that his mount would be best served by allowing MR MAJESTIC to settle in a three wide position rather than making use of his mount to endeavour to cross WATCH BUDDY which was positioned to his inside.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings. <5/10/2023 Additional Veterinary Reports>MR MAJESTIC, which performed disappointingly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings.  MR MAJESTIC was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer D J Whyte this morning.  He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its left front leg with a left front tendon injury.  Before being allowed to race again, MR MAJESTIC will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Was withdrawn on 3.10.23 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame left fore) and was replaced by Standby Declared Starter AFFIRM.  Before being allowed to race again, UNISON will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
No report.

When questioned regarding the performance of RUBY SAILING, Z Purton stated that whilst his mount was able to hold a forward position and travelled satisfactorily in the run, when asked for an effort from the 400 Metres, RUBY SAILING failed to respond to his riding and, in his opinion, was disappointing.  He added the only explanation he could offer was that RUBY SAILING is now looking to be stepped up in distance where it can travel at a more sustainable pace in the early stages. Trainer K L Man stated that with RUBY SAILING wearing blinkers and the tongue tie for the first time and racing without cover, the horse then was unable to finish the race off as he had expected.  He added that he agreed with the assessment offered by Jockey Purton and indicated that he will endeavor to step RUBY SAILING up in distance for its next race start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of RUBY SAILING was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, RUBY SAILING will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Was slow to begin.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

The performance of SPARKLING DOLPHIN, a last start winner, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, SPARKLING DOLPHIN will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Was sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned regarding his riding out over the concluding stages, H Bowman stated that KAHOLO ANGEL lay in when placed under pressure in the Home Straight and near the 100 Metres he was required to put more pressure on his left rein when the horse continued to lay in.  He added over the concluding stages, whilst he continued to ride KAHOLO ANGEL out to the finish, he was unable to apply his full and usual vigour as his focus was on preventing KAHOLO ANGEL, which was commencing to tire, from shifting in further and causing interference.  After viewing the patrol films, the Stewards accepted the explanation offered by Jockey Bowman.
No report.

Was slow to begin.  In the early part of the Home Straight lay in when racing tight to the inside of MARVEL DRAGON.  As a result, K De Melo had some difficulty in riding his mount out through that section of the race.

Was reported by the Veterinary Surgeon to have bled from both nostrils after the race.  Before being allowed to race again, WONDERFUL UNICORN will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

The performance of, DASHING SUCCESS, which finished tailed out on the second consecutive occasion, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, DASHING SUCCESS will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a series of consecutive barrier trials and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

The Stewards deferred the declaration of weighed-in whilst they considered if SMART LEADER had been afforded a fair start.  After viewing the patrol films and taking evidence from the Starter, Mr A Speechley, the Stewards found that as the start was effected SMART LEADER reared and jumped awkwardly, resulting in its rider, H Bentley, being dislodged.  As the Stewards were satisfied that such occurrence happened simultaneously to the start being effected, SMART LEADER was declared a runner.  Before being allowed to race again, SMART LEADER will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  After the race, H Bentley was examined by the Chief Medical Officer and passed fit to fulfil his remaining race riding engagements.
Was sent for sampling post-race.

Approaching the 100 Metres NATURAL GOLD shifted in, resulting in its rider, K De Melo, correcting his mount.  Whilst being corrected and being ridden along, NATURAL GOLD then shifted out, resulting in SUPER WISE DRAGON, which had improved to the outside of NATURAL GOLD, being taken out, causing FREE FOAL and GO HERO to be taken out and IMPERIAL MAGEE then having to be checked when crowded to the inside of NOBLE PURSUIT.  K De Melo was severely reprimanded and advised in similar circumstances he would be expected to stop riding his mounts when they shift ground whilst not clear sooner than what he did on this occasion.

He added that, in his opinion, NOBLE WIN prefers softer going and also would appreciate a race run at a stronger tempo, particularly when settling back in the field.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned regarding his riding, A Badel stated that with CALIFORNIA SPANGLE and CIRCUIT STELLAR expected to lead the event, he was asked to obtain a position with cover behind those two runners.  He said in the early stages when caught wide and to the outside of CIRCUIT STELLAR, he endeavoured to ride forward to cross CIRCUIT STELLAR, but when that runner was travelling well and held its position to his inside, he was obliged to race three wide and without cover.  He added that throughout the middle stages although he was aware the race was being run at a pace slower than standard, he was reluctant to push his mount forward as CIRCUIT STELLAR was travelling strongly and he felt this would have resulted in him having to make too much use of MONEY CATCHER to cross that runner.  After considering his explanation, the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Badel were reasonable in the circumstances.

When questioned regarding his riding out of AWESOME TREASURE over the concluding stages, Z Purton stated that after hearing a call from runners to his outside, he desisted from riding his mount along as he was concerned he may be causing interference.  He said as a result he then shifted AWESOME TREASURE in, but then received a call from Apprentice Y L Chung, the rider of COLONEL, and as a result he straightened AWESOME TREASURE and was unable to ride it out to the finish of the event.  The Stewards accepted the explanation offered by Z Purton.  Z Purton could offer no explanation for his mount’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Was sent for sampling post-race.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned regarding the improved performance of TATTENHAM, Trainer P C Ng stated that at its last start the stable was disappointed with its performance and as a result he transferred TATTENHAM to his Conghua stable.  He said he then barrier trialed TATTENHAM on 9 October 2023 where he removed the hood and the pacifiers and instructed its rider to take up a forward position in the barrier trial.  He added that TATTENHAM performed well in this barrier trial and as a consequence tonight he instructed A Hamelin, from its inside barrier, to endeavour to obtain a forward position if possible which advantaged TATTENHAM tonight.  He said in addition TATTENHAM was suited by the "Good to Yielding” track conditions.  Was sent for sampling post-race.
Approaching the 200 Metres had some difficulty obtaining clear running when positioned close to DIAMOND DIAMOND.

He added that when he asked his mount for an effort in the Home Straight, it failed to respond to his riding and raced in a disappointing manner.  Trainer W Y So advised that SUPER EAGLE had pleased him leading into the race and he was unable to offer any explanation as to why the horse performed disappointingly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Was noted to have blood in its mouth whilst in the saddling stalls, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  After the race, L Hewitson stated that his mount raced greenly throughout the event but was still somewhat disappointing.
No report.

Jumped awkwardly and shifted out.  In the middle stages raced keenly and for some distance near the 800 Metres was steadied away from TELECOM DRAGON.  For a short distance approaching the 400 Metres was held up for clear running behind TELECOM DRAGON.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have bled from both nostrils.  Before being allowed to race again, NICETOBEMET will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the race, M F Poon stated that his mount would derive benefit from today’s race experience but could offer no other explanation for his mount’s performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly and was then crowded by CHOICERUS which shifted out.  Approaching the 50 Metres was shifted to the outside of NICETOBEMET to continue into clear running.

When questioned regarding his riding, A Badel advised that his instructions were to ride the horse in a conservative manner in the early stages as DAN ATTACK had not performed well last preparation when it was ridden in a forward position.  He said as a consequence from the start he elected to shift DAN ATTACK behind runners in the early stages where he obtained a midfield position with cover behind ISLAND GOLDEN.  He stated that DAN ATTACK raced a little keenly when ISLAND GOLDEN was steadied in front of him at the 800 Metres and when placed under pressure in the early part of the Home Straight DAN ATTACK responded in a one-paced manner.  He added that as a result he was not able to take advantage of a run that developed between ISLAND GOLDEN and SPEEDY FORTUNE near the 300 Metres and he then elected to shift DAN ATTACK to the outside to secure clear running.  He further stated that, in his view, DAN ATTACK would derive benefit from today’s race experience and would also be advantaged by being stepped up in distance at its next race start.  Trainer J Richards confirmed the instructions issued and the reasons as to why such instructions were issued.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of mucus in the horse’s trachea.

Was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event, hung out in the middle stages and shifted ground on the Home Turn.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of FANCY STAR, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, FANCY STAR will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial around a bend in Hong Kong and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Was sent for sampling post-race.

When placed under pressure in the Home Straight hung in and proved difficult to ride out to the finish of the event.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Was sent for sampling post-race.

Prior to the declaration of weighed-in, the Stewards viewed the patrol films to ascertain if there were sufficient grounds for a protest/objection following AMAZING ACE being crowded near the 50 Metres between HAPPY UNITED and DIAMOND SOARS, both of which shifted ground.  When the Stewards were satisfied that there were not sufficient grounds, weighed-in was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.
Was slow to begin.

Was crowded shortly after the start and as a result was steadied.  Approaching the 900 Metres was steadied when crowded by GORGEOUS VITALITY which shifted in and away from ACE TALENT.  Was held up for clear running making the Home Turn.
Approaching the 50 Metres was bumped by TELECOM SPIRIT which shifted out.

Shortly after the start was crowded by ACE TALENT (L Currie) which shifted in and away from HAPPY UNITED.  L Currie was advised to exercise more care.  When questioned regarding the performance, Z Purton stated that his mount was crowded shortly after the start, but then was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  He added that GORGEOUS VITALITY did not respond strongly to his riding in the Home Straight and after being bumped by A AMERIC TE SPECSO near the 50 Metres when that runner shifted in, his mount did not finish the race off strongly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, GORGEOUS VITALITY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Was sent for sampling post-race.

Shifted out and bumped with GOLDEN CHAMPION shortly after the start.  Near the 350 Metres was crowded between GORGEOUS VITALITY and DIAMOND FLARE which made the turn awkwardly and shifted out slightly.
Jumped awkwardly and became unbalanced.  Approaching the 200 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running between GORGEOUS VITALITY and ACE TALENT which shifted out whilst giving ground.
No report.
When giving ground near the 50 Metres was steadied when crowded between GORGEOUS VITALITY and SAVVY DELIGHT.
Was crowded shortly after the start and was bumped by NISHIKADO.  Passing the 800 Metres commenced to race keenly and was steadied to avoid HAPPY UNITED when crossed by that runner.
Was sent for sampling post-race.
Was sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly and was then crowded shortly after the start.  Was sent for sampling post-race.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Was held up for clear running making the Home Turn.  Approaching the 50 Metres was directed to the outside of MODEST GENTLEMAN to continue into clear running.
Jumped awkwardly.

After the race, C L Chau reported that his mount raced too keenly in the middle stages and for some distance near the 700 Metres was steadied away from MIRACLES after being crossed by that runner and as a result was not able to finish the race off strongly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood and mucus in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, CIRCUIT SPLENDOR will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Jumped awkwardly and then was bumped shortly after.  For a short distance approaching the 300 Metres raced tight to the inside of FINGERS CROSSED which shifted in slightly.

After the race, Z Purton stated that his mount was able to obtain a position outside the lead in the early stages but did not respond to his riding in the Home Straight and may not have appreciated tonight’s "Good to Yielding” track conditions.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of MIRACLES was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, MIRACLES will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Jumped only fairly.  Near the 850 Metres was bumped by JUST GREAT TWO.  Bumped with DRAGON KINGDOM at the 300 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Was bumped shortly after the start.  Near the 300 Metres was bumped by FINGERS CROSSED.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  The performance of DRAGON KINGDOM, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, DRAGON KINGDOM will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood and mucus in the horse’s trachea.

Passing the 1000 Metres went amiss when it sustained an injury to the left front fetlock and  was retired from the event.  L Ferraris was subsequently examined by the Chief Medical Officer and passed fit to fulfil his remaining race riding engagements.  Samples were also taken from the horse.
Was sent for sampling post-race.
Was sent for sampling post-race.
Raced keenly in the middle stages and near the 850 Metres shifted out slightly when being steadied away from WIDE BLUE YONDER.  From the 400 Metres to the 250 Metres was held up for clear running.
No report.

Approaching the 900 Metres commenced to race keenly and shifted out when being steadied away from CRYSTAL POWERFUL.  Then continued to race keenly in the middle stages.  Was sent for sampling post-race.

Was bumped at the start.  Near the 850 Metres, when racing keenly, was steadied to avoid the heels of LESLIE.  From the 350 Metres to the 250 Metres was held up for clear running.  At the 250 Metres was then directed to the outside of LUCKY BANNER but then raced in restricted room until the 200 Metres between KING OF THE COURT and LUCKY BANNER which shifted out under pressure.

Close to the finish could not be fully ridden out when positioned tight between LESLIE and PINS PRINCE. The Stewards opened an inquiry into B Avdulla’s riding of CHILLI BABA between the 400 Metres and the 200 Metres.  Evidence was taken from Jockey Avdulla and Trainer P F Yiu.  B Avdulla stated that from the inside barrier he was instructed to hold a midfield position but was issued with no specific instructions as to when to place his mount under pressure.  He said after following PINS PRINCE into the race, he elected to remain racing behind that runner on straightening with a view to improving behind it.  He said when PINS PRINCE became held up and did not proceed forward, this resulted in CHILLI BABA also being held up behind that runner before he then shifted to its outside near the 300 Metres to look for clear running.  He added between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres he was unable to commit to a run to the outside of TOP TOP TEA as he was concerned that HERO ICON was giving ground and for this reason he did not immediately shift out.  He further stated that approaching the 200 Metres he was able to direct CHILLI BABA to the outside of TOP TOP TEA and HERO ICON whereby CHILLI BABA initially responded well to his riding before its run ended near the 100 Metres.  Mr Yiu confirmed the instructions issued and expressed satisfaction with the manner in which B Avdulla rode the horse.  After considering the evidence, the Stewards advised B Avdulla that he had persevered for too long behind PINS PRINCE and TOP TOP TEA when there was an opportunity to shift to the outside of those runners sooner to present CHILLI BABA with clear running.  In electing not to take the matter further, the Stewards were mindful that CHILLI BABA had peaked on its run at the 100 Metres and could not be satisfied that B Avdulla’s actions had impacted on the finishing position of CHILLI BABA.  However, Jockey Avdulla was advised that he must ensure he shows better judgement and reacts quicker to ensure that his mounts are given first available opportunity to improve.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Near the 1100 Metres, when racing keenly, was crossed by ALWAYS FLUKE (C Y Ho) which shifted in when not clear.  C Y Ho was reprimanded.
Was crowded shortly after the start.  Raced keenly in the middle stages and making the turn approaching the 800 Metres got its head up and shifted out.
No report.
Jumped awkwardly and then was bumped at the start.  Passing the 1300 Metres was briefly crowded by LUCKY BANNER which shifted in before being corrected by its rider L Currie.
No report.

Passing the 150 Metres was steadied when crowded between CHILLI BABA and PINS PRINCE which shifted out slightly.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Was noted to have blood in the mouth on arrival at the Start, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.
Was noted to have lost its left front plate on arrival at the Start and was subsequently replated.  Was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly.

When questioned regarding his riding, B Avdulla stated that he was instructed to settle his mount where comfortable and anticipated taking up a midfield position. He said after being crossed by ARTHUR’S KINGDOM in the early stages, MISTER DAPPER was awkwardly placed on the heels of that runner.  He said from the 600 Metres he was unable to improve when held up behind ARTHUR’S KINGDOM and further could not shift out as NOBLE WIN was positioned directly to his outside.  He added on straightening he shifted MISTER DAPPER back to the inside to secure clear running whereby he was able to place his mount under full pressure.  He further stated that approaching the 100 Metres he elected to endeavour to secure clear running to the inside of MASTER HERO as he felt MASTER HERO was shifting out slightly.  He said when MASTER HERO was straightened by its rider, Apprentice Y L Chung, he then was unable to improve between that runner and CAPTAIN HURRICANE and did not obtain clear running until near the 50 Metres when he shifted to the outside of MASTER HERO.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
Crowded shortly after the start. Briefly held up approaching the 300 Metres.
Jumped awkwardly and made contact with the left side of its barrier and lost ground.  Then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

After the race, K De Melo reported that his instructions from a wide barrier were to endeavour to find cover back in the field.  He said after JOYFUL PROSPERITY jumped well and with the pace of the event being run slower than standard, JOYFUL PROSPERITY was caught wide and without cover despite his efforts in the early stages to ride his mount conservatively.  He further stated that as a result of racing wide and without cover for the majority of the event, JOYFUL PROSPERITY was unable to finish the race off strongly.  Trainer C W Chang confirmed the instructions issued.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped awkwardly, shifted in and made contact with the right side of its barrier.  Approaching the 900 Metres commenced to race keenly and shifted out when being steadied away from the heels of CELTIC TIMES.

Jumped only fairly and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  In the middle stages raced keenly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the race, M L Yeung explained that due to the slow pace that the event was run at in the early stages, his mount found it difficult to finish the race off.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  For a short distance near the 100 Metres raced tight to the inside of HOLY LAKE which lay in.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Over the final 100 Metres lay in and proved difficult to ride out to the finish of the event.  When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight, K C Leung stated that after being held up behind CHIU CHOW BROTHER, he then commenced to shift out near the 300 Metres to look for clear running.  He said as he commenced to shift out, LOST CHILD also shifted out which resulted in a run developing to that runner’s inside.  He added that as a result he then shifted back to the inside of LOST CHILD where he secured clear running passing the 250 Metres.
No report.

When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight, H Bowman stated that after following OWNERS’ PRAISE into the Home Straight, he remained racing behind that runner as he felt that the horse would take him into the event.  He said when OWNERS’ PRAISE did not improve into the race as he had expected, he then elected to shift to that runner’s inside near the 300 Metres to improve.  He added after obtaining a narrow run between OWNERS’ PRAISE and SUNLIGHT POWER near the 300 Metres, he then commenced to ride his mount along, but near the 200 Metres became held up behind LOST CHILD when that runner commenced to give ground.  He further stated that he was not able to then obtain clear running until after the 100 Metres when he secured a narrow run between LOST CHILD and SUNLIGHT POWER.  The Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Bowman were reasonable in the circumstances.
Was held up for clear running between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 250 Metres was held up for clear running when improving into a narrow run between CHARMANDER and HORSESAIN BOLT and did not obtain clear running until near the 200 Metres.

After the race, L Hewitson stated that he was instructed from his wide barrier, if the pace allowed him to do so, he should take up a forward position.  He said after commencing well, when caught wide in the early stages, he elected to continue to go forward rather than being caught wide.  He added that in retrospect LOST CHILD would be better suited by being ridden back in the field as it did not finish the race off.  Trainer C W Chang confirmed that L Hewitson was given the option of holding a forward position, but he agreed with Jockey Hewitson that on this occasion LOST CHILD would be better served by being ridden in a more conservative manner in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Slow to begin.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Near the 550 Metres was bumped by STRATHPEFFER and then was awkwardly placed on the heels of HORSESAIN BOLT for a short distance.

Withdrawn on 19.10.23 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (wound to left front leg).  Before being allowed to race again, CAN’T GO WONG will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Was sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 400 Metres, C L Chau dropped his whip.  Was sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
After the 400 Metres was bumped and taken wider by YEE CHEONG WARRIOR when that runner shifted to the outside of BEAUTY NOVA to improve.

Was slow to begin and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.   Approaching the 1400 Metres improved to the inside of TRAVEL GUIDE (M L Yeung) and then shortly after was steadied when crowded by TRAVEL GUIDE.  M L Yeung was severely reprimanded and advised he must ensure he is sufficiently clear when shifting ground.
Jumped awkwardly and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  For some distance after the 400 Metres was held up behind YEE CHEONG WARRIOR.
No report.
No report.

Jumped only fairly.  When questioned regarding the disappointing performance of TRAVEL GUIDE, M L Yeung stated that his mount failed to travel at any stage of the event which he attributed to the fact that TRAVEL GUIDE did not appreciate the "Good to Yielding” track conditions.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the race, L Hewitson stated that his intention was to hold a forward position but not necessarily lead.  He said from the outside barrier he was able to improve to the lead without having to make too much use of his mount, but, in his opinion, TSUEN WAN GLORY was not suited by racing in that position and gave ground under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.
Jumped only fairly.  Was sent for sampling post-race.
Was sent for sampling post-race.

Was reported to have an abrasion to the right hock on the morning of the race, was examined by the Veterinary Officer on arrival at Happy Valley Racecourse and passed suitable to race.  Was crowded shortly after the start and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Approaching the 1400 Metres commenced to race keenly and was steadied to avoid AMAZING BOY as that runner was being shifted in.  Was sent for sampling post-race.

From the 250 Metres until near the 100 Metres raced tight to the inside of TO INFINITY (K C Leung) when that runner shifted in whilst being ridden along and as a consequence TO INFINITY and WIN WIN FIGHTER made contact on a number of occasions.  K C Leung was advised to exercise more care.

Was bumped at the start.  From the 550 Metres until the 400 Metres was held up behind E GLORY.  Lay in in the Home Straight and bumped with WIN WIN FIGHTER on a number of occasions between the 250 Metres and the 100 Metres.  K C Leung was warned in relation to using the whip forward of the saddle.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Was held up making the Home Turn.  After the 300 Metres became held up for clear running and near the 200 Metres was steadied when disappointed between SUPER BABY and MASTER TORNADO which shifted out.  Was then shifted to the inside of MASTER TORNADO, but then became held up behind SNOWALOT for a short distance near the 100 Metres.
No report.
Shifted in and bumped TO INFINITY at the start.

After the race, A Badel stated that whilst his mount raced outside the lead, he did not have to pressure it in the early stages to do so.  He added when placed under pressure in the Home Straight MASTER TORNADO responded only fairly to his riding, may not have appreciated the "Yielding” track conditions and would derive benefit from tonight’s performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  The performance of E GLORY, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, E GLORY will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Was sent for sampling post-race.

Over the concluding stages lay in under pressure whilst being ridden along and as a result shifted in.  C L Chau was advised to exercise more care and make a greater effort to straighten his mounts.  Was sent for sampling post-race.
Inside the 50 Metres was steadied to avoid the heels of LUCKY GOR (L Hewitson) which shifted out.  L Hewitson was advised to exercise more care.
Was bumped shortly after the start.

Approaching the 100 Metres lay in whilst being ridden along, resulting in its rider, L Hewitson, having to stop riding, correct his mount and change the whip to his right hand.  Then shifted out under pressure before being again corrected near the 50 Metres.
No report.
No report.

Jumped awkwardly and then was crowded shortly after the start.  In the early stages raced keenly and lay out making the first turn when positioned to the inside of HOSS.  Then continued to race keenly in the middle stages and for some distance after the 700 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from FUN N GLORY.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.  Raced wide and without cover from the 800 Metres.

Shortly after the start was crowded by SON PAK FU (C L Chau) which shifted in.  C L Chau will be advised to exercise more care.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly.

After the race, Z Purton stated that his preference was to hold a forward position, but on jumping CALL ME DANDY, which had been fractious in the barriers, jumped awkwardly and lost ground.  He said as a result CALL ME DANDY settled at the tail of the field, but, in his opinion, did not appreciate the "Yielding” track conditions.  He also stated that, in his opinion, CALL ME DANDY may not have appreciated the Happy Valley circuit which it was racing at for the first time.  Assistant Trainer S K Sit confirmed the instructions issued.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, CALL ME DANDY will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Over the concluding stages was crowded between CHIU CHOW SPIRIT (A Badel) which shifted in and TAMRA BLITZ (H Bowman) which shifted to the outside of MASSIVE ACTION to improve.  Both A Badel and H Bowman were advised to exercise more care.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Crowded at the start by GOLDEN SAMURAI which shifted in abruptly.  Near the 300 Metres was hampered when HYPER DRAGON BALL shifted out to improve.

Apprentice Y L Chung was spoken to in respect of raising his whip arm above shoulder height.  Passing the winning post was crowded between CHIU CHOW SPIRIT and HYPER DRAGON BALL.

Passing the 1100 Metres was steadied when crowded between COMET SPLENDIDO and ABSOLUTE SUNSHINE which, when being steadied away from the heels of HYPER DRAGON BALL, commenced to race keenly and shifted out, crowding the running of LET’S DO IT.  Near the 500 Metres became positioned close to the heels of COMET SPLENDIDO and shifted out slightly.  Near the 300 Metres was steadied when crowded by COMET SPLENDIDO (K H Chan) which shifted out and then near the 250 Metres was crowded by STORM LEGEND (Apprentice E C W Wong) which shifted in.  Both K H Chan and Apprentice Wong were reprimanded and advised they must stop riding and straighten their mounts when they shift ground whilst not clear.
Shortly after the start was hampered  when crowded by RATTAN KINGDOM.  After the race, K De Melo reported that his mount raced greenly throughout the event.
No report.

Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.  Throughout the early and middle stages raced keenly and after the 1100 Metres was checked to avoid HYPER DRAGON BALL.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have bled from both nostrils.  Before being allowed to race again, COMET SPLENDIDO will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Jumped only fairly.  Over the final 150 Metres lay out.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced wide and without cover from the 800 Metres. Sent for sampling post-race.

Bumped on jumping by BUTTERFIELD.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Between the 350 Metres and the 200 Metres was held up for clear running and was directed to the outside of COLUMBUS COUNTY and NIMBLE NIMBUS to secure a clear run.

When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight, M L Yeung stated that approaching the 200 Metres he commenced to improve to the inside of RISING FROM ASHES, however, when that runner shifted in and away from CHAMPION DRAGON, he then felt the run commence to close and as a result he directed his mount with the intent to improve to the outside of RISING FROM ASHES.  He added that as he directed his mount out, RISING FROM ASHES then shifted out at the same point which then required him to move back to the inside where he was able to secure clear running at the 100 Metres.
No report.
Sent for sampling post-race.
After the race, A Badel stated that, in his opinion, THE BEST PEACH raced "flat” today.

Kicked a rail on entering the track, was examined by the Veterinary Officer on arrival at the Start and passed suitable to race.  When questioned regarding the tactics adopted on HELENE FEELING, K Teetan stated that the preference was to hold a forward position if his mount commenced well, but he was also given the option, if required, to settle further back in order to obtain cover.  He said after commencing reasonably well, his mount was positioned behind BOURBONAIRE and LOOKING GREAT that were on either side of him and as a result he was obliged to come back to look for a position with cover.  He added from the 800 Metres HELENE FEELING was under pressure and after bringing his mount to the outside in the Home Straight worked to the line reasonably well.  He further stated that, in his view, HELENE FEELING may benefit from the addition of sheepskin cheek pieces or blinkers given the manner in which it raced in the middle stages.  Trainer C S Shum confirmed the instructions issued.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Between the 500 Metres and the 400 Metres was held up for clear running behind BOURBONAIRE.  After the race, L Ferraris stated that his mount came under pressure from the 800 Metres and finished the race off only fairly.
Bumped at the start.
Jumped awkwardly.  From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the race. A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From the 400 Metres until approaching the 250 Metres was held up for clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages. Was held up for clear running between the 350 Metres and the 300 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Making the Home Turn was taken wider when MR ASCENDENCY shifted out to improve.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Passing the 400 Metres attempted a narrow run between PRIME MINISTER and THE GOLDEN SCENERY, but was disappointed and then shifted to the inside of THE GOLDEN SCENERY to obtain clear running.  Then near the 200 Metres improved into a tight run between SUPREME LUCKY and EASON and as a result shifted out and made contact with EASON and became unbalanced inside the 100 Metres.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Bumped with PRIME MINISTER near the 50 Metres.
Crowded near the 900 Metres.

Crowded at the start.  Near the 300 Metres became held up for clear running behind MR ASCENDENCY and did not obtain clear running until after the 250 Metres when it was shifted to that runner’s outside.
Shifted out when it was bumped on jumping.  Inside the 100 Metres was bumped by DANCING CODE and was eased when positioned tight to the inside of THE GOLDEN SCENERY.
Jumped awkwardly and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly.  K C Leung (KEEFY) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 900 Metres he permitted his mount to shift in when not clear of MR ASCENDENCY, resulting in MR ASCENDENCY being unnecessarily crowded and taken in onto MOMENTS IN TIME which was also unnecessarily crowded.  Both MOMENTS IN TIME and MR ASCENDENCY became badly unbalanced as a result.  After assessing the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 1 and having regard to his record, the Stewards determined the appropriate penalty to be a reprimand.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly and then was crowded on jumping.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Noted to have blood in its mouth on arrival at the Start.  Examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the race, Z Purton could offer no excuse for his mount’s performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Bumped at the start and then shortly after was steadied when crowded.

After the race, C L Chau reported that his mount came under pressure from the 600 Metres and failed to finish the race off.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Passing the 1500 Metres raced tight for a short distance to the inside of STAR OF GLORY.

Jumped only fairly and was then crowded a short distance later.  The Stewards conducted an inquiry into the riding of Apprentice E C W Wong after he obtained a narrow run to the inside of BON’S A PEARLA near the 1000 Metres and then when he allowed his mount to improve to the inside of MALDIVES near the 750 Metres where there was insufficient room to do so, resulting in PERFECT TEAM having to be checked.  After taking evidence from Apprentice Wong, his allocated master, Mr C Fownes, and the Chief Riding Instructor, Mr F Coetzee, the Stewards advised Apprentice Wong that in respect of both incidents he had permitted his mount to improve where there was not sufficient room to do so and that in similar circumstances he would be expected to show far greater judgement than he did on this occasion.  He was further advised that whilst a narrow run had developed to the inside of FIERY DIAMOND soon after entering the Home Straight, once again he should have shown better judgement by not attempting to improve to the inside of that runner where, in the opinion of the Stewards, there was also doubtful room which resulted in PERFECT TEAM having to be shifted to the outside of FIERY DIAMOND near the 250 Metres to secure clear running.  Near the 150 Metres was taken out by FIERY DIAMOND when that runner shifted out under pressure.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 900 Metres shifted out and away from ISLAND BRIGHT and became unbalanced.  The Stewards deferred the declaration of weighed-in as they were of the view that an incident had occurred inside the 100 Metres where CHAMPION INSTINCT had shifted in and made contact with RUBYLOT which cast doubt  as to whether RUBYLOT should  be declared the outright second placegetter.  Subsequently the Stewards, acting under the provisions of Rule 122, lodged a protest/objection on behalf of the connections of RUBYLOT alleging interference inside the 100 Metres.  After considering the evidence, including the patrol films, the Stewards found that near the 100 Metres CHAMPION INSTINCT shifted in and made contact with RUBYLOT on two occasions, taking RUBYLOT in and restricting L Hewitson’s ability to fully ride his mount out to the finish of the event.  As the Stewards were comfortably satisfied that had the interference not occurred RUBYLOT would have finished in outright second place, the protest/objection was sustained and the placings amended to read No. 2, CHAMPION METHOD, 1st; No. 4, RUBYLOT, 2nd; No. 12, CHAMPION INSTINCT, 3rd; and No. 7, MASSIVE TALENT, 4th.  L Hewitson was reminded of the provisions of Rule 117(5) that requires him to utilise all available measures to establish whether reasonable grounds exist to warrant the making of a protest/objection under these Rules and that he should avail himself of this opportunity in similar circumstances in future.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Approaching the 100 Metres, A Badel’s whip was knocked from his grasp by the whip of L Hewitson.

Was held up for clear running until passing the 350 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned regarding his riding, K Teetan stated that from a wide barrier, with the first two races being run inside standard in the early stages, he was instructed to ride his mount conservatively in the early stages.  He said as a result he was obliged to settle at the rear of the field to ensure his mount had cover.  When questioned if there was an opportunity to improve to the outside of SUPER CONTENTED from the 600 Metres, K Teetan stated that he was concerned that had he done so, SUPER CONTENTED would shift out and take his mount wider.  He said for this reason he elected to remain racing behind SUPER CONTENTED with a view to following WAR OF COURAGE into the race.  He said near the 500 Metres when SUPER CONTENTED shifted out slightly, he was obliged to steady away from the heels of that runner and as a result his mount lost momentum.  He added as a result of this incident WAR OF COURAGE was able to improve into the event where his mount was then left flat-footed.  He further stated that after being held up for clear running in the early part of the Home Straight, he then attempted to improve to the outside of WAR OF COURAGE near the 300 Metres, but was disappointed for this run when SUPER CONTENTED held its position to his outside.  He said as a consequence he was obliged to shift to the inside of WAR OF COURAGE where he secured clear running at the 200 Metres.  Trainer J Size confirmed the instructions issued and the reasons as to why such instructions were issued.  He stated that, in his opinion, K Teetan would have been better suited, having regard to the moderate early pace, by making a run to the outside sooner than what he did.  K Teetan agreed with the Stewards that he had made a slight error of judgement in not improving to the outside of SUPER CONTENTED from the 550 Metres.  He was advised that he should, wherever possible, ensure that he rides his mounts in such a manner so as to leave no room for query.
No report.
