When questioned regarding the performance of BEAUTY WAVES, Z Purton stated that his mount raced without cover throughout the event and, in his opinion, would be better suited by being stepped up in distance around a bend where the horse could travel at a more sustainable pace.  He added that BEAUTY WAVES finished the race off reasonably well and he was satisfied with his mount’s performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 300 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running to the outside of SUPER AXIOM (H T Mo) which shifted out.  H T Mo was reprimanded and advised to stop riding and straighten his mounts when they shift ground whilst not clear.
Shortly after the start was bumped by SUPER AXIOM which shifted in when being corrected by its rider.

Shortly after the start raced tight to the outside of SUPER AXIOM.  Passing the 300 Metres was steadied when crowded by METRO WARRIOR (A Atzeni) which shifted to the inside of SUPER AXIOM to obtain clear running.  A Atzeni was advised to exercise more care.  Over the final 100 Metres was held up for clear running and as a consequence could not be ridden out to the finish of the event.

Bumped at the 300 Metres.  After the race, A Hamelin stated that his mount failed to travel at any stage of the event and raced in a disappointing manner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of SPARKLING KNIGHT, a winner in its two previous starts, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, SPARKLING KNIGHT will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
No report.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.
Jumped awkwardly and bumped BEAUTY WAVES.  Over the concluding stages, K De Melo dropped his whip.

When commencing to give ground near the 300 Metres shifted in and made contact with SPARKLING KNIGHT.  Approaching the 200 Metres when continuing to give ground shifted out and was steadied away from INVINCIBLE SAGE when that runner shifted in slightly when improving to the inside of EXPLOSIVE WITNESS.  After the race, Apprentice Y L Chung stated that his mount gave ground in the Home Straight and he was concerned that there may be something amiss with the horse and therefore he did not ride it out to the finish of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, KA YING SPIRIT will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Over-raced throughout the early and middle stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

After the race, L Ferraris stated that he was asked to take up a forward position on his mount, but not lead.  He said after NOT USUAL STAR commenced well and he was caught wide in the early stages, he elected to allow his mount to stride forward and lead to avoid covering additional ground.
No report.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

In the middle stages raced keenly and for some distance near the 800 Metres was steadied away from ATOMIC FORCE.  Whilst the Stewards were satisfied that the riding of B Avdulla, 7th placegetter, over the concluding stages did not affect the horse’s finishing position, he was nonetheless reminded of his obligation to ensure that he fully rides his mounts out to the finish of the race.

After the race, K Teetan stated that from the 500 Metres he was unable to proceed forward when positioned behind GOLDEN ARTIE, but then when placed under pressure in the Home Straight his mount did not respond to his riding in the same manner as it had done in its previous two starts.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Lay in in the Home Straight when placed under pressure.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly.  Near the 150 Metres improved into a narrow run between DESERT STAR and SIXTH GENERATION and as a result made contact with DESERT STAR at that point.  Approaching the 100 Metres was then directed to the inside of KYRUS DRAGON to continue into clear running.
No report.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped shortly after the start.  Near the 300 Metres was bumped.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly, shifted in behind SUPER BUDDY and blundered and as a result lost ground.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
No report.

Jumped awkwardly.  Passing the 300 Metres endeavoured to secure clear running to the outside of FORTUNE TRIPLE, however, was prevented from doing so by SUNNY BABY, resulting in HAPPY HERO making contact with SUNNY BABY and being disappointed for clear running.  Near the 250 Metres was then shifted to the inside of FORTUNE TRIPLE to secure clear running.  Near the 150 Metres was inconvenienced when racing in restricted room to the inside of FORTUNE TRIPLE which shifted in slightly.   A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Approaching the 500 Metres was steadied when momentarily crowded by JOYFUL CHAMPION which, after racing tight to the inside of COLOURFUL BARON (A Badel), shifted in slightly away from that runner.  A Badel was advised to exercise more care.  Near the 50 Metres was steadied when crowded between LOYAL AMBITION and JOYFUL CHAMPION (B Avdulla) which shifted out.  B Avdulla was reprimanded.
No report.
No report.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Crowded shortly after the start.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Apprentice Y L Chung explained that after the 100 Metres when he pulled his whip through to his right hand, he observed that it had broken and as a result he was unable to continue to use it on his mount from that point onwards.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Bumped at the start.  When questioned regarding his riding out of the horse, L Hewitson stated that approaching the winning post when he was riding his mount along vigorously, he felt EXPLOSIVE WITNESS commence to lay in and for this reason when he became concerned that he may interfere with HEROIC MASTER which was positioned to his inside, he was obliged to momentarily stop riding and straighten his mount by placing pressure on his left rein to avoid EXPLOSIVE WITNESS shifting in further.  After considering his explanation and the Stewards reviewing the patrol films, they were satisfied that L Hewitson’s actions in the circumstances were reasonable in that he had ridden in a manner to ensure the safety to his fellow rider and HEROIC MASTER.
Jumped only fairly.  Lay out when obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Near the 600 Metres brushed the running rail when racing tight to the inside of HUMBLE STAR which shifted in and away from HEROIC MASTER.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Slow to begin.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned, Z Purton stated that his mount lay in when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  He said over the final 150 Metres his mount came under pressure and shifted in towards VICTOR THE WINNER.  He added near the 75 Metres he received a call from K Teetan, the rider of VICTOR THE WINNER, and as a consequence he was obliged to stop riding and straighten his mount approaching the 50 Metres to avoid causing interference.  He further stated shortly after he was able to recommence riding LUCKY SWEYNESSE to the finish of the event although it continued to lay in to the winning post.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly.  After the 100 Metres improved into a narrow run between LUCKY SWEYNESSE and SIGHT SUCCESS and over the concluding stages raced tight between those runners when LUCKY SWEYNESSE shifted out when being corrected by its rider.
Approaching the 1100 Metres was steadied when crowded between LUCKY SWEYNESSE and SIGHT SUCCESS which shifted out slightly when being crossed by VICTOR THE WINNER.

After the race, K Teetan reported that his mount travelled satisfactorily in the lead, but when asked for an effort in the Home Straight did not respond to his riding and performed in a disappointing manner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

On arrival at the barriers, L Hewitson expressed concern regarding the action of STOLTZ.  STOLTZ was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said the horse was lame in its right front leg and as such was not suitable to race.  Acting on this advice, the horse was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  Before being allowed to race again, STOLTZ will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Slow to begin.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Lay out near the 200 Metres before being corrected by its rider.  Then shifted in at the 150 Metres before being corrected.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Bumped at the start.  Despite being ridden along in the early stages was unable to hold a more forward position.
No report.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Blundered on jumping and became unbalanced.  Near the 350 Metres was briefly held up behind FREE FOAL.
No report.

Jumped awkwardly and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners shortly after the start.  In the early stages raced keenly and refused to settle.  K C Leung was spoken to regarding using the whip on a horse which was out of contention.

Near the 350 Metres endeavoured to improve into a narrow run between ATOMIC BEAUTY and BIG TWO where there was doubtful room.  As a result, FREE FOAL was disappointed for clear running and badly held up until near the 250 Metres when it obtained a run to the inside of ATOMIC BEAUTY.  L Ferraris was spoken to regarding using the whip on a horse which was out of contention.

After the race, K Teetan stated that his mount was disappointing as it failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight and he could offer no excuse for the performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped awkwardly and then was bumped shortly after the start.  Was obliged to race wide and without cover until near the 1000 Metres when it was allowed to stride forward to avoid covering additional ground.  After the race, K De Melo reported that his mount lay in when placed under pressure and gave ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Near the 500 Metres was steadied away from KING INVINCIBLE.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Slow to begin.  Near the 600 Metres brushed the running rail when positioned tight to the inside of MR VALIANT.  Near the 200 Metres was directed to the outside of VALIANT ELEGANCE and FORTUNE WARRIOR to secure clear running.  Over the concluding stages lay in, resulting in its rider, K H Chan, having to stop riding and straighten his mount.
Over the concluding stages was bumped on the hindquarters by KING INVINCIBLE.

Briefly crowded near the 550 Metres.  When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight, Z Purton stated that after the 300 Metres he attempted to shift his mount to the outside of SERGEANT PEPPER to secure clear running.  He added KING INVINCIBLE lay in at that stage and did not respond to his efforts to shift out and a short distance later MR VALIANT was able to secure a clear run to his outside.  He said as a result he continued to ride KING INVINCIBLE along with a view to improving into a run between SERGEANT PEPPER and CIRCUIT SEVEN.  He further stated that near the 75 Metres SERGEANT PEPPER shifted in slightly and as a consequence he could not ride his mount out to the finish of the event when disappointed for clear running.  After considering the evidence, the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Purton were reasonable in the circumstances.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Near the 550 Metres became unbalanced when crowded by FORTUNE WARRIOR (K Teetan) which shifted in before being corrected by its rider.  K Teetan was advised to exercise more care.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
No report.

Throughout the early and middle stages raced wide and without cover, raced greenly and refused to settle.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly and then was crowded shortly after the start between ISLAND SURPRISE which shifted out slightly and CIRCUIT SEVEN (Apprentice Y L Chung) which shifted in whilst being ridden along.  Apprentice Chung was advised to exercise more care.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Withdrawn on 28.10.23 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (heart irregularity) and was replaced by Standby Declared Starter ISLAND SURPRISE.  Before being allowed to race again, GALLANT VALOUR will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Near the 100 Metres was bumped by DURHAM STAR which shifted in slightly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Jumped awkwardly.

Jumped only fairly.  Near the 300 Metres shifted out and made contact with CHATEAU.  After the race, B Avdulla stated that after settling back in the field his mount ran on reasonably and, in his opinion, is looking for additional distance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Approaching the 400 Metres was steadied away from CONCERTO and shifted to that runner’s inside to secure clear running.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the race, M Chadwick stated that the only excuse he could offer for his mount’s disappointing performance was that it was having its first run at Happy Valley today.   A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.

Crowded shortly after the start and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  K C Leung was spoken to in respect to using the whip on a horse which was out of contention. A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.  Bumped near the 300 Metres.
No report.
Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned regarding the horse leading, A Badel stated that he was instructed to hold a forward position.  He said after commencing well and with the slow pace in the early stages, TELECOM SPIRIT was able to lead the event without being unduly pressured.  Trainer Y S Tsui confirmed the instructions issued.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
In the early part of the Home Straight lay in and proved reluctant to shift to the outside of JOY COMING.
Jumped awkwardly, shifted out and became unbalanced.
No report.

When questioned regarding his riding, M L Yeung stated that he was instructed to hold a forward position, preferably with cover.  He said in the early stages he was required to ride JOY COMING along in an endeavour to hold a forward position, but was unable to obtain a position closer to the rail and as a result was obliged to race wide and without cover.  He added that whilst the pace of the event in the middle stages was slow and his mount was travelling strongly through that section of the race, he was reluctant to allow JOY COMING to stride forward and cross the leaders as it was carrying 133 lbs and he had to make some use of his mount in the early stages to hold a forward position.  The Stewards found the tactics adopted in the circumstances were reasonable having regard to the explanation provided by Jockey Yeung.
Jumped only fairly and a short distance later was hampered when crowded between YOUNG LIFE FOREVER and SUPER ELITE which shifted out.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shortly after the start was checked when crowded by GOLDEN RISE (L Currie) which, after shifting in and making contact with SOLID SHALAA on jumping, then shifted in again before being corrected by its rider.  L Currie was advised to exercise more care.  Near the 950 Metres was steadied away from TACTICAL COMMAND.  When questioned regarding the performance, Z Purton stated that after settling back in the field as a result of the slow pace of the event and under its top weight of 135 lbs his mount found it difficult to make up ground in the Home Straight when the race developed into a sprint home.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Making the turn near the 1000 Meres was steadied away from GOLDEN RISE and got its head up.
Jumped awkwardly and then from the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Noted to have sustained a laceration to its right hind leg.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.

Raced tight for some distance on jumping.  In the middle stages raced keenly,  Approaching the 300 Metres was disappointed for a run between GALLANT WAKING and DENFIELD and was then shifted to the inside of DENFIELD to obtain clear running.  Approaching the 200 Metres then attempted to obtain a narrow run between DENFIELD and COLOURFUL EMPEROR, but was steadied passing the 150 Metres when COLOURFUL EMPEROR shifted out.  After COLOURFUL EMPEROR was corrected by its rider and shifted in passing the 150 Metres, SUGAR SUGAR was shifted to the outside of COLOURFUL EMPEROR to secure clear running at the 100 Metres.

In the middle stages raced keenly and for some distance near the 900 Metres was steadied away from LUCKY ARCHANGEL.  After the race, K De Melo reported that his mount raced keenly and hung in throughout the event.
For some distance after the 900 Metres raced tight to the inside of GAMEPLAYER ELITE.

Jumped awkwardly.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Steadied shortly after the start when crowded.  Near the 200 Metres was shifted to the outside of TORONADO PHANTOM to continue into clear running.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.

After being loaded into the barriers got its left front leg over the barrier partition for an extended period of time.  Removed from the barriers and examined by the Veterinary Officer who said the horse was not suitable to race.  Acting on this advice, SOLAR GOGO was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  Before being allowed to race again, SOLAR GOGO will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Withdrawn on 30.10.23 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (swollen right front leg) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter AMAZING RUN.  Before being allowed to race again, JOLLY RULER will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
After the 200 Metres Apprentice Y L Chung dropped his left rein for a number of strides before regathering it.  Sent for sampling post-race.
On the Home Turn lay out.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.
No report.
Jumped only fairly and then shortly after the start was crowded.
No report.
Jumped awkwardly.  Lay out in the early stages and as a result shifted out making the first turn.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
In the middle stages raced keenly and for some distance near the 1100 Metres was steadied away from YOO YOO KNIGHT.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  For some distance passing the 1200 Metres raced keenly and was steadied away from GOOD VIEW GLORY.  After the race, Z Purton could offer no excuse for his mount not running on strongly in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the race, B Avdulla stated that from a wide barrier his mount settled towards the back in the field.  He said when placed under pressure in the Home Straight FORTUNE MASTER did not respond to his riding and, in his opinion, races best when able to be positioned amongst other runners.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From a wide barrier was attempted to be shifted across behind runners in the early stages and when caught wide was allowed to stride forward.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have an epiglottic entrapment.

Crowded on jumping and became unbalanced.  When questioned, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that approaching the 1100 Metres his mount lay in and away from GOOD VIEW GLORY and as a result made slight contact with the running rail.  He said after this contact SUPER CONTENTED then over-reacted and shifted in further, making heavy contact with the running rail for some distance, becoming badly unbalanced and losing significant ground.  Trainer C Fownes was advised that the racing manners of SUPER CONTENTED were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, SUPER CONTENTED will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial in amongst other runners and to be ridden by a senior rider.  He said he may experiment with the gear on the horse before the barrier trial.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
In the early stages lay in.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Over the final 100 Metres lay in and inside the 50 Metres briefly raced tight to the inside of THE GOOD DEAL which shifted in.
Jumped only fairly.

Jumped only fairly and then soon after the start was bumped and became unbalanced when crowded by FINGERS CROSSED (L Currie) which, after racing tight to the outside of THE GOOD DEAL, shifted in.  L Currie was advised to exercise more care.  Approaching the 700 Metres was bumped on several occasions when racing tight to the inside of FINGERS CROSSED as both runners contested a position one-off the rail.  L Currie was advised to exercise more care.
Throughout the early and middle stages raced keenly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 1400 Metres was steadied away from DEVILDOM which, after shifting in towards ZONE D, then shifted out and away from that runner.
No report.

Crowded at the start.  When being shifted towards the rail near the 1500 Metres became unbalanced when being corrected by its rider M Chadwick and as a consequence lost ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race revealed that the horse was displaying an irregular heart rhythm.  Before being allowed to race again, JUNE PLANET will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

As the start was effected stood flat-footed and lost a considerable amount of ground.  As this was the second consecutive occasion that ZONE D had performed in a similar manner, the horse will be required to perform satisfactorily in a series of consecutive barrier trials before being allowed to race again.  Near the 1300 Metres improved to the inside of DEVILDOM (L Ferraris) and was steadied when crowded by that runner before DEVILDOM was corrected by its rider L Ferraris.  L Ferraris was advised to exercise more care.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have bled from both nostrils.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Shortly after the start was crowded between RUN RUN TIMING and AMAZING ACE which was taken in by UNIVERSAL PURSUIT which in turn was taken in by HONG KONG HALL.  Passing the 400 Metres shifted to the inside of RUN RUN TIMING to secure clear running and raced greenly when placed under pressure for a short distance thereafter.  After the race, an endoscopic examination was conducted at the request of Trainer T P Yung.  The Veterinary Surgeon said this examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, STRATHBARRY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly.  Near the 350 Metres blundered.

Was noted to have bled from both nostrils after the race.  Before being allowed to race again, GOLDEN WARSTEED will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Approaching the 400 Metres became unbalanced when STERLING WONGCHOY shifted in before being corrected by its rider.
No report.
No report.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the race, L Ferraris reported that his mount failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight and raced in a disappointing manner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of HONG KONG HALL, a last start winner, was considered to be disappointing as compared to its last start.  Before being allowed to race again, HONG KONG HALL will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Hampered shortly after the start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned regarding his riding in the early stages and as to whether there was an opportunity to take up a position one-off the rail, Apprentice Y L Chung stated that his instructions were to lead if possible. He said after commencing well, he was reluctant to ride his mount along in the early stages as MASTER HERO had raced a little keenly at its last start.  He said as there was a long run to the first turn, he was not concerned crossing towards the rail too soon to ensure that his mount raced comfortably in the early stages and as a result LOOKING COOL was able to improve to his inside near the 1100  Metres which resulted in his mount then being obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  After considering his explanations, Apprentice Chung agreed with the Stewards that he had made an error of judgement in the early stages by not shifting towards the rail to obtain a position one-off when he was clear of LOOKING COOL to do so.  He was advised that in future he would be expected to show better judgement than he did on this occasion.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly.  When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight, Z Purton stated that after following LOOKING COOL into the event, he elected to shift to that runner’s outside with a  view to securing clear running between MASTER HERO and PAKISTAN FRIEND.  He said his decision to shift out was influenced by the fact that PAKISTAN FRIEND appeared under pressure and was shifting out at that point and, in his opinion, this would have afforded him clear running at that stage.  He added that when PAKISTAN FRIEND then shifted in slightly and MASTER HERO shifted out, AESTHETICISM was disappointed for clear running at the 350 Metres and then did not secure clear running until approaching the 100 Metres where it found the line strongly.  When questioned if there was an opportunity to shift to the inside of LOOKING COOL, Z Purton stated that whilst that option was available, he felt, given the way PAKISTAN FRIEND was racing, that was the best option to improve into the race.  The Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Purton were reasonable in the circumstances.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  In the early part of the Home Straight lay in when placed under pressure.

Near the 200 Metres improved into a tight run between CASA COSMO and BULB PRINCE and raced tight between those runners for some distance thereafter.
No report.
On jumping shifted out, made contact with the left side of its barrier and became unbalanced.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 900 Metres became unbalanced when racing tight to the inside of LOOKING COOL which shifted in and away slightly from MASTER HERO when racing tight inside that runner.  After the race, C L Chau reported that after being crowded near the 900 Metres his mount failed to travel from that point and raced disappointingly thereafter.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.

Withdrawn on raceday morning by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (swollen right hind leg).  Before being allowed to race again, RELIABLE PROFIT will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Jumped awkwardly, shifted in and became unbalanced.  Passing the 300 Metres was bumped on the hindquarters.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped awkwardly, shifted out and made contact with CHAMPION INSTINCT and became unbalanced.

As the start was effected reared and as a consequence lost ground.  When questioned regarding his riding out over the final 100 Metres, K C Leung stated that inside the 100 Metres when he observed PERFECT PEACH shift in slightly after making contact with ARIEL, he then stopped riding as a precaution when he was concerned that PERFECT PEACH would shift in further.  He said when PERFECT PEACH was then straightened, he was able to recommence riding near the 50 Metres.  K C Leung was advised that, wherever possible, he should continue to fully test his mounts to the finish of the event with the appropriate vigour.

When questioned regarding the performance, Z Purton stated that whilst his mount was able to hold an on-pace position, it did not travel comfortably and he had some concern with its action.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Before being allowed to race again, TOP TOP TEA will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 1100 Metres was steadied when crowded by CHAMPION INSTINCT which raced tight to the inside of PERFECT PEACH (Apprentice Y L Chung).  Apprentice Chung was severely reprimanded and advised he must ensure he leaves sufficient racing room to runners to his inside.

Jumped awkwardly and then was crowded shortly after the start.  After the race, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that shortly after the start his mount commenced to buck and as a result did not stretch out and lost ground despite his efforts to ride it along.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Before being allowed to race again, KILLER INSTINCT will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial in raceday gear.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped awkwardly.  After the race, K De Melo reported that his mount came under pressure after the 500 Metres and weakened in the Home Straight.  He could offer no explanation for the disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of NATURAL GOLD was considered to be disappointing as compared to its last starts.  Before being allowed to race again, NATURAL GOLD will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Approaching the 150 Metres was bumped when crowded between STRAIGHT ARRON which shifted in and TOURBILLON DIAMOND which shifted out and away from CHAMPION DRAGON.
Approaching the 150 Metres shifted in, resulting in its rider L Hewitson having to stop riding and straighten his mount.

After the race, A Badel reported that MONEY CATCHER travelled comfortably in the lead but failed to quicken in the Home Straight and, in his opinion, may not have appreciated today’s top weight of 135 lbs.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped awkwardly.  When questioned, M Chadwick stated that from the outside barrier his instructions were to endeavour to find cover if possible as the connections were mindful that it may be difficult to make up ground when settling too far back in the field.  He said from the outside barrier when positioned to the outside of STRAIGHT ARRON in the early stages, he elected not to take cover behind that runner as he felt SUPER SUNNY SING would not be able to make up sufficient ground in the Home Straight from that position.  He added for this reason he remained racing wide and without cover in the middle stages, however, SUPER SUNNY SING did not travel strongly through that section of the race.  He added that as a result approaching the 900 Metres he elected not to improve forward to prevent SENOR TOBA from shifting out and as a result near the 800 Metres when SENOR TOBA shifted out, he took a trailing position behind that runner.  He stated that when SENOR TOBA did not improve into the event, SUPER SUNNY SING lost momentum at that point but in the Home Straight when shifted to the outside ran on fairly.  He further stated that he felt the manner in which the race was run today and the positioning of SUPER SUNNY SING throughout the middle stages disadvantaged his mount.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the race, Z Purton stated that RUNNING GLORY did not travel comfortably and he had some concern with his mount’s action during the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Before being allowed to race again, RUNNING GLORY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Bumped at the start.
Crowded at the start.

Withdrawn prior to Race 1 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame left hind).  Before being allowed to race again, NIMBLE NIMBUS will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Jumped only fairly and from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 600 Metres was checked away from CHRYSOS when that runner was being retired from the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 600 Metres was bumped and taken wider by CHILL CHIBI.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Checked away from SILVER SONIC approaching the 1400 Metres.
Near the 350 Metres was steadied away from FAMILY FOLKS and shifted to that runner’s inside to secure clear running.
Badly crowded approaching the 1400 Metres.

When questioned regarding the performance, Apprentice Y L Chung stated that he was obliged to make use of his mount in the early stages to endeavour to cross runners to his inside.  He said as the pace of the event was run faster than standard in the early stages, OUTGATE was then unable to finish the race off strongly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced keenly in the middle stages.
Taken in approaching the 1400 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Apprentice Y L Chung (OUTGATE) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that approaching the 1400 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when insufficiently clear of RED MAJESTY, resulting in RED MAJESTY being taken in onto SILVER SONIC, causing SILVER SONIC, FAMILY FOLKS and IVY LEAGUE to be badly crowded for room and FAMILY FOLKS then having to be checked away from RED MAJESTY and further resulting in SILVER SONIC shifting out, causing TOURBILLON PRINCE to be checked away from the heels of SILVER SONIC.   Apprentice Chung was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 22 November 2023 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his good race riding record.  Near the 350 Metres was disappointed for running to the outside of RED MAJESTY.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings. <2/11/2023 Additional Veterinary Reports> FAMILY FOLKS, which performed disappointingly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings. FAMILY FOLKS was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer C W Chang this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to have sustained a right front suspensory ligament injury. Before being allowed to race again, FAMILY FOLKS will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Badly crowded approaching the 1400 Metres and shifted out when being steadied.  Obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 800 Metres, CHRYSOS commenced to give ground, resulting in MAJESTIC COLOUR being shifted to that runner’s outside.  After the race, K C Leung stated that with the fast pace in the early stages and his mount carrying top weight of 135 lbs, it was under pressure from the 600 Metres and failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  The performance of MAJESTIC COLOUR, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, MAJESTIC COLOUR will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped at the start.  After the race, A Badel reported that when he had concerns that there may be something amiss with his mount near the 800 Metres, he retired it from the event.  The performance of CHRYSOS was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, CHRYSOS will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly and then was crowded shortly after the start.  Approaching the 350 Metres improved into a run between DASHING GLORY and CIRCUIT NINE where there was doubtful room, resulting in BEATO making heavy contact with CIRCUIT NINE for some distance thereafter as DASHING GLORY also shifted out slightly.  Apprentice Y L Chung was severely reprimanded and advised he must ensure there is sufficient room to improve in similar circumstances and he should show better judgement than what he did on this occasion.  After obtaining clear running between DASHING GLORY and CIRCUIT NINE near the 250 Metres, BEATO continued to race tight to the inside of CIRCUIT NINE and made contact with that runner for some distance after the 200 Metres.  BEATO was then able to secure clear running to the inside of CHILLI BABA approaching the 150 Metres when CHILLI BABA shifted out.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Slow to begin.

Bumped by BEATO between the 350 Metres and the 250 Metres and again between the 200 Metres and the 150 Metres.  Prior to the declaration of weighed-in, M Chadwick viewed the patrol films to ascertain if there were sufficient grounds for a protest/objection against BEATO being declared the second placegetter. When Jockey Chadwick was satisfied that there were not sufficient grounds and the Stewards were similarly satisfied, weighed-in was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge..

After the race, K Teetan reported that he had to make some use of his mount to clear DASHING GLORY to his inside in the early stages and as a result the horse was not able to finish the race off.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shortly after the start was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.  For some distance after the 350 Metres was held up when positioned behind YOUNG HORIZON.  Approaching the 250 Metres was then shifted to the outside of YOUNG HORIZON but then became held up for clear running behind ALWAYS FLUKE and was not able to be fully tested until near the 100 Metres.

After the 400 Metres was steadied away from MERCHANT PRINCE when that runner was taken out by CYBER PATCH which in turn shifted out and away from CIRCUIT NINE after being bumped by that runner.  Noted to have sustained a wound to the right front hoof.
Shortly after the start bumped with CYBER PATCH and became unbalanced.

After the race, L Hewitson reported that due to today’s racing pattern, he was instructed to obtain a more forward position and he attributed the horse’s disappointing performance to the manner in which it was ridden today.  He added he recommended to connections that the horse to be ridden quietly in the early stages in its future starts if the circumstances permit.  Trainer K W Lui confirmed the instructions issued and concurred with Jockey Hewitson’s view.  Mr Lui stated that the horse will be ridden in a conservative manner in the early stages in its future starts.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that there was blood at the left nostril after the race.  An endoscopic examination found that there was no blood in its trachea and therefore was deemed not to have bled.  The performance of ALWAYS FLUKE was considered to be disappointing as compared to its previous starts.  Before being allowed to race again, ALWAYS FLUKE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

When questioned regarding his riding in the early part of the Home Straight and the reason as to why PINS PRINCE (Z Purton) was able to secure clear running to his inside, B Avdulla stated that soon after the 400 Metres YOUNG HORIZON came under pressure and commenced to lay in.  He stated as a result he corrected YOUNG HORIZON and as it was giving ground YOUNG HORIZON shifted out slightly when being corrected by him.  He added that given the manner in which YOUNG HORIZON was yielding ground, he did not continue to push his mount along and YOUNG HORIZON then weakened over the final 250 Metres.  After considering his explanations and taking evidence from Jockey Purton, B Avdulla was advised that in similar circumstances he would be expected to ride his mounts in a manner so as to leave no room for query.
In the early and middle stages raced keenly and for some distance after the 900 Metres was steadied away from ALWAYS FLUKE.
When being steadied in an attempt to obtain cover near the 850 Metres became awkwardly placed close to DASHING GLORY and was steadied.  Hampered and taken wider after the 400 Metres.
Crowded at the start.  After the 400 Metres was bumped and became unbalanced. Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Jumped only fairly and was steadied when crowded for room shortly after. The performance of URBAN TRIUMPH, which finished tailed out on the second occasion in recent starts, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, URBAN TRIUMPH will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a series of consecutive barrier trials and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  When questioned regarding his riding from the 700 Metres, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that his mount commenced to race keenly and as a result improved to the inside of FALLON and raced behind PHOENIX LIGHT.  He said from the 700 Metres until near the 500 Metres he was unable to improve his position behind PHOENIX LIGHT, but after entering the Home Straight and being inconvenienced near the 350 Metres when PHOENIX LIGHT shifted out, he was able to place FLAGSHIP WARRIOR under full pressure where it ran to the line strongly.  When questioned if there was an opportunity to shift to the outside of FALLON to follow BLUE MARLIN into the event approaching the 700 Metres.  Apprentice Wong stated that he was concerned that FALLON would shift out, taking his mount wider and for this reason he elected to shift to the inside.  After considering his explanation, the Stewards advised Apprentice Wong that he had made an error of judgement in not shifting to the outside to follow BLUE MARLIN which would have allowed him to improve into the event sooner than what he did on this occasion.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned regarding his riding, L Ferraris stated that he was instructed from a wide barrier to ride LUCKY GOR conservatively in the early stages, preferably in a midfield position.  He said after jumping well he endeavoured to comply with his instructions, however, LUCKY GOR raced keenly and when he received a call from riders to his inside, he was obliged to make the first turn wide.  He added as a result LUCKY GOR continued to race keenly along the Back Straight and although his mount was racing keenly, he was reluctant to allow LUCKY GOR to stride forward given the wide run it had experienced in the early stages.  Trainer C Fownes confirmed the instructions issued and advised that such instructions were issued as LUCKY GOR had performed well when ridden behind the pace on 27 September 2023.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Prior to declaring weighed-in, the Stewards considered as to whether E UNIVERSE had been afforded a fair start.  After taking evidence from M L Yeung, Trainer K L Man and Starter, Mr A Speechley, the Stewards found that E UNIVERSE, which had been assisted by a starting gate handler when it was being fractious, had its head turned slightly to the side as the start was effected, however, in the opinion of the Stewards, such occurrence had not resulted in E UNIVERSE being subjected to an unfair start and as a result it was declared a runner.  Before being allowed to race again, E UNIVERSE will be required to perform satisfactorily in a stalls test.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly and then was bumped shortly after the start.  The Stewards considered a protest/objection lodged by K De Melo, rider of ATULLIBIGEAL, placed 4th, against DANCING CODE, placed 3rd, alleging interference at the 400 Metres and again approaching the 200 Metres.  In considering all the evidence, the Stewards found that near the 400 Metres ATULLIBIGEAL shifted out slightly and made contact with the hindquarters of DANCING CODE, resulting in DANCING CODE being turned in and ATULLIBIGEAL and DANCING CODE becoming unbalanced in this incident.  The Stewards further found that near the 200 Metres after ATULLIBIGEAL obtained a narrow run between DANCING CODE and CIRCUIT STELLAR, it then was momentarily crowded when CIRCUIT STELLAR shifted out and away from RED LION and DANCING CODE which shifted in slightly.  After considering both incidents in their totality, the Stewards overruled the protest/objection and correct weight was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.  K De Melo was advised to exercise more care.

The Stewards today inquired into the circumstances regarding the inadvertent treatment of CAN’T GO WONG which was withdrawn from this race on 10.11.23 by order of the Stewards.  Evidence was taken from Mr F C Lor, the trainer of CAN’T GO WONG, Mr P K Lo, assistant    trainer, and Mr P C Lam, work rider allocated to Mr Lor’s stable.  It was ascertained that CAN’T GO WONG was inadvertently treated with an anti-ulcer medication and as that treatment was inside the recommended withdrawal period for the medication, the Stewards acceded to a request from Mr Lor for the horse to be withdrawn.  It was subsequently ascertained that Mr Lam inadvertently treated CAN’T GO WONG despite there being a number of measures in place to ensure that the horse was not treated given that it had been declared to race.  Mr Lor was fined the sum of $20,000 for a breach of Rule 50(2) in that as the person responsible for all matters pertaining to the running of his stable including the work of the stable staff allocated to him, he failed to ensure that CAN’T GO WONG was not treated in accordance with the Rules of Racing.  Before being allowed to race again, CAN’T GO WONG will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Before being allowed to race again, RED ELEGANCE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly and became unbalanced and then shortly after was steadied when crowded.  Approaching the 250 Metres lay in and away from NOIR RIDER and as a result made contact with the hindquarters of AMAZING TRAVIS and became unbalanced.

Jumped only fairly.  Raced keenly in the middle stages.  Near the 100 Metres was bumped by RATTAN KINGDOM and as a result shifted out and away from that runner.

Jumped only fairly.  Bumped near the 400 Metres and became unbalanced.  Approaching the 100 Metres was disappointed for a run between JOYFUL HUNTER and FLYING MOJITO and was then shifted to the inside to continue into clear running.

When questioned, L Hewitson stated that his mount jumped awkwardly and made contact with KA YING CHEER but travelled well throughout the early and middle stages.  He said after being placed under pressure making the Home Turn JOYFUL HUNTER failed to respond to his riding from that point and raced in a disappointing manner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of JOYFUL HUNTER was considered to be disappointing as compared to its previous starts.  Before being allowed to race again, JOYFUL HUNTER will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Apprentice E C W Wong stated that after his mount commenced awkwardly, he lost the use of his right iron for a short distance before he was able to reposition his foot into the iron.  He said that he was given no specific instructions as to where to settle his mount but in the early stages was caught wide and as a result raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  He added that in the Home Straight CAPITAL LEGEND did not respond to his riding and raced disappointingly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

L Ferraris, who weighed in at 123 lbs, was fined the sum of $3,000 for retuning to scale 2 lbs overweight.  Jumped awkwardly and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

On arrival at the barriers, C L Chau expressed concern with his mount’s action.  Examined by the Veterinary Officer and found to be lame in its right front leg and accordingly was not suitable to race.  Withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  Before being allowed to race again, HYPER DRAGON BALL will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Over the concluding stages lay in towards SUPER COMMANDER, resulting in its rider, Apprentice Y L Chung, having to stop riding and straighten his mount for a short distance.  When questioned regarding his riding of HARMONY N BLESSED, Apprentice Y L Chung stated that he was instructed, with SUPER COMMANDER and FORTUNE WARRIOR being speed horses, to endeavour to take a seat behind those two horses in the early stages.  He said from a wide barrier he rode HARMONY N BLESSED along whereby it then commenced to race keenly and approaching the 850 Metres he endeavoured to comply with his instructions, but was unable to do so due to his mount continuing to race too keenly. Trainer D A Hayes confirmed the instructions were to take cover with noted speed runners in the event.  Apprentice Chung was advised that he had made an error of judgement in the early stages in riding his mount with too much vigour for too long which resulted in HARMONY N BLESSED not being ridden in accordance with the instructions that he was issued.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, HARMONY N BLESSED will be subjected to an official veterinary examination. <16/11/2023 Additional Veterinary Reports> HARMONY N BLESSED, which performed disappointingly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in its trachea. HARMONY N BLESSED was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer D A Hayes this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its right front leg. As previously advised, HARMONY N BLESSED will be subjected to an official veterinary examination before being allowed to race again.

When questioned regarding the tactics adopted on FORTUNE WARRIOR, K Teetan advised that from the outside barrier he was instructed to take up a position outside the anticipated leader SUPER COMMANDER.  He said in the early stages he rode his mount along to comply with his instructions, but when HARMONY N BLESSED held its position to his inside, he continued to make use of FORTUNE WARRIOR in an endeavour to cross that runner.  He added approaching the 700 Metres when it became apparent his mount would be caught wide, he then elected to obtain cover behind HARMONY N BLESSED and soon after shifted to the rail.  When questioned if there was an opportunity to restrain his mount sooner than what he did, K Teetan agreed with the Stewards that in retrospect he had persisted for too long in an endeavour to cross HARMONY N BLESSED.  Trainer P C Ng confirmed the instructions issued to Jockey Teetan and said that such instructions issued were consistent with the horse’s previous race starts.  The Stewards advised Jockey Teetan that his actions through that section of the race constituted an error of judgement and that in similar circumstances he would be expected to show better judgement than he did on this occasion.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Near the 200 Metres, A Hamelin dropped his whip.  Trainer P C Ng confirmed that the instructions issued to A Hamelin were to hold the lead which was consistent with its previous racing pattern.
Slow to begin.

Near the 200 Metres was bumped by RUN RUN COOL which shifted in.  When questioned regarding his riding in the early stages and the reason he rode KYRUS DRAGON in a conservative manner through that section of the race, B Avdulla stated that at its previous race start on 29 October 2023 over 1200 Metres, KYRUS DRAGON raced too keenly and as a result found it difficult to finish the race off.  He said from the inside barrier this evening he was asked not to place KYRUS DRAGON under pressure in the early stages to allow it to settle as KYRUS DRAGON was being dropped back to 1000 Metres where a strong pace was expected.  He added in accordance with his instructions he allowed KYRUS DRAGON to settle towards the back of the field, but it finished the race off only fairly.  Trainer D J Hall confirmed the instructions issued and stated that KYRUS DRAGON had raced keenly at its last race start and this was the reason why the horse was dropping back to a 1000 Metre race tonight.  He added that he would continue to issue similar instructions to riders of the horse in future to ensure that KYRUS DRAGON settles in its future race starts.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Made the Home Turn awkwardly, shifted out and was steadied away from FAST BUCK.
Shifted out at the start and then was bumped and became unbalanced.

Lay in when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  After the race, C Y Ho advised that despite riding his mount along in the early stages, it did not show its usual pace and as a result was caught wide in the early stages.  He said entering the Back Straight, when caught wide, he was obliged to make further use of his mount to continue to go forward and obtain a position closer to the rail and as a consequence when he placed his mount under pressure in the Home Straight, it did not finish the race off strongly.
Crowded shortly after the start.

Making the first turn raced keenly and lay out.  After the race, A Hamelin stated that his mount jumped only fairly and then shortly after the start was crowded for room and as a result could not obtain a forward position.  He added after entering the Back Straight, he had to come back further in the field to obtain cover and then in the Home Straight the horse ran home fairly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped awkwardly and then bumped with JOY COMING.  Raced keenly in the middle stages.  Near the 550 Metres became unbalanced when reluctant to hold its position to the inside of ACA POWER.  After the race, K C Leung stated that the horse was reluctant to race inside other runners during the event.  He added that due to the manner in which PRIME MORTAR finished the race off in the Home Straight, he recommended to connections that they consider stepping the horse up in distance in its future starts.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

At declaration time, Z Purton was declared as the rider of both FAST BUCK and TALENTS SUPREMO.  It was established that Z Purton had a firm commitment to ride TALENTS SUPREMO.  As such, the Stewards permitted L Currie to be substituted as the rider of FAST BUCK.  For this declaration error, Trainer J Size was fined $2,000.  Approaching the 300 Metres was inconvenienced when positioned close to the heels of JOY COMING (M L Yeung) which shifted out.  M L Yeung was advised to exercise more care.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

When questioned regarding his riding, A Badel stated that from the outside barrier he was asked to ride his mount conservatively in the early stages, but he was also instructed that as PROSECCO does not appreciate racing inside other runners, he was to make his run to the outside and he was also given the option to make a mid-race move due to PROSECCO’s light weight and the fact that it is one-paced.  He added after entering the Back Straight near the 1000 Metres, he contemplated making a forward move, but when the pace of the event was still strong, he remained racing towards the rear of the field.  He said near the 700 Metres when he felt the pace of the race eased slightly, he elected to allow PROSECCO to stride forward and made a forward move.  He said after obtaining a position behind and to the outside of SNOWALOT, he waited for that runner to shift out to provide him with cover three wide into the Home Straight whereby PROSECCO, when presented to the outside, ran on reasonably well.  Trainer W Y So confirmed the instructions issued.  The Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Badel were reasonable in the circumstances.
No report.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race revealed that the horse was displaying an irregular heart rhythm.  Before being allowed to race again, PRINCE ALEX will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination. <15 November 2023 Happy Valley Racemeeting – Race 3 (169)>PRINCE ALEX – A veterinary inspection immediately following the race determined that the horse was displaying an abnormal heart rhythm. An ECG examination was subsequently performed as per protocol and sent for a specialist opinion the following day. A specialist review of the post-race ECG performed on PRINCE ALEX has determined that the horse was not displaying a significant irregular heart rhythm. However, the Stewards have determined that before being allowed to race again, PRINCE ALEX will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

K De Melo was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 6 December 2023 at Happy Valley. He further stated that as a result soon after entering the Home Straight he held FLYING ACE together to allow it to improve into the event without being pressured until inside the 300 Metres where he then rode FLYING ACE along vigorously to the finish of the event although he was of the opinion that its run peaked near the 50 Metres.
