Near the 350 Metres, ARIEL, which was giving ground, was steadied when briefly crowded between SMART FIGHTER and LOST CHILD, both of which shifted ground slightly.  A short distance later, CIRCUIT NINE (M Chadwick), which was being shifted to the outside of ARIEL, was checked away from the heels of ARIEL and shifted out abruptly, resulting in G LINER being bumped heavily by CIRCUIT NINE and taken out onto SPEEDSTAR which was checked.  The Stewards found that as ARIEL was steadied just prior to CIRCUIT NINE being shifted out, it had contributed to the degree of the interference suffered by G LINER and SPEEDSTAR, however, M Chadwick was reprimanded and advised that he would be expected to show better judgement than he did on this occasion in that he was positioned too close to the heels of ARIEL when he commenced to shift out.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When giving ground near the 350 Metres was steadied when crowded for room.  After the race, L Ferraris stated that whilst his mount was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event, it was under pressure from the 600 Metres and gave ground noticeably in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of ARIEL was considered to be disappointing as compared to its previous starts.  Before being allowed to race again, ARIEL will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Jumped only fairly.  Approaching the 1000 Metres was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.  Sent for sampling post-race.
K Teetan was fined the sum of $5,000 for raising his whip arm above the height of his shoulder in the Home Straight.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Approaching the 1000 Metres was bumped and became unbalanced.  Between the 350 Metres and the 300 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.
No report.
Crowded near the 900 Metres.

Approaching the 1000 Metres became unbalanced when crowded between WELLINGTON and LUCKY SWEYNESSE which, after racing tight to the inside of SIGHT SUCCESS (B Avdulla), shifted in slightly and made contact with DUKE WAI, resulting in LUCKY SWEYNESSE being turned in further and crowding DUKE WAI.  B Avdulla was advised to exercise more care and to ensure that he provides comfortable racing room for runners to his inside.  B Avdulla pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 900 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of LUCKY SWEYNESSE, resulting in LUCKY SWEYNESSE being taken in, crowding DUKE WAI, causing DUKE WAI to be checked and also taken in, unnecessarily crowding FANTASTIC TREASURE.  B Avdulla was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Sunday, 3 December 2023 at Sha Tin.  In addition, Jockey Avdulla was fined $22,500.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent race riding record.

Jumped awkwardly.  After the race, L Ferraris reported that his mount was making an abnormal respiratory noise during the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.  Before being allowed to race again, SUPER WEALTHY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned, K C Leung explained that approaching the 300 Metres he changed his whip from his right to his left hand whereby he struck BEAUTY JOY on one occasion.  He said as he then endeavoured to strike BEAUTY JOY on the second occasion, he lost the whip from his grasp and as a consequence was unable to use it for the remainder of the event.  K C Leung was warned and advised that he should ensure at all times, where possible, that he maintains proper control over his whip.  In taking no action against Jockey Leung, the Stewards considered that he has not offended similarly for over two years.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

When questioned regarding the disappointing performance, M Chadwick stated that he was obliged to make some use of his mount along the Back Straight to cross HEALTHY HAPPY.  He said CALIFORNIA SPANGLE travelled well in the lead, but from the 500 Metres was pressured when VOYAGE BUBBLE improved to his outside.  He added soon after entering the Home Straight CALIFORNIA SPANGLE failed to respond to his riding from that point.  Trainer A S Cruz agreed with the views of Jockey Chadwick and also added that CALIFORNIA SPANGLE was required to give 5 lbs to the other runners in the race and that the time of the event, particularly in the early stages, was run faster than standard.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Before being allowed to race again, CALIFORNIA SPANGLE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly.  Near the 1300 Metres got its head up when being steadied as it was crossed by CALIFORNIA SPANGLE.  Near the 1000 Metres, after improving to the inside of CALIFORNIA SPANGLE, HEALTHY HAPPY was steadied when crossed by CALIFORNIA SPANGLE (M Chadwick) which shifted in when not quite clear.  M Chadwick was severely reprimanded and advised he must ensure he provides sufficient clearance when shifting ground.
Jumped only fairly.  Raced keenly in the early and middle stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
No report.
No report.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the race, M L Yeung reported that his mount was making an abnormal respiratory noise during the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Before being allowed to race again, CALL ME DANDY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

When questioned, C L Chau stated that from a wide barrier he was instructed to ride WINNER METHOD in a conservative manner in the early stages as the horse had disappointed at its last two starts when ridden in a more forward position.  He added due to a wide barrier he was obliged to race slightly further back than what he had anticipated.  Trainer C S Shum confirmed the instructions issued and advised that such instructions were given as WINNER METHOD had disappointed at its last two starts.
Jumped awkwardly.  Near the 350 Metres, RAGNARR shifted out and away from GALAXY PATCH and bumped with MONTA FRUTTA which became unbalanced.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  When finishing the race off well over the concluding stages, was steadied to avoid COMPASSION SPIRIT when that runner shifted out slightly.
Jumped awkwardly.
Crowded shortly after the start.  In the middle stages lay out and as a result made the Home Turn wide.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have bled from both nostrils.  Before being allowed to race again, CALIFORNIA VANES will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

C Y Ho (STRAIGHT ARRON) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that over the concluding stages he allowed his mount to shift in when insufficiently clear of NIMBLE NIMBUS, resulting in NIMBLE NIMBUS being unnecessarily crowded for room and having to be steadied.  C Y Ho was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 29 November 2023 at Happy Valley.  In addition, Jockey Ho was fined $27,500.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 3 and the consequences grade 1 and also considered his excellent race riding record.

Jumped only fairly.  When commencing to finish the race off well, was directed to the outside of SWORD POINT near the 25 Metres in an attempt to secure clear running, but then was checked away from NIMBLE NIMBUS when that runner was taken in.
After the 350 Metres raced tight to the inside of RUSSIAN EMPEROR and made contact with that runner on a number of occasions.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Bumped on the hindquarters near the 300 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped awkwardly.  In the early stages over-raced and near the 1300 Meres was allowed to stride forward and was then caught wide and without cover from that point when SWORD POINT shifted out to a position outside MONEY CATCHER, before weakening in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Before being allowed to race again, GLORIOUS DRAGON will be subjected to an official veterinary examination. <20/11/2023 Additional Veterinary Reports> GLORIOUS DRAGON, which performed poorly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings. GLORIOUS DRAGON was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer P C Ng this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its right front leg. As previously advised, GLORIOUS DRAGON will be subjected to an official veterinary examination before being allowed to race again.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event. Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Jumped only fairly. Near the 25 Metres was bumped by GORGEOUS VITALITY which shifted out and then lay out to the finish.
No report.
No report.
Bumped shortly after the start.

As the start was effected turned its head to the side and as a result lost ground.  Near the 550 Metres lay in, made contact with the running rail and as a result became unbalanced and lost ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped on jumping.  After the race, Z Purton stated that his mount raced in a disappointing manner but could offer no explanation for the performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly and made contact with CIRCUIT SEVEN.  Was then crowded between CIRCUIT SEVEN and CALL ME MIGHTY which shifted in slightly.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

After travelling a short distance was crowded between HAPPY UNITED and CALL ME MIGHTY which shifted out.  After the race, A Atzeni reported that due to the fast early pace STRIVE FOR GLORY did not travel well, however, he was not too disappointed with its finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the race, K Teetan reported that with the fast early pace he was obliged to make some use of his mount to hold a forward position as he was instructed.  He said as a result, PROSPEROUS SMILE, which was having its first race start, gave ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly and then got its head up when bumped by SURE JOYFUL.  Lay in in the Home Straight.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Lay in in the Home Straight.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Passing the 250 Metres was bumped by RED HARE KING which shifted out when being corrected by its rider M Chadwick.  When questioned regarding his riding and the reason he elected to leave a trailing position behind GALLANT CROWN approaching the 900 Metres to improve, K De Melo stated that his instructions were to lead and after his mount did not show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position, he was obliged to settle in a handy position behind GALLANT CROWN.  He said when he observed the pace of the event eased slightly after the 900 Metres, he elected to allow HAPPY ANGEL to improve three deep with a view to crossing to the lead as he was advised that HAPPY ANGEL is a one-paced horse.  Assistant Trainer P H Lo confirmed the instructions issued to Jockey De Melo.  After considering his explanation, the Stewards advised Jockey De Melo that the tactics he adopted were reasonable in the circumstances although HAPPY ANGEL was unable to cross to the rail and as a result raced wide and without cover from the 900 Metres.
Crowded at the start.  In the middle stages raced keenly and after the 1000 Metres was steadied away from CLUB SODA.
Lay in in the early part of the Home Straight and for some distance near the 200 Metres raced in restricted room to the inside of SURE JOYFUL which lay in.
When being shifted towards the rail approaching the 1600 Metres was awkwardly placed on the heels of HAPPY ANGEL and was steadied.
No report.
No report.
Shortly after the start was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.

M Chadwick (RED HARE KING) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 250 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when insufficiently clear of CONCERTO, resulting in CONCERTO being unnecessarily crowded for room and having to be steadied and also being taken in, unnecessarily crowding MASTER TORNADO.  M Chadwick was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 6 December 2023 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 3 and the consequences grade 1 and also took into account his good race riding record.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Steadied when crowded near the 250 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Despite being ridden along in the early stages was unable to show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly and was checked shortly after the start when crowded.  Was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages from a wide barrier.  After the 400 Metres became held up behind SUPER JOY before shifting to that runner’s outside to improve.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Over the concluding stages lay out under pressure.  When questioned, A Badel stated that his instructions were to obtain a midfield position early and he was given the option of making a mid-race move if circumstances permitted as REGENCY HAPPY STAR had performed well when ridden in this manner in the past.  He added whilst the pace of the event was run inside of standard throughout the early and middle stages, entering the Back Straight he felt there was an opportunity to allow REGENCY HAPPY STAR to stride forward and as a result he shifted to the outside to allow his mount to cross and eventually lead from the 600 Metres.
Jumped awkwardly and then was bumped.

Shortly after the start was steadied when crowded.  Near the 600 Metres became unbalanced when crowded by REGENCY HAPPY STAR (A Badel) which shifted in before being corrected by its rider.  A Badel was severely reprimanded.  A short distance later was then steadied when REGENCY HAPPY STAR crossed to the rail.  A Badel was reprimanded and advised he must ensure he is sufficiently clear when shifting ground.
No report.

After the race, L Hewitson stated that his mount did not appreciate the early pace of the event being run inside of standard time.  Whilst the Stewards were satisfied that the riding of L Hewitson, 7th placegetter, over the concluding stages did not affect the horse’s finishing position, he was nonetheless reminded of his obligation to ensure that he rides his mounts out fully to the finish of the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

Slow to begin.  After the race, M Chadwick reported that his mount over-raced throughout the event and refused to settle and he was placed at some disadvantage when the bit shifted in the horse’s mouth.  He added as a result SUPER JOY was unable to finish the race off due to its racing manners in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Approaching the 500 Metres bumped with PERFECT ROCK when endeavouring to shift to the outside of NICE BIRDIE.  Approaching the 300 Metres became held up behind NICE BIRDIE and was then shifted to that runner’s outside to secure clear running and raced tight between NICE BIRDIE and PERFECT ROCK for a short distance thereafter and made contact with PERFECT ROCK.  After the race, L Ferraris reported that his mount raced keenly in the early stages and for some distance after the 1200 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from CORDYCEPS ONE.  He added that the horse made an abnormal respiratory noise during the running of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Before being allowed to race again, GET THE MONIES will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
After the race, K C Leung could offer no excuse for his mount’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped approaching the 300 Metres.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Over the final 250 Metres lay in under pressure.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Jumped awkwardly and then from the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Lay in in the Home Straight under pressure.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
No report.
No report.
No report.

When questioned, Z Purton stated that his mount was fractious in the barriers and as the start was effected jumped awkwardly and as a result lost ground.  He said consequently HAPPY GOLF settled further back in the field than he had anticipated.  He added that on straightening he directed his mount to the inside and commenced to ride HAPPY GOLF along.  He added approaching the 200 Metres he was unable to shift to the outside as he felt that HAPPY DAY had secured a run to the outside of SPICY SO SMART and when SPICY SO SMART was giving ground, he then became held up behind CHAMPION INSTINCT and did not obtain clear running until near the 150 Metres when he shifted back to the inside of that runner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly and then was bumped a short distance later.
No report.

Jumped only fairly and then after travelling a short distance was crowded.  Approaching the 1000 Metres was steadied when crowded between LUCKY PLANET and DIAMOND DIAMOND which made the turn awkwardly and shifted out.  When questioned, A Atzeni stated that his mount, which was racing in ear plugs for the first time, settled back in the field, but did not travel strongly during the event.  He said on straightening he elected to shift in slightly to avoid his mount losing momentum and after briefly held up behind HAPPY GOLF near the 200 Metres, he was able to secure clear running to that runner’s outside whereby his mount worked to the line reasonably well.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the race, A Hamelin reported that his mount did not appreciate the step-up in grade to Class 4 for tonight’s event.  Trainer P C Ng stated that following its last start he gave SPICY SO SMART some light work after it had pulled up well following its last start win.  He added he agreed with the explanation of A Hamelin that SPICY SO SMART was not suited by racing up in Class 4.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance was considered to be disappointing as compared to its last start.  Before being allowed to race again, SPICY SO SMART will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination. <16/11/2023 Additional Veterinary Reports> SPICY SO SMART, which performed disappointingly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings. SPICY SO SMART was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer P C Ng this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its right front leg. As previously advised, SPICY SO SMART will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination before being allowed to race again.

When questioned regarding SCOTCH TYCOON leading, L Ferraris stated that whilst he was not specifically asked to lead, he was given the option of holding a forward position if his mount jumped well.  He said after commencing well and when no other runner in the race showed intent to hold the lead, he allowed SCOTCH TYCOON to improve to the lead where it travelled comfortably.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Approaching the 1000 Metres was steadied when crowded between WIND SPEEDER which shifted out slightly and GOLDEN RISE which lay in.  Close to the finish was awkwardly placed close to the heels of SCOTCH TYCOON.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.
Jumped only fairly.

Close to the finish raced tight between JUMBO LEGEND and SOLID SHALAA which shifted out.  After the race, K Teetan stated that in the Home Straight his mount lay out and shifted ground and proved difficult to ride out.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 1000 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from JUMBO LEGEND.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Raced keenly in the early stages and lay out on the first turn.  Near the 450 Metres raced tight between MR GOOD VIBES and CHOICERUS which shifted to the outside of SIR HURRICANE.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Crowded shortly after the start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Near the 800 Metres raced in restricted room between EIGHTEEN PALMS and RED ACLAIM which shifted out.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Approaching the 200 Metres was disappointed for clear running between OUTGATE and QUANTUM PATCH before being shifted to the outside of QUANTUM PATCH to obtain clear running.

Near the 300 Metres was held up between E LEGEND and ALL IS GOOD which was giving ground.  Over the final 200 Metres lay in.  Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out when crowded between E LEGEND and STORM LEGEND, both of which shifted ground slightly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the 500 Metres was steadied when improving into a narrow run between RED ACLAIM and EIGHTEEN PALMS and as a result made contact with EIGHTEEN PALMS.  Approaching the 250 Metres improved into a run between STORM LEGEND and PRIME MINISTER and then raced tight between those two runners for some distance thereafter.  Then continued to race tight to the inside of PRIME MINISTER which lay in and as a result near the 100 Metres was shifted to the outside of PRIME MINISTER to secure clear running.
Jumped only fairly.
On arrival at the Start, the tongue tie applied to KIMBERLEY was replaced.  Jumped awkwardly and from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Crowded at the start.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

After the race, C Y Ho reported that his mount was obliged to race wide and at various stages did not have cover.  He added that as a result EIGHTEEN PALMS was unable to finish the race off strongly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of EIGHTEEN PALMS was considered to be disappointing as compared to its previous starts.   Before being allowed to race again, EIGHTEEN PALMS will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

When questioned, Z Purton stated that whilst he had not specifically expected to lead tonight, he was obliged to go forward and lead when caught wide early.  He said ALL IS GOOD came under pressure near the 800 Metres and in the Home Straight shifted ground and also weakened.  Assistant Trainer S K Sit stated that ALL IS GOOD had pleased the stable leading into tonight’s race and he could offer no explanation for the disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of ALL IS GOOD, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, ALL IS GOOD will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Noted to have lost its right front plate after the race.

Crowded shortly after the start and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Noted to have lost its left front plate after the race.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped shortly after the start. Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
No report.
No report.

After the race, B Avdulla stated that from his wide barrier he shifted GIDDY UP across behind runners in the early stages, but the horse raced keenly and ran wide on the first turn.  He added near the 700 Metres GIDDY UP shifted in abruptly when racing ungenerously and then once balanced up in the Home Straight ran on strongly under pressure.
Jumped awkwardly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Crowded on jumping.  Over the concluding stages raced tight to the inside of O’LINER when that runner shifted in.

After the race, Z Purton stated that his mount dipped near the 900 Metres and became awkward in its action for a short distance after.  He said COLOURFUL EMPEROR did not travel well thereafter.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Bumped on the hindquarters shortly after the start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 200 Metres, Apprentice E C W Wong was unable to ride his mount for a short distance when he had some difficulty in changing his whip from a backhand to a forehand grip.
No report.
Slow to begin.

In the middle stages raced keenly and near the 1000 Metres got its head up when being steadied to avoid the heels of MASTER OF LUCK.  Trainer K L Man confirmed that from a wide barrier he had instructed A Badel to ride the horse in a conservative manner in the early stages as TSUEN WAN GLORY had disappointed at its most recent starts when ridden in a more forward position.
Raced wide and without cover from the 900 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly and was bumped shortly after the start.  Bumped near the 200 Metres.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 1200 Metres, when racing keenly, was steadied to avoid the heels of GREAT BRILLIANT when that runner was shifted in.  Near the 900 Metres was briefly crowded by TSUEN WAN GLORY.  Passing the 200 Metres was directed to the outside of TSUEN WAN GLORY to continue into clear running.
Bumped on jumping.

When questioned, Z Purton stated that after settling back in the field, he was unable to proceed forward in the early part of the Home Straight when positioned behind COMPULSORY.  He said as a result he elected to endeavour to obtain a narrow run between GENERAL WINNER and MASTER OF LUCK approaching the 250 Metres, but then was badly held up until near the 200 Metres where it made contact with MASTER OF LUCK.  He added between the 200 Metres and the 100 Metres he was then crowded when GENERAL WINNER (A Atzeni) shifted out whilst being ridden along.  A Atzeni was advised to exercise more care.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the race, C L Chau reported that his mount raced keenly in the early stages when left without cover, lay out making the Home Turn and as a result was left without a finishing effort.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Hampered on jumping.  Noted to have bled from both nostrils.

Withdrawn on 25.11.23 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame left fore) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter TSUEN WAN GLORY.  Before being allowed to race again, ART LITE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Approaching the 200 Metres lay in and was corrected by its rider L Hewitson. Then shifted out when being corrected.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.
Bumped shortly after the start and from the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Steadied near the 600 Metres.
Sent for sampling post-race.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Approaching the 1000 Metres was steadied away from CHARMING STEED (K H Chan) which shifted in when not clear.  K H Chan was severely reprimanded and advised he must ensure he provides sufficient clearance when shifting ground.  Near the 600 Metres shifted in and away from ISLAND SURPRISE and made slight contact with ERNEST FEELING.  A short distance later shifted out and was severely checked when racing tight between ERNEST FEELING and ISLAND SURPRISE and as a consequence lost ground.  The Stewards found that the racing manners of BRILLIANT PIONEER were the principal reason for the interference occurring.  A Atzeni stated that after striking interference near the 600 Metres, his mount failed to finish the race off from that point.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly.  Near the 1100 Metres, when racing keenly, got its head up when being steadied away from MISTER ARM when that runner gave ground.  Then continued to over-race in the early stages and near the 950 Metres shifted out when being steadied away from MISTER ARM.  Near the 600 Metres was shifted to the outside to avoid BRILLIANT PIONEER.

In the middle stages raced keenly.  Lay out on the Home Turn and then continued to lay out in the Home Straight before being corrected by its rider M L Yeung.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned, C L Chau stated that his instructions were to lead.  He said DAY DAY RICH was able to obtain the lead comfortably in the early stages without being pressured but disappointed in its failure to respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of DAY DAY RICH was considered to be disappointing as compared to its last start.  Before being allowed to race again, DAY DAY RICH will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Checked at the 600 Metres.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned regarding his mount leading, Apprentice Y L Chung stated that from the inside barrier he was instructed to lead on LEAN MASTER and as a consequence he rode his mount along in the early stages to comply with his instructions.  Trainer C H Yip stated that with blinkers on today, from the inside barrier and having its first start on the All Weather surface and with the apprentice claim, he had instructed Apprentice Chung to lead on the horse.  He stated that such instructions were issued as LEAN MASTER had also performed well when ridden in a forward position in a barrier trial on 14 November 2023.
Near the 250 Metres, when laying out, raced tight to the inside of MULTISUPER.  Then continued to lay out to the finish of the event.
Jumped only fairly and then blundered shortly after the start.

After the race, J McDonald reported that his mount jumped awkwardly and lost ground and, in his opinion, did not appreciate the kickback when being settled in behind runners.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  For a short distance after the 250 Metres was held up behind RED DESERT before shifting to the outside to secure clear running approaching the 150 Metres.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, COLOURFUL PRINCE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
No report.

After the race, B Avdulla stated that his mount travelled satisfactorily behind the leaders throughout the early stages.  He said on the Home Turn RED DESERT came under pressure before weakening in the Home Straight.  Trainer J Size advised that RED DESERT had pleased him since its last start win on 25 October 2023, barrier trialed well on 14 November 2023  and could offer no excuse for today’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance was considered to be disappointing as compared to its previous starts.  Before being allowed to race again, RED DESERT will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Near the 750 Metres was steadied when crowded by COLOURFUL PRINCE (K De Melo) which shifted in when not clear.  K De Melo was advised to exercise more care.  Then obliged to race wide and without cover for the remainder of the event.
Lay out in the middle stages and made the Home Turn wide.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Withdrawn on 25.11.23 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (wound to left hip) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter COLOURFUL PRINCE.  Before being allowed to race again, BRAVE WITNESS will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
After being shifted to the inside near the 300 Metres to obtain clear running then raced greenly and proved difficult to ride out.

After blundering approaching the 200 Metres then lay out under pressure to the finish of the event.  After the race, Z Purton stated that his mount travelled satisfactorily in an on-pace position, but when asked for an effort from the 400 Metres did not respond to his riding as strongly as he had anticipated and finished the race off only fairly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly.
No report.
Shortly after the start shifted out and got its head up when being corrected by its rider A Hamelin.  Approaching the 350 Metres was steadied away from HAYDAY, shifted out and bumped heavily.
No report.
Approaching the 350 Metres shifted out and away from LOYAL BO BO.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Raced tight for a short distance after the start.  Approaching the 350 Metres was bumped and became unbalanced.
Jumped awkwardly.  Approaching the 350 Metres bumped heavily and became unbalanced.

Jumped only fairly and then was crowded by GUSTY FIGHTER which shifted out.  Approaching the 350 Metres HAYDAY shifted out and away from  LOYAL BO BO when LOYAL BO BO shifted out before being corrected by its rider Z Purton.  As a result, HAYDAY then shifted out further, resulting in VALIANT ELEGANCE, which was positioned close to the heels of HAYDAY, then being taken out abruptly and bumping heavily with ISLAND BRIGHT, resulting in ISLAND BRIGHT being taken out further, causing GRAND CONQUEROR to be checked when crowded between ISLAND BRIGHT and GOLDEN CHAMPION.  The Stewards found that the racing manners of HAYDAY were the significant contributor to the interference being caused.

After being loaded became fractious in the barriers and got its right front leg over the barrier partition.  Acting on veterinary advice that LUCKY QUALITY was not suitable to race, the horse was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  Before being allowed to race again, LUCKY QUALITY will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Subsequently C Y Ho was examined by the Chief Medical Officer and passed fit to fulfil his remaining race riding engagements.

Withdrawn on 25.11.23 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame right fore) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter HAYDAY.  Before being allowed to race again, BELLE HEART will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Hampered on jumping when taken out by SMOKEY BEAR.
No report.

When questioned, K Teetan stated that he was instructed with the anticipated strong early pace to ride FORTUNE WARRIOR behind the speed with cover.  He said after being positioned behind AMAZING DUCK near the 650 Metres, FORTUNE WARRIOR commenced to race keenly and got its head up when being checked away from the heels of that runner for some distance thereafter.  Trainer P C Ng confirmed the instructions issued.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Obliged to race wide and without cover in the middle stages.
Slow to begin and then was steadied when crowded shortly after the start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shortly after the start was bumped heavily by ADEFILL and became unbalanced.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.  After the race, B Avdulla reported that he was instructed to ride his mount conservatively in the early stages as it had raced disappointingly last start when ridden in a forward position.  Assistant Trainer Y H Wong confirmed the instructions issued and the reason as to why such instructions were issued.  Sent for sampling post-race.

M F Poon, the rider of 3rd placegetter, ALL FOR ST PAUL’S, was found guilty of a charge of having failed to ride his mount out over the final one stride of the event to the satisfaction of the Stewards [Rule 100(2)].  In the circumstances and having regard to the margin between the 2nd placing and the 3rd placing of a nose, the Stewards believed the appropriate penalty was for M F Poon’s licence to ride in races be suspended for a period to commence on Wednesday, 6 December 2023 and to expire on Sunday, 24 December 2023 on which day he may resume race riding (6 Hong Kong racedays).

After the 300 Metres endeavoured to obtain a narrow run to the inside of ALL FOR ST PAUL’S but approaching the 250 Metres was steadied when disappointed for this run.  Was then shifted to the outside of ALL FOR ST PAUL’S shortly after to secure clear running.
No report.
No report.
Jumped awkwardly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
After the 150 Metres raced in restricted room between LOOKING GREAT and BOURBONAIRE which shifted out.

When questioned regarding his riding of RISE BRETHREN, Z Purton stated that his mount settled in a position behind midfield where he expected.  He said due to the slow early pace of the event, he commenced to ride his mount forward soon after the 600 Metres to improve into the event where he initially followed COLUMBUS COUNTY before shifting to that runner’s outside at the 450 Metres.  He stated that as the pace of the event continued to quicken, RISE BRETHREN was unable to secure a run that had developed between BUTTERFIELD and COLUMBUS COUNTY and then lay in and was positioned close to the heels of COLUMBUS COUNTY.  He added that approaching the 250 Metres when the run between COLUMBUS COUNTY and BUTTERFIELD closed, he then became held up behind COLUMBUS COUNTY and was unable to secure clear running from that point until the finish of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 400 Metres when being shifted to the outside to improve shifted out and made contact with SHARPEN BRIGHT.
Slow to begin.
No report.

When questioned regarding CHATEAU racing in a more forward position, A Badel stated that from a wide barrier he was instructed to hold a three wide position with cover if possible, however, was given the option to go forward if circumstances permitted.  He added that when caught wide in the early stages and with cover not being available, he then allowed CHATEAU to stride forward and took up a position outside the lead.  Trainer J Size confirmed the instructions issued.
Bumped near the 400 Metres.

When questioned, Apprentice Y L Chung confirmed his instructions were to lead today, but despite being ridden along in the early stages did not show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position.  When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight and the reason he elected to shift to the outside of CHATEAU near the 350 Metres, Apprentice Chung stated that as he was aware that IMPERIAL MAGEE, which had been positioned to his outside, had raced wide and without cover and he was anticipating that horse to give ground when placed under pressure in the Home Straight and for this reason he committed to improving to the outside of CHATEAU.  He added as he shifted to the outside of CHATEAU passing the 350 Metres, IMPERIAL MAGEE shifted in slightly which resulted in the run between CHATEAU and IMPERIAL MAGEE closing and MASTER HERO was then held up for clear running between the 300 Metres and the 50 Metres when it was unable to proceed between those two runners.  He further stated that whilst he was aware that a run had commenced to develop to the inside of CHATEAU, he felt that shifting to the outside would have provided his mount with a better chance to secure clear running at that point.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight and as to whether there was an opportunity to improve to the outside of IMPERIAL MAGEE sooner than he attempted, C Y Ho stated that after following CHATEAU, he was racing to the inside of the heels of IMPERIAL MAGEE and as a result was unable to shift out.  He said after the 400 Metres he steadied his mount slightly so that he could shift to the outside of IMPERIAL MAGEE, but as he attempted to obtain that run, IMPERIAL MAGEE shifted out slightly which resulted in his mount making contact with CASA COSMO near the 350 Metres, causing SUPER WISE DRAGON to be badly held up when disappointed for clear running between the 350 Metres and the 200 Metres before being able to shift to the outside to secure clear running.  Trainer W Y So confirmed that with SUPER WISE DRAGON stepping up in distance today and from a wide barrier, he had instructed C Y Ho to take up a more forward position on the horse.
From the 350 Metres until the 250 Metres was bumped on the hindquarters by SUPER WISE DRAGON on a number of occasions.

Passing the 1000 Metres raced in restricted room between CHATEAU and SUPER WISE DRAGON which shifted out slightly after being crossed by LUCKY ETERNITY.  Near the 50 Metres was steadied when crowded between CASA COSMO and MASTER HERO which shifted out.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly.
Slow to begin.

Whilst proceeding to the Start became fractious, resulting in its rider, M L Yeung, dismounting from the horse.  DELAGO PATROL was then withdrawn by order of the Stewards when it was unable to be taken to the Start.  Before being allowed to race again, DELAGO PATROL will be required to undertake a parade test.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced keenly in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Taken wider after the 700 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly, shifted in and bumped RED LION.
Jumped awkwardly and from the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Jumped awkwardly.
No report.

After the 700 Metres commenced to race keenly when HAPPY TOGETHER improved to its outside and as a result was steadied away from the heels of BOURBONAIRE and shifted out.  After the race, Z Purton stated that, in his opinion, RED LION did not run out the 1600 Metres of today’s event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Jumped awkwardly and made contact with the left side of its barrier.

Bumped shortly after the start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Due to the disappointing performance, RUNNING GLORY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination before being allowed to race again.
Jumped only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly and then was crowded shortly after the start.
No report.

Approaching the 300 Metres was held up for clear running between FAST VICTORY and BRAVE DREAMS which shifted out and away from MAGNIAC as that runner commenced to give ground.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Near the 200 Metres was bumped by FAST VICTORY.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out to the finish when held up behind LET’S DO IT.
Jumped only fairly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 600 Metres was steadied when crowded by STURDY RUBY which was taken in by KILLER INSTINCT (C Y Ho) which shifted in when not clear.  C Y Ho was reprimanded.  Near the 400 Metres was held up behind KILLER INSTINCT.  When questioned regarding the slow pace set in the early stages, K H Chan stated that he was instructed to lead on his mount but not to ride along to do so as SAMARKAND has an inclination to race keenly.  He said after obtaining the lead, SAMARKAND settled well and although he was aware the pace of the event was slow, he was reluctant to make any use of his mount to set a faster pace so as to avoid SAMARKAND over-racing.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 250 Metres bumped with GOLDEN SAMURAI.

After the 600 Metres was steadied away from SIMPLE HEDGE.  Passing the 400 Metres was bumped by LESLIE which shifted out to improve.  Near the 300 Metres, the whip of L Currie was momentarily caught within his reins.
No report.
Sent for sampling post-race.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 1000 Metres was steadied away from DURHAM STAR and was shifted out to commence a forward move.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

After the race, B Avdulla stated that he was able to obtain a position outside the lead in the early stages, but soon after straightening failed to respond to his riding and weakened from that point.  He added that, in his view, MAGNIAC did not run out today’s 1400 Metres and recommended that the horse be dropped back in distance for its next race start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Passing the 1100 Metres was attempted to be shifted behind SUPERB BOY to obtain cover, but became awkwardly placed on the heels of that runner and was then obliged to race wide and without cover thereafter.
Crowded shortly after the start.
Lay out in the Home Straight.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 1100 Metres was steadied away from FORTUNE PRESIDENT.
No report.

After travelling a short distance was crowded for room.  Near the 900 Metres was steadied away from DANCING CODE. After the race, Z Purton stated that his mount was disadvantaged by the pace steadying in the middle stages and by having to make a wide run in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Crowded shortly after the start.
No report.
Lay in in the Home Straight. Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event. After the race, L Ferraris reported that his mount raced keenly in the early and middle stages.

Bumped shortly after the start.  After the race, J McDonald stated that whilst his mount was obliged to race three wide, it had cover behind DANCING CODE.  He said from the 600 Metres SUPREME LUCKY was under pressure and was disappointing in its failure to finish the race off.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance was considered to be disappointing as compared to its most recent starts.  Before being allowed to race again, SUPREME LUCKY will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

When questioned regarding the tactics adopted, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that he was instructed to lead on his mount if possible, but not to engage in a speed battle with the other expected leader DROMBEG BANNER.  He said after riding his mount along in the early stages, he was able to hold an advantage over IMA SINGLE MAN, but near the 1200 Metres he relaxed on his mount as he felt that he would be able to cross IMA SINGLE MAN without having to continue to pressure his mount.  He added when IMA SINGLE MAN held its position to his inside and DROMBEG BANNER improved to his outside, he then allowed DROMBEG BANNER to cross his mount so that he did not have to unnecessarily pressure FLAMING RABBIT through that section of the race.  The Stewards advised Apprentice Wong that he had made an error of judgement in that near the 1200 Metres he did not continue to ride his mount forward which would have allowed FLAMING RABBIT to cross and lead on the rail in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Taken wider near the 1000 Metres.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Slow to begin.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the race, K De Melo reported that his mount found it difficult to make up ground from back in the field due to the slow early pace of the event.

After the 1000 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from STURDY RUBY due to the slow pace.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the race, L Hewitson reported that his mount was not suited by the slow early pace and in hindsight he would have been better suited holding a more forward position due to the slow early pace.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Due to the slow pace was checked passing the 1100 Metres when crowded between RUNNING AHEAD and WIN WIN FIGHTER which shifted out.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Due to the slow pace over-raced in the early stages and approaching the 1000 Metres ran out across PEGASUS GENERAL and was checked.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
After the 300 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when being shifted to the outside of CAPITAL LEGEND.
No report.

Bumped at the start.  Near the 1400 Metres BEAUTY FIT shifted in and away from MARADO (C L Chau) after initially being taken in by that runner, resulting in MASTER OF FORTUNE being steadied and shifted in when momentarily crowded, crowding the running of BEAUTYVERSE.  C L Chau was advised to exercise more care.  When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight, Z Purton stated that having regard to the pattern of racing, his preference was to obtain a run to the inside in the Home Straight.  He said after having to improve to the outside of BEAUTYVERSE on the Home Turn, he then was obliged to attempt to secure clear running wider on the track between POWERFUL WINGS and SPEED DRAGON, but approaching the 250 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running between those runners.  He added as a result he then shifted MASTER OF FORTUNE to the inside where he was able to commence riding his mount along, but near the 100 Metres he improved into a narrow run to the inside of CAPITAL LEGEND and as a result was not able to fully test his mount for a number of strides thereafter when he was concerned that he may cause interference to FLAMINGO TRILLION which was positioned directly to his inside.  He further stated that after fully establishing clear running, he was able to recommence riding his mount out to the finish of the event.  In the circumstances, the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Purton were reasonable, however, he was advised, wherever possible, he should fully test his mounts out to the finish of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Crowded after the 250 Metres.
Crowded after the 250 Metres.
Crowded near the 1400 Metres.  Near the 750 Metres got its head up.

Bumped on the hindquarters after the 250 Metres and became unbalanced.  After the race, M F Poon reported that his mount jumped awkwardly and as a result settled further back than what he had been instructed.
Approaching the 900 Metres raced tight to the inside of GRATEFUL HEART.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages, but was unable to obtain cover and as a result raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  After the 250 Metres BEAUTY FIT (A Hamelin) shifted to the outside of CAPITAL LEGEND to secure clear running, resulting in ROMANTIC CHARM being taken out and making contact with MARADO which resulted in MARADO being taken out further onto POWERFUL WINGS and SPEED DRAGON, which lay in, having to be steadied after bumping with POWERFUL WINGS and becoming unbalanced.  A Hamelin was advised to exercise more care.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 250 Metres, K Teetan momentarily lost control of his whip before quickly regathering it.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Kicked a rail on leaving the Parade Ring, examined by the Veterinary Officer on arrival at the Start and passed suitable to race.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned, J McDonald stated that the intention was to hold a midfield position on the horse, but EXPLOSIVE WITNESS commenced well tonight and established a forward position soon after the start.  He said his intention was to shift in and race to the outside of E UNIVERSE, however, when HEROIC MASTER, which had drawn barrier 1, shifted to a one-off position, he was then obliged to race wide and without cover.  He added that near the 800 Metres he endeavoured to restrain EXPLOSIVE WITNESS to obtain cover behind HEROIC MASTER, but when his mount commenced to race keenly and would not respond to his efforts to come back, he was obliged to race wide and without cover for the remainder of the event.
Over the concluding stages was unable to be ridden out to the finish when being corrected by its rider M L Yeung due to it shifting in and crowding the running of CALIFORNIA DEEPLY.
No report.

As the start was effected became fractious and as a result was slow to begin.  Over the concluding stages, when commencing to finish the race off well, improved into a tight run to the inside of E UNIVERSE when that runner was commencing to give ground and shift in and as a result could not be fully ridden out to the finish of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Slow to begin.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Slow to begin and then was crowded a short distance later.  In the middle stages commenced to race keenly and was steadied away from HAPPILY FRIENDS for some distance approaching the 600 Metres.  After the 600 Metres became unbalanced when bumped by EIGHT TRIGRAMS which shifted out after making contact with DASHING GLORY.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Near the 350 Metres blundered.
No report.
Bumped shortly after the start.  Bumped after the 600 Metres.  Near the 100 Metres was directed to the inside of GREAT DAYS to continue into clear running.

Crowded after the 600 Metres.  After the race, C L Chau advised that the intention was to hold a forward position with cover, but when caught wide in the early stages he was obliged to settle further back in the field to avoid racing wide.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Slow to begin.  When questioned regarding the apparent improved performance, Trainer D J Whyte stated that at its last race start WONDER YEARS was disadvantaged by having to race wide and without cover.  He added tonight WONDER YEARS was advantaged by the strong early pace which allowed the horse to make a long sustained run from the back of the field and finished the race off strongly.  Sent for sampling post-race.

The start was delayed when JUBILATION proved difficult to load into the starting gates.  Before being allowed to race again, JUBILATION will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Made contact with a rail on leaving the Parade Ring, examined by the Veterinary Officer on arrival at the Start and passed suitable to race.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly and then was bumped shortly after the start.

When questioned regarding the tactics adopted, K Teetan advised that his instructions were to hold a handy position in the early stages and if circumstances permitted to make a mid-race move entering the Back Straight.  He said whilst he was aware that the pace of the event was being run inside of standard, as his mount is one-paced and to comply with his instructions, he shifted out near the 1000 Metres to commence a forward move and eventually crossed to lead.  Trainer K H Ting confirmed the instructions issued and stated that they were issued on the basis that AI ONE had won when ridden in a similar manner on 3 May 2023.

Slow to begin.  Between the 250 Metres and the 100  Metres was held up for clear running before being shifted to the inside of ACT OF FAITH to secure a run.  Over the concluding stages raced tight to the inside of ACT OF FAITH which shifted in slightly.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Brushed the running rail after the 600 Metres.  Bumped on the hindquarters passing the 100 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly.  Near the 1200 Metres was steadied when momentarily crowded by AI ONE (K Teetan) which shifted in before being corrected by its rider.  K Teetan was advised to exercise more care.  Crowded passing the 100 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Passing the 100 Metres was checked when crowded between DARCI JOY (Apprentice Y L Chung) which shifted out and MANAGEMENT FOLKS which was taken in after being crowded by KASA PAPA (C L Chau).  Both Apprentice Chung and C L Chau were reprimanded and advised they must stop riding and straighten their mounts sooner than what they did on this occasion.  After the race, M L Yeung advised that from a wide barrier he was instructed to go forward on SUNNY BABY.  Trainer D A Hayes confirmed the instructions issued.

When questioned, Z Purton stated that his instructions were to settle where comfortable but had not anticipated leading tonight.  He said in the early stages KYRUS UNICORN raced keenly, refused to settle and as a result he was obliged to lead.  He added that when AI ONE improved forward and pressured his mount from the 800 Metres, he was obliged to make use of KYRUS UNICORN from that point and in the Home Straight it failed to respond to his riding and gave ground.  Trainer D J Hall confirmed that the instructions were not to lead tonight’s event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  The performance was considered to be disappointing as compared to its recent starts.  Before being allowed to race again, KYRUS UNICORN will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the race, B Avdulla stated that his mount travelled comfortably in the early and middle stages but came under pressure from the 600 Metres and raced "flat”. Assistant Trainer C K Tong agreed with the assessment of Jockey McDonald.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of mucus in the horse’s trachea.  The performance was considered to be disappointing as compared to its pervious race starts. He said entering the Home Straight MISSION BRAVO failed to respond to his riding and when he was concerned that there was something amiss with the horse, he did not ride it out over the final 100 Metres of the event when not in a competitive position.  Trainer M Newnham stated that the only explanation he could offer was that MISSION BRAVO may have been better suited by being placed under pressure sooner than it was in the event as it is somewhat one-paced and does not appreciate racing amongst other horses.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance was considered to be disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, MISSION BRAVO will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination. When questioned, C Y Ho stated that his instructions were to hold a forward position but not to make use of his mount to do so as at its last start YOUNG HORIZON had not finished the race off strongly when ridden in this manner.  He said in the early stages when positioned to the outside of SUPER LEGENDS, he elected not to ride his mount forward to cross that runner as he was mindful of his instructions.  He said he then endeavoured to obtain a position behind SUPER LEGENDS near the 1200 Metres, but when MR ALADDIN improved to his inside, he was then unable to shift in which resulted in YOUNG HORIZON being obliged to race wide and without cover for the remainder of the event. From the 550 Metres was held up for clear running and near the 450 Metres shifted to the outside of YOUNG HORIZON to secure clear running and in doing so bumped ENDEARED.  Apprentice Y L Chung (BEATO) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that after improving into a narrow run to the inside of SUPER LEGENDS passing the 250 Metres, he allowed his mount to shift out, resulting in SUPER LEGENDS being taken out across the running of YOUNG HORIZON, resulting in YOUNG HORIZON being unnecessarily crowded and steadied and YOUNG HORIZON then being taken out, causing SUNLIGHT POWER to be checked away from the heels of YOUNG HORIZON.  Apprentice Chung was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Wednesday, 6 December 2023 and to expire on Monday, 11 December 2023 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In addition, Apprentice Chung was fined $60,000.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Apprentice Y L Chung (MAJESTIC KNIGHT) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that over the concluding stages, whilst riding his mount out with the whip, he allowed his mount to shift out when not clear of HOWDEEPISYOURLOVE, resulting in HOWDEEPISYOURLOVE being checked away from the heels of MAJESTIC KNIGHT and being taken out and also resulting in WONDER KIT being checked when crowded between BUNDLE OF CHARM and HOWDEEPISYOURLOVE.  Taking into account his record, Apprentice Chung was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Tuesday, 26 December 2023 and to expire on Tuesday, 2 January 2024 on which day he may resume race riding (3 Hong Kong racedays).  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2.  In addition, in lieu of a fine and having regard to his inexperience as an apprentice, Apprentice Chung was directed to appear before the riding skills panel for remedial training under the provisions of Rule 12(46). L Ferraris stated that over the concluding stages he received a call from K Teetan, rider of LOOKING GREAT, which was positioned to his inside and for this reason he stopped riding and straightened his mount.  Whilst the Stewards were satisfied that the riding of L Ferraris, 6th placegetter, over the concluding stages did not affect the horse’s finishing position, he was nonetheless reminded of his obligation to ensure that he rides his mounts out fully to the finish of the race.  After the race, L Ferraris reported that with blinkers being applied tonight for the first time, he was instructed to take up a forward position but not necessarily race in the lead.  He said when caught wide in the early stages, he was obliged to allow HAMERON to stride forward to avoid covering additional ground.

No report.

Crowded shortly after the start.  When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight, L Hewitson stated that near the 200 Metres he commenced to obtain a narrow run between ALL FOR ST PAUL’S and BOURBONAIRE.  He said when BOURBONAIRE shifted in slightly, this resulted in RISING FROM ASHES being disappointed for this run and then being checked away from the heels of ALL FOR ST PAUL’S which was giving ground.  L Hewitson was advised to exercise more care and to ensure that there is comfortable racing room when he is endeavouring to improve.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer”.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Bumped shortly after the start.  When questioned regarding his riding on the Home Turn and the reason he elected to shift out, K C Leung stated that when he had identified HONG KONG HALL and ROUND THE GLOBE were under pressure, he elected to shift out to follow the favourite GORGEOUS WIN which was travelling well at that stage.  He added whilst he was aware there was room available to improve to the inside of that runner, he felt that STORM RIDER would be advantaged by obtaining clear running to the outside.  The Stewards found the tactics adopted were reasonable.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly and then was bumped shortly after the start.  Near the 900 Metres was steadied when crowded between STORM RIDER and HAPPY GOLF which shifted in and away from PATCH OF TIME after being taken in slightly by that runner.  In this incident, PATCH OF TIME was corrected by its rider C Soumillon.  Near the 250 Metres was hampered when crowded between HAPPY GOLF and PHOENIX LIGHT which was shifted to the outside of COPARTNER PRANCE to secure clear running.
SPICY GOLD, which was having its first race start, made the Home Turn awkwardly and raced greenly when placed under pressure in the Home Straight and over the concluding stages lay in.

On arrival at the Start, it was noted that PHOENIX LIGHT had lost its left front plate.  PHOENIX LIGHT was replated, examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Near the 300 Metres became held up on the heels of COPARTNER PRANCE and then was directed to the outside of that runner near the 250 Metres to secure clear running.

Noted to have sustained a small abrasion to the left front leg in the saddling stalls, examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Bumped shortly after the start.  Near the 350 Metres was checked when crowded between HAPPY GOLF which shifted in slightly when improving to the inside of STORM RIDER and LUCKY PLANET (K Teetan) which shifted out whilst being ridden along.  K Teetan was reprimanded.  When questioned regarding his riding, A Atzeni stated that from a wide barrier he was instructed to obtain cover but expected to settle behind midfield.  He said in the early stages FIGHTING MACHINE did not travel strongly but near the 500 Metres commenced to improve and for this reason he was reluctant to immediately shift FIGHTING MACHINE to the outside as it commenced to travel well.  He said as a result he allowed FIGHTING MACHINE to improve to the inside and near the 350 Metres was checked when crowded between LUCKY PLANET and HAPPY GOLF.  He added that after shifting to the inside of LUCKY PLANET, he then became held up on the heels of COPARTNER PRANCE near the 200 Metres when that runner gave ground.  He further stated that after being shifted to the outside of COPARTNER PRANCE near the 150 Metres, he then continued to experience some difficulty obtaining clear running behind PHOENIX LIGHT and did not obtain clear running until near the 50 Metres when positioned to the outside of LUCKY PLANET.  Trainer P C Ng confirmed the instructions were to ride the horse conservatively in the early stages from a wide barrier and also confirmed that he had not issued any specific instructions in relation to improving to the outside in the Home Straight.  Mr Ng stated that whilst FIGHTING MACHINE had difficulty obtaining clear running in the Home Straight, he was satisfied with the riding of Jockey Atzeni.  After considering his explanation, the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Atzeni were reasonable in the circumstances.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 450 Metres was hampered when momentarily crowded by STORM RIDER which shifted out. <11/12/2023 Additional Veterinary Reports> After the race, an endoscopic examination was conducted on HAPPY GOLF at the request of Trainer F C Lor. The Veterinary Surgeon reported that this examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea. Before being allowed to race again, HAPPY GOLF will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After being loaded into the starting gates became fractious, reared and struck its head. Acting on this advice, SUPERB BOY was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  A subsequent veterinary examination found the horse to have sustained a wound to the poll of the head. For some distance near the 550 Metres raced tight between FIVE G PATCH and ZEFFIRO which shifted to the outside of GERALDINA to improve.  After the 350 Metres was steadied and shifted to the inside of LEBENSSTIL to obtain clear running.

When questioned regarding his riding and the reason his mount raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event, A Badel stated that his instructions were to hold an on-pace position, preferably with cover but he was instructed not to take his mount back in the early stages.  He said after travelling a short distance he had expected WARM HEART to stride to the lead and cross LA CITY BLANCHE which would have allowed him to obtain a position one-off.  He said when WARM HEART remained racing to the outside of LA CITY BLANCHE, he then contemplated taking a trailing position behind LEBENSSTIL but was unable to do so due to the slow early pace.  He added whilst he contemplated making a forward move in the early stages, as WARM HEART was travelling better than his mount and FIVE G PATCH was not travelling strongly, he felt he would have had to make too much use of his mount to do so and in addition FIVE G PATCH is not a horse that would appreciate being ridden in this manner.

Near the 250 Metres JUNKO (M Guyon) shifted in, causing ZEFFIRO to be taken in and crowded the running of GERALDINA, resulting in GERALDINA (W Buick) then shifting in and away from that runner and crowding LA CITY BLANCHE which was checked.  M Guyon was reprimanded and advised that he should stop riding and straighten his mounts sooner than he did on this occasion as they shift ground when not clear.  W Buick was advised to exercise more care and to ensure that he makes sufficient effort to straighten his mounts when they shift ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned, J Moreira stated that LEBENSSTIL was able to obtain a favourable position behind WARM HEART in a slowly run event.  He said from the 600 Metres LEBENSSTIL came under pressure when positioned behind WARM HEART and for this reason he elected to shift to the outside of WARM HEART to endeavour to have LEBENSSTIL improve into the race.  He added that from that point LEBENSSTIL failed to respond to his riding, raced in a disappointing manner and he could offer no excuse for the horse’s poor performance.  Trainer H Tanaka could offer no explanation for the disappointing performance of the horse.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Mr Hall could offer no explanation for the horse’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of VAMOS was considered to be disappointing as compared to its previous starts.  Before being allowed to race again, VAMOS will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination. When questioned regarding his riding and the degree of vigour he used on the horse in the Home Straight, Z Purton stated that he was asked to ride ALL IS READY where comfortable and to ensure ALL IS READY was balanced up in the Home Straight before he placed it under full pressure and to limit his whip use as ALL IS READY appeared to resent the whip previously.  He stated that as a consequence in accordance with his instructions, after entering the Home Straight he ensured that ALL IS READY was balanced when it improved to the outside of BAEBAE TSOI.  He said near the 300 Metres ALL IS READY commenced to lay in and as he had his whip in his left hand and being mindful of his instructions, he continued to encourage ALL IS READY into the race under hands and heels riding.  He added that after the 300 Metres he was reluctant to pull his whip through to his right hand as ALL IS READY continued to lay in and after being hampered near the 150 Metres when APEX TOP shifted out, ALL IS READY did not finish the race off and gave ground thereafter.  Trainer M Newnham confirmed the instructions issued and stated that he had asked Jockey Purton to limit the whip use as at its previous race start on 3 December 2023, in his opinion, ALL IS READY may not have appreciated being struck with the whip in the Home Straight.  The Stewards advised Jockey Purton that, wherever possible, he should ensure that he places the appropriate degree of vigour on his mounts and utilise all available methods to encourage his mounts to finish in the best possible placing in the field.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
