From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned regarding his riding tactics and the reason he made a move near the 900 Metres to go forward which resulted in TURIN MASCOT racing wide and without cover for the remainder of the event, Z Purton stated that as TURIN MASCOT is one-paced, his usual instructions are, whenever possible, to make a forward move to offset the horse’s inability to quicken.  He said after entering the Back Straight he allowed TURIN MASCOT to stride forward, but his mount did not show sufficient pace to cross runners to his inside and as a result he was obliged to race wide and without cover for the remainder of the event.  He added that when caught wide, he felt it was in the best interests of TURIN MASCOT not to be made use of to cross runners to his inside as the horse had won when ridden in a similar manner last season.  Trainer P C Ng confirmed the instructions issued.  After considering his explanation, the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Purton were reasonable in the circumstances.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.
No report.

After the race, C Y Ho could offer no explanation for his mount’s disappointing performance.  Trainer C Fownes stated that after making a forward move near the 1200 Metres, PACKING HURRICANE may not have been suited by being pressured from the 800 Metres and as a result was left without a finishing effort.  He indicated that he will now send PACKING HURRICANE to Conghua for a let-up prior to its next race start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Approaching the 100 Metres was bumped by MASTER HERO which shifted out.  When questioned, J McDonald stated that from the inside barrier he was instructed to settle where comfortable but not to ride his mount along in the early stages as SUPER WISE DRAGON has been subject to a wind operation.  He said as a result after beginning only fairly and with the strong early pace, he was able to hold a midfield position throughout the early and middle stages.  When questioned regarding his riding on the Home Turn and the reason he shifted out to follow MASTER HERO rather than improving to the inside, J McDonald stated that due to the pace of the event being run inside of standard, he had expected the leaders to give ground and as a result he elected to shift out and follow MASTER HERO into the Home Straight as he felt MASTER HERO would provide him with a good trail into the race.  Trainer W Y So confirmed the instructions issued.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Prior to the declaration of weighed-in, the Stewards conducted an inquiry to ascertain whether MASTER OF FORTUNE had been denied a fair start.  After taking evidence from Z Purton and Mr A Speechley, Starter, the Stewards found that whilst being assisted by a starting gate handler MASTER OF FORTUNE reared simultaneously as the start was effected which resulted in MASTER OF FORTUNE losing significant ground.  As the Stewards were satisfied that MASTER OF FORTUNE had not been denied a fair start, weighed-in was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.  Before being allowed to race again, MASTER OF FORTUNE will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned regarding the tactics adopted, C L Chau stated that from the outside barrier he was given the instructions to endeavour to hold a midfield position preferably with cover.  He said on jumping CHILL CHIBI commenced well and in accordance with the manner he usually rides the horse from the barriers, he placed it under pressure for a short distance to ensure it held its position at the start.  He said when caught wide in the early stages and when the pace of the event was slow, he allowed CHILL CHIBI to stride forward and take up a position outside the early leader DROMBEG BANNER.  He added that when GALAXY WITNESS improved forward along the Back Straight, he was able to obtain a position with cover behind DROMBEG BANNER and making the Home Turn improved to the outside of DROMBEG BANNER to start his run.  He said when placed under pressure at this point CHILL CHIBI became one-paced and did not immediately respond to his riding which resulted in HAPPY TOGETHER improving around his mount and CHILL CHIBI then being placed in restricted room for a short distance near the 250 Metres when DROMBEG BANNER shifted out slightly and HAPPY TOGETHER shifted in.  He further stated that after shifting to the outside of HAPPY TOGETHER near the 150 Metres, CHILL CHIBI finished the race off reasonably well and, in his opinion, was looking for additional distance.  Assistant Trainer T H So confirmed the instructions were to endeavour to find a midfield position, but also confirmed if this was not available, the option to take up a more forward position was available to Jockey Chau.  The Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Chau, having regard to the early sectionals of the event, were reasonable in the circumstances.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced tight shortly after the start.

When questioned regarding the tactics adopted on DROMBEG BANNER and particularly the slow pace set throughout the early and middle stages, A Atzeni advised that he had expected to lead on DROMBEG BANNER and with this in mind, after commencing well, he was able to obtain the lead in the early stages.  He said from the 1200 Metres DROMBEG BANNER, which was having its first race start at Happy Valley, had some difficulty making the turns and for this reason approaching the 1000 Metres got its head up when he was obliged to place pressure on his right rein to make that turn.  He said after entering the Back Straight he allowed DROMBEG BANNER to race at a pace which was comfortable but was then taken on in the lead when GALAXY WITNESS improved forward near the 900 Metres.  When questioned if there was an opportunity to set a more even pace throughout the early and middle stages, A Atzeni stated that he felt his mount was racing at a comfortable pace, but agreed with the Stewards that in hindsight he should have allowed DROMBEG BANNER to set a more even pace through that section of the race so as to avoid another runner taking his mount on during the event.  Trainer P C Ng confirmed the instructions issued and expressed satisfaction with the tactics adopted by Jockey  Atzeni.  Mr Ng further stated that whilst he expected DROMBEG BANNER to  race in a more competitive manner, he was still satisfied with its performance tonight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages. Then did not obtain clear running until near the 100 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 1300 Metres, CHOICERUS, which was racing fiercely, got its head up and was checked when crowded between MASTER TORNADO and TACTICAL COMMAND (M L Yeung) which, after shifting in before being corrected by its rider, then raced tight to the inside of RED HARE KING (L Hewitson).  M L Yeung and L Hewitson were advised to exercise more care.  However, the Stewards found the racing manners of CHOICERUS were the main reason for the interference occurring.  CHOICERUS then continued to race fiercely throughout the early stages and refused to settle despite the efforts of its rider.  The racing manners of CHOICERUS were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, CHOICERUS will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial amongst other runners.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

He added, in his opinion, SUPERB CAPITALIST is better suited on firmer surfaces.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

M L Yeung (RUBY SAILING) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 250 Metres he directed his mount out when insufficiently clear of TOP PEAK, resulting in TOP PEAK being taken from its rightful running and being taken out, causing SECOND TO NONE, which was positioned to the outside of TOP PEAK, to be checked.  M L Yeung was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Thursday, 4 January 2024 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent race riding record.

When questioned regarding his riding rounding the Home Turn and in the early part of the Home Straight, A Atzeni stated that he was instructed to take up a midfield position with cover if possible and that to hold the horse up for a final run in the Home Straight as MAXIMIZE HEART only has a short sprint.  He said after settling back in the field when following the favourite in the event FIGHTING MACHINE, he was content to remain racing behind that runner approaching the Home Turn, but then elected to shift to its outside near the 500 Metres when FIGHTING MACHINE initially did not improve.  He added as a result he then became held up for clear running behind BEYOND TURBO before shifting to that runner’s inside approaching the 300 Metres whereby he secured clear running and MAXIMIZE HEART finished the race off well.  When questioned if there was an opportunity to shift to the outside on the Home Turn and provide his mount with a clear run sooner than what it had obtained, A Atzeni stated that bearing in mind his instructions, he felt it would be best to ride MAXIMIZE HEART between horses to save it up for a final run to the finish.  Trainer C H Yip confirmed the instructions issued.  The Stewards advised Jockey Atzeni that, in their opinion, he would have been better suited to shift to the outside and obtain the position that PERFETTO eventually took advantage of which would have provided MAXIMIZE HEART with clear and uninterrupted running sooner than what it received in this race.

At declaration time, L Hewitson was declared as the rider of both ISLAND GOLDEN and NATURAL GOLD.  It was established that L Hewitson had a firm commitment to ride ISLAND GOLDEN.  As such, the Stewards permitted L Ferraris to be substituted as the rider of NATURAL GOLD.  For this declaration error, Trainer D J Whyte was fined $2,000.
Jumped only fairly.

Before being allowed to race again, BEYOND TURBO will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

The performance of PRESIDENT’S CHOICE was considered to be disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, PRESIDENT’S CHOICE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination. <26/12/2023 Additional Veterinary Reports> PRESIDENT’S CHOICE, which performed disappointingly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings. PRESIDENT’S CHOICE was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer C W Chang last Sunday morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its right front leg. As previously advised, PRESIDENT’S CHOICE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination before being allowed to race again.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

The performance of EVERYONE’S DELIGHT, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, EVERYONE’S DELIGHT will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments. <26/12/2023 Additional Veterinary Reports> The Veterinary Surgeon reported that EVERYONE’S DELIGHT was lame in its right hind leg on the morning after racing. As previously advised, EVERYONE’S DELIGHT will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments before being allowed to race again.

When questioned regarding the horse settling at the rear of the field, C Y Ho stated that his instructions from the outside barrier were to endeavour to obtain a position preferably near midfield with cover.  He said when caught wide in the early stages and when MAGNIFICENT NINE held its position to his inside, he was obliged to come back and race behind that horse to avoid covering additional ground and as a result JOYFUL HUNTER settling further back than what he had intended.  He added JOYFUL HUNTER was momentarily held up on the Home Turn behind TRUE GENIUS before obtaining clear running entering the Home Straight.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly and then was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  The Stewards deferred the declaration of weighed-in following an incident that occurred inside the 100 Metres which cast doubt as to whether WOODFIRE BRO should be declared the second placegetter. The Stewards subsequently considered a protest/objection lodged by Z Purton, placed 3rd, against WOODFIRE BRO (M L Yeung), placed 2nd, alleging interference inside the final 100 Metres.  After considering the evidence and viewing the patrol films, the Stewards found that near the 100 Metres WOODFIRE BRO shifted out, resulting in FIVE G PATCH being checked when crowded between ENSUED and WOODFIRE BRO and losing significant ground.  As the Stewards were satisfied that had this interference not have occurred FIVE G PATCH would have finished ahead of WOODFIRE BRO, the protest/objection was sustained and the placings amended to read No. 10 ENSUED, 1st; No. 2, FIVE G PATCH, 2nd; No. 9, WOODFIRE BRO, 3rd; and No. 6, COLUMBUS COUNTY, 4th.  At a subsequent inquiry, M L Yeung was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 100 Metres he allowed his mount to shift out when insufficiently clear of FIVE G PATCH, resulting in FIVE G PATCH having to be checked when it lost its running and crowded between ENSUED and WOODFIRE BRO.  M L Yeung was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Sunday, 7 January 2024 and to expire on Thursday, 11 January 2024 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 3 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent race riding record.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Between the 400 Metres and the 350 Metres was held up for clear running behind BOURBONAIRE.  Sent for sampling post-race.

He said when caught wide in the early stages to the outside of WOODFIRE BRO, he was obliged to continue to allow AWESOME FLUKE to stride forward and race outside the lead to avoid covering additional ground.  He added when placed under pressure in the Home Straight AWESOME FLUKE did not respond to his riding and raced in a disappointing manner.  Trainer C Fownes confirmed the instructions issued.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of AWESOME FLUKE was considered to be disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, AWESOME FLUKE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Shortly after the start was steadied when crowded between ARMOUR WAR EAGLE and JOYFUL HUNTER which shifted in.  C Y Ho (JOYFUL HUNTER) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 150 Metres he permitted his mount to shift out when insufficiently clear of MAGNIFICENT NINE, resulting in MAGNIFICENT NINE being checked to avoid JOYFUL HUNTER.  C Y Ho was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Friday, 29 December 2023 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good race riding record.  When questioned regarding his riding of MAGNIFICENT NINE, Z Purton stated that from a wide barrier he was asked to ride MAGNIFICENT NINE in a conservative manner in the early stages to allow it to finish the race off strongly.  He said after complying with his instructions in the early stages, MAGNIFICENT NINE, which was racing in a hood for the first time, appeared to relax wearing that gear and as a result he was obliged to niggle at his mount in the early stages to maintain its position towards the rear of the field.  He added when under pressure in the Home Straight MAGNIFICENT NINE commenced to respond to his riding before receiving interference at the 150 Metres at which point the horse was not able to regain its momentum and finish the race off.  Trainer J Size confirmed the instructions issued and stated having regard to its trials on the All Weather Track he asked Jockey Purton to ride MAGNIFICENT NINE in a conservative manner in the early stages to enhance its chances to finish the race off.
After the race, K De Melo advised that he was instructed to go forward from a wide barrier.  Trainer J Richards confirmed the instructions issued.

Before being allowed to race again, LOOKING COOL will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the race, A Badel expressed concern with his mount’s action during the running of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race revealed that the horse was displaying an irregular heart rhythm and an endoscopic examination also showed a substantial amount of blood in its trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, IMPERIAL MAGEE will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

WIDE BLUE YONDER, Standby Declared Starter, was withdrawn on 25.12.23 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame left fore).  Before being allowed to race again, WIDE BLUE YONDER will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After being loaded became fractious in the barriers and then was slow to begin.  Had difficulty obtaining clear running for a short distance after passing the 400 Metres.
No report.

A little slow to begin and was then checked severely a short distance after the start when crowded for room between HERO MASTER which shifted out despite the efforts of its rider and CALIFORNIA TOUCH which was taken in by PACKING BOLE after both horses had made contact on the hindquarters.  When questioned, Z Purton stated that after suffering significant interference at the start, his mount lost considerable ground and given its best performances were over 1400 Metres when racing overseas, it then made up good ground inside the final 200 Metres once recovering from the interference early.
No report.

After the race, K Teetan reported that his mount travelled well in the early stages, but then failed to respond to his riding when placed under pressure inside the final 500 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, LUCKY GOR will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

The performance of PACKING BOLE was considered to be disappointing as compared to its previous race starts. When questioned regarding SPICY GOLD racing in a forward position, L Hewitson stated that from the outside barrier he was instructed to endeavour to hold a midfield position with cover.  He said after SPICY GOLD commenced well, he elected to ride his mount forward to take advantage of the good start and in an attempt to take up a position outside the lead, but when JOYFUL LIFE improved to his inside, he was unable to cross that runner and consequently was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  He added that as a result of the wide run, SPICY GOLD did not respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  He further stated that in retrospect his mount would have been better ridden in a more conservative manner in the early stages given the wide run that it endured.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Sent for sampling post-race.  A Badel pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference passing the 200 Metres (see RED LION).
In the middle stages got its head up and raced ungenerously.
Jumped only fairly.  Near the 150 Metres was crowded between REWARDING TOGETHER and CALIFORNIA SPANGLE which shifted out after being crowded by HEALTHY HAPPY.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.

Steadied when crowded passing the 200 Metres.  When questioned, H Bowman stated that whilst his mount was able to lead today’s event, it did not travel as strongly as what it had when he had ridden the horse at its previous race start on 15 October 2023.  He added when placed under pressure in the early part of the Home Straight CALIFORNIA SPANGLE lay in and near the 200 Metres was crowded for room by HEALTHY HAPPY and had this not have occurred, he felt CALIFORNIA SPANGLE would have finished closer to the placegetters than what it did.  H Bowman pleaded guilty of a breach of Rule 100(2) in that he failed to ride CALIFORNIA SPANGLE, 7th placegetter, out to the end of the race to the satisfaction of the Stewards.  For this breach of the Rule, H Bowman was fined a sum of $25,000.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

A Badel (HEALTHY HAPPY) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that passing the 200 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when insufficiently clear of CALIFORNIA SPANGLE, resulting in CALIFORNIA SPANGLE being taken in and crowded in onto RED LION, causing RED LION to lose its rightful running and be severely checked.  A Badel was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Saturday, 13 January 2024 and to expire on Thursday, 18 January 2024 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 3 and the consequences grade 3 and also considered his excellent race riding record.  When questioned regarding the performance of RED LION, K Teetan stated that after obtaining a tight run to the inside of CALIFORNIA SPANGLE approaching the 350 Metres, RED LION commenced to finish the race off reasonably well.  He said however when severely checked passing the 200 Metres his mount lost momentum and was unable to finish the race off from that point.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Slow to begin.  From the 400 Metres to the 300 Metres was held up for clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Leaving the 800 Metres was steadied away from MAJESTIC SPEED and then raced wide and without cover thereafter.  Lay in under pressure in the Home Straight and near the 250 Metres was corrected by its rider A Atzeni.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly, made contact with the right side of its barrier and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Lay in and away from SWEET ENCOUNTER near the 250 Metres.

Near the 250 Metres LOST CHILD shifted in and away from SWEET ENCOUNTER when taken in by SWEET ENCOUNTER (A Atzeni), resulting in HAPPY DAILY having to be steadied when crowded for room.  Whilst the Stewards accepted that A Atzeni had made some effort to straighten his mount, he was advised that in similar circumstances he would be expected to react sooner than he did on this occasion.
Slow to begin and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.

After the race, Z Purton reported that his mount was not suited by the middle stages of the event being run outside of standard time.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

Bumped at the start.  From the 400 Metres until the 100 Metres was badly held up for clear running.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.

Jumped awkwardly and then was bumped heavily by SAVVY CHIC which shifted in.  Near the 400 Metres was steadied to avoid the heels of HAPPY DAILY when that runner was not improving and then was unable to obtain clear running until near the 350 Metres.
Bumped at the start.
No report.
No report.

Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  Near the 300 Metres, when hanging in, was awkwardly placed close to the heels of KAHOLO ANGEL which shifted in slightly.  Continued to hang in for the remainder of the event when giving ground and proved difficult to ride out.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Crowded shortly after the start.  Near the 150 Metres lay in before being corrected by its rider K H Chan.  When questioned regarding the apparent improved performance of the horse, Trainer A S Cruz stated that this preparation, whilst the horse had not finished in placings, it had not been beaten too far from the placegetters.  He said after ATOMIC BEAUTY’s last start on 17 December 2023, he had noticed an improvement in the horse’s condition within the stable and this, together with the horse being suited racing at Happy Valley, were the explanations he could provide for the improved performance.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Whilst being ridden along near the 150 Metres shifted out under pressure before being corrected by its rider L Hewitson near the 100 Metres.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.
Bumped shortly after the start.  Near the 150 Metres raced in restricted room for a short distance between CONCERTO and SATIRICAL GLORY which shifted out.

Making the Home Turn was held up when disappointed for clear running between ATOMIC BEAUTY and CONCERTO which shifted to the outside of the weakening HO HO STAR.  Whilst the Stewards were satisfied that the riding of H Bowman, 7th placegetter, over the concluding stages did not affect the horse’s finishing position, he was nonetheless reminded of his obligation to ensure that he fully rides his mounts out to the finish of the race.
After the race, A Badel reported that his mount would be  better suited over 1200 Metres.

Near the 400 Metres was held up behind HO HO STAR which was giving ground and was shifted to that runner’s outside shortly after to continue to improve.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the race, K De Melo reported that after beginning only fairly, his mount failed to show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position and raced in a disappointing manner.  Trainer P C Ng stated that HAPPY ANGEL had pleased him since its last start on 13 December 2023 and was disadvantaged by not showing its usual early pace.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of HAPPY ANGEL was considered to be disappointing as compared to its recent starts.  Before being allowed to race again, HAPPY ANGEL will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race. <1/1/2024 Additional Veterinary Reports>HAPPY ANGEL, which performed disappointingly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings.  HAPPY ANGEL was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer P C Ng last Saturday morning.  He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its left front leg.  As previously advised, HAPPY ANGEL will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination before being allowed to race again.

Jumped only fairly, was bumped shortly after the start and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 300 Metres M Chadwick dropped his whip.  After the race, M Chadwick reported that in the early part of the Home Straight his mount hung out and proved difficult to place under pressure.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the race, A Atzeni stated that from the outside barrier he rode the horse forward to take up a position outside the lead.  He added that, in his opinion, HO HO STAR did not run out the 1650 Metres of tonight’s event and gave ground quickly when placed under pressure from near the 500 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of HO HO STAR, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, HO HO STAR will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

The performance of ACE TALENT, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, ACE TALENT will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.

When questioned, H Bentley stated that he felt his saddle slipped back slightly as the start was effected and near the 1000 Metres SPICY SO SMART commenced to buck, became badly unbalanced and was eased out of the event.  As SPICY SO SMART has offended previously in a similar manner, Trainer P C Ng was advised that it will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a series of consecutive barrier trials utilising raceday gear and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  He was further advised that SPICY SO SMART must be ridden by a senior jockey.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings. <5/1/2024 Additional Veterinary Reports> SPICY SO SMART, which commenced to buck near the 1000 Metres, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings. SPICY SO SMART was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer P C Ng this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its right front leg. As previously advised, SPICY SO SMART will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a series of consecutive barrier trials utilising raceday gear and be subjected to an official veterinary examination before being allowed to race again.

After the race, K De Melo reported that it was not the pre-race intention to take up a forward position, however, his mount jumped well and for that reason he made the decision to go forward.  Trainer W Y So was satisfied with the tactics adopted given the circumstances that unfolded early in the race.

Before being allowed to race again, CALL ME TEDDY will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination. <27/12/2023 Additional Veterinary Reports>CALL ME TEDDY, which performed poorly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings. Sent for sampling post-race.

As the start was being effected lunged forward and made heavy contact with the starting gate, opening its gate slightly prior to the remaining starting gates opening and BEAUTY FIT becoming unbalanced.  As the Stewards were satisfied that BEAUTY FIT had not gained any advantage from such occurrence, weighed-in was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

In the middle stages raced keenly.  From the 400 Metres was held up for clear running when endeavouring to obtain a narrow run between GREEN N WHITE and SOLID IMPACT and near the 300 Metres shifted out and made contact with SOLID IMPACT.

Due to the slow pace in the middle stages commenced to race keenly leaving the 900 Metres and for some distance thereafter was steadied away from SWEET BRIAR.  When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight, K C Leung stated that after being held up behind SWEET BRIAR, he then shifted to that horse’s outside leaving the 400 Metres in an attempt to secure clear running.  He said when a run between SOLID IMPACT and FASHION LEGEND did not develop, he continued to remain held up for clear running behind SOLID IMPACT.  He added near the 250 Metres he then shifted to the inside of SOLID IMPACT in an attempt to secure clear running, but when AMAZING VICTORY did not quicken to take advantage of a run between SOLID IMPACT and SWEET BRIAR, he then continued to be held up for clear running, particularly when SWEET BRIAR shifted out under pressure.  He further stated that near the 150 Metres he directed his mount to the inside of SWEET BRIAR and BEAUTY FIT where he secured clear running approaching the 100 Metres and AMAZING VICTORY finished the race off strongly.  The Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Leung were reasonable in the circumstances.

When questioned regarding his riding of BLUE MARLIN, K Teetan stated that from the outside barrier he was instructed to attempt to obtain a midfield position with cover.  He said in the early stages, when caught wide, he elected to restrain BLUE MARLIN in an attempt to obtain cover behind FASHION LEGEND, but due to the pace of the event in the middle stages being run outside of standard, it took some time for BLUE MARLIN to respond to his efforts to be positioned behind FASHION LEGEND in order to comply with his instructions.  He added when CALIFORNIA VOCE held its position to his inside, he was unable to obtain cover behind FASHION LEGEND until near the 650 Metres and in the Home Straight BLUE MARLIN found the line reasonably well.  K Teetan added that whilst the opportunity was available for him to take up a more forward position, he felt had he had done so, this would have been in contrast to the instructions that he had been issued.  Trainer D J Whyte confirmed the instructions issued.

When questioned regarding the performance of GREEN N WHITE, Z Purton stated that his mount, which was racing after a break of almost eight weeks, did not finish the race off strongly over the concluding stages and, in his opinion, would derive benefit from today’s performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 1500 Metres improved to the inside of DRAGON STAR (K Teetan) as that runner was being shifted in, resulting in SURE JOYFUL being steadied away from DRAGON STAR. Near the 550 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from FORTUNE PRESIDENT.  The Stewards considered a protest/objection lodged by C L Chau, the rider of 4th placegetter, KASA PAPA, against AMAZING BOY being declared 3rd placegetter alleging interference near the 200 Metres.  After considering the evidence and viewing the patrol films, the Stewards found that near the 250 Metres AMAZING BOY shifted to the inside of DRAGON STAR when clear of KASA PAPA to secure clear running which left a tight run for KASA PAPA to improve into, resulting in KASA PAPA then racing in restricted room to the inside of AMAZING BOY and being struck across the nose by the whip of K C Leung (AMAZING BOY) near the 150 Metres.  As the Stewards were satisfied that AMAZING BOY was clear to shift in near the 250 Metres and that KASA PAPA improved into the tight run, the protest/objection was overruled and weighed-in was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.

Approaching the 300 Metres was awkwardly placed on the heels of SERGEANT PEPPER which shifted out and away from HARMONY FIRE.  When questioned regarding his riding, B Avdulla stated that he had expected to hold the lead, but in the early stages when SERGEANT PEPPER and HARMONY FIRE held their positions to his inside, he was caught wide and without cover.  He added from the 800 Metres he was reluctant to ride KOWLOON EAST STAR forward, particularly when he felt SERGEANT PEPPER would cross HARMONY FIRE which would provide KOWLOON EAST STAR a position one-off.  He said when SERGEANT PEPPER remained racing to the outside of HARMONY FIRE, KOWLOON EAST STAR was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  He further stated that his mount was not travelling well enough to ride forward and cross SERGEANT PEPPER and as a result remained racing three deep.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned regarding his riding, C L Chau stated that his instructions were, if possible, to hold a forward position with cover but was also given the option, if necessary, to come back in the early stages in order to avoid racing wide.  He said whilst SON PAK FU commenced well, when MAJESTIC STAR and WINNING ICEY also held their positions to his inside, he elected to come back behind those runners to obtain cover as he felt if he remained to the outside of WINNING ICEY, he would have been obliged to race wide and potentially without cover.  He added that in the middle stages when positioned at the rear of the field, he was obliged to make use of SON PAK FU to maintain contact with the field and when he observed NORDIC DRAGON commence to improve to the outside from the 500 Metres, he shifted out shortly after to follow that runner into the event.  He further stated that after securing clear running after the 300 Metres SON PAK FU finished the race off well.  After considering his explanations, the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Chau throughout the event were reasonable in the circumstances.  Trainer T P Yung confirmed the instructions issued.  Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned regarding his riding, H Bentley stated that from a wide barrier he was asked to ride the horse in a midfield position preferably with cover.  He said after jumping reasonably well, he looked to obtain cover in the early stages behind PATCH OF THETA, but when he was concerned that that runner would obtain a position closer to the rail, he then looked to obtain cover behind PATCH OF KINGDOM so as to avoid potentially racing wide and without cover.  He said when positioned behind PATCH OF KINGDOM near the 900 Metres, he then was concerned that PATCH OF KINGDOM would shift in and obtain a trailing position behind PATCH OF THETA and for this reason he then contemplated taking up a position behind AMAZINGTEAMWORK when that runner held a position three wide.  He added that when PATCH OF KINGDOM did not obtain a position closer to the rail, he was then left racing to the outside of AMAZINGTEAMWORK and consequently his mount settled further back than what he had intended.  H Bentley agreed with the Stewards that in hindsight he should have made more effort to maintain his position behind PATCH OF THETA and prevented PATCH OF KINGDOM crossing his mount which would have allowed him to take up a midfield position with cover.  H Bentley stated that when placed under pressure in the Home Straight SKY HEART responded well to his riding and over the final 200 Metres lay in and proved somewhat difficult to ride out to the finish of the event.   Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Crowded on jumping.
Bumped at the start.

When questioned regarding his riding, M Chadwick stated that the instructions were if his mount commenced well, to take up a forward position, but not to make too much use of his mount to do so and was given the option to endeavour to take cover behind midfield if unable to go forward.  He said after LOYAL BO BO commenced reasonably well, he assessed the runners positioned to his inside and when HONG KONG HALL went forward, he contemplated following that runner across.  He added that when LOYAL BO BO did not show sufficient pace to do so, he then elected to endeavour to obtain a position behind PATCH OF THETA, however, when PATCH OF KINGDOM then improved to his inside, he was left racing wide and without cover.  He further stated that from the 900 Metres when BOWSER went forward, he contemplated allowing LOYAL BO BO to improve to cross PATCH OF THETA, but when PATCH OF THETA was travelling well, he elected to remain four wide without cover where his mount was travelling comfortably.  After considering his explanations, the Stewards advised Jockey Chadwick that his ride in the early stages lacked initiative in that he did not make any decisive decision to endeavour to race closer to the rail.  Trainer F C Lor confirmed the instructions issued.

In the early stages raced keenly when being steadied to obtain cover.  Near the 800 Metres was then steadied to avoid the heels of BOWSER (A Atzeni) which shifted in when not clear.  A Atzeni was advised to exercise more care.  C L Chau pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 200 Metres (see BOWSER).

After the 200 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running between PATCH OF THETA which shifted in slightly and HIGH PERCENTAGE which shifted out under pressure.  Then had difficulty obtaining clear running over the final 200 Metres.
Jumped only fairly.

C L Chau (HIGH PERCENTAGE) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 200 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when insufficiently clear of BOWSER, resulting in BOWSER having to be checked.  C L Chau was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Sunday, 21 January 2024 and to expire on Thursday, 25 January 2024 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his good race riding record.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Leaving the 300 Metres became held up for clear running behind BOWSER and was unable to secure clear running until near the 200 Metres.

Withdrawn prior to the race by order of the Stewards when unable to be bridled.  Trainer M Newnham was advised that before being allowed to race again, WINDCHEATER will be subjected to a parade test where it will be required to have the bridle fitted once in the parade.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly, shifted out and was bumped.

Became fractious in the Parade Ring and made contact with a partition.  Examined by the Veterinary Officer on arrival at the Start who said after the necessary consultations the horse was suitable to race.

Bumped at the start.  From the 450 Metres was held up for clear running and near the 350 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running between TAKE ACTION and ENNEA FORTUNE and was then shifted back to the inside of ENNEA FORTUNE to secure clear running.

Bumped at the start.  After the race, an endoscopic examination was conducted on ENNEA FORTUNE at the request of Trainer C H Yip.  The Veterinary Surgeon said this examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, ENNEA FORTUNE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Near the 300 Metres improved into a tight run between CALIFORNIATOTALITY and GALLANT GOODY which shifted out slightly, resulting in SOLID SHALAA then racing in restricted room until near the 250 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped on jumping.  After the 400 Metres was held up for clear running and near the 300 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running between TAKE ACTION and GALLANT GOODY.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Shortly after the start was bumped and became unbalanced.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Raced keenly in the early stages when being restrained to obtain cover.
Jumped only fairly.
Jumped awkwardly and then in the early stages over-raced.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the race, C L Chau stated that he was asked to take up a forward position from the inside barrier, but not necessarily lead.  He said after commencing well he was able to lead without having to pressure his mount to do so.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the race, Trainer C Fownes confirmed that with the horse stepping up in distance today and with its light weight, he had instructed Jockey K De Melo to endeavour to take up a more forward position.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Near the 400 Metres was shifted to the inside of READY PLAYER ONE to secure clear running and as a result made contact with JUBILATION for some distance near the 350 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.  Near the 350 Metres was bumped for some distance.
Jumped awkwardly, shifted out and bumped JUBILATION.  Approaching the 1000 Metres made contact with the running rail.
Jumped awkwardly.  Approaching the 400 Metres was taken out.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.
No report.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Approaching the 400 Metres was steadied away from DARCI JOY when that runner was taken out slightly by ROMANTIC FANTASY.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Kicked a rail when proceeding to the Start, examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Jumped only fairly.
No report.

After the race, C Y Ho stated that he was able to take up a forward position, but, in his opinion, READY PLAYER ONE appreciates racing on tracks that have more give than today’s surface.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of mucus in the horse’s trachea.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly and then shortly after the start was bumped by BRAVE WITNESS which shifted out despite the efforts of its rider.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Bumped at the start.  H Bowman was questioned regarding his riding out of COLOURFUL PRINCE over the concluding stages.   He stated that after riding his mount vigorously with the whip, when the winner FAST BUCK improved to his outside, he continued to apply the whip until the final two strides whereby he then continued to ride his mount with his right arm to the finish of the event.  When questioned if the degree of vigour he used over the final stride had decreased, H Bowman stated that whilst he did not apply the whip, he continued to encourage COLOURFUL PRINCE to the finish of the event.  After considering his explanations, the Stewards were satisfied that H Bowman had fulfilled his obligations under the Rules, however, he was advised he must ensure that he rides his mounts out using an unquestionable degree of vigour to the finish of every race where circumstances allow.
No report.
Hung out on the Home Turn.
Crowded shortly after the start.

Near the 300 Metres shifted in slightly and was awkwardly placed behind REGENT GLORY.  When being corrected by its rider, BRAVE WITNESS then became unbalanced when it shifted back out and had to be corrected by its rider L Hewitson.
Bumped at the start.

After the race, Apprentice E C W Wong reported that his mount found it difficult to finish the race off due to the early stages being run inside of standard time.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  After the race, M Chadwick reported that his mount, which was having its first race start on the All Weather Track, did not appreciate racing on the surface.
Crowded shortly after the start.  Near the 200 Metres was steadied away from TELECOM SPEED which shifted out slightly when giving ground.

Shortly after the start was checked when crowded between PANDA LEGEND and PATCH OF WATCH which was taken out by DAILY TROPHY which shifted out despite the efforts of its rider A Badel.  After the race, H Bentley reported that his mount failed to travel well after receiving interference in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 800 Metres was steadied away from VICTOR THE WINNER (H Bowman) which shifted out when not quite clear.  H Bowman was advised to exercise more care.  For some distance after the 800 Metres was buffeted for room between DUKE WAI (K Teetan) which shifted in after being crossed by VICTOR THE WINNER and FLYING ACE which raced tight to the outside of SEASONS WIT which in turn was positioned to the outside of WE ARE HERO when that runner was also tight to the outside of INVINCIBLE SAGE (A Badel).  Both K Teetan and A Badel were advised to exercise more care in similar circumstances.
Bumped at the start.  Near the 700 Metres was steadied.

Leaving the 800 Metres was steadied to avoid VICTOR THE WINNER (H Bowman) which shifted out when not clear.  H Bowman was reprimanded.  A short distance later was again steadied and shifted in to avoid the heels of VICTOR THE WINNER.
No report.

When questioned regarding the performance, H Bowman stated that with VICTOR THE WINNER dropping back in distance from the 1200 Metres to 1000 Metres, he was obliged to make some use of his mount to hold the lead in the early stages whereby VICTOR THE WINNER raced at its top for some distance thereafter.  He said as a consequence when asked for an effort over the final 400 Metres VICTOR THE WINNER responded only moderately to his riding and weakened from the 100 Metres.  He added that whilst VICTOR THE WINNER was carrying the top weight of 135 lbs, he felt that the tempo of the event was the principal reason for VICTOR THE WINNER not being able to sustain a finishing effort.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly.  For some distance after the 800 Metres was bumped by FLYING ACE.
For some distance after the 800 Metres became unbalanced when buffeted for room.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Withdrawn on 6.1.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame left fore).  Before being allowed to race again, KURPANY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Jumped only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
A Badel was fined the sum of $7,500 for using the whip on numerous occasions forward of the saddle in the Home Straight.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Between the 250 Metres and the 100 Metres raced tight to the inside of GOOD BUDDY.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.

After the 500 Metres shifted to the outside of GOOD BUDDY to improve and made contact with SELF IMPROVEMENT.  Near the 300 Metres became unbalanced when crowded for room between SELF IMPROVEMENT and MONTA FRUTTA (M Chadwick) which shifted to the outside of GOOD BUDDY to obtain clear running.  M Chadwick was reprimanded.  Noted to have bled from both nostrils after the race.  Before being allowed to race again, CALL ME DANDY will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.  Approaching the winning post was steadied away from SELF IMPROVEMENT which shifted out and away from CALL ME DANDY.

Made contact with a rail whilst parading behind the barriers and examined by the Veterinary Officer who said after the necessary consultations the horse was suitable to race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Jumped awkwardly.  After the race, M F Poon reported that his mount, when caught wide in the early stages, lay out on the first turn and remained racing wide and without cover thereafter.  The performance of THE GREAT MASTER, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, THE GREAT MASTER will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.   A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Crowded shortly after the start.
No report.

Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  When questioned regarding MASTER OF FORTUNE racing in a more forward position, C Y Ho stated that he was expected to race in a midfield position, but in the early stages when positioned to the outside of WINNER METHOD, he was obliged to make use of his mount to cross that runner to avoid racing wide and, with blinkers applied for the first time today, MASTER OF FORTUNE raced more forward than intended.  When questioned regarding the tactics adopted on MASTER OF FORTUNE and the reason he shifted to the rail near the 600 Metres, C Y Ho stated that after following SOLAR PARTNER and having E LEGEND positioned to his outside, when he was concerned that those two runners would not provide him with a trail into the race, he elected to shift to the inside to follow SUPERB BOY.  He added that whilst he was aware that E LEGEND had raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event, he felt that by shifting to the inside would provide his mount with a  better opportunity to obtain uninterrupted running on the Home Turn.
Near the 600 Metres was steadied to avoid MASTER OF FORTUNE (C Y Ho) which shifted in when not clear.  C Y Ho was reprimanded.
No report.
Bumped at the start.
Crowded on jumping.

Bumped at the start and became unbalanced and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Raced keenly in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped awkwardly and then raced keenly in the early stages.  After the race, A Atzeni stated that from a wide barrier he was instructed to ride his mount conservatively in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped at the start.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

SURUGA BAY, Standby Declared Starter, was withdrawn on 6.1.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (inappetence).  Before being allowed to race again, SURUGA BAY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Jumped only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Severely checked at the start when crowded between GOODMANSHIP and HAPPY HORSE which was taken out by FINGERS CROSSED when that runner shifted out despite the efforts of its rider.  After the race, L Hewitson stated that the intention was to settle in a more forward position, but after having to severely check his mount at the start settled further back than intended.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

In the early part of the Home Straight lay in.  When questioned regarding his riding from the 600 Metres and the reason his mount lost its position behind the leaders, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that when MODEST GENTLEMAN improved to his inside and shifted out slightly, MULTIMORE had a tendency to lay out and as a result he was cautious not to allow his mount to shift out.  He said as a consequence he did not ride MULTIMORE along through that section of the race to ensure his mount maintained its position on the track which resulted in MULTIMORE losing some ground after the 500 Metres.  After the race, the Veterinary Surgeon reported that MULTIMORE had an epiglottic entrapment.  Apprentice E C W Wong pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 50 Metres (see GOODMANSHIP).
Crowded on jumping.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.

Bumped heavily on the hindquarters on jumping and became unbalanced.  Apprentice E C W Wong (MULTIMORE) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 50 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of GOODMANSHIP, resulting in GOODMANSHIP having to be checked.  Apprentice Wong was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 17 January 2024 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good race riding record.   K Teetan, the rider of 7th placegetter, GOODMANSHIP, was reminded of his obligation to ensure he rides his mounts out to the finish of the race.  However, the Stewards elected not to take any action against Jockey Teetan due to the interference suffered by GOODMANSHIP near the 50 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
From the 650 Metres raced wide and without cover.

Near the 350 Metres DOUBLE WIN made the turn awkwardly and shifted out, resulting in SUPER BABY shifting out and away from that runner, taking AFFIRM out towards RED HARE KING which was hampered and shifted out away from AFFIRM.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 300 Metres was steadied away from RED HARE KING and shifted to that runner’s inside to secure clear running.
Shifted out and was bumped on jumping.  Shifted out and away from DOUBLE WIN near the 350 Metres.
Slow to begin and then was crowded by RED HARE KING which shifted out despite the efforts of its rider.  Raced keenly in the early stages.

After the race, an endoscopic examination was conducted on DOUBLE WIN at the request of Trainer T P Yung.  The Veterinary Surgeon said this examination showed a substantial amount of mucus in the horse’s trachea.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Bumped at the start.  After the race, H Bowman stated that his mount came under pressure in the middle stages and as a result he was obliged to ride it along from the 600 Metres.  He added TOTAL POWER failed to respond to his riding and raced in a disappointing manner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped awkwardly.  Taken wider near the 350 Metres.  After the race, M F Poon stated that whilst he was able to hold a forward position, his mount was not advantaged compared to its last start as the early stages of the event were run quicker than at its last race start.  He added after being wide making the Home Turn his mount did not finish the race off thereafter.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Jumped awkwardly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 1050 Metres became unbalanced when it shifted in and away from KING INVINCIBLE and was positioned close to the running rail.  In the Home Straight lay in and proved difficult to ride out.  Near the 100 Metres shifted in and away from SUPER ELITE, resulting in its rider B Avdulla having to stop riding and straighten his mount which resulted in GALLANT VALOUR not being able to be fully ridden out to the finish of the event.
No report.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Over the concluding stages was steadied away from GALLANT VALOUR.
No report.
Jumped awkwardly and then was bumped shortly after the start.  Over the concluding stages raced tight to the inside of GOLD TACK and could not be ridden out to the finish.
Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.
Jumped awkwardly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.
Jumped only fairly.  Briefly held up near the 300 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight, Apprentice Y L Chung stated that after leading the event, he rode SUPERB CAPITALIST vigorously hands and heels to the finish, however, did not utilise the whip as he had been instructed not to do so by Trainer A S Cruz.  Mr Cruz confirmed the instructions issued.
No report.
Bumped at the start.

After the race, B Avdulla stated that when caught wide in the early stages he was obliged to shift across behind runners to avoid racing wide and as a consequence settled slightly further back than he had intended.
Jumped awkwardly and from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Shortly after the start was crowded for room.
Near the 900 Metres was steadied away from heels, was bumped and became unbalanced.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have sustained a minor laceration to the left hind pastern.

Near the 900 Metres ATOMIC FORCE shifted out when being steadied away from CHAMPION METHOD and as a result made contact with EXCELLENT FIGHTER which became unbalanced.  After the race, A Atzeni stated that EXCELLENT FIGHTER was disadvantaged by being obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event and as a consequence gave ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Making the turn near the 350 Metres hung out and was steadied away from SWORD POINT.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Crowded shortly after the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly and was bumped.
Jumped only fairly.

Despite being ridden along in the early stages failed to show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position.  After the 1500 Metres raced tight to the inside of ENCOUNTERED.  Approaching the 1200 Metres, when racing keenly, was steadied away from the heels of ENCOUNTERED which shifted in.
No report.

Passing the 1500 Metres was steadied away from SWORD POINT when that runner was steadied to obtain cover behind MONEY CATCHER.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Crowded shortly after the start.

Bumped at the start.  When questioned regarding his riding and the reason he made a forward move from the 750 Metres when positioned behind NIMBLE NIMBUS, M Chadwick stated that after following NIMBLE NIMBUS in the early and middle stages, he felt NIMBLE NIMBUS gave ground slightly on the leader TELECOM FIGHTERS and as MONEY CATCHER is one-paced, he elected to shift out and commenced to improve into the event.  He added from that point MONEY CATCHER was obliged to race wide and without cover and finished the race off only fairly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned, H Bowman stated that after following MONEY CATCHER, when that runner improved from the 750 Metres, SWORD POINT then was positioned to the inside of MONEY CATCHER which was racing three wide.  He stated that his intention was to endeavour to follow MONEY CATCHER from the 500 Metres, however, SWORD POINT lay in and when positioned to the inside of MONEY CATCHER was unable to shift out.  He added as a result he then continued to follow NIMBLE NIMBUS and from the 350 Metres endeavoured to shift to the outside of NIMBLE NIMBUS to secure clear running, however, SWORD POINT hung in and he was unable to shift to the outside of that runner.  He further stated that near the 200 Metres he was held up for clear running behind TELECOM FIGHTERS whereby SWORD POINT lost momentum and did not finish the race off from that point.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the race, K De Melo reported that his mount made an abnormal breathing noise during the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 150 Metres was bumped by ONE HEART ONE.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 150 Metres was bumped by MEDIC ELITE.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly and then was crowded shortly after.  In the early stages raced keenly.  Had difficulty obtaining clear running near the 250 Metres when positioned behind JOYFUL CHAMPION.  Approaching the 200 Metres was crowded for room between ONE HEART ONE (L Hewitson) and JOYFUL CHAMPION (M F Poon), both of which shifted ground.  A short distance later then shifted in and away from ONE HEART ONE slightly, made contact with JOYFUL CHAMPION and became badly unbalanced.  L Hewitson and M F Poon were both advised to exercise more care.
Jumped awkwardly and was bumped.  Near the 150 Metres was bumped and became unbalanced.

Bumped shortly after the start.  Bumped TACTICAL COMMAND near the 1500 Metres.  Near the 350 Metres was checked when crowded between MEDIC ELITE and HAPPY JAI JAI which was taken out by ONE HEART ONE (L Hewitson).  L Hewitson was severely reprimanded.

For some distance near the 150 Metres again had difficulty obtaining clear running when positioned behind JOYFUL CHAMPION.

Made contact with a  rail on entering the track, examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  When caught wide without cover in the early stages was allowed to stride forward leaving the 1100 Metres to hold a position in the lead.  After the race, Apprentice Y L Chung stated that when caught wide in the early stages he was obliged to make use of his mount to go forward and then when MISTER ARM held its position to his inside along the Back Straight, he was obliged to make additional use of REGENCY HAPPY STAR and as a result it was left without a finishing effort.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 1200 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from CORDYCEPS ONE. A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of HAPPY JAI JAI was considered to be disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, HAPPY JAI JAI will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the 400 Metres was shifted to the outside of TACTICAL COMMAND to continue into clear running.

From the 400 Metres until approaching the 150 Metres was held up for clear running where it shifted to the inside of DRAGON DELIGHT to secure clear running.

H T Mo (DASHING GLORY) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 250 Metres he permitted his mount to shift out when insufficiently clear of BRILLIANT PIONEER, resulting in BRILLIANT PIONEER losing its rightful running and being checked.  H T Mo was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 24 January 2024 at Sha Tin. Near the 1000 Metres was steadied to avoid RUBY SAILING (H Bowman) which shifted in when not quite clear.  H Bowman was advised to exercise more care.  In the early and middle stages raced keenly.  In the Home Straight lay in and proved difficult to ride out.
Crowded near the 200 Metres.

After being loaded into the starting gates got its left hind leg momentarily caught on the running board.  Removed from the barriers, examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Jumped only fairly and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  In the middle stages raced keenly.  Near the 200 Metres was checked when crowded between FUNG and GUSTY FIGHTER (A Atzeni) which, when laying in, shifted in and away from MUST GO before then racing tight to the inside of MUST GO which shifted in when being corrected by its rider Z Purton.  A Atzeni was advised to exercise more care and make a greater effort to prevent his mounts from shifting ground.  However, the Stewards found that the racing manners of GUSTY FIGHTER and MUST GO were the principal reason for the interference occurring.  In this incident, FLYING ROMANTIC struck the heels of GUSTY FIGHTER and blundered.

Near the 900 Metres was steadied when crowded for room.  When questioned, Z Purton stated that his instructions were to take up a forward position, but his mount raced greenly throughout the event.  He said making the Home Turn MUST GO, which had a tendency to lay in from the 600 Metres, then shifted out and made the turn wider when he pulled the whip through to his right hand.  He added in the Home Straight MUST GO continued to race greenly and lay out on entering the Home Straight which resulted in him pulling the whip through to his left hand to correct his mount, but then when under pressure, MUST GO hung in and proved difficult to ride out to the finish of the event before giving ground over the concluding stages.  Trainer J Size confirmed the instructions were to take up a more forward position and was of the view that MUST GO may not have appreciated the addition of a hood today.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly and then was crowded shortly after the start.  After the race, K Teetan reported that his mount failed to respond to his riding when placed under pressure in the early part of the Home Straight and he did not ride it out to the finish when not in a competitive position.  He added that when returning to the unsaddling area SIGHT HERO fell over before regaining to its feet shortly after.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of SIGHT HERO was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, SIGHT HERO will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly and then was crowded shortly after the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly and blundered shortly after the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Passing the 400 Metres blundered.
Jumped awkwardly.  For some distance near the 350 Metres was held up behind CHILLI BABA.  Over the final 200 Metres lay in.

Was contacted on the rump by DEEP PURSUIT when that runner was fractious in the barriers.  Removed from the barriers, examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race. Before being allowed to race again, RED ELEGANCE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Before being allowed to race again, METRO WARRIOR will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Before being allowed to race again, DEEP PURSUIT will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

H Bowman (HELIOS EXPRESS) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that approaching the 250 Metres he allowed his mount to shift to the outside of FLAMING RABBIT when insufficiently clear of BEAUTY LIVE, resulting in BEAUTY LIVE being awkwardly placed on the heels of HELIOS EXPRESS and having to be steadied to avoid the heels of HELIOS EXPRESS.  H Bowman was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 17 January 2024 at Happy Valley.  In addition, Jockey Bowman was fined $55,000.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 1 and also considered his neutral race riding record.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

He added after settling towards the rear of the field, ERNEST FEELING did not travel strongly and as a result he was obliged to ride his mount along throughout the early and middle stages to maintain his position at the tail of the field which he attributed to the stronger pace set in tonight’s race as compared to its most previous start when it was able to lead from the inside barrier.  He further stated that when placed under pressure in the Home Straight ERNEST FEELING responded well to his riding and finished the race off strongly.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 700 Metres was eased when tightened for room by SPEEDY FORTUNE which was laying out and was also taken out by HAYDAY which was inconvenienced when having to avoid the heels of SUPER COMMANDER.  Near the 500 Metres was checked severely when again crowded for room by SPEEDY FORTUNE which continued to lay out away from HAYDAY which shifted out slightly.  Whilst the degree of interference suffered by PANDA was significant, the Stewards were satisfied that the main contributing factor to these incidents was the racing manners of SPEEDY FORTUNE and that no rider error was involved, therefore no further action was taken.  Held up for clear running over the final 150 Metres and near the 100 Metres was checked severely when disappointed for a clear run between SUPER AXIOM and SUPER COMMANDER.  In this incident, SUPER AXIOM was also checked severely when weakening.  K Teetan was reprimanded that whilst he may have been in an awkward position on the heels of SUPER COMMANDER, it is an offence under the Rules when endeavouring to obtain clear running where there is insufficient room.
No report.

Blundered on jumping and then was checked and became very unbalanced when being bumped by SUPER COMMANDER which shifted out before being straightened by its rider.  As a result of this incident, H Bentley lost the use of his left stirrup iron before regathering it near the 900 Metres.  Noted to have lost its right front plate after the race.

He added that rounding the Home Turn and in the early part of the Home Straight he was unable to place his mount under pressure when held up for clear running until passing the 300 Metres.

An inquiry was conducted into the reason for LUCKY ETERNITY making heavy contact with BEATO (Z Purton) for some distance between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres.  H Bowman stated that near the 450 Metres when his mount was travelling strongly, he observed BEATO to his outside, which had been obliged to race wide and without cover, not travelling, in his opinion, strongly and as a result he endeavoured to obtain a run between BEATO and JOYFUL PROSPERITY.  He said when BEATO held its ground, he made heavy contact with that runner for some distance thereafter and approaching the 300 Metres desisted from attempting to obtain this run and shifted to the inside whereby LUCKY ETERNITY secured clear running approaching the 150 Metres.  The Stewards were satisfied that in this incident BEATO had shifted in principally due to the contact from LUCKY ETERNITY and Jockey Purton was riding competitively to hold his position to the outside of LUCKY ETERNITY.
Jumped awkwardly, shifted out and made contact with BEATO.  In the early and middle stages raced keenly due to the slow pace.  Noted to have lost its right hind plate after the race.

The Stewards tonight inquired into the circumstances regarding the inadvertent treatment of TOP TOP TEA which was withdrawn from this race on 16.1.24 by order of the Stewards.  Evidence was taken from Mr C H Yip, the trainer of TOP TOP TEA, Mr M H Chan, assistant trainer, and Mr C L Yip, head lad allocated to Mr Yip’s stable.  It was ascertained that TOP TOP TEA was inadvertently treated with an anti-ulcer medication and as that treatment was inside the recommended withdrawal period for the medication, the Stewards acceded to a request from Mr C H Yip for the horse to be withdrawn.  It was subsequently ascertained that Mr C L Yip inadvertently treated TOP TOP TEA despite there being a number of measures in place to ensure that the horse was not treated given that it had been declared to race.  Mr C H Yip was fined the sum of $20,000 after pleading guilty to a breach of Rule 51 as he failed to fulfil his responsibility under the Rules by allowing TOP TOP TEA to be treated in contravention of the recognized withholding period for the anti-ulcer medication.  Before being allowed to race again, TOP TOP TEA will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

A Atzeni (DROMBEG BANNER) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 850 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when insufficiently clear of FLAMING RABBIT, resulting in FLAMING RABBIT having to be checked.  A Atzeni was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 7 February 2024 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent race riding record. The Stewards deferred the declaration of weighed-in whilst they considered if GLOBAL HARMONY had been afforded a fair start.  On the evidence, it was established that as the start was effected, GLOBAL HARMONY stood in the barriers and refused to jump.  As the Stewards formed the opinion that GLOBAL HARMONY had not had an unfair start, the horse was declared a runner.  Before being allowed to race again, GLOBAL HARMONY will be required to perform satisfactorily in a series of consecutive barrier trials.
