When questioned, Z Purton stated that his instructions were to be positive from a wide barrier and in the early stages was crowded by SAMARKAND which shifted in.  He said he was then able to obtain a handy position in the early stages behind WINNING STEPS.  He added when the pace of the race increased in the middle stages when HARRY’S HERO went forward, KIMBERLEY was shuffled further back in the field where it continued to follow WINNING STEPS.  He said from near the 600 Metres his intention was to attempt to follow WINNING STEPS into the event, however, when that runner quickened better than his mount, he was unable to continue to follow WINNING STEPS due to his mount becoming one-paced at that point before finishing the race off fairly in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

H Bowman (LUCKY BANNER) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 1500 Metres he made insufficient effort to prevent his mount from shifting in, resulting in LEGION OF MERIT and WINNING SEVEN being badly crowded for room and LEGION OF MERIT also having to be checked when it lost its running.  H Bowman was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Thursday, 15 February 2024 and to expire on Monday, 19 February 2024 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 1 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his poor race riding record.  In addition, Jockey Bowman was fined $30,000. Jumped awkwardly and shifted out.  The Stewards opened an inquiry into the reason for ROMANTIC CHARM falling near the 450 Metres, resulting in C Y Ho being dislodged.  After taking evidence from M F Poon, the rider of ABSOLUTE SUNSHINE, the inquiry was adjourned so that Jockey Ho, who had been transported to hospital for medical assessment, could be interviewed.  After the race, the Veterinary Officer reported that as a consequence of the fall ROMANTIC CHARM was lame in its right front and right hind legs.  Before being allowed to race again, ROMANTIC CHARM will be subjected to an official veterinary examination. <7/2/2024 Adjourned Inquiry – 24 January 2024 Sha Tin Racemeeting – Race 8 (368)> The Stewards tonight resumed an inquiry, which was opened on 24 January 2024, into the reason for ROMANTIC CHARM (C Y Ho) falling near the 450 Metres, resulting in Jockey Ho being dislodged. Further evidence was taken from M F Poon (ABSOLUTE SUNSHINE) and evidence was taken from C Y Ho. M F Poon was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 450 Metres, whilst riding his mount along, he allowed ABSOLUTE SUNSHINE to shift out, resulting in ABSOLUTE SUNSHINE making contact with ROMANTIC CHARM and as a result of that contact, ROMANTIC CHARM fell and dislodged its rider, C Y Ho. M F Poon was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Sunday, 25 February 2024 and to expire on Monday, 11 March 2024 on which day he may resume race riding (5 Hong Kong racedays). In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 5 and also considered his excellent race riding record.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Checked near the 300 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.  Near the 100 Metres made contact with SMART BEAUTY which shifted out slightly.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Raced wide and without cover in the middle stages.  At the winning post SMART BEAUTY shifted in and brushed CHARMANDER.  When questioned, Z Purton stated that Trainer J Richards had asked him to hold a more forward position on his mount today to encourage it to race in a more competitive manner.  Mr Richards confirmed the instructions and said he issued such instructions on the basis that CHARMANDER had performed well in a barrier trial on 19 January 2024 when ridden in a forward position.

When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight, M F Poon stated that his mount hung in and proved difficult to ride out.  He said near the 250 Metres when BROTHER PEARL improved to his outside, ARTHUR’S KINGDOM continued to hang in and then became awkwardly placed on the heels of DIAMOND DIAMOND near the 150 Metres where he was obliged to check away from the heels of that runner.  He added that near the 100 Metres he was able to secure clear running between BROTHER PEARL and DIAMOND DIAMOND where his mount finished the race off reasonably well.

He said whilst he observed FASTPASS and STAR OF GLORY were in advance of him, he elected to shift his mount out with a view to following ONE HEART ONE into the event as he felt it was a fancied runner that would provide him with a trail into the race.  He said when ONE HEART ONE almost fell approaching the 300 Metres, he was obliged to steady away from that runner’s heels and shift to the inside to continue into clear running.  He added near the 50 Metres he was briefly held up when he shifted to the inside of STAR OF GLORY to secure clear running after which STARSHIP EIGHTY continued to finish the race off well.

Jumped only fairly and then was crowded shortly after the start.  H Bowman pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 300 Metres he permitted his mount to shift out when positioned too close to the heels of CHARMANDER, resulting in ONE HEART ONE striking the heels of CHARMANDER, blundering and almost falling and H Bowman being dislodged and resulting in SMART BEAUTY and BRILLIANT PIONEER, which were following, being checked and STARSHIP EIGHTY, which was positioned to the inside of ONE HEART ONE, being steadied to avoid that horse.  H Bowman was suspended from riding in races for three Hong Kong racedays and was fined a sum of $60,000.  The Stewards determined that the racemeetings upon which Jockey Bowman will serve this suspension will not be finalised until the conclusion of an appeal to be conducted in relation to a careless riding charge from Wednesday, 24 January 2024.  H Bowman was subsequently examined by the Chief Medical Officer and passed fit to fulfil his remaining race riding engagements  .After the race, it was reported that ONE HEART ONE had sustained injuries to both front legs.  Samples were taken from the horse.

In the early stages raced keenly and near the 900 Metres shifted out when being steadied away from WELLINGTON.

When questioned, Z Purton stated that it was his intention to hold a forward position and although his mount commenced reasonably well, it failed to show the early pace despite his efforts to ride his mount along.  He said as a result LUCKY SWEYNESSE was obliged to settle in a position behind midfield where it followed PACKING TREADMILL.  He said due to the early pace of the event being run outside of standard, LUCKY SWEYNESSE commenced to race keenly near the 1000 Metres and as a result he was checked to avoid PACKING TREADMILL near the 900 Metres, shifted out and made contact with WELLINGTON.  He added that his intention was to continue to follow PACKING TREADMILL, but due to the pace of the event in the middle stages remaining outside of standard, he was positioned inside the heels of PACKING TREADMILL and although his preference was to endeavour to shift out and follow WELLINGTON, he was unable to do so as LUCKY SWEYNESSE had improved inside PACKING TREADMILL.  He further stated that as a result he was obliged to make a run to the inside in the Home Straight when LUCKY SWEYNESSE had some difficulty securing clear running near the 300 Metres before he was able to place his mount under full pressure until approaching the 50 Metres where he was obliged to shift to the inside of SON PAK FU to continue into clear running.  Trainer K L Man confirmed the intention was to hold a more forward position and was unable to offer an explanation as to why LUCKY SWEYNESSE did not show more pace in the early stages. He added LUCKY SWEYNESSE had pleased the stable in the lead up to today’s event and particularly had barrier trialed well on 9 January 2024.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race. <29/1/2024 Additional Veterinary Reports>LUCKY SWEYNESSE, which performed disappointingly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings. LUCKY SWEYNESSE was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer K L Man this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its right front leg. Before being allowed to race again, LUCKY SWEYNESSE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

An inquiry was opened into the reason for C L Chau being dislodged from FAST AS ROCKET approaching the 1000 Metres.  After taking evidence from C L Chau and H Bowman, the rider of TELECOM SPEED, the Stewards found that near the 1000 Metres FAST AS ROCKET shifted out across the heels of TELECOM SPEED, resulting in FAST AS ROCKET striking the heels of that runner, blundering and C L Chau being dislodged.  The Stewards determined that the racing manners of FAST AS ROCKET were the reason for it striking the heels and blundering.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  The Stewards ruled that FAST AS ROCKET will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial around a bend in Hong Kong and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  C L Chau was subsequently examined by the Chief Medical Officer and passed fit to fulfil his remaining race riding engagements.

When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight and the reason he did not improve into a run between AORAKI SUMMIT and SWEET BRIAR, K C Leung stated that after following BEAUTY FIT, he improved to that runner’s outside approaching the 400 Metres.  He said near the 400 Metres AORAKI SUMMIT and SWEET BRIAR both shifted slightly and when he felt that the run was going to close, he elected to shift to the outside of SWEET BRIAR to follow the favourite GREEN N WHITE into the event.  He added that after obtaining a position behind GREEN N WHITE near the 300 Metres, he then was unable to improve from the 200 Metres until the finish of the event when held up between GREEN N WHITE and SINBA which shifted in slightly.  After considering his explanations, Jockey Leung agreed with the Stewards in that he had made an error of judgement in shifting too quickly to the outside of SWEET BRIAR as the run had always remained open between SWEET BRIAR and AORAKI SUMMIT and he would have obtained clear running had he persevered for this run.   Whilst the Stewards elected not to take any action against Jockey Leung when they were satisfied that both SWEET BRIAR and AORAKI SUMMIT had shifted slightly near the 400 Metres, he was told he would be expected to ride his mounts with better judgement than what he did on this occasion.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped shortly after the start.  Approaching the 500 Metres lay in before being corrected by its rider H Bowman.  Sent for sampling post-race.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  When questioned, Apprentice Y L Chung stated that when being placed under pressure near the 200 Metres, he dropped his left rein for a number of strides which he attributed to some moisture being present on his reins.  Apprentice Chung was advised that he must, wherever possible, maintain control of his reins to allow him to continue to ride his mounts out without having to regather his reins.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.

Bumped shortly after the start.  After the 200 Metres was held up for clear running between HERCULES and DOUBLE SHOW which shifted out slightly.  After the race, an endoscopic examination was conducted on H Z TOURBILLON at the request of Trainer T P Yung.  The Veterinary Surgeon said this examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, H Z TOURBILLON will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Approaching the 100 Metres was awkwardly placed close to NOIR RIDER and at the same point, its rider, M Chadwick, had his whip entangled in his reins as he endeavoured to pull it through to his right hand.
From the 350 Metres until the 200 Metres was held up for clear running.

Shortly after the start became unbalanced when it bumped with ISLAND SURPRISE.  When questioned, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that he was instructed to hold a midfield position.  He said when caught wide in the early stages and as his mount was travelling well, he elected to allow TIMESTORM to stride forward and lead to avoid covering additional ground.  Trainer D J Hall confirmed the instructions issued.
Jumped only fairly and shortly after the start was bumped heavily by TIMESTORM, resulting in BAYVIEW STAR becoming unbalanced and losing ground.

After the race, K C Leung reported that after travelling satisfactorily in the early stages in a forward position, his mount failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped shortly after the start.  Raced keenly in the middle stages and was obliged to race wide and without cover from the 700 Metres.  After the race, A Atzeni stated that, in his opinion, MODEST GENTLEMAN would be better suited over a distance of 1000 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of MODEST GENTLEMAN was considered to be disappointing as compared to its last start win.  Before being allowed to race again, MODEST GENTLEMAN will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Jumped awkwardly.  Near the 100 Metres shifted in before being corrected by its rider M F Poon.  Then shifted out and made contact with HARMONY FIRE.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Was bumped by CIRCUIT SEVEN inside the 50 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Near the 100 Metres raced tight to the inside of CIRCUIT SEVEN as that runner shifted in when improving to the inside of HARMONY FIRE.

Over the concluding stages raced tight between OVERSUBSCRIBED and HARMONY FIRE which shifted out after being bumped by CIRCUIT SEVEN and as a result could not be ridden out to the finish of the event.
At the 300 Metres shifted out and made contact with SCOTCH TYCOON.
Crowded for room shortly after the start.  In the early stages raced keenly.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Jumped only fairly and then was crowded shortly after the start.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 750 Metres commenced to race keenly when steadied away from LIFE IS GOOD, shifted out and made contact with SCOTCH TYCOON near the 650 Metres.  Near the 450 Metres was bumped and became unbalanced.  After the race, L Hewitson reported that from the 500 Metres his mount was bumped on a number of occasions when racing tight between LIFE IS GOOD and SCOTCH TYCOON and as a consequence did not finish the race off as expected.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

In the early part of the Home Straight lay in behind OVERSUBSCRIBED and proved reluctant to shift to that runner’s outside.  Continued to lay in for the remainder of the event.  After the race, M Chadwick reported that his mount over-raced  throughout the event and refused to settle.  He said for some distance in the middle stages his mount got its head up when being steadied away from OVERSUBSCRIBED.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Crowded shortly after the start.  Near the 650 Metres was checked away from BEAUTY DESTINY.  Near the 450 Metres was steadied away from SAVVY DELIGHT, shifted out and made contact with SUPER FAST DRAGON.  After the race, Apprentice Y L Chung reported that his mount raced keenly throughout the event and refused to settle.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Was bumped at the start and then raced tight to the inside of HARMONY FIRE (H Bowman).  H Bowman was advised to exercise more care.  Was bumped near the 650 Metres.  Leaving the 450 Metres was bumped and taken wider.  Bumped at the 300 Metres.

Bumped on jumping.  Lay in over the final 150 Metres and was corrected by its rider H Bowman near the 50 Metres.  Leaving the 100 Metres H Bowman’s whip was knocked from his grasp by the whip of M F Poon, the rider of ISLAND BRIGHT.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the race, M L Yeung reported that he was instructed to ride his mount conservatively in the early stages, but ALLOY  KING jumped well and he elected then to allow it to stride forward and lead.  Trainer K H Ting confirmed the instructions issued.  Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned regarding his riding from the 500 Metres and as to whether there was an opportunity to be positioned closer to the leader ALLOY KING, A Hamelin stated that his instructions were to hold a midfield position, but in the early stages he was obliged to make some use of COUNTRY DANCER to cross runners to his inside to avoid racing wide.  He said as a result COUNTRY DANCER settled in a more forward position than what he had been instructed.  He added with this in mind, in the middle stages, he allowed COUNTRY DANCER to race where comfortable and although there was an opportunity to improve to be closer to ALLOY KING, he was reluctant to do so bearing in mind his instructions.  He said from the 500 Metres he felt ALLOY KING, which he had ridden at its previous two race starts and was up in grade on this occasion, would not improve as it entered the Home Straight and for this reason he remained racing some distance away from ALLOY KING to provide him with the opportunity to shift out if necessary.  He further stated when ALLOY KING then improved from the 400 Metres, he commenced to ride his mount along to improve to the inside of ISLAND BRIGHT whereby COUNTRY DANCER obtained clear running soon after entering the Home Straight.  After considering his explanations, the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Hamelin were reasonable in the circumstances.

When questioned, K Teetan stated that from a wide barrier he was given the option to go forward if his mount commenced well, but also he was instructed that if his mount did not commence well enough to go forward, to come back and find cover.  He said after KING ECCELLENTE jumped awkwardly, he elected to shift his mount across behind runners in the early stages.  He said after the 300 Metres when following TALENTS SUPREMO, he felt that runner was going to shift to the inside of HIGH RISE SOLDIER and as a result he elected to come to the outside of TALENTS SUPREMO to secure clear running.  He added that as he commenced to shift out TALENTS SUPREMO then shifted out in advance of him which resulted in KING ECCELLENTE having to be shifted out between the 250 Metres and the 150 Metres to secure clear running to the outside of GREAT ACHIEVER.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight, B Avdulla stated that when positioned behind HIGH RISE SOLDIER, he was reluctant to improve to that runner’s inside as he felt that ISLAND BRIGHT would give ground, resulting in his mount being held up.  He said as a result he elected to shift to the outside of HIGH RISE SOLDIER and HAPPY GOLF where he secured clear running at the 200 Metres and his mount finished the race off reasonably well.  Noted to have lost its left front plate after the race.
No report.
Over the concluding stages raced tight between ISLAND BRIGHT and TALENTS SUPREMO.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

From the 900 Metres commenced to race keenly and got its head up and for some distance near the 800 Metres was steadied away from HIGH RISE SOLDIER.  Was then left racing wide and without cover from the 700 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

Jumped only fairly.  Approaching the 1000 Metres, when racing keenly, was steadied when racing tight to the inside of GREAT ACHIEVER which shifted in despite the efforts of its rider C L Chau.  After the race, Z Purton reported that throughout the early and middle stages LUCKY SYMPHONY over-raced badly, refused to settle and as a consequence did not finish the race off.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The racing manners of LUCKY SYMPHONY were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, LUCKY SYMPHONY will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial around a bend in Hong Kong.

Prior to declaring weighed-in, the Stewards considered whether E UNIVERSE had been afforded a fair start as it failed to jump with the field.  After viewing the videos and considering the evidence, the Stewards found that E UNIVERSE, whilst being fractious in the gates, refused to jump and took no part in the race, however, had not been denied a fair start and therefore was declared a runner.  Trainer K L Man was advised that E UNIVERSE will be required to perform satisfactorily in a series of consecutive barrier trials before its next race start.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.
Shortly after the start shifted out and away from GRATEFUL HEART before being corrected by its rider.
No report.
No report.
Near the 150 Metres obtained a tight run to the inside of ONE FOR ALL and as a result raced in restricted room for some distance.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

After the race, H Bowman stated that his mount was obliged to race three wide throughout the event and as a consequence did not finish the race off.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the race, L Hewitson reported that his mount made a respiratory noise during the running of the event and gave ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the race, Z Purton reported that his mount made a respiratory noise during the running of the event and gave ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of CELESTIAL COLOURS was considered to be disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, CELESTIAL COLOURS will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned, Apprentice Y L Chung stated that he was unable to cross ONE FOR ALL and CELESTIAL COLOURS in the early stages which resulted in SUPERB CAPITALIST racing wide and without cover.  He said throughout the event SUPERB CAPITALIST raced keenly and hung out and as a result made the Home Turn wide.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The racing manners of SUPERB CAPITALIST were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, SUPERB CAPITALIST will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial around a bend in Hong Kong and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
From the 800 Metres was left racing wide and without cover.
Raced wide and without cover in the early stages and was allowed to stride forward where it obtain a position outside the lead after the 1000 Metres.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
After the race, K De Melo reported that in the Home Straight his mount hung in and proved difficult to ride out to the finish of the event.

Slow to begin and then was crowded by SIMPLY MAVERICK which shifted out.  After the race, C L Chau reported that after being held up for some distance near the 400 Metres GALLANT WAKING found it difficult to make up ground in the Home Straight due to carrying the top weight in the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the race, H Bowman reported that when caught wide in the early stages he was obliged to shift across behind runners to avoid racing wide and settled further back than intended.  He added with the pace of the middle stages being run outside of standard, LEAN HERO was unable to make up ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

Slow to begin.  Raced keenly in the early stages.  The performance of MAJESTIC SPEED, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, MAJESTIC SPEED will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After arriving at the Start, THESIS was inspected at the request of Jockey A Badel and was found to be lame in the left front leg.  Acting on veterinary advice that the horse was not suitable to race, THESIS was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  Before being allowed to race again, THESIS will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Was obliged to race wide and without cover for the  majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, FINGERS CROSSED will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

J McDonald was advised to exercise more care.  Near the 1600 Metres was then eased to allow SWAN BAY and ESCAPE ROUTE to cross.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Close to the winning post the whip of J Kah was knocked from her grasp by the whip of Apprentice E C W Wong, the rider of WAR OF COURAGE.  Whilst the Stewards were satisfied that the riding of J Kah, 6th placegetter, over the concluding stages did not affect the horse’s finishing position, she was nonetheless reminded of her obligation to ensure that she fully rides her mounts out to the finish of the race.

After the 200 Metres raced in restricted room between CLUB SODA and AMAZING RUN.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 1300 Metres was steadied away from ATOMIC BEAUTY (H Bentley) which shifted in when not clear.  H Bentley was advised to exercise more care.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 1300 Metres was bumped when PRINCE ALEX shifted out and then raced keenly in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Approaching the 700 Metres improved to the inside of TO INFINITY where there was doubtful room and then became unbalanced when crowded by TO INFINITY which shifted in slightly.  A Atzeni was advised to exercise care and to ensure that there is sufficient room when improving into similar runs in future.

Approaching the 300 Metres had some difficulty obtaining clear running when being shifted to the outside of SURE JOYFUL.

Leaving the 350 Metres was bumped by PRINCE ALEX.  After the race, Z Purton stated that his mount was able to obtain a favourable position in the event, but failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight and was somewhat disappointing.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  The performance of TURIN WARRIOR was considered to be disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, TURIN WARRIOR will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination. After the race, L Ferraris reported that his mount was able to lead comfortably, but failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight and was disappointing.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Bumped at the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 250 Metres became unbalanced after making contact with JOYFUL CHAMPION when held up for clear running between JOYFUL CHAMPION and GOLDEN FAIRY.  Then raced tight to the inside of GOLDEN FAIRY until near the 100 Metres.

Shifted out at the start, was bumped and became unbalanced.  Near the 250 Metres was bumped on a number of occasions and became unbalanced.  After the race, L Hewitson reported that, in his opinion, his mount did not run out the 2200 Metres of tonight’s event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
After the race, M L Yeung reported that after making contact with DIAMOND WINNER on the Home Turn, GREEN LASER did not finish the race off from that point.

After the race, Z Purton reported that his mount raced keenly in the lead.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Before being allowed to race again, M M NEBULA will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Z Purton pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference approaching the 200 Metres (see SPEED DRAGON).  Sent for sampling post-race.

Slow to begin.  After making contact with HOWDEEPISYOURLOVE near the 500 Metres, STAR MAC was then shifted to the inside of BEAUTY CRESCENT to continue into clear running.  Near the 50 Metres was shifted to the inside of HELENE FEELING to continue into clear running.

Slow to begin.  After the 400 Metres was disappointed for clear running between HELIOS EXPRESS and HELENE FEELING.  Z Purton (HELENE FEELING) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that  approaching the 200 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when insufficiently clear of SPEED DRAGON, resulting in SPEED DRAGON losing its rightful running between CHANCHENG GLORY and HELENE FEELING and having to be checked.  Z Purton was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 21 February 2024 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent race riding record.
Over-raced in the early and middle stages.
No report.

Jumped only fairly.  After the race, M L Yeung reported that, in his view, FALLON would be advantaged by being stepped up in distance for its next start as his mount was one-paced to the line.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 500 Metres was bumped by STAR MAC which shifted out to improve.  When questioned, J McDonald stated that the instructions from the outside barrier were to ride his mount in a conservative manner to allow HOWDEEPISYOURLOVE to run out the 1600 Metres and also to ensure that it settled.  He said whilst there was an option to take up a position in advance of FALLON in the early stages, he would have had to make some use of HOWDEEPISYOURLOVE to do so and for this reason he elected to come back to remain racing outside of FALLON and behind STAR MAC.  He added throughout the early and middle stages HOWDEEPISYOURLOVE raced too keenly and refused to settle and although taken wider by FALLON near the 800 Metres, the manner in which his mount raced throughout the early and middle stages resulted in it not running out the 1600 Metres of today’s event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Near the 1200 Metres raced keenly and got its head up when being steadied away from FANTASTIC TREASURE.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Passing the 100 Metres raced tight between FANTASTIC TREASURE and SUPER SUNNY SING.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Badly crowded at the start by SWORD POINT which shifted in.  Between the 400 Metres and the 200 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when being shifted to the outside of NIMBLE NIMBUS.
Over the concluding stages was steadied when crowded by NIMBLE NIMBUS (A Atzeni) which shifted in.  A Atzeni was reprimanded.

Between the 400 Metres and the 50 Metres was badly held up for clear running until it shifted to the inside of CHAMPION DRAGON at the 50 Metres to secure clear running.

Jumped awkwardly and then made contact with MONEY CATCHER. In this incident, FIVE G PATCH was then taken in by FANTASTIC TREASURE which raced tight to the inside of LA CITY BLANCHE which shifted in and away from NIMBLE NIMBUS (A Atzeni) which also shifted in.  A Atzeni was advised to exercise more care.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Whilst proceeding to the Start, A Atzeni was dislodged from his mount without incident.  HOSS was quickly recaptured, examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the race, H Bowman stated that in the early stages he had some concern with his mount’s action when it was racing on the wrong lead leg.  He said in the Home Straight VIVA CHALEUR  balanced up, but failed to finish the race off.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Made contact with its barrier on jumping.  Making the turn near the 1000 Metres commenced to race ungenerously for a short distance when positioned to the inside of VIVA CHALEUR.  After the race, A Badel reported that his mount, which was having its first race start at Happy Valley tonight, raced greenly throughout the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shortly after the start was bumped by ARMOUR EAGLE, became unbalanced, shifted in and made contact with BRAVE STAR.  After the race, A Hamelin reported that with the strong early pace and his mount being up in grade this evening, it was under pressure to maintain its position outside the leader BEAUTY WAVES and gave ground under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Near the 700 Metres raced ungenerously when positioned to the inside of HAPPY FOR ALL.  Lay in in the early part of the Home Straight.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned, Z Purton stated that from a wide barrier he was instructed by Trainer J Size to ride the horse preferably midfield with cover but given the option of racing further back if required to obtain cover.  He said although TOP SCORER commenced well today and it would have been open to him to go forward, given the specific instructions issued, he elected to come back in order to find cover and ride in accordance with his instructions.  He said in the early stages when positioned to the outside and behind HAPPY FOR ALL, he was of the view that HAPPY FOR ALL would obtain a position with cover behind CORDYCEPS ONE and for this reason he elected to come back and race behind ONLY U to avoid being caught wide and without cover.  He said after obtaining a trailing position behind ONLY U near the 1000 Metres, TOP SCORER travelled reasonably well.  He added from the 600 Metres when the pace of the race quickened he commenced to encourage TOP SCORER to go forward, but his mount became one-paced for some distance thereafter and after shifting to the outside of ONLY U at the entrance to the Home Straight ran home strongly.  Mr Size confirmed the instructions were to endeavour to hold a midfield position with cover but also said that Jockey Purton was given the option to settle further back if he was not able to obtain a midfield position with cover.  He said the instructions issued to Jockey Purton today were due to TOP SCORER not beginning well at its only two previous race starts and felt that, given the wide draw today, such instructions would provide TOP SCORER with the best opportunity to finish the race off.  After considering the evidence of Jockey Purton and Trainer Size, the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Purton in the circumstances were reasonable.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  From the 300 Metres until inside the 200 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.
Slow to begin.

H Bowman pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 250 Metres (see PHILOS).

No report.

Jumped awkwardly.  H Bowman (LESS IS MORE) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 250 Metres he permitted his mount to shift in when there was insufficient room to do so, resulting in PHILOS being bumped and then crowded for room and ultimately losing its rightful running between LESS IS MORE and VALIANT ELEGANCE and being checked.  H Bowman was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Wednesday, 13 March 2024 and to expire on Thursday, 21 March 2024 on which day he may resume race riding (3 Hong Kong racedays).  In addition, Jockey Bowman was fined $120,000.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very poor race riding record.

Bumped at the start.  Shortly after the start was steadied when crowded between LUCKY CHARM and GANGNAM STAR which shifted in before being corrected by its rider.  After the race, A Atzeni reported that his mount, which was having its first race start, was unable to obtain a position closer to the stand rail and raced greenly throughout the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of mucus in the horse’s trachea.

After the race, A Badel reported that he was asked to ride his mount where comfortable and was able to lead in the early stages without having to pressure ROMANTIC FANTASY to do so.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 300 Metres lay in and shifted in abruptly, resulting in its rider Z Purton having to correct his mount.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Near the 300 Metres was steadied away from SHARPEN BRIGHT which shifted in abruptly when being corrected by its rider Z Purton.
No report.

Jumped awkwardly and then was crowded shortly after the start.  Leaving the 1400 Metres was steadied when racing tight to the inside of SHARPEN BRIGHT which lay in.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Slow to begin.  When questioned regarding his riding from the 800 Metres, K De Melo stated that he was given the option if the pace of the event allowed him to do so, he should commence a forward move in the Back Straight as the horse often does.  He said he was also given the option if he was able to obtain a trail behind another runner to improve into the race, he should take advantage of that.  He said from the 800 Metres he commenced a forward move and shifted to the outside of SERANGOON.  He further stated that leaving the 700 Metres SERANGOON then shifted out and, bearing in mind his instructions, he looked to obtain a trailing position behind that runner.  He stated when SERANGOON did not continue forward, this resulted in WONDER YEARS being caught wide at which point he recommenced riding his mount along near the 500 Metres after which WONDER YEARS hung out and did not run on in the Home Straight.  Trainer D J Whyte confirmed the instructions issued and in particular stated that Jockey De Melo was asked to obtain a trailing position into the Home Straight if possible.  Mr Whyte further added that, in his opinion, WONDER YEARS may not have appreciated backing up within 10 days from its previous race start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Withdrawn on 6.2.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame right hind).  Before being allowed to race again, MR ALADDIN will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Held up for a short distance on the Home Turn.  Sent for sampling post-race.

He said as a result he was unable to take up a forward position as instructed.

After the race, B Avdulla reported that it was not his intention to lead, but from a favourable barrier when his mount commenced reasonably well, DAILY TROPHY was able to lead the event.  However, B Avdulla could offer no explanation for DAILY TROPHY weakening in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of mucus in the horse’s trachea.  The performance of DAILY TROPHY was considered to be disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, DAILY TROPHY will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination. On arrival at the Start, M L Yeung expressed concern with his mount’s action.  MERCHANT PRINCE was examined by the Veterinary Officer who, after the necessary consultations, said the horse was suitable to race.  When questioned, M L Yeung stated that from an inside barrier he was asked to ride MERCHANT PRINCE in a forward position and as a result after jumping awkwardly, he rode his mount along in accordance with his instructions. He said throughout the event MERCHANT PRINCE did not travel strongly and he had some concern with its action as it became unbalanced at various stages of the event.  He added that on pulling up he also expressed concern with his mount’s action.  Trainer J Richards confirmed that from an inside barrier he had asked Jockey Yeung to take up a forward position.  He said whilst MERCHANT PRINCE had received some farrier treatment in the lead up to tonight’s race, he was satisfied with its pre-race condition prior to the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Mr Richards was advised that MERCHANT PRINCE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination before being allowed to race again.

Prior to declaring weighed-in, the Stewards considered as to whether D STAR had been afforded a fair start.  After taking evidence from Apprentice Y L Chung and Starter, Mr A Speechley, the Stewards found that just prior to the start being effected D STAR turned its head to the outside and as a consequence was slow to begin.  As the Stewards were satisfied that D STAR turned its head to the outside just prior to the start being effected and was not being prevented from jumping by a starting gate handler, the horse had been afforded a fair start and was declared a runner.  Before being allowed to race again, D STAR will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial.

After the race, L Hewitson could offer no explanation for his mount’s performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

He said as a result he allowed SIXTH GENERATION to stride forward where it obtained the lead near the 600 Metres but failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned, K De Melo stated that with the horse stepping up to 1650 Metres tonight, he was asked to take up a forward position on his mount.  He said although DASHING GLORY jumped only fairly, he rode his mount along in the early stages to comply with his instructions which resulted in DASHING GLORY being able to obtain a position outside the lead near the 1000 Metres.  He added approaching the Home Turn he felt something may be amiss with DASHING GLORY as it hung in and as a result he eased it down from the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of DASHING GLORY, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, DASHING GLORY will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race revealed that the horse was displaying an irregular heart rhythm.  Before being allowed to race again, APEX TOP will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Leaving the 900 Metres was steadied away from URBAN TRIUMPH.  When questioned, K De Melo stated that he had anticipated taking up a midfield position, but when caught wide in the early stages and when there was interference to his inside approaching the first turn, he elected to come back to obtain cover.  When questioned regarding his riding making the Home Turn and as to whether there was an opportunity to improve to the outside of GOLDEN LINK sooner than what he did, K De Melo stated that as GOLDEN LINK had been inclined to shift ground, he was reluctant to commit to improve past that runner until he was sure his mount would secure clear running.  He added after the 500 Metres when GOLDEN LINK shifted in, he then immediately elected to shift to that runner’s outside where he was able to secure clear running on straightening and PATCH OF THETA ran home strongly.  The Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey De Melo were reasonable in the circumstances.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Whilst proceeding to the starting gates, L Ferraris was dislodged without incident before remounting SPICY GOLD.  Near the 850 Metres, when racing keenly, was steadied to avoid PARTERRE (L Hewitson) which shifted in when not quite clear.  L Hewitson was advised to exercise more care.

From the 400 Metres became held up for clear running behind RUN RUN TIMING and then near the 300 Metres was disappointed for clear running between RUN RUN TIMING and GOLDEN BULL and did not obtain clear running until the 250 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the 400 Metres was shifted to the outside of PING HAI COMET to secure clear running and then lay in for some distance thereafter.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Near the 300 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running between FLYING MOJITO and WINNING STEPS before being shifted to the inside of FLYING MOJITO approaching the 250 Metres to obtain clear running.  Then raced tight between FLYING MOJITO and DEVAS TWELVE for some distance thereafter.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Slow to begin.

Near the 650 Metres brushed the running rail when  positioned close to WINNING DATA.  After the race, Apprentice Y L Chung stated that from the inside barrier he endeavoured to obtain a forward position with cover to assist his mount in travelling comfortably.  He said throughout the early and middle stages LUCKY ETERNITY travelled only fairly and was one-paced to the finish of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly.
Bumped near the 1450 Metres when racing tight to the inside of FLYING MOJITO.
Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned, B Avdulla stated that the intention was to attempt to hold a midfield position and after travelling a short distance STAR CLUB did not show sufficient pace to do so and as a result he was obliged to make some use of his mount to endeavour to maintain a position towards the back of the field.  When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight, B Avdulla stated that as he was of the view there was some advantage to remain racing to the inside, he elected to remain positioned slightly to the inside of AUTUMN DELIGHT with a view to improving to the inside of that runner.  He said when GLORY ELITE shifted out, he was then obliged to shift to the outside of AUTUMN DELIGHT approaching the 350 Metres in an attempt to secure clear running.  He said when AUTUMN DELIGHT then shifted out slightly, he was held up for clear running between AUTUMN DELIGHT and CALIFORNIA ICON.  He added that it was then his intention to endeavour to shift to the outside of CALIFORNIA ICON approaching the 300 Metres, however, when STAR CLUB was travelling too well to come back and clear the heels of CALIFORNIA ICON, he remained badly held up for clear running until near the 250 Metres.  He further stated that when a run presented to the inside of AUTUMN DELIGHT after the 250 Metres, he was able to place STAR CLUB under full pressure where it finished the race off strongly when being directed to the outside of SUPER GOLDI near the 150 Metres.  The Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Avdulla were reasonable in the circumstances.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  After the race, C L Chau advised that he was instructed to go forward on his mount from the outside barrier.

Blundered on jumping and lost ground.  Near the 650 Metres was steadied away from MANYTHANKS FOREVER.  For a short distance near the 300 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.  Near the 150 Metres shifted in and away from SUPER GOLDI and became awkwardly placed behind MUST GO for a short distance thereafter.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.   Between the 400 Metres and the 350 Metres was held up for clear running behind WINDCHEATER.

Near the 850 Metres was steadied to avoid GOLDEN BULL (C L Chau) which shifted in when not clear.  C L Chau was advised to exercise more care.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the race, H Bentley stated that from a wide barrier he was obliged to make use of his mount in the early stages to hold the lead and under its top weight of 135 lbs RUN RUN TIMING was unable to finish the race off.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Inside the 100 Metres had difficulty securing clear running when improving into a narrow run between RUN RUN TIMING and MANYTHANKS FOREVER which shifted in slightly.
Shortly after the start was bumped.  Raced keenly in the middle stages.

Bumped on jumping.  Near the 950 Metres, when racing keenly, was steadied away from MANYTHANKS FOREVER. <14/2/2024 Additional Veterinary Reports>The Veterinary Surgeon reported that AUTUMN DELIGHT was found to be lame in its left hind leg on the morning after racing. Before being allowed to race again, AUTUMN DELIGHT will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
No report.
Raced tight to the inside of LE MAILLOT JAUNE shortly after the start.  Near the 900 Metres shifted out and away from CALIFORNIA ICON.

When questioned, B Thompson stated that he was asked to hold a forward position on his mount if possible.  He said after commencing well he was able to obtain an on-pace position before LE MAILLOT JAUNE gave ground quickly in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of LE MAILLOT JAUNE, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, LE MAILLOT JAUNE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

STRATHBARRY, Standby Declared Starter, was withdrawn on 11.2.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame left fore).  Before being allowed to race again, STRATHBARRY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly.  Passing the 300 Metres was steadied away from PING HAI COMET when  held up for clear running behind that runner.  Was then shifted to the inside of PING HAI COMET approaching the 200 Metres, but then became held up for clear running behind MASTER HERO and did not obtain clear running until near the 100 Metres when it shifted to the outside of PING HAI COMET to do so.

Shortly after the start was bumped by WINNING STEPS which shifted in and away from ME TIME.  Near the 1450 Metres bumped with WINNING STEPS.  Near the 600 Metres raced tight between STRONGEST BOY and CAN’T GO WONG which shifted out slightly.
No report.
Jumped awkwardly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Withdrawn on 11.2.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame right fore) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter BEER PALACE.  Before being allowed to race again, SUPER CONTENTED will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Crowded at the start.  Near the 800 Metres was steadied when it commenced to race keenly when positioned between MASSIVE ACTION and EIGHTY LIGHT YEARS.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Lay out under pressure over the final 100 Metres and bumped with EIGHTY LIGHT YEARS passing the winning post.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
No report.

Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  Noted to have blood at the right nostril after the race.  An endoscopic examination conducted on ARMOUR WAR EAGLE found that there was no blood in its trachea and therefore the blood in the nostril was determined to be not coming from the lungs and as such the horse was deemed not to have bled.
No report.
No report.
Jumped only fairly and then was badly crowded between SUPER FORTUNE and KA YING RISING which was taken out by SHOW RESPECT which shifted out despite the efforts of its rider.
Jumped awkwardly, shifted out and made contact with EIGHTY LIGHT YEARS.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.

Jumped only fairly.  Approaching the 450 Metres made contact with IMA SINGLE MAN when being shifted to the outside of PINS PRINCE to improve.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped on the hindquarters on jumping and became unbalanced.  After the race, M F Poon reported that SUPER FORTUNE coughed on pulling up.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped on jumping.  Bumped near the 450 Metres.
Brushed near the 150 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Steadied at the 1100 Metres.  Near the 150 Metres shifted in and brushed RED LION.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the race, Trainer P C Ng confirmed that he had asked Apprentice Y L Chung to take up a position behind SUPER WEALTHY in the early stages to obtain cover.  He said, in his opinion, when SUPER WEALTHY did not show the expected early pace as he had instructed Jockey Atzeni to lead the event, this resulted in DUKE WAI racing in a more forward position than what he had anticipated.  Apprentice Y L Chung confirmed the instructions issued by Mr Ng and advised that when DUKE WAI raced keenly, he allowed it to stride forward and lead in an attempt to allow his mount to settle.

Crowded on jumping.  When questioned regarding his riding making the Home Turn and the reason RED LION was able to secure clear running to his inside near the 450 Metres, L Ferraris stated that his instructions were to ensure COURIER WONDER was properly balanced into the Home Straight and to save it up for a run to the finish from the 300 Metres.  He said after being crowded at the start, COURIER WONDER became unbalanced near the 1100 Metres when MUGEN shifted out away from RED LION.  He said he was then able to obtain a position to follow SUPER WEALTHY where he had RED LION positioned to his inside.  He said making the Home Turn whilst he was aware RED LION was positioned to his inside, he was reluctant to improve forward to prevent RED LION from shifting out bearing in mind the instructions he had been issued by Trainer M Newnham.  He added that once COURIER WONDER was balanced into the Home Straight, he then placed his mount under pressure.  Mr Newnham confirmed the instructions issued and also advised that, in his opinion, COURIER WONDER does not appreciate being contacted by other horses and he had asked Jockey Ferraris to ensure that COURIER WONDER was given an uninterrupted run in the event.
Jumped only fairly and then was crowded between DUKE WAI and COURIER WONDER.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped. A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  Over the concluding stages lay in, resulting in its rider M Chadwick having to correct his mount.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly.  Making the turn near the 1000 Metres raced tight to the inside of GOLDEN SAMURAI and was eased.  Inside the 50 Metres had some difficulty obtaining clear running when improving into a tight run between SING DRAGON and RAGING BLIZZARD.

Making the turn near the 1000 Metres was steadied when crowded by SUGAR SUGAR (K H Chan) which shifted in before being corrected by its rider.  K H Chan was reprimanded.  In the Home Straight lay in.  Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out when it shifted in and away from CHAIN OF GOLD and was awkwardly placed on the heels of RAGING BLIZZARD.
No report.

Brushed a rail in the Parade Ring, examined by the Veterinary Officer on arrival at the Start and passed suitable to race.  Inside the 50 Metres raced tight to the inside of BON’S A PEARLA.  After the race, L Hewitson reported that his mount, which was having its first race start in Hong Kong, would derive benefit from tonight’s performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

After the race, K Teetan reported that his mount raced wide but had cover and did not respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped awkwardly.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  From the 550 Metres hung out and ran wide on the Home Turn.  The racing manners and performance of SOLAR UP, which finished tailed out, were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, SOLAR UP will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial around a bend in Hong Kong and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.

At the 900 Metres shifted out when being steadied away from WE ARE HERO.  Lay in approaching the 150 Metres and was bumped.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Near the 200 Metres was brushed by REWARDING TOGETHER which lay in and away from BUNDLE OF CHARM.

When the pace steadied at the 900 Metres was awkwardly placed behind REWARDING TOGETHER and was steadied away from the heels of that runner.  Approaching the 150 Metres became unbalanced when bumped by GALAXY PATCH which shifted in abruptly before being corrected by its rider K Teetan.
Jumped awkwardly and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Had difficulty obtaining clear running between the 400 Metres and the 200 Metres.
Slow to begin and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Crowded at the 900 Metres.  Between the 350 Metres and the 250 Metres was held up for clear running between HOWDEEPISYOURLOVE and LUCKY ENCOUNTER.  Over the concluding stages was held up behind LUCKY ENCOUNTER and could not be ridden out to the finish.  After the race, H Bentley stated that his intention was to lead the event, but after being slow to begin, MAJESTIC KNIGHT settled further back than he was instructed.
No report.

Near the 900 Metres was steadied to avoid LUCKY ENCOUNTER (A Atzeni) which shifted in when not clear.  A Atzeni was reprimanded.  At the 900 Metres was again steadied away from LUCKY ENCOUNTER.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  At the 900 Metres was taken wider by GALAXY PATCH.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
B Thompson was reminded of his obligation not to use the whip on a horse which was out of contention.

When the pace steadied at the 900 Metres improved to the inside of GOOD LUCK FRIEND where there was not sufficient room, resulting in WE ARE HERO being badly crowded, having to be checked and making contact with MAJESTIC KNIGHT.  Held up for clear running between the 400 Metres and the 250 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Held up for clear running on the Home Turn. Jumped only fairly and then was crowded by BRAVEHEARTS which was taken in by HOLY LAKE. Held up for clear running approaching the 250 Metres, then shortly after was bumped and became unbalanced.  Near the 200 Metres was bumped and became unbalanced.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out when positioned close to the heels of SWEET ENCOUNTER.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  Near the 300 Metres became held up behind HOLY LAKE and was then shifted to the outside of HOLY LAKE and SOLEIL FIGHTER to secure clear running approaching the 200 Metres.

Bumped on jumping.  Shifted out and away from SILVER UP near the 250 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the race, K C Leung reported that his mount, which was having its first race start in Hong Kong, would derive benefit from today’s performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly and then was crowded shortly after the start.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the race, K Teetan reported that despite riding his mount along in the early stages it did not show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position and as a result was obliged to race very wide and without cover throughout the event and consequently gave ground in the Home Straight.  The performance of XPONENTIAL, a last start winner, was considered to be disappointing.  Before being allowed to race again, XPONENTIAL will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped at the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
