K H Chan (STORM RIDER) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that leaving the 1100 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not sufficiently clear of MAGNIFICENT NINE, resulting in MAGNIFICENT NINE being checked away from the heels of STORM RIDER and losing its running.  K H Chan was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Thursday, 15 February 2024 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent race riding record.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
In the middle stages raced keenly and lay out.
Bumped on jumping and then shortly after the start was crowded by GIDDY UP which shifted in despite the efforts of its rider.
Near the 200 Metres raced tight to the inside of KARMA for a short distance.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Jumped awkwardly.  Near the 400 Metres was disappointed for clear running between E LEGEND and RUN RUN COOL which shifted to the outside of SUPER WINNER to improve.  Was then held up for clear running until approaching the 150 Metres.
No report.

Near the 200 Metres was bumped by STORM RIDER which shifted in whilst giving ground.  After the race, L Ferraris reported that from an inside barrier he was instructed to take up a forward position and as a result he rode his mount along in the early stages to comply with his instructions.  Trainer F C Lor confirmed the instructions issued.

K H Chan pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference leaving the 1100 Metres (see MAGNIFICENT NINE).  After the race, K H Chan reported that from a wide barrier he was obliged to make use of his mount in the early stages to cross and race outside the lead.  He added that entering the Home Straight STORM RIDER came under pressure and gave ground from that point onwards.  Trainer D A Hayes advised that, in his opinion, the early section of the race, which was run inside of standard time, may have affected the ability of STORM RIDER to finish the race off.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of STORM RIDER was considered to be disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, STORM RIDER will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.   Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

After the race, L Hewitson reported that he was instructed to find cover from the outside barrier and as a result he was obliged to shift across behind runners in the early stages to comply with his instructions.  Assistant Trainer H F Yiu confirmed the instructions issued.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Withdrawn on 9.2.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame left fore) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter SUPER WINNER.  Before being allowed to race again, WINNER METHOD will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 900 Metres was steadied away from HAPPY TRIO.  Sent for sampling post-race.  H Bentley pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference over the concluding stages (see LUCKY ARCHANGEL).
Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 1100 Metres raced tight between LUCKY ARCHANGEL and COLOURFUL EMPEROR, both of which shifted ground slightly. Approaching the finish raced tight between LUCKY ARCHANGEL and COLOURFUL EMPEROR.
Jumped only fairly.

H Bentley (ATOMIC FORCE) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that over the concluding stages he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of LUCKY ARCHANGEL, resulting in LUCKY ARCHANGEL losing its rightful running and having to be checked.  H Bentley was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Sunday, 25 February 2024 at Sha Tin.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent race riding record.   A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Making the first turn near the 1000 Metres commenced to race keenly and lay out.  Near the 150 Metres was eased when crowded between ATOMIC FORCE and LUCKY ARCHANGEL (M F Poon) which shifted out.  M F Poon was severely reprimanded. After the 100 Metres was shifted to the inside of LUCKY ARCHANGEL to continue into clear running.
No report.
Slow to begin.

As the start was effected became fractious, reared and lost ground.  As the Stewards were satisfied that such occurrence was due to the horse’s barrier manners as the start was effected, it was declared a starter.  Before being allowed to race again, KYEEMA will be required to perform satisfactorily in a stalls test.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Jumped awkwardly and lost ground and then was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 600 Metres was hampered when taken wider by TIGER AND GOLD.

After the race, M Chadwick reported that at its last start he was requested to hold a more forward position, but from an awkward barrier settled in a midfield position.  He said tonight after commencing well from a favourable barrier NOT A FEW was able to obtain a more forward position.
No report.

Slow to begin and then was crowded shortly after the start.  Near the 250 Metres was disappointed for clear running between AROMATICA and RED MAJESTY and was then shifted to the inside of RED MAJESTY shortly after to obtain clear running.
No report.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

TIGER AND GOLD, which was having its first race start in Hong Kong, raced greenly and for some distance after the 1200 Metres was steadied away from ATOMIC BEAUTY.  Near the 600 Metres, TIGER AND GOLD, which continued to race greenly, became unbalanced when bumped by CHARITY BINGO (B Avdulla) which shifted out when making the turn awkwardly.  As a result, TIGER AND GOLD became unbalanced and lost ground.  B Avdulla was advised to exercise more care.  The racing manners and performance of TIGER AND GOLD were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, TIGER AND GOLD will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 350 Metres, when under pressure, was eased when crowded between ATOMIC BEAUTY and THE CONCENTRATION which shifted out.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have bled from both nostrils.  Before being allowed to race again, CLUB SODA will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly.  Near the 350 Metres was shifted to the outside of JOYFUL CHAMPION to secure clear running.  Near the 200 Metres A Hamelin’s whip was knocked from his grasp by the whip of M L Yeung, the rider of GREEN LASER.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped near the 350 Metres.
Noted to have lost its right front plate after the race.

Between the 500 Metres and the 300 Metres became badly unbalanced as it endeavoured to force a run which resulted in JOYFUL CHAMPION being positioned too close to the heels of SUPER HORNET.  L Hewitson pleaded guilty to a improper riding charge for causing interference between the 500 Metres and the 300 Metres (see COPARTNER ERA).  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly.
Bumped at the start.  Near the 350 Metres shifted out and away from DIAMOND WINNER and made contact with GREEN LASER.

After the race, B Thompson stated that his intention was to be a little closer in the run, but was unable to achieve this position in the early stages and GENERAL WINNER did not respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped at the start.

L Hewitson (JOYFUL CHAMPION) pleaded guilty to a charge of improper riding [Rule 100(1)] in that between the 500 Metres and the 300 Metres he endeavoured to force a run when there was not sufficient room to do so between SUPER HORNET and COPARTNER ERA, resulting in JOYFUL CHAMPION making heavy contact with COPARTNER ERA, resulting in COPARTNER ERA becoming badly unbalanced and being taken from its rightful running and JOYFUL CHAMPION also becoming badly unbalanced and resulting in JOYFUL CHAMPION being positioned too close to the heels of SUPER HORNET.  L Hewitson was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Wednesday, 28 February 2024 and to expire on Sunday, 17 March 2024 on which day he may resume race riding (6 Hong Kong racedays).  In assessing penalty, the Stewards took into account his guilty plea, his good race riding record and the severity of the incident.  An inquiry was also conducted into K C Leung’s right arm extending out in this incident and making contact with JOYFUL CHAMPION near the 400 Metres.  Jockey Leung stated that he was endeavouring to ride in a competitive manner and to hold his position on the track and for this reason he placed pressure on his right rein in an endeavour to maintain that position.  He added that although his right arm extended away from his body, it had not been his intention to make contact with JOYFUL CHAMPION.  After considering the incident and the circumstances leading up to the 400 Metres, Jockey Leung was warned that in similar circumstances, wherever possible, he should ensure that his arm remains in the confines of his body and he must not extend his arm to make contact with any other horse or rider.  K C Leung was warned in relation to using his whip forward of the saddle on a number of occasions passing the 200 Metres.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  After the race, K C Leung reported that he was instructed to take up a midfield position, but from a favourable barrier COPARTNER ERA raced more forward than what had been intended.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 1300 Metres was steadied away from CORDYCEPS ONE.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.

When questioned regarding his riding and as to whether there was an opportunity to hold a more forward position, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that from an inside barrier he was asked to hold a handy position but not to make use of his mount in the early stages to do so.  He said after commencing well he rode in accordance with his instructions where CAPITAL LEGEND then settled in a handy position behind BRAVE WITNESS. Trainer C Fownes confirmed the instructions issued and advised that Apprentice Wong had ridden the horse in accordance with those instructions.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Bumped at the start.  When questioned regarding his riding, A Atzeni stated that his instructions were to endeavour to hold a forward position.  He said after being bumped at the start, he was reluctant to ride his mount forward as the horse has previously had a tendency to race keenly when he rode the horse on 13 January 2024.  He said when caught wide in the early stages and when a number of runners positioned to his inside had held a forward position, he elected to allow CHATEAU to hold a midfield position where it was able to obtain cover behind KEEN UNITY.  When questioned if there was an opportunity to make use of his mount in the early stages to comply with his instructions and go forward, A Atzeni stated that he was reluctant to do so given the horse’s previous racing manners and he felt his best option was to endeavour to obtain cover in the early stages.  Trainer J Size confirmed the instructions were to hold a forward position.  The Stewards advised Jockey Atzeni that, in their opinion, he had made an error of judgement in the early stages in that he failed to ride his mount with the necessary urgency to comply with his instructions and he would be expected in future to endeavour to ensure that he rides his mounts in such a manner so as to comply with the instructions that he has been issued with.

On arrival at the Start, the tongue tie applied to LEGION OF MERIT was replaced.  After being loaded into the barriers lunged forward and opened the starting gate.  Removed from the barriers, examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly.  Approaching the 550 Metres became unbalanced when endeavouring to improve into a narrow run between CAPITAL LEGEND and CHATEAU.  Over the concluding stages could not be fully ridden out when positioned behind CHATEAU.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Jumped only fairly.

Jumped awkwardly, shifted in and made contact with CHATEAU.  Then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the race, M F Poon stated that his mount became stirred up prior to the event due to the start of the race being delayed.  He added that FIGHT TIME did not travel well throughout the event and failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of FIGHT TIME was considered to be disappointing as compared to its first race start.  Before being allowed to race again, FIGHT TIME will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Reared in the barriers after being loaded, resulting in its right front leg making contact with the running board.  Removed from the barriers, examined by the Veterinary Officer who said the horse was lame in its right front leg and therefore was not suitable to race.  Acting on this advice, JOYFUL FRIENDSHIP was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  Before being allowed to race again, JOYFUL FRIENDSHIP will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Withdrawn on 13.2.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (left front tendon injury) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter BRAVE WITNESS.  Before being allowed to race again, FEARLESS FIRE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

No report.

He said when caught wide in the early stages he then allowed his mount to obtain cover behind RUBY SAILING.  He added in the middle stages FORTUNE WARRIOR then over-raced and finished the race off only fairly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Sent for sampling post-race.

He added due to the positioning of his saddle he was unable to forcefully move his mount to the outside of SUPER EAGLE and as a result VALHALLA took some time to respond to his urgings to improve to the outside of SUPER EAGLE where it obtained clear running near the 200 Metres.

He said as a result FLYING PHANTOM was unable to finish the race off strongly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings. After the race, K C Leung stated that his mount enjoyed a good run in the event, but failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight and was disappointing.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

He said when AUGUST MOON did not show sufficient pace to cross runners to his inside, he was obliged to race very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Both Apprentice Wong and K C Leung were advised to exercise more care.

When questioned regarding the improved performance, Trainer K W Lui stated that he had instructed L Hewitson to go forward and obtain cover.  He said GOLDEN EMPIRE was advantaged by being able to obtain a position on the rail behind the leader and this was the reason for the horse’s improved performance tonight. When questioned, Z Purton stated that his instructions were to hold a forward position.  He said after riding his mount along in the early stages he was able to obtain a position three wide to the outside of MEGA BONUS.  He said whilst his preference was to maintain this position, as PRINCE OF PORTY raced too keenly in the early stages, he was then obliged to allow PRINCE OF PORTY to improve forward with MEGA BONUS in the middle stages to race outside the lead.  He added under pressure in the Home Straight PRINCE OF PORTY commenced to give ground and near the 200 Metres shifted in and away from ACT OF FAITH before failing to run on from that point.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.

Jumped only fairly and then from the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages. Whilst the Stewards were satisfied that the manner in which PRINCE OF PORTY was giving ground and that it had shifted out and away from RIGHTEOUS ARION was the cause for LIGHTNING BOLT striking heels, Apprentice Chung was nonetheless advised to exercise more care in similar circumstances.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Having regard to the margin of three quarters of a length between the two horses at the finish of the event, the Stewards declined to lodge a protest/objection when they were satisfied that there were not sufficient grounds to do so and declared weighed-in on the numbers semaphored by the Judge. When caught wide in the early stages was ridden forward near the 1100 Metres to avoid covering additional ground.  Apprentice E C W Wong pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference leaving the 450 Metres (see VIVA HUNTER).

Jumped awkwardly.  In the early stages raced keenly and for some distance near the 1300 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from MAYHEM.  Badly crowded near the 450 Metres.  The performance of SIR HURRICANE, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, SIR HURRICANE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary examination immediately following the race found that horse to be distressed.

Apprentice E C W Wong (BONUS PAL) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that leaving the 450 Metres he allowed his mount, which was giving ground, to shift in when insufficiently clear of VIVA HUNTER, resulting in VIVA HUNTER having to be severely checked, shifting in and crowding SIR HURRICANE and also resulting in HARRY’S HERO, which was following VIVA HUNTER, having to be checked.  Taking into account his record, Apprentice Wong was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Sunday, 25 February 2024 and to expire on Monday, 4 March 2024 on which day he may resume race riding (3 Hong Kong racedays). In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 3 and the consequences grade 3.  In addition, in lieu of a fine and having regard to his inexperience as an apprentice, Apprentice Wong was directed to appear before the Riding Skills Panel for remedial training under the provisions of Rule 12(46).  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, VIVA HUNTER will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

He said when NEW POWER commenced well, he elected to make use of its good start where he rode his mount along in the early stages to hold a forward position.  He added when runners to his inside did not show intent to lead the event, so as to avoid racing wide, he continued to ride his mount along to cross to the lead.

He said after this incident WOODFIRE BRO did not travel well throughout the event and when he was concerned that there may be something amiss with his mount in the Home Straight, he did not ride it out to the finish when not in a competitive position.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race revealed that the horse was displaying an irregular heart rhythm.  Before being allowed to race again, WOODFIRE BRO will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments.

When questioned regarding his mount racing in a more forward position today, M Chadwick stated that VICTORY MOMENTS, which was having its first race start on the All Weather surface, had performed well in barrier trials when ridden in a forward position.  He said as a result and due to the horse being a "roarer”, he was asked to allow VICTORY MOMENTS to take up a forward position but only where it was comfortable to ensure that it relaxed during the event.  He added that whilst VICTORY MOMENTS was caught wide and without cover for the majority of the event, it travelled comfortably in that position and as a result was able to go on to win the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.

B Avdulla (ATULLIBIGEAL) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 200 Metres he allowed his mount to improve into a run where there was insufficient room to do so between DROMBEG BANNER and KEEFY, resulting in KEEFY being crowded for room and having to be checked when it lost its rightful running between ATULLIBIGEAL and SUPERB BOY.  B Avdulla was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Sunday, 25 February 2024 and to expire on Thursday, 29 February 2024 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his good race riding record.
Jumped only fairly.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

The Stewards deferred the declaration of weighed-in whilst they considered if GLOBAL HARMONY had been afforded a fair start.  On the evidence, it was established that as the start was effected, GLOBAL HARMONY refused to jump and took no part in the event.  As the Stewards formed the opinion that GLOBAL HARMONY had not had an unfair start, the horse was declared a runner.  As this was the second consecutive occasion that GLOBAL HARMONY had refused to jump, Trainer D A Hayes was informed that the entries of GLOBAL HARMONY in races and barrier trials will be refused until such time the Stewards make a final determination in respect to the racing future of the horse.  Sent for sampling post-race. <29/2/2024 GLOBAL HARMONY>The Stewards have considered an application from the Owners’ representative of GLOBAL HARMONY to permit GLOBAL HARMONY to continue to race in Hong Kong following the horse refusing to jump from the starting gates on 21 January 2024 and most recently on 18 February 2024.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Crowded on jumping.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  In the middle stages raced keenly.  For some distance after the 600 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from PHILOS.  Held up on the Home Turn.

Jumped only fairly and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  When questioned regarding his riding to the finish of the event, H Bentley stated that GLORY CLOUD lay in when placed under pressure in the Home Straight and proved difficult to ride out.  He said over the concluding stages when his mount continued to lay in, he heard a call back to his inside and as he was concerned GLORY CLOUD may be shifting in, he stopped riding and straightened his mount at the finish.  After considering his explanations and viewing the patrol films, the Stewards were satisfied that H Bentley’s actions in the circumstances were reasonable.
Slow to begin.
Hampered and taken out over the concluding stages.

M L Yeung was severely reprimanded and advised that he must stop riding and straighten his mounts when they commence to shift ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Leaving the 1600 Metres raced in restricted room between DANCING CODE which lay in despite the efforts of its rider and HAPPY TOGETHER which was taken out slightly when positioned to the outside of LA CITY BLANCHE.  Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out when improving into a narrow run to the inside of TELECOM FIGHTERS which shifted in slightly.
No report.

Near the 1500 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from LA CITY BLANCHE.  When questioned, K Teetan stated that with his mount stepping back up in distance to 1650 Metres tonight, he was asked to settle DANCING CODE where comfortable and to get the horse to relax.  He said with the slow pace in the early and middle stages, DANCING CODE raced a little keenly but was unable to quicken when the tempo of the race increased approaching the Home Turn.  When asked if there was an opportunity to improve forward in the middle stages to offset the slow pace, K Teetan stated that as his mount was stepping back up to 1650 Metres and wearing blinkers tonight, to ensure that it ran out the distance of the event, he elected not to do so.  Trainer C Fownes confirmed the instructions issued and expressed satisfaction with the tactics adopted by K Teetan.  Mr Fownes added that DANCING CODE was disadvantaged by the slow early pace.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

B Thompson was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 13 March 2024 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent race riding record.

The Veterinary Surgeon said this examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, SON PAK FU will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.

B Thompson pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 150 Metres (see BEAUTY CHARGE).

Whilst the Stewards were satisfied that the riding of A Atzeni, 7th placegetter, over the concluding stages did not affect the horse’s finishing position, he was nonetheless reminded of his obligation to ensure that he fully rides his mounts out to the finish of the race. He added that when CIRCUIT BLAZING came under pressure from the 500 Metres, he shifted to the outside of that runner, but then became held up behind JUBILATION for some distance thereafter. The Stewards deferred the declaration of weighed-in whilst they considered an application from Trainer F C Lor that SPEED SWORD had been denied a fair start.  After taking evidence from H Bowman and Mr A Speechley, the Starter, and after viewing the patrol films, it was established that SPEED SWORD became fractious in the barriers as the start was effected and as a result turned its head to the right and failed to jump with the field, losing significant ground.  As the Stewards were satisfied that such occurrence had simultaneously occurred as the start was effected, SPEED SWORD was declared a runner.  Trainer F C Lor was advised that SPEED SWORD will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial prior to its next race start. Near the 1000 Metres was steadied when crowded between TACTICAL COMMAND and MODEST GENTLEMAN which shifted in and away from CHIU CHOW BROTHER despite the efforts of its rider A Atzeni.  Leaving the 100 Metres was steadied when crowded between FORTUNE MASTER which shifted in slightly and MODEST GENTLEMAN (A Atzeni) which shifted out.  A Atzeni was severely reprimanded and advised to stop riding and straighten his mounts sooner than he did on this occasion.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages and raced keenly.  Held up for clear running approaching the 250 Metres and near the 200 Metres was steadied when crowded between PRECISION GOAL which shifted in slightly and NOIR RIDER (M L Yeung) which shifted out.  M L Yeung was advised to exercise more care.  Over the final 50 Metres could not be ridden out when positioned close to the heels of HERO ICON.

Approaching the 300 Metres was crowded between FORTUNE MASTER and PRECISION GOAL (C L Chau) which shifted out.  C L Chau was reprimanded.  As a result, FIRE BALL then did not obtain clear running until after the 200 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly, shifted in and was bumped shortly after the start.  After the race, A Badel reported that his mount raced "flat” throughout the event and gave ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race revealed that the horse was displaying an irregular heart rhythm.  Before being allowed to race again, CHIU CHOW BROTHER will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Near the 500 Metres was steadied and shifted to the inside of MONEY CATCHER to improve into clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Lay in in the Home Straight.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Kicked a rail in the saddling stalls, examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Jumped awkwardly.
No report.
No report.

Got its head up in the early stages when being shifted across behind runners.  Leaving the 500 Metres improved into a narrow run between FIVE G PATCH and CHAMPION DRAGON and made contact with CHAMPION DRAGON.
No report.
Slow to begin and then was crowded shortly after by SWORD POINT.  Checked at the 1500 Metres.  Was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 1500 Metres STRAIGHT ARRON was steadied in an endeavour to obtain cover behind ENCOUNTERED.  When STRAIGHT ARRON remained in a three wide position to the outside of ENCOUNTERED, CHAMPION DRAGON was checked to avoid the heels of STRAIGHT ARRON and as a result became unbalanced.  SENOR TOBA, which was following, was checked as a consequence.  After considering all the evidence, the Stewards found that the pace of the event easing slightly during that section of the race and STRAIGHT ARRON being steadied at that stage were the principal reasons for CHAMPION DRAGON having to be checked and therefore H Bowman was advised that he should exercise more care when performing similar manoeuvres in future.  Bumped near the 500 Metres.  After the race, A Badel stated that his mount failed to show sufficient pace in the early stages to hold a more forward position.

After the race, L Ferraris reported that he had some concern with his mount’s action behind when it commenced to give ground in the Home Straight and therefore he did not ride it out to the finish of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of MONEY CATCHER was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, MONEY CATCHER will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Became fractious after being loaded into the starting gates, removed and examined by the Veterinary Officer who said the horse was suitable to race.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Jumped awkwardly.
Jumped only fairly and then was crowded.  Briefly held up near the 400 Metres.
Jumped only fairly and then was crowded shortly after the start.  From the 400 Metres to the 300 Metres was held up for clear running.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 400 Metres was held up for clear running behind SUMMIT IMPACT before shifting to that runner’s inside to obtain a run.  In this incident, LOST CHILD shifted in and made contact with TRUE GENIUS.
Near the 700 Metres commenced to race keenly and was steadied away from SUMMIT IMPACT.
C L Chau (FUN TOGETHER) was reprimanded for permitting his mount to shift in near the 800 Metres when not clear of SUGAR BALL.
Slow to begin.  Bumped near the 400 Metres.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover until the 700 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped on the hindquarters on jumping and became unbalanced.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped on jumping.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  From the 400 Metres to the 300 Metres was held up for clear running behind DIAMOND WINNER.  Near the 200 Metres was crowded between BRILLIANT PIONEER which shifted in slightly and CIRCUIT ELITE (K C Leung) which was shifted to the outside of NICE BIRDIE.  K C Leung was advised to exercise more care.
Shifted out shortly after the start and was bumped.

Jumped only fairly and then was crowded shortly after the start.  In the early stages raced keenly and for some distance after the 1700 Metres was steadied away from PALACE PAL.  After the 400 Metres became held up behind CLASSIC ARCHI and when being shifted to the outside of CLASSIC ARCHI near the 350 Metres made contact with HAPPY HERO.  Then raced tight between HAPPY HERO and CLASSIC ARCHI for some distance thereafter.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, DIAMOND WINNER will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 200 Metres was disappointed for clear running to the inside of COLOURFUL BARON when that runner shifted in, resulting in GOLDEN FAIRY having to be shifted out where it secured clear running approaching the 150 Metres.  After the race, A Badel reported that when the pace of the event increased along the Back Straight, GOLDEN FAIRY came under pressure and finished the race off only fairly.

Jumped awkwardly, shifted out and was bumped.  When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight, K C Leung stated that after being positioned to the inside of NICE BIRDIE near the 300 Metres, he observed that runner was inclined to shift in and as he was concerned NICE BIRDIE would continue to shift in and he would become held up behind LOYAL AMBITION, he elected to ease CIRCUIT ELITE approaching the 200 Metres to shift to the outside of NICE BIRDIE to secure clear running.  He added as he endeavoured to do so, CIRCUIT ELITE made contact with MIGHTY STAR and had difficulty obtaining clear running until near the 100 Metres.  The Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Leung were reasonable in the circumstances.  Noted to have blood in its mouth after the race.

After the race, H Bentley reported that his mount was unsuited when the pace of the event increased along the Back Straight when PALACE PAL went forward and was under pressure from that point.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Bumped shortly after the start.

Bumped on jumping.  From the 800 Metres raced wide and without cover after it made a forward move to follow PALACE PAL.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Withdrawn on 27.2.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame left fore) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter HAPPY HERO.  Before being allowed to race again, AI ONE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Held up for clear running between the 400 Metres and the 200 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
Raced wide and without cover until near the 600 Metres.
Bumped at the start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of mucus in the horse’s trachea.
No report.
Hampered on jumping and was bumped a short distance later.

Jumped awkwardly.  For a short distance near the 300 Metres was held up for clear running.  Close to the finishing line could not be ridden out when positioned close to the heels of GOLD TACK which shifted in.
Jumped only fairly and then was crowded shortly after the start.

Shortly after the start was bumped by LUCKY GOLD which shifted out and was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Raced keenly in the early stages and refused to settle, resulting in its rider K C Leung allowing his mount to stride forward after the 1000 Metres but was obliged to race wide and without cover thereafter.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages and raced keenly.  K H Chan was warned in relation to using his whip on a horse that was out of contention and showing no response.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shifted in on jumping and made contact with the right side of its barrier.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event. <29/2/2024 Additional Veterinary Reports> The Veterinary Officer reported that GOLDEN BULL was found to be lame in its left front leg on the morning after racing. Before being allowed to race again, GOLDEN BULL will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
No report.
Noted to have lost its left front plate after the race.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Making the first turn raced ungenerously and lay out.  Bumped near the 300 Metres.

Jumped only fairly and after travelling a short distance was crowded by GORGEOUS VITALITY which was taken in by TELECOM SPEED which shifted in when being corrected by its rider.  After being held up on the Home Turn improved into a run approaching the 300 Metres between TELECOM SPEED and MARIO where there was not sufficient room, resulting in PRIME MORTAR becoming awkwardly placed behind TELECOM SPEED, shifting out and bumping with MARIO.  K C Leung was reprimanded and advised that he must ensure there is sufficient racing room when he is improving.
Shortly after the start was bumped by GOLDEN BULL and became unbalanced.
Crowded shortly after the start.  Near the 300 Metres bumped with GOLDEN LINK.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

At declaration time, K De Melo was declared as the rider of both MARIO and RUNNING BOY.  It was established that K De Melo had a firm commitment to ride RUNNING BOY.  As such, the Stewards permitted A Badel to be substituted as the rider of MARIO.  For this declaration error, Trainer D J Hall was fined $2,000.  Approaching the 1000 Metres raced tight to the inside of TELECOM SPEED which lay in despite the efforts of its rider.  Bumped near the 300 Metres and became unbalanced.

After the race, A Atzeni reported that his mount was under pressure throughout the event and he was obliged to ride it along to hold his position.  He added that in the Home Straight CRYSTAL POWERFUL failed to respond to his riding and gave ground.  Trainer W K Mo advised that CRYSTAL POWERFUL had pleased him leading into tonight’s race and he expected it to run well.  He added the only explanation he could offer was that the horse had to be replated on the left hind leg on arrival at Happy Valley, however, was passed suitable to race by the Veterinary Officer.  A  veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of CRYSTAL POWERFUL was considered to be disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, CRYSTAL POWERFUL will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After being loaded into the barriers reared and got its left front leg over the gates.  Acting on veterinary advice that TATTENHAM was not suitable to race, the horse was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  Before being allowed to race again, TATTENHAM will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Over the concluding stages raced tight to the inside of RED HARE KING which shifted in and was brushed by that runner.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Making the Home Turn hung out after being taken wider by GLORIOUS JOURNEY.  Over the concluding stages shifted in and was brushed.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Held up making the Home Turn behind GLORIOUS JOURNEY.  On straightening was then shifted to the inside of I AM THE BOSS to obtain clear running.

Slow to begin.  When finishing the race off well improved into a tight run between I AM THE BOSS and GLORIOUS JOURNEY near the 150 Metres and raced tight for a short distance thereafter.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Over the concluding stages was impeded by the whip of K Teetan, the rider of GALAXY WITNESS, when he pulled the whip through to his left hand.  When questioned, A Hamelin stated that from a wide barrier he was requested to ride his mount in a midfield position.  He said after travelling a short distance he was able to comply with his instructions and obtained a trailing position behind ESCAPE ROUTE.  Trainer D A Hayes confirmed the instructions issued.
Bumped on jumping.  Near the 1300 Metres was briefly crowded by ESCAPE ROUTE.
No report.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

After the race, C L Chau reported that he had some concern with his mount’s action in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Before being allowed to race again, SILVER SONIC will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Near the 400 Metres was awkwardly placed close to RUN RUN COOL when being shifted to that runner’s outside to improve.
Leaving the 1500 Metres, when racing keenly, was steadied to avoid SIXTH GENERATION.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the race, A Atzeni stated that the intention was to hold a more forward position, but ENDEARED was slow to begin.  He said ENDEARED was obliged to race wide and without cover until near the 900 Metres when he was able to obtain cover. He added that his mount gave ground when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced keenly in the early stages.
No report.
Trainer C Fownes confirmed that from the outside barrier he had instructed K H Chan to take up a forward position.  Sent for sampling post-race.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the 250 Metres was steadied and shifted to the inside of DENFIELD to secure clear running.  Then raced tight to the inside of ONE FOR ALL for some distance near the 150 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Slow to begin.
In the middle stages raced keenly.  Briefly held up after the 300 Metres and then approaching the 200 Metres raced tight between ONE FOR ALL and VIVA GRACIOUSNESS.
No report.

Passing the 800 Metres was steadied when crowded by JOYFUL HUNTER (A Atzeni) which, after initially shifting in and being corrected by its rider, then again shifted in when being steadied away from SUGAR SUGAR.  A Atzeni was severely reprimanded.

Kicked a rail on entering the Parade Ring, examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Near the 1000 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from DENFIELD.  After the race, A Atzeni stated that his mount travelled satisfactorily throughout the event but after being placed under pressure entering the Home Straight did not quicken as he had anticipated and finished the race off only fairly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.

Jumped awkwardly.  After the race, B Thompson reported that his mount made a respiratory noise during the running of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Before being allowed to race again, ONE FOR ALL will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced wide and without cover from the 900 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly.  Raced keenly in the early stages.  When questioned, A Hamelin stated that from a wide barrier he was instructed to ride DAN ATTACK conservatively in the early stages in an endeavour to have his mount settle.  He said he was also instructed if possible he should make his run to the inside in the Home Straight as connections had formed the opinion that it was advantageous to improve on this section of the track.  He said he shifted DAN ATTACK across behind runners in the early stages where his mount raced keenly.  He said after following KING ECCELLENTE into the Home Straight, he initially ascertained as to whether a run was available to the inside of KING ECCELLENTE having regard to his instructions.  He said when KING ECCELLENTE maintained its position towards the inside, he then observed the run available to the outside of YOUTH POWER and behind OUR LUCKY GLORY where he endeavoured to balance DAN ATTACK up and then commenced to allow it to improve into the event.  He added near the 200 Metres once fully balanced he was able to place DAN ATTACK under pressure where it finished the race off reasonably well.  When questioned regarding his vigour between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres, A Hamelin stated that at all stages through this section of the race he was urging his mount forward, but having regard to his previous experience with the horse, where it was required to be balanced before being placed under full pressure, he was reluctant to ride his mount along fully through this section of the race.  Trainer J Richards confirmed the instructions issued and expressed satisfaction with his ride.  After considering his explanations, the Stewards advised A Hamelin that he had made an error of judgement between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres by not placing his mount under full pressure to follow OUR LUCKY GLORY into the event.  Whilst the Stewards found Jockey Hamelin had made an error of judgement, they were satisfied that his actions had not resulted in DAN ATTACK not finishing the best possible placing in the field.
No report.
No report.
After the 350 Metres was awkwardly placed close to SCOTCH TYCOON and was steadied.
No report.
Over the final 200 Metres was badly held up behind VANTASTIC CHOICE and could not be tested.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Slow to begin.  Over the final 200 Metres was held up and could not be ridden out to the finish.
Jumped only fairly and shortly after the start was crowded.
Bumped shortly after the start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Blundered shortly after the start.  Near the 450  Metres was crowded by CHIRON.  Held up for a short distance approaching the 300 Metres behind BAEBAE TSOI.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Despite being ridden along in the early stages failed to show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly.  Near the 700 Metres lay out and was awkwardly placed on the heels of ASIAN ONE.  Near the 450 Metres was checked to avoid MILLENNIUM FALCON when that runner commenced to give ground and was shifted to the inside of MILLENNIUM FALCON to continue to improve.  From the 350 Metres until the 250 Metres was held up for clear running behind GET THE MONIES and then near the 250 Metres was crowded when it improved into a narrow run between ASIAN ONE and GET THE MONIES which shifted out.
No report.
Bumped at the start.

Blundered badly on jumping and became unbalanced.  After the race, K Teetan reported that when placed under pressure in the Home Straight his mount did not respond to his riding and raced in a disappointing manner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped at the start.  Near the 250 Metres was bumped by CHIRON when crowded for room between CHIRON and M M NEBULA which shifted in slightly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, ASIAN ONE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Jumped awkwardly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, BAEBAE TSOI will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the race, B Thompson advised that from the outside barrier he was instructed to ride his mount conservatively in the early stages and as a result he shifted RED MAVERICK across behind runners in the early stages to comply with his instructions.  Trainer Y S Tsui confirmed the instructions issued.  The performance of RED MAVERICK, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, RED MAVERICK will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the race, H Bentley reported that his mount hung out throughout the event and changed stride on a number of occasions before weakening in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of MILLENNIUM FALCON, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, MILLENNIUM FALCON will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the 400 Metres improved to the inside of ALL IS GOOD and made contact with that runner.
Jumped awkwardly and made contact with the left side of its barrier.  In the middle stages raced keenly.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.

Near the 200 Metres was crowded.  After the race, A Badel reported that his mount travelled satisfactorily throughout the event but failed to quicken when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  He added he had suggested to Trainer P C Ng that he might experiment with the head gear for the horse for its next race start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 200 Metres was crowded by HEALTHY HEALTHY which, after improving to the inside of SUPERB CAPITALIST, was then taken in by that runner slightly.  After the race, K C Leung expressed concern with the horse’s action.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Before being allowed to race again, CHAMPION METHOD will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Jumped only fairly.  Bumped after the 400 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Near the 200 Metres was awkwardly placed close to TELECOM FIGHTERS when that runner shifted out and when being corrected K C Leung dropped his left rein for a short distance.  After the race, K C Leung stated that his intention was to find cover in the early stages, but due to the slow pace and when positioned to the outside of ALL FOR ST PAUL’S in the early stages, he was obliged to allow his mount to stride forward and raced in a more forward position than what he had anticipated.
Jumped only fairly and was bumped shortly after the start.

Bumped at the start.  When questioned, A Hamelin stated that he was asked to endeavour to hold a midfield position, but from an awkward barrier he was obliged to settle slightly further back than anticipated.  He added with the slow pace in the early and middle stages, the race developed into a sprint home which resulted in ADEFILL not being able to make up any appreciable ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  When being shifted across behind runners near the 1500 Metres raced keenly and got its head up.
Crowded on jumping and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Bumped at the start.  After the race, Apprentice Y L Chung stated that his mount was crossed in the early stages by APACHE PASS and, in his view, it races best when able to dictate from in front.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Held up on the Home Turn and approaching the 200 Metres was crowded between DIAMOND SOARS and KOWLOON EAST STAR, both of which shifted ground slightly.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After travelling a short distance was crowded between SUPER AXIOM which shifted out and DIAMOND SOARS which was racing tight to the inside of COLOURFUL PRINCE.  Near the 550 Metres was steadied and shifted out to avoid SUPER CHARIZZARD.  Lay in in the Home Straight.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.

Jumped only fairly and then was bumped by BEAUTY DESTINY which shifted out.  Near the 550 Metres was severely checked when crowded between PARENTS’ LOVE which raced tight to the inside of OVERSUBSCRIBED and LEAN  MASTER which shifted out when making the turn awkwardly.  The Stewards found the racing manners of LEAN MASTER were the principal reason for the interference.

Jumped only fairly and shortly after the start was crowded by OVERSUBSCRIBED which shifted in.  Was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  In the early stages lay out and had difficulty maintaining its position at the rear of the field.  Near the 200 Metres was briefly held up before being directed to the outside of SUPER CHARIZZARD to obtain clear running.  Lay in in the Home Straight.  Over the concluding stages was not ridden to the finish when being positioned tight to the inside of KOWLOON EAST STAR.
Bumped near the 200 Metres.
No report.

Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  Approaching the 500 Metres was steadied when racing tight to the inside of LEAN MASTER.  Between the 250 Metres and the 200 Metres was held up for clear running.  Inside the 100 Metres lay in and away from OVERSUBSCRIBED and approaching the winning post was then steadied when crowded between OVERSUBSCRIBED and CIRCUIT SEVEN, both of which shifted ground slightly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Proved difficult to load into the barriers.  Before being allowed to race again, PARENTS’ LOVE will be required to perform satisfactorily in a stalls test.  Bumped shortly after the start and became unbalanced.  Raced tight near the 550 Metres and was steadied.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Crowded shortly after the start.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly and then was bumped by CALIFORNIATOTALITY and became unbalanced.  Held up making the Home Turn and shifted to the inside of GALLANT CROWN near the 400 Metres to obtain clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Noted to have blood in the mouth on arrival at the Start, examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Bumped at the start and became unbalanced.  When questioned, Apprentice Y L Chung stated that his intention was to hold an on-pace position, but CALIFORNIATOTALITY, which was not racing with blinkers for the first time, did not show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position.  He added when a number of runners to his outside improved forward, CALIFORNIATOTALITY raced further back than what was anticipated.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Had some difficulty obtaining clear running near the 400 Metres.
No report.

When questioned regarding his riding out, K Teetan stated that close to the winning post when riding his mount along, he became momentarily unbalanced in the saddle, however, was able to continue to push CHILLI BABA out over the final stride of the event.  After the race, K Teetan advised that from a wide barrier he was instructed to take up a forward position on his mount.
From the 400 Metres until the 200 Metres was held up for clear running behind CHILLI BABA.
No report.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
After the race, A Atzeni advised that from a wide barrier he was instructed to take up a forward position on his mount.

From the 350 Metres until the 250 Metres raced tight  between CELTIC TIMES and GALLANT CROWN which shifted out slightly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.  L Ferraris was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 900 Metres (see SOLAR UP).

Apprentice Y L Chung (SOLAR UP) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that approaching the 400 Metres he allowed his mount to shift out, resulting in PACKING WISHER being taken out across the running of STRATHPEFFER, resulting in STRATHPEFFER  having to be checked and GANGNAM STAR, which was following and slightly to the outside of STRATHPEFFER, also having to be checked.  Apprentice Chung was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Sunday, 24 March 2024 and to expire on Thursday, 28 March 2024 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his good race riding record.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
No report.
As the start was effected lowered its head, resulting in its rider B Shinn becoming unbalanced on jumping and SKY TRUST being slow to begin.

Leaving the 1100 Metres improved to the inside of GOLDEN DARCI and was steadied for a short distance.  Making the turn leaving the 900 Metres lay out and made the turn wider.  Checked approaching the 400 Metres.

Raced keenly in the middle stages.  Held up making the Home Turn.  Near the 300 Metres, GOLDEN DARCI, which was laying out, was steadied and got its head up when crowded between KING OBERON and SOLAR UP (Apprentice Y L Chung) which shifted in.  Apprentice Chung was reprimanded and advised that he would be expected to stop riding and straighten his mount sooner than he did on this occasion.  Near the 50 Metres was shifted to the inside of KING OBERON to secure clear running and over the concluding stages could not be ridden out when KING OBERON shifted in slightly.

When questioned, A Hamelin stated that from the outside barrier he was instructed by Trainer C H Yip to ride his mount conservatively in the early stages.  He said after settling at the rear of the field, he placed TRAVEL GOLF under pressure leaving the 500 Metres, however, his mount lay in and proved reluctant to shift to the outside of runners in the Home Straight.  He added as a result he was placed at some disadvantage from not being able to fully test TRAVEL GOLF out to the finish of the event although his mount ran home reasonably well.  Trainer C H Yip confirmed the instructions issued.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped awkwardly, made contact with the left side of its barrier and lost ground. When questioned regarding his riding, H Bowman stated that he anticipated taking up a handy position with cover. He said in the early stages he was able to obtain a position behind ENIGMA, however, that runner raced keenly and got its head up on a number of occasions.  He added that after entering the Back Straight when he observed FLAMINGO TRILLION racing in a three wide position, he was of the view it would be advantageous to shift NOBLE PURSUIT out and to follow FLAMINGO TRILLION to provide his mount with a trail into the event.  He added when he commenced a forward move, ENIGMA, which had continued to race keenly, shifted out which resulted in NOBLE PURSUIT being taken four wide and without cover near the 1100 Metres.  He said as a result when he was of the view the pace of the event would allow him to do so, he then commenced to allow NOBLE PURSUIT to stride forward with a view to crossing FLAMINGO TRILLION.  He said as he commenced to do so, the pace of the event quickened when FLAMINGO TRILLION endeavoured to prevent NOBLE PURSUIT from crossing which then resulted in NOBLE PURSUIT being obliged to race four wide and without cover until near the 600 Metres.  After considering the explanations, the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Bowman were reasonable and that he would not have been able to reasonably anticipate ENIGMA shifting out near the 1100 Metres as its rider Apprentice Y L Chung had endeavoured to remain racing behind LEAN HERO throughout the early and middle stages.   A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Whilst the Stewards were satisfied that K C Leung’s action in attempting to regain control of his whip was an instinctive one, he was nevertheless advised, wherever possible, he should ensure that his focus remains on riding his mounts out to the finish of the event. After the race, M L Yeung reported that his instructions were to take up a forward position.  He said when RUNNING AHEAD held its position to his inside, ROYAL PRIDE was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Trainer C Fownes confirmed the instructions issued.  Trainer C Fownes will be interviewed relative to ROYAL PRIDE being presented and racing with a hood, not part of its approved racing gear. <10/3/2024 – 6 March 2024 Happy Valley Racemeeting – Race 3 (477)> The Stewards today conducted an inquiry in relation to ROYAL PRIDE being presented and racing with a hood, not part of its approved gear in the abovementioned race. Evidence was taken from Mr C Fownes, trainer of ROYAL PRIDE, Mr Fownes’ assistant trainer Mr C K Chung and Mr W L Tsang, stables assistant of ROYAL PRIDE. The evidence established that ROYAL PRIDE was transported to the Happy Valley Racecourse with a black hood. Upon arrival the horse was attended by Mr Tsang and a yellow pre-race hood, part of ROYAL PRIDE’S approved gear, was inadvertently placed over the black hood by Mr Tsang before ROYAL PRIDE was taken to the saddling stalls to be saddled by Mr Fownes. Mr Fownes advised that as the pre-race hood was covering the black hood he did not detect that the black hood was fitted to ROYAL PRIDE. As ROYAL PRIDE was presented in the Parade Ring with a yellow pre-race hood covering the black hood, gear inspections performed by the Stewards in the Parade Ring had not identified that the black hood had been fitted to ROYAL PRIDE as the yellow pre-race hood, in accordance with standard practice, had not been removed from ROYAL PRIDE until once at the starting gates. Mr Fownes pleaded guilty to a charge under Rule 96 in that he did negligently present ROYAL PRIDE to race in Race 3 at the Happy Valley racemeeting on 6 March 2024 in a hood, which was not part of that horse's declared gear, which resulted in ROYAL PRIDE wearing a hood in the said race. Mr Fownes was fined the sum of $15,000. The Stewards have now updated their standard operating procedures to minimise the risk of such error occurring again. A report will be made to the Head of Dual Site Stables Operations in respect to Mr Tsang erroneously applying a hood to ROYAL PRIDE.

Made contact with FLYING PHANTOM after the 400 Metres.  When questioned, H Bentley stated that from a wide barrier his instructions were to take up a forward position.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 1000 Metres got its head up when crowded between FLYING PHANTOM and SERGEANT PEPPER which shifted out.  Lay in in the Home Straight and near the 150 Metres its rider B Avdulla was obliged to stop riding and straighten his mount.

Both H Bentley and L Ferraris were advised to exercise more care.  Passing the 400 Metres was held up for clear running behind TOGEPI.
No report.
No report.

He added that near the 150 Metres his mount was momentarily crowded by HAPPY GOLF when that runner shifted in.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages. <7/3/2024 Additional Veterinary Reports> The Veterinary Surgeon reported that HIGH RISE SOLDIER had sustained an injury to the right front suspensory ligament. Before being allowed to race again, HIGH RISE SOLDIER will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Approaching the 1000 Metres commenced to race keenly and got its head up when being steadied to avoid HERO STAR (Apprentice Y L Chung) when that runner was steadied in front.  Whilst the Stewards accepted that SERGEANT PEPPER had raced keenly at that stage, Apprentice Chung was advised that he must ensure he does not ease the tempo too quickly in similar circumstances.
Shifted out at the start and made contact with CHEER FOR SOUTH.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
For a short distance approaching the 200 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running between SUPER AXIOM and ACE POWER.  Sent for sampling post-race.
After the 150 Metres raced tight to the inside of SUPER EAGLE for some distance and as a result was held up for clear running.
No report.
Shortly after the start was bumped by E UNIVERSE and shifted out slightly and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Before being allowed to race again, MISTER FOX will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Jumped awkwardly and made contact with the left side of its barrier.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

At declaration time, Apprentice E C W Wong had claimed 2 lbs overweight to ride SUPER AXIOM at 113 lbs.  When Apprentice Wong was unable to claim down to the advertised weight of 113 lbs, the Stewards permitted H T Mo to be substituted as the rider of SUPER AXIOM.  Apprentice Wong was fined a sum of $5,000.

When questioned, K C Leung stated that from a wide barrier as GLORIOUS EXPERT had raced keenly at its previous race start, he was instructed to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages.  He said after jumping awkwardly, GLORIOUS EXPERT then got its head up and became unbalanced when being shifted across behind runners.  He said after obtaining a position at the tail of the field making the first turn near the 1000 Metres, GLORIOUS EXPERT became unbalanced when racing tight to the inside of HAPPY FEELING and as a result lost ground.  He added, in his opinion, GLORIOUS EXPERT would be better suited by racing at Sha Tin.  Noted to have lost its right front plate after the race.
Bumped on jumping.  Sent for sampling post-race.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

He said as a result SURE JOYFUL was unable to finish the race off strongly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings. He added from the 700 Metres TAKE ACTION was under pressure and gave ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After being placed in the barriers kicked out, resulting in its left hind leg being cast over the back gate for a considerable period.  Acting on veterinary advice that STARSHIP EIGHTY was not suitable to race, the horse was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  Before being allowed to race again, STARSHIP EIGHTY will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

He said GOLDEN LONG jumped awkwardly and as a result lost ground.  He said in the early stages he did not feel his mount was showing sufficient pace to hold out GOLDEN TITLE and as a result that runner was able to cross his mount in the early stages, resulting in GOLDEN LONG settling further back than what had been intended.

He added making the first turn he was hampered when GOOD LUCK WIN shifted out and WATCH BUDDY did not travel well thereafter and failed to finish the race off.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Over the concluding stages lay in, resulting in its rider H Bowman having to stop riding and straighten his mount approaching the winning post.  As a consequence, LIGHTNING BOLT could not be ridden out to the finish of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

As the start was effected sat back in the barriers, bounded on jumping and as a result lost ground.  Before being allowed to race again, METRO WARRIOR will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial.

Bumped shortly after the start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, DEEP PURSUIT will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

On 7 March 2024, the Stewards approved for A Atzeni to be substituted as the rider of SIXTH GENERATION as K H Chan was unable to make the weight.  Having regard to the circumstances of this case and in particular that Jockey Chan advised the connections and the Stewards of his unavailability to ride prior to betting commencing, the Stewards believed that the appropriate penalty was for him to be fined a sum of $2,000.  Jumped awkwardly, was then crowded shortly after the start and as a result was steadied.
Bumped at the start.  In the middle stages raced keenly.

No report.
Noted to have lost its left front plate after the race.
