After the race, A Hamelin reported that from the outside barrier he was asked to ride ACE ONE in a conservative manner in the early stages.  Trainer D J Whyte confirmed the instructions issued and stated that he asked the horse to be ridden conservatively in the early stages to avoid it racing wide.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Shifted out on jumping and was bumped.  After the race, M L Yeung reported that his mount gave ground quicky over the concluding stages when under pressure and when not in a competitive position he eased his mount down over the final 100 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race revealed that the horse was displaying an irregular heart rhythm.  Before being allowed to race again, LOST CHILD will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Bumped on jumping.  Held up for clear running between the 450 Metres and the 350 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned regarding his riding, Apprentice Y L Chung stated that from a wide barrier he was instructed to take up a midfield position but if unable to do so with cover, he was given the option to come back in order to find cover.  He said in the early stages when caught wide he elected to settle PHOENIX LIGHT towards the rear of the field to ensure that he complied with his instructions.  When questioned regarding his riding from the 550 Metres, Apprentice Chung stated that when following the short- priced favourite STAR CLUB, he elected to remain racing behind that runner with a view to following it into the event.  He said he was reluctant to shift to the outside at this stage as he was concerned that he would have had to shift out a number of horses and be taken wide.  He added after continuing to follow STAR CLUB, when that runner was able to secure a narrow run to the outside of MASSIVE TALENT near the 350 Metres, when MASSIVE TALENT then commenced to give ground and he had GAMEPLAYER WARRIOR to his outside, he was unable to improve to follow STAR CLUB.  He further stated that as a result approaching the 300 Metres he then elected to improve to the inside of MASSIVE TALENT but became held up between COMPASSION SUPER and LIFELINE EXPRESS near the 200 Metres and did not obtain clear running until after the 100 Metres where his mount finished the race off well.  After considering his explanations, the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Apprentice Chung were reasonable in the circumstances.
Near the 800 Metres was taken wide by VERBIER which shifted to the outside of GAMEPLAYER WARRIOR.  Then raced very wide and without cover from that point onwards.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped.
No report.

Leaving the 200 Metres became held up for clear running behind COMPASSION SUPER when that runner commenced to give ground.  As a result, FORERUNNER was badly held up and could not be ridden out until near the 50 Metres.
Jumped only fairly.

Approaching the 900 Metres was eased away from the heels of GIMME FIVE which was taken in slightly by MASSIVE TALENT.  Approaching the 300 Metres raced in restricted room between PACKING PROSPECT which was giving ground and STAR CLUB which shifted out to improve.

After the race, L Ferraris stated that after commencing well he was able to hold the lead on GLORY ELITE, but his mount was not suited by being pressured in the lead by COMPASSION SUPER and as a result did not finish the race off when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the race, M Chadwick reported that he was obliged to make use of his mount in the early stages to clear runners to his inside and to take up a forward position.  He said as a result MASSIVE TALENT was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Raced wide and without cover from the 800 Metres.  After the race, J McDonald reported that when placed under pressure in the Home Straight his mount commenced to give ground and when he was concerned there may be something amiss with it he did not ride it out over the final 200 Metres when not in a competitive position.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of PACKING PROSPECT, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, PACKING PROSPECT will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Noted to have blood in its mouth on arrival at the Start, examined by the Veterinary Officer and found to be suitable to race.  After the race, Trainer A S Cruz stated that whilst the track was still rated "Good”, CALIFORNIA SPANGLE was advantaged by the track having some give in it due to light rain that had fallen prior to the running of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Over the concluding stages raced tight to the inside of CALIFORNIA SPANGLE.

Bumped at the start and then raced tight to the inside of HEALTHY HAPPY for a short distance after the start.  When being shifted behind LUCKY WITH YOU in the early stages was steadied away from the heels of that runner approaching the 1200 Metres.  After being bumped by LUCKY SWEYNESSE leaving the 1200 Metres commenced to race keenly and was steadied away from LUCKY WITH YOU for some distance before shifting out near the 1100 Metres to avoid that runner’s heels.  When placed under pressure in the Home Straight lay in, resulting in its rider Z Purton having to correct his mount near the 200 Metres and being placed in some disadvantage in riding his mount out fully to the end of the race.

When questioned regarding his riding, J McDonald stated that his instructions were that if his mount commenced well, to endeavour to hold a forward position but otherwise he was asked to obtain cover on the horse.  He said after HEALTHY HAPPY, which was positioned directly to his inside, jumped better than LUCKY SWEYNESSE, he elected to then ride his mount with the intent to find cover.  He said in the early stages with BEAUTY ETERNAL positioned to his inside, he was caught three wide to the outside of that runner and then near the 1200 Metres elected to obtain cover.  He added when BEAUTY ETERNAL shifted out near the 1100 Metres he was then obliged to restrain LUCKY SWEYNESSE and take a position with cover towards the rear of the field.  He said although he was aware the pace of the event was being run outside of standard in the middle stages, he felt that obtaining cover was the best option for his mount.  He further stated that from near the 550 Metres he commenced a three wide move and after being taken wider on the Home Turn by BEAUTY ETERNAL, LUCKY SWEYNESSE finished the race off reasonably well.  Trainer K L Man confirmed the instructions as detailed by Jockey McDonald.  He stated that although the pace of the event was run outside of standard throughout the early and middle stages, he was satisfied with Jockey McDonald’s decision to come back and obtain cover behind BEAUTY ETERNAL to avoid racing wide.  Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned, H Bowman stated that from the 800 Metres his mount hung out which resulted in him having to place significant pressure on his right rein to maintain his position on the track. When questioned, J McDonald stated that his instructions were to settle his mount where comfortable but not to make use of it as it had previously over-raced when ridden forward in the early stages.  He said from the inside barrier GIDDY UP jumped reasonably well but in accordance with his instructions he did not push it along in the early stages to hold a more forward position.  He said as a result TALENTS AMBITION was able to shift across his mount in the early stages which resulted in GIDDY UP setting towards the rear of the field.  He added approaching the first turn when TALENTS AMBITION shifted out, he was able to allow GIDDY UP to improve to the inside of that runner and follow MASTER OF FORTUNE.  He further stated that from the 600 Metres when he remained positioned behind MASTER OF FORTUNE, his visibility was impaired due to the kickback from runners in front and as a result he was not able to proceed forward from the 600 Metres to the 400 Metres when there was not sufficient room to do so.  He said after entering the Home Straight he shifted to the outside of MASTER OF FORTUNE to follow BEAUTY FIT, but was held up for clear running from the 350 Metres until the 200 Metres where he was able to place GIDDY UP under full pressure and the horse finished the race off well.  Trainer J Richards confirmed the instructions issued and as GIDDY UP was stepping up to 1600 Metres and when ridden forward from an inside barrier at Happy Valley on 20 December 2023, GIDDY UP raced keenly and as a result did not finish the race off.  He said this was the basis for issuing the instructions to Jockey McDonald.  Mr Richards added that whilst he had expected GIDDY UP settling in a more forward position, he was of the view that due to GIDDY UP being held up in the early part of the Home Straight, this had impacted the horse’s chances of finishing in a more forward position.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Jumped awkwardly and then shortly after the start was steadied when crowded between SOLEIL FIGHTER and UNIVERSAL HORIZON.  Near the 1100 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from ACCOLADE START.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Crowded at the start between UNIVERSAL HORIZON and KARMA which shifted out.  Between the 450 Metres and the 350 Metres was held up for clear running.
No report.

After the race, K De Melo reported that as he had some concern with his mount’s action on the Home Turn he eased it down in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of YOUNG BRILLIANT, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, YOUNG BRILLIANT will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 1450 Metres was steadied away from MIGHTY STAR.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
From the outside wide barrier was shifted across behind runners, over-raced and refused to settle in the early and middle stages.  Lay in under pressure over the final 250 Metres.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Slow to begin and then was crowded shortly after the start.
Over the concluding stages raced tight to the inside of PRECISION GOAL (C L Chau) and approaching the winning post was steadied to avoid that runner.  C L Chau was reprimanded.

In the early stages raced keenly and for some distance approaching the 1400 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from FOXHUNTER WAY.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, HAPPIHOOD will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the race, Apprentice Y L Chung stated that he was obliged to go forward in the early stages to race outside the lead and, in his opinion, SUPERB MOVE would be better suited when being able to obtain a position with cover.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly, shifted in and was bumped.  Was ridden along in the early stages and improved to the inside of HAPPIHOOD as that runner was being shifted towards the rail.  Near the 1450 Metres HAPPIHOOD got its head up when being corrected by its rider K C Leung, resulting in MEDIC ELITE being crowded for room, becoming unbalanced and losing ground.  After the race, K Teetan reported that his mount was disadvantaged by being slow to begin, crowded near the 1450 Metres and settled further back.  He added that, in his opinion, MEDIC ELITE would be better suited when being able to race up on the pace.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 300 Metres improved into a narrow run to the outside of SUPERB MOVE and made contact with ANGELS HUNTER on a number of occasions thereafter.  Approaching the 150 Metres raced in restricted room between SUPERB MOVE and BEAU GOSSE which shifted in before being corrected by its rider H Bentley.  After the race, Z Purton could offer no explanation for his mount’s failure to finish the race off.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped for some distance after the 300 Metres.  Near the 150 Metres was shifted out and away from HAPPY JAI JAI which was giving ground.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Withdrawn on 12.3.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (left front tendon injury).  Before being allowed to race again, FAITHFUL TRINITY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Shifted out shortly after the start despite the efforts of its rider.  Sent for sampling post-race.

In the early stages raced keenly and near the 900 Metres got its head up and ran wide when being steadied away from STREET CONQUEROR.  Noted to have lost its left hind plate after the race.

Checked shortly after the start.  After the race, K Teetan reported that after being interfered with shortly after the start his mount settled further back than intended and was not suited by the pace of the event being run outside of standard in the early and middle stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
For some distance approaching the 50 Metres raced tight between BEAT HOLLOW and WINNING HEART, both of which shifted ground slightly.

Shortly after the start was severely checked when crowded between GREAT ACHIEVER and LAPRAS which was taken out by STREET CONQUEROR which shifted out after being checked away from COPARTNER PRANCE when that runner shifted out despite the efforts of its rider Z Purton.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Checked shortly after the start.  When questioned, H Bentley stated that after being checked shortly after the start he then commenced to shift his mount in in the early stages to take a position on the rail and to the inside of WINNING HEART.  He said as he was shifting in at an acute angle, LAPRAS continued in despite his efforts, made heavy contact with the running rail near the 1000 Metres and as a result became badly unbalanced.  H Bentley was advised that in similar circumstances he should exercise more care and ensure that he does not shift his mounts across at such an acute angle.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Before being allowed to race again, LAPRAS will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Withdrawn on 12.3.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame left fore) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter HERCULES.  Before being allowed to race again, SAVVY CHIC will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Brushed the running rail near the 600 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the race, B Avdulla stated that with his mount stepping up in distance he was asked to take up a forward  position on TRUE GENIUS as TRUE GENIUS races in a one-paced manner.  Trainer A S Cruz confirmed the instructions issued.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

He added that COPARTNER AMBITION was obliged to race wide until near the 600 Metres and finished the race off reasonably well.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be lame in its left front leg.  Before being allowed to race again, COPARTNER AMBITION will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Bumped shortly after the start and became unbalanced.  In the early and middle stages raced keenly and near the 900 Metres was steadied away from TOMODACHI KOKOROE.  When questioned, Apprentice Y L Chung stated that approaching the winning post he was positioned close to the heels of TOMODACHI KOKOROE and as a result did not push his mount out over the final stride of the event.  Whilst the Stewards were satisfied that the riding of Apprentice Chung, 7th placegetter, over the concluding stages did not affect the horse’s finishing position, he was nonetheless reminded of his obligation to ensure that he fully rides his mounts out to the finish of the race.

Jumped awkwardly.  Near the 300 Metres was bumped by BON’S A PEARLA when that runner shifted out to improve.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Before being allowed to race again, BON’S A PEARLA will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Apprentice Wong was advised in similar circumstances he would be expected to stop riding and straighten his mounts sooner than what he did on this occasion.  He was further advised that his riding out over the final 150 Metres was also of concern that he should have made a greater effort to straighten his mount up as it continued to shift out under pressure.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Bumped on the hindquarters on jumping.

The Stewards found that STURDY RUBY improving to the inside of SHOW RESPECT had significantly contributed to the incident occurring.  Both Z Purton and H Bentley were advised to exercise more care.

He said once balanced in the early part of the Home Straight he was able to commence to ride his mount along where it obtained running near the 200 Metres between SPEEDY SMARTIE and SMART FOLKS.

Apprentice Wong was severely reprimanded. Approaching the 400 Metres was disappointed for clear running to the outside of SIGHT VICTORY which shifted out, resulting in SUPER HIGHWAY being steadied and shifted to the inside of that runner to secure clear running. From the 600 Metres until the 450 Metres was held up and unable to improve when positioned behind JOY FOR YOU and to the inside of CIRCUIT FIERY.

No report.
No report.

When questioned, Z Purton stated that his mount was stirred up prior to the event and was agitated once placed into the starting gates.  He said as a result CHATEAUNEUF jumped only fairly but then travelled well throughout the early and middle stages.  He added when RUN RUN TIMING did not improve into the race, he then was obliged to shift CHATEAUNEUF to the outside of that runner near the 550 Metres to improve, but his mount responded only fairly to his riding in the Home Straight and raced in a disappointing manner.  Trainer D A Hayes stated that after the horse’s first start win on 18 February 2024 the horse was transferred to his Conghua stable where it barrier trialed satisfactorily on 8 March 2024.  He stated that the horse’s mannerism behind and in the starting gates today were uncharacteristic but otherwise he could offer no excuse for the disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of mucus in the horse’s trachea.   The performance of CHATEAUNEUF was considered to be disappointing as compared to its first race start.  Before being allowed to race again, CHATEAUNEUF will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.   Sent for sampling post-race. <18/3/2024 Additional Veterinary Reports>CHATEAUNEUF, which performed disappointingly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of mucus in its trachea. CHATEAUNEUF was again examined by the Veterinary Surgeon at the stables of Trainer D A Hayes yesterday morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its right front leg. As previously advised, CHATEAUNEUF will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination before being allowed to race again.
No report.
Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.  Near the 1000 Metres was steadied when crowded by CIRCUIT FIERY which shifted in before being corrected by its rider C L Chau.

Bumped shortly after the start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race revealed that the horse was displaying an irregular heart rhythm.  Before being allowed to race again, SIGHT VICTORY will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Noted to have blood in the mouth on arrival at the Start, examined by the Veterinary Officer and found to be suitable to race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the race, the Veterinary Surgeon reported that CASA COSMO was found to have sustained an injury to the left front fetlock.  Before being allowed to race again, CASA COSMO will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly.  A Atzeni (CIRCUIT BLAZING) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 900 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when insufficiently clear of NINJA DERBY, resulting in NINJA DERBY being crowded for room and taken in across the running of DEVAS TWELVE, resulting in DEVAS TWELVE having to be checked.  A Atzeni was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Sunday, 31 March 2024 and to expire on Thursday, 4 April 2024 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his good race riding record.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From the 400 Metres until the 200 Metres was badly held up for clear running.

When questioned, B Thompson stated that his instructions were to hold a forward position preferably with cover, but he was given the option to allow his mount to lead if it did not settle in the early stages.  He said after being crossed by NINJA DERBY and obtaining cover near the 1200 Meres SATIRICAL GLORY then commenced to race keenly, got its head up and was steadied away from NINJA DERBY for some distance thereafter.  Trainer D A Hayes confirmed the instructions issued and advised that once SATIRICAL GLORY had been crossed by FOREVER GLORIOUS in the early stages, he agreed with Jockey Thompson that there was not an opportunity to allow SATIRICAL GLORY to lead the event and in hindsight SATIRICAL GLORY would be better suited by being able to dictate terms in the lead.  SATIRICAL GLORY continued to over-race throughout the middle stages and refused to settle.  Near the 1000 Metres was momentarily crowded by FURY AND GOLD which shifted in before being corrected by its rider H Bentley.

Jumped awkwardly and from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Leaving the 200 Metres was steadied and directed to the outside of the heels of NINJA DERBY when that runner shifted out.
On the Home Turn was held up for clear running.  Near the 250 Metres was checked to avoid CIRCUIT BLAZING when that runner gave ground in front.

Shortly after the start was crowded by NINJA DERBY which shifted in and as a result made contact with the hindquarters of FOREVER GLORIOUS.  Near the 1000 Metres was steadied away from FURY AND GOLD and was then shifted out to avoid that runner’s heels.  From the 700 Metres raced wide and without cover.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  C  L Chau pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 300 Metres (see CHATEAU).
Slow to begin.  From the 350 Metres until the 200 Metres was held up when being directed to the outside to obtain clear running.
Crowded near the 900 Metres.
Bumped on the hindquarters shortly after the start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 1000 Metres was taken wider by SPECIAL HEDGE and was then obliged to race wide and without cover for the remainder of the event.  C L Chau (SPECIAL HEDGE) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 300 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of CHATEAU, resulting in CHATEAU having to be checked to avoid SPECIAL HEDGE and being taken in, crowding the running of CIRCUIT BLAZING.  C L Chau was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Wednesday, 3 April 2024 and to expire on Monday, 8 April 2024 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his good race riding record.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Crowded near the 300 Metres when giving ground.  A Atzeni pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 900 Metres (see DEVAS TWELVE).

After the race, H Bentley reported that when he felt there was something amiss with his mount on the Home Turn, he eased it out of the event when not in a competitive position.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of FURY AND GOLD, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, FURY AND GOLD will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination. From the 400 Metres to passing the 200 Metres was held up for clear running.

Jumped only fairly and was then crowded shortly after the start.  Near the 1150 Metres was steadied when crowded between SETANTA and PACKING BRILLIANT, both of which shifted ground slightly.  Between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.

Raced keenly in the middle stages.  When questioned regarding his riding, K C Leung stated that his instructions were to find a position with cover just behind midfield.  He said when his mount jumped awkwardly and lost ground, SUPER GOLDI settled further back than what it had been anticipated.  He added from the 500 Metres he contemplated shifting to the outside of JOYFUL SUPREME but was reluctant to do so as he felt the racing pattern today had advantaged horses making their run to the inside and further as JOYFUL SUPREME was not improving into the race, he would have had to restrain his mount to get to the outside of that runner.  He added as a result he elected to continue to improve to the inside of JOYFUL SUPREME where he initially followed PACKING BRILLIANT into the Home Straight.  He said after shifting to the outside of PACKING BRILLIANT near the 300 Metres, he then became badly held up behind GREAT SPIRIT and could not ride his mount out until he obtained a narrow run between GREAT SPIRIT and EXCELLENT DADDY near the 100 Metres whereby his mount finished the race off well.  After considering his explanations, the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Leung were reasonable in the circumstances.
No report.

Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A Badel was warned for raising his whip arm above shoulder height.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Approaching the 150 Metres was steadied when crowded for room to the inside of HAPPY HORSE (Apprentice E C W Wong) which shifted in.  Apprentice Wong was severely reprimanded.

Hit a rail on entering the track, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Approaching the 800 Metres was steadied when placed in restricted room between MODEST GENTLEMAN and GOODMANSHIP which shifted out slightly.

Jumped only fairly.  Near the 250 Metres was held up for clear running when improving to the outside of GOODMANSHIP which shifted out slightly, resulting in MODEST GENTLEMAN shifting out and making contact with AUGUST MOON.

Near the 250 Metres was carried wider by MODEST GENTLEMAN.  When questioned regarding his riding, K H Chan stated that from the outside barrier his instructions were to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages to endeavour to avoid racing wide.  He stated that after AUGUST MOON commenced well, he initially contemplated allowing his mount to go forward but when a number of runners improved to his inside, he then desisted from riding forward and look to obtain a position with cover as instructed.  He added when AUGUST MOON did not come back in the early stages, he was then obliged to race very wide and without cover for the remainder of the event.  Trainer J Richards confirmed the instructions issued and stated that such instructions were issued as AUGUST MOON was obliged to race wide and without cover at its previous race start.  Mr Richards stated that, in his opinion, although he had instructed Jockey Chan to ride the horse conservatively in the early stages, he would have been better served by taking advantage of his mount’s good start and holding a forward position.  After considering the evidence, the Stewards advised K H Chan that he had made an error of judgement in the early stages in that, notwithstanding his instructions, when his mount commenced well, he should have taken advantage of the good start to hold a more forward position to endeavour to avoid racing wide.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

Shortly after the start was crowded.  Approaching the 800 Metres was steadied when crowded between GOODMANSHIP and MR GOOD VIBES which shifted out slightly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned, H Bentley stated that he was instructed to hold a forward position on his mount from his wide barrier.  He said WINDCHEATER was standing awkwardly in the barriers and as a consequence jumped awkwardly and lost ground.  He said bearing in mind his instructions he then commenced to ride WINDCHEATER along to obtain a forward position in accordance with his instructions and whilst he had contemplated riding his mount conservatively in the early stages, he felt that his best option was to attempt to comply with his instructions.  He added that after improving forward in the early stages, he then had to make some use of his mount to cross OUTGATE approaching the first turn near the 900 Metres and once positioned to the outside of MASSIVE ACTION, his mount relaxed although WINDCHEATER remained positioned in advance of MASSIVE ACTION.  He further stated that when placed under pressure in the Home Straight WINDCHEATER initially responded to his riding but gave ground over the final 200 Metres due to the use he had to make of his mount in the early stages.  H Bentley agreed with the Stewards that in retrospect when his mount lost ground at the start, his best option would have been to ride it in a conservative manner in the early stages to avoid making too much use of WINDCHEATER to go forward.  Trainer M Newnham confirmed the instructions issued and also agreed with the Stewards that H Bentley would have been best suited by riding his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.

K C Leung was fined the sum of $3,000 for failing to declare a probable 2 lb overweight on the horse at the time of declaration.  Shifted in at the start and made heavy contact with CIRCUIT SEVEN.
Jumped only fairly.
Bumped heavily on jumping and became unbalanced.  Approaching the 100 Metres M F Poon dropped his right rein for some distance when he changed his whip through to his right hand.

After the race, Z Purton reported that near the 600 Metres his mount, which was having its first race start, was reluctant to hold its position when racing to the inside of SERGEANT PEPPER and as a result became unbalanced and lost ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped shortly after the start.  After the 200 Metres lay in and was reluctant to shift to the outside of SPICY SPANGLE.

Shortly after the start raced tight to the inside of COLOURFUL PRINCE.  After the 550 Metres was hampered when taken wider by UNIVERSAL BLAZE.  After the race, A Hamelin reported that after being taken wider near the 550 Metres SUPER FAST DRAGON did not travel well thereafter and finished the race off in a disappointing manner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported. <21/3/2024 Additional Veterinary Reports>SUPER FAST DRAGON, which performed disappointingly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time the horse was found to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported. SUPER FAST DRAGON was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer J Richards this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its left front leg. Before being allowed to race again, SUPER FAST DRAGON will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Making the first turn near the 550 Metres hung out across the heels of CIRCUIT SEVEN and was severely checked.  The racing manners of UNIVERSAL BLAZE were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, UNIVERSAL BLAZE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial around a  bend.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Found to be mildly distressed after the race.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped on the hindquarters shortly after the start and became unbalanced.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.  B Shinn pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 200 Metres (see CIRCUIT MIGHTY).

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  When questioned, B Avdulla stated that his mount hung out from the 500 Metres and over the concluding stages he was unable to ride LINK out as he was concerned it would shift out away from the winning post.
In the early stages raced keenly and got its head up when being crossed by CIRCUIT MIGHTY.

When questioned, L Ferraris stated that from a wide barrier he was instructed to ride his mount conservatively in the early stages to ensure that it obtained cover.  He stated that in the early stages when caught wide to the outside of DOUBLE WIN, he elected to come back to follow that runner to avoid covering additional ground which resulted in SPICY GOLD settling slightly further back than what he had intended.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.
No report.

Approaching the 1300 Metres was steadied when crowded by DOUBLE WIN which shifted out abruptly.  B Shinn (SKY TRUST) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 200 Metres he allowed his mount to shift out when not clear of CIRCUIT MIGHTY, resulting in CIRCUIT MIGHTY having to be checked.  B Shinn was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 27 March 2024 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 1 and the consequences grade 2.
Jumped awkwardly and from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

L Ferraris was advised to exercise more care.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Slow to begin.  Raced wide and without cover until near the 750 Metres where it was ridden forward to obtain a position in the lead.
No report.
No report.

When questioned, B Avdulla stated that he was instructed to hold a midfield position from a favourable barrier, but SMART BEAUTY jumped only fairly and as a result was positioned towards the back of the field.  He said in the early stages when he was positioned to the outside of CLASSIC ARCHI and behind that runner slightly, he elected to shift behind that runner to avoid racing wide which resulted in SMART BEAUTY settling further back than what he had intended.  He added approaching the first turn near the 1400 Metres he endeavoured to maintain a position one-off behind CLASSIC ARCHI, but when racing tight to the inside of SUPERB DADDY, he elected to allow that runner to take his mount towards the rail to avoid contesting that position.  B Avdulla further stated that in the early stages he was reluctant to ride his mount along as it has had a tendency to race keenly in its races when pressured in the early stages.  He stated that throughout the middle stages SMART BEAUTY raced keenly and from the 550 Metres started a forward move around the field but was taken wider on the Home Turn by SUPERB DADDY.  He added in the Home Straight SMART BEAUTY lay in which restricted his ability from pushing it out over the final 100 Metres of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly.  For some distance approaching the 600 Metres raced tight between DRAGON PRIDE and SUPERB DADDY.  After the race, A Hamelin could offer no explanation for his mount’s failure to run on in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly and then was bumped shortly after the start.
Slow to begin.  Near the 300 Metres lay in when improving to the inside of LOYAL AMBITION, resulting in its rider M Chadwick having to correct his mount.

When questioned, Z Purton stated that making the Home Turn his mount was held up for clear running behind HORSE OF GOOD LUCK.  He stated that on entering the Home Straight near the 300 Metres GO GO GO remained held up when disappointed for clear running between HORSE OF GOOD LUCK and SUPER HORNET which shifted in.  He said after obtaining clear running near the 200 Metres between SUPER HORNET and HORSE OF GOOD LUCK, he was unable to ride his mount along when FASTPASS, which was positioned in advance of him, was giving ground.  He added that he then improved to the inside of FASTPASS approaching the 100 Metres, but when that runner shifted in, he could not fully ride GO GO GO out to the finish of the event as he was concerned that he may cause interference to HORSE OF GOOD LUCK which was positioned to his inside.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

<21/3/2024 Additional Veterinary Reports>The Veterinary Surgeon reported that HORSE OF GOOD LUCK was lame in its left front leg on the day after racing. Before being allowed to race again, HORSE OF GOOD LUCK will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race revealed that the horse was displaying an irregular heart rhythm.  Before being allowed to race again, JUNE PLANET will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination..

When questioned, B Shinn stated that from a wide barrier he was given no specific instructions as to where to settle his mount.  He said after SKY HEART began well, he rode his mount forward in an endeavour to maintain his position but when a number of runners to his inside showed intent on holding a more forward position, he elected to come back and follow TOP PEAK.  He added his decision to obtain cover was influenced by the fact that he would have had to make too much use of his mount to cross runners to his inside and that SKY HEART was up in weight and in distance today and this may have resulted in his mount left without a finishing effort.  B Shinn further stated that after obtaining cover behind TOP PEAK, SKY HEART travelled well, but disappointed in the Home Straight in that it failed to respond strongly to his riding when placed under pressure. After the 500 Metres endeavoured to improve into a narrow run between WAR OF COURAGE and TOP PEAK and as a result made contact with the hindquarters of TOP PEAK, resulting in TOP PEAK shifting in and crowding SOARING BRONCO.
Noted to have sustained a laceration to the left hind leg after the race.

Jumped only fairly and then was crowded.  Held up for clear running from the 450 Metres and then shifted to the outside of SKY HEART after the 400 Metres to obtain clear running.  When being shifted out, FIGHT TIME made contact with LUCKY FIONN.  Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out to the finish when held up behind SKY HEART and LUCKY FIONN.

After the race, R Moore stated that after his mount jumped awkwardly and lost ground, he was obliged to make use of GOOD GOOD throughout the early and middle stages to hold his position.  He said in the Home Straight GOOD GOOD finished the race off in a one-paced manner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
After the 500 Metres was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Crowded shortly after the start by WAR OF COURAGE which shifted in.  Raced keenly in the middle stages.
Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight, C L Chau stated that when his mount travelled strongly after the 400 Metres he was reluctant to place it under pressure as COMMANDING MISSILE had not finished its races off at its previous race starts.  He stated that between the 400 Metres and the 250 Metres as COMMANDING MISSILE continued to travel strongly into the event, he held his mount together to encourage it to improve and approaching the 250 Metres he then commenced to ride his mount along when SMART LEADER improved to his outside.  He added COMMANDING MISSILE responded reasonably well to his riding, however, he was unable to prevent the winner SMART LEADER improving past his mount.  The Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Chau were reasonable in the circumstances.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
Crowded on jumping and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.

Jumped only fairly.  After the race, Z Purton could offer no excuse for his mount’s failure to finish the race off.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.  Noted to have lost its right front plate after the race.

In the early stages raced keenly and when being shifted behind DAY DAY RICH approaching the 800 Metres was steadied away from the heels of that runner.  After the 150 Metres had some difficulty obtaining clear running when being shifted to the outside of SWEET DIAMOND which shifted out.
From the 850 Metres raced wide and without cover.

Jumped awkwardly and then blundered shortly after the start.  Near the 950 Metres was briefly crowded by THE GOOD DEAL which shifted in and then was awkwardly placed on the heels of E GLORY for some distance thereafter.  Passing the 50 Metres was shifted to the outside of THE GOOD DEAL to continue into clear running.
No report.

For a short distance approaching the 400 Metres was held up for clear running behind NOBLE ONE and shifted to that runner’s inside to improve.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shortly after the start was hampered when taken out by E GLORY.

Jumped awkwardly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, DAY DAY RICH will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

For some distance approaching the 1100 Metres raced tight to the inside of SUPERB BOY which initially raced in restricted room to the inside of ALL FOR ST PAUL’S. At the 1100 Metres SUPERB BOY (A Badel) shifted in when not quite clear of THE GOLDEN SCENERY, resulting  in THE GOLDEN SCENERY having to steady to avoid the heels of SUPERB BOY.  A Badel was severely reprimanded.   Shifted out after the 1100 Metres and made contact with RISING FROM ASHES for some distance thereafter.  Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned, H Bowman stated that his instructions were to endeavour to have MUGEN settle in the early stages as it was stepping up to 1600 Metres for the first time.  He stated that MUGEN jumped only fairly and he allowed the horse to settle towards the rear of the field where it travelled comfortably.  He added that from the 600 Metres he commenced to allow MUGEN to improve into the event and was able to secure clear running after the 500 Metres.  He further stated that MUGEN initially responded to his riding but after improving to the outside of THE GOLDEN SCENERY near the 200 Metres finished the race off in a one-paced manner and, in his opinion, may not have run out a strong 1600 Metres.  Trainer P C Ng confirmed the instructions and stated that he issued such instructions on the basis that MUGEN had raced a little keenly after being ridden along in the early stages at its last start and the fact that it was stepping up to 1600 Metres.  Mr Ng expressed satisfaction with the manner in which H Bowman rode the horse today and agreed with Jockey Bowman that MUGEN may not have run out a strong 1600 Metres and his intention would be to drop it back in distance for its next race start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly, shifted in and was corrected by its rider.
Shortly after the start was crowded between RISING FROM ASHES and ALL FOR ST PAUL’S which shifted in as it was being corrected by its rider M F Poon.

After the race, A Badel stated that his mount raced a little keenly in the early stages but failed to run on in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Crowded on jumping.  After the 1100 Metres THE GOLDEN SCENERY shifted to the outside of SUPERB BOY, resulting in RISING FROM ASHES being taken wider and SUPERB BOY and RISING FROM ASHES making contact for some distance thereafter.  Approaching the 400 Metres was steadied away from MUGEN which shifted out and away from THE GOLDEN SCENERY.
When questioned, M L Yeung stated that from a wide barrier he was instructed to obtain cover on his mount and ride it in a conservative manner in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
H Bentley pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 300 Metres (see FOREMOST TEDDY).

Near the 300 Metres was brushed.  Over the final 100 Metres raced tight when crowded between MR ALADDIN and JUMBO LEGEND.  When questioned, B Avdulla stated that his instructions were to hold an on-pace position preferably with cover but not to lead.  He said whilst the pace of the event was outside of standard throughout the early stages, he was reluctant to allow ATOMIC BEAUTY to stride forward considering his instructions.  He added that entering the Back Straight he allowed ATOMIC BEAUTY to improve slightly forward, but was reluctant to continue when he observed FOREMOST TEDDY to his inside commencing to shift out and as a result he elected to maintain his position behind that runner.  He stated as a result ATOMIC BEAUTY was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Slow to begin.  Approaching the 400 Metres was briefly held up for clear running.  After the 300 Metres was held up behind FOREMOST TEDDY and shifted to the outside of FOREMOST TEDDY and ATOMIC BEAUTY approaching the 200 Metres to obtain clear running.   Over the final 100 Metres was crowded between ATOMIC BEAUTY which was taken out by MR ALADDIN (H Bentley) and UNITED ENDEAVORS (M L Yeung) which shifted in whilst being ridden along.  M L Yeung was severely reprimanded for not making sufficient effort to straighten his mount and H Bentley was reprimanded for permitting his mount to shift out.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced keenly in the lead in the early and middle stages.

Bumped shortly after the start.  Over the final 50 Metres was held up for clear running behind GALLANT CROWN and could not be ridden out to the finish of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shortly after the start was steadied when crowded between ATOMIC BEAUTY and WINNING SEVEN which was taken out by UNITED ENDEAVORS.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Bumped shortly after the start.
Crowded shortly after the start and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

After the race, K Teetan stated that the intention was to be closer in the event, however, his mount failed to show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position.  He added when the pace of the race increased from the 700 Metres VIVA HUNTER came under pressure and did not finish the race off from that point.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 1450 Metres was steadied to avoid the heels of GALLANT CROWN (K C Leung) which shifted in when not quite clear.  K C Leung was reprimanded.  H Bentley (MR ALADDIN) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 300 Metres he directed his mount out, resulting in MR ALADDIN making heavy contact with FOREMOST TEDDY, taking FOREMOST TEDDY from its rightful running and resulting in the horse becoming badly unbalanced.  H Bentley was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 3 April 2024 at Sha Tin.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good race riding record.
Withdrawn on 26.3.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (left front tendon injury) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter JUMBO LEGEND.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Over the final 300 Metres lay out and proved difficult to ride.
No report.
No report.
No report.

After the race, an endoscopic examination was conducted on THE PERFECT MATCH at the request of Trainer C S Shum.  The Veterinary Surgeon said this examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, THE PERFECT MATCH will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

When questioned regarding his riding over the final 300 Metres, B Avdulla stated that after settling towards the rear of the field approaching the 300 Metres, his mount commenced to finish the race off well.  He said as a result when there was no run available behind PROSECCO, he then elected to shift in to secure clear running.  He said near the 200 Metres he observed a run become available between RED ELEGANCE and PARENTS’ LOVE and initially was going to take advantage of that run, however, when PARENTS’ LOVE shifted out approaching the 150 Metres when being corrected by its rider Apprentice Y L Chung, he then elected to shift to that runner’s inside in an attempt to secure clear running between PARENTS’ LOVE and GLORY ELITE.  He added when GLORY ELITE shifted out and PARENTS’ LOVE maintained a straight course, this resulted in FLYING PHANTOM being badly held up over the final 100 Metres and not being able to be ridden out to the finish of the event.  After considering B Avdulla’s explanations, the Stewards were satisfied that near the 150 Metres Apprentice Chung had endeavoured to correct his mount which resulted In PARENTS’ LOVE shifting out slightly and in the circumstances were satisfied that B Avdulla’s decision to shift to the inside of that runner was reasonable in the circumstances.
Jumped awkwardly and then was badly crowded between RED ELEGANCE and METRO WARRIOR, both of which shifted ground.

Bumped on the hindquarters on jumping and became unbalanced.  When questioned regarding his riding in the middle stages and as to whether there was an opportunity to move out to the stands rail near the 800 Metres to follow SUPER COMMANDER, H Bowman stated that after following GUSTY FIGHTER, he was reluctant to shift to the rail as this would have resulted in him having only one option to improve into the event.  He said as a result he elected to remain racing behind GUSTY FIGHTER but when that runner did not improve approaching the 500 Metres, he then looked to shift to the stands rail, however, was prevented from doing so as PROSECCO had improved to his outside.  He added as a result METRO WARRIOR lost some momentum approaching the 400 Metres when positioned behind GUSTY FIGHTER before shifting to the inside of that runner near the 350 Metres whereby METRO WARRIOR finished the race off reasonably well.  The Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Bowman in the circumstances were reasonable.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
C L Chau was fined $2,000 for initially presenting himself to be weighed out with the incorrect saddle cloth number.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 600 Metres was bumped by FLYING MOJITO which shifted out, resulting in FORERUNNER then being obliged to race wide and without cover thereafter.
No report.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Noted to have sustained a wound to the left front leg after the race.

Became fractious in the Parade Ring and made contact with a parade ring partition.  Examined by the Veterinary  Officer on arrival at the Start and passed suitable to race.  Crowded shortly after the start by SMART FIGHTER which shifted in and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Near the 200 Metres was eased when crowded between SMART FIGHTER and DARING PURSUIT which lay in.  After the race, Z Purton reported that his mount raced too keenly throughout the middle stages and got its head up when being steadied away from SMART FIGHTER.  He added that as a result GOLDEN RISE did not finish the race off strongly in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Slow to begin.
No report.
No report.
In the Home Straight lay out and proved difficult to ride.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped awkwardly.  After the race, K De Melo reported that his mount made a respiratory noise on pulling up.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Before being allowed to race again, BRAVE WITNESS will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
After the race, K Teetan reported that from the outside barrier and with his mount stepping up in distance, he was instructed to obtain a more forward position on TEAM HAPPY today.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Jumped awkwardly.

When questioned regarding his riding in the early and middle stages, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that his instructions were to take up a forward position and if the pace was not too fast, he had the option to lead.  He said when caught wide in the early stages he elected to push forward and take up a position outside KILINDINI near the 1200 Metres.  He added after the 1000 Metres when L Ferraris, the rider of KILINDINI, steadied his mount, he maintained an even pace to the outside of that runner, but was reluctant to ride his mount forward as he felt the pace of the event was being run at standard time and he would have had to make use of his mount to cross KILINDINI.  He stated that when KILINDINI then improved back to his inside near the 850 Metres, DRAGON STAR commenced to race a little keenly and as a result maintained its position to the outside of KILINDINI for some distance thereafter.
Shifted out on jumping and was bumped.
Bumped on jumping.
No report.

Jumped awkwardly, made contact with the right side of its barrier and became unbalanced.  Then shifted in and bumped COMET SPLENDIDO.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings. <28/3/2024 Additional Veterinary Reports> KILINDINI, which performed disappointingly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings. KILINDINI was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer W K Mo this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its right front leg. Before being allowed to race again, KILINDINI will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

In the early stages raced tight to the inside of KILINDINI.  After being crossed by KILINDINI near the 1200 Metres commenced to race keenly and was steadied away from the heels of that runner.  Near the 1000 Metres when KILINDINI was steadied when positioned to the inside of DRAGON STAR, CALIFORNIA ICON commenced to race keenly and was shifted to the outside of KILINDINI to avoid that runner.
Jumped awkwardly and then was crowded shortly after the start.

After the race, A Badel stated that his instructions were to endeavour to hold a forward position but his mount failed to show sufficient pace to do so in the early stages.  He said as a result AMAZING TEENS was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  He further stated that his mount raced "flat” throughout the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of AMAZING TEENS, a last start winner, was considered to be disappointing as compared to its last start.  Before being allowed to race again, AMAZING TEENS will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Withdrawn on 26.3.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame left hind and right fore) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter PACKING WISHER.  Before being allowed to race again, PO ON WAY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

After the race, H Bowman stated that with the pace of the event being run outside of standard time, GOLDEN DARCI raced keenly throughout the early and middle stages and was steadied away from RIVER VIEWS.  He said as a result GOLDEN DARCI finished the race off in a one-paced manner in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Fractious in the barriers, delaying the start.  Before being allowed to race again, PATCH OF TIME will be required to perform satisfactorily in a stalls test.

After the race, C L Chau stated that his intention was to be more forward on his mount, but when a number of runners to his inside held their position in the early stages, he elected to shift in and take a handy position with cover behind PATCH OF TIME.
Jumped only fairly.  In the early stages raced keenly and near the 900 Metres shifted out when being steadied away from CHILLI BABA.
Raced keenly in the early stages.  Near the 900 Metres was hampered when taken wider by JUMBO FORTUNE which shifted out when racing keenly.
After the race, A Badel stated that from an inside barrier he was able to obtain a more forward position on his mount.

Withdrawn on 29.3.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (swollen right fore) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter VERBIER.  Before being allowed to race again, BEAUTY CHAMP will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Withdrawn on 28.3.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (inappetence) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter WAR OF COURAGE.  Before being allowed to race again, PACKING WISHER will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Near the 900 Metres SUPERB KID and VIVA GRACIOUSNESS were steadied when crowded by SUNNY DARLING (Apprentice Y L Chung) which, after initially shifting in, was then corrected by its rider.  A short distance later, BEAUTY FIT (A Hamelin) shifted in, taking SUNNY DARLING in and again crowding VIVA GRACIOUSNESS and SUPERB KID.  Both Apprentice Chung and A Hamelin were reprimanded.  Near the 400 Metres raced tight between ORIENTAL SMOKE and VIVA GRACIOUSNESS and as a result made contact with ORIENTAL SMOKE.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Crowded shortly after the start.

Jumped awkwardly and then from the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After improving to the inside of ALL IS GOOD after the 600 Metres was then steadied when briefly crowded by ALL IS GOOD which shifted in.  From the 400 Metres was held up for clear running and then was shifted to the outside where it secured a clear run approaching the 200 Metres.
Jumped awkwardly, resulting in it shifting in and making contact with ALL IS GOOD.  Crowded on two occasions near the 900 Metres.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Crowded at the start and became unbalanced.  After this incident, despite being ridden along in the early stages was unable to show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position.

Jumped only fairly and then was crowded shortly after the start by CITY THUNDER which was positioned tight to the inside of BEAUTY FIT.  The performance of SATIRICAL FAN, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, SATIRICAL FAN will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped at the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 500 Metres was shifted to the outside of MAGNIFICENT NINE and in doing so made contact with AMAZING VICTORY.

Bumped at the start.  After the 300 Metres became held up behind FUN TOGETHER for a short distance and did not obtain clear running over the final 150 Metres.

Raced keenly in the early stages and got its head up approaching the 1000 Metres when being crossed by SAKEWIN.  Approaching the 200 Metres, when commencing to give ground, was steadied when crowded between SAKEWIN which shifted out and made slight contact with AEROINVINCIBLE and FUN TOGETHER which shifted in slightly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  A Atzeni pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference approaching the 800 Metres (see BIG RED).
No report.
No report.

A Atzeni (AEROINVINCIBLE) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that approaching the 800 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when insufficiently clear of BIG RED, resulting in BIG RED having to be checked.  A Atzeni was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Wednesday, 17 April 2024 and to expire on Sunday, 21 April 2024 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In addition, Jockey Atzeni was fined $60,000.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his neutral race riding record.
Stumbled shortly after the start after being bumped by YOU’REMYEVERYTHING.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly and then was crowded shortly after the start.

When questioned, H Bowman stated that it was not his intention to lead the event, but shortly after the start his mount blundered which then resulted in KING MILES commencing to race keenly and improving to lead.  He stated that given the manner in which his mount was racing, he was reluctant to restrain it to obtain cover, and when SEA SAPPHIRE crossed to the position to his outside near the 900 Metres, KING MILES would not relax in the lead.  He added that as a result KING MILES was left vulnerable at the end of the race.  Trainer K W Lui confirmed the instructions were to obtain a forward position from the inside barrier but not to lead on KING MILES.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 150 Metres was steadied and directed to the outside of KING MILES to obtain clear running.
Shifted out on jumping and was bumped on the hindquarters.
No report.

After the race, L Ferraris stated that on jumping his left foot made contact with SUNNY DA BEST and as a result he looked down to reposition his foot in the stirrup iron.  Approaching the 900 Metres KING OBERON was checked when crowded by SUNNY DA BEST (K De Melo) which, after being steadied away from YOU’REMYEVERYTHING, shifted in, crowding KING OBERON.  K De Melo was reprimanded.  In issuing a reprimand, the Stewards acknowledged that Jockey De Melo had corrected his mount when it shifted in towards KING OBERON.
Jumped awkwardly and then was crowded shortly after the start.  Crowded near the 900 Metres.

After the race, C L Chau stated that his mount may not have been suited by the track conditions which, whilst still rated as "Good”, had some effects of light rain which had fallen during the meeting.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the race, A Badel reported that at its last race start SEA SAPPHIRE was advantaged by being able to obtain the lead from the inside barrier.  He said today he was obliged to make some use of SEA SAPPHIRE to take up a position outside the lead and as a consequence the horse gave ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
In the middle stages raced keenly and after the 900 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from LUCY IN THE SKY.

Sent for sampling post-race.  Apprentice E C W Wong was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference approaching the 700 Metres (see YOUTHFUL SPIRITS).

Apprentice Wong was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Sunday, 7 April 2024 and to expire on Thursday, 11 April 2024 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In addition, Apprentice Wong was fined $10,000. When questioned, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that in the middle stages when the pace of the event eased slightly, SUPERB MOVE commenced to race keenly.  He said approaching the 800 Metres SUPERB MOVE became awkwardly placed behind SUPER HORNET and when he was unable to sufficiently restrain his mount to avoid that runner’s heels, it shifted to the outside of SUPER HORNET and as a result made contact with M M NEBULA, resulting in SUPERB MOVE becoming unbalanced.  He added that on the Home Turn he was then held up for clear running behind ANGELS HUNTER and did not obtain clear running until after the 300 Metres when he improved between M M NEBULA and JOYFUL CHAMPION.

Trainer P C Ng stated that with the early stages of the event being run inside of standard time, M M NEBULA was not provided with the opportunity to travel comfortably.  He stated that, in his opinion, M M NEBULA was also disadvantaged when being bumped by SUPERB MOVE approaching the 700 Metres and as a result was unable to finish the race off.  He added however he would now drop M M NEBULA back in distance for its next race start on the All Weather surface.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned, L Ferraris stated that his mount was reluctant to jump from the starting gates and as a result missed the start.  He said after settling back in the field, he was obliged to make use of MISSION BRAVO throughout the early and middle stages to hold his position.  He added although MISSION BRAVO raced tight to the inside of THE CONCENTRATION near the 200 Metres, it finished the race off in a disappointing manner.  Assistant Trainer Y H Wong advised that MISSION BRAVO had pleased the stable coming into the event and that the stable was not able to offer any reason as to why the horse was slow to begin at its recent race starts.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The barrier manners and performance of MISSION BRAVO were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, MISSION BRAVO will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments. A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.

Jumped awkwardly.  When questioned, H Bentley stated that his instructions were to settle his mount where comfortable, however, the stable was confident that FRUITY WARRIOR would be able to run out a strong 2000 Metres.  He said from an inside barrier he was able to obtain an on-pace position in the early stages behind SATIRICAL GLORY.  He said with the early pace of the event being run inside of standard time, he was concerned that the leader SPECIAL HEDGE may ease the pace in the Back Straight and for this reason he elected to shift his mount to the outside of SATIRICAL GLORY to avoid being positioned in amongst horses.  He added that after holding a position to the outside of SATIRICAL GLORY near the 1300 Metres, he was reluctant to continue forward as he was concerned that H Bowman, rider of SATIRICAL GLORY, would shift away from the rail, resulting in his mount racing wide and without cover.  He stated that as he remained racing behind and to the outside of SATIRICAL GLORY, that runner shifted away from the rail, resulting in FRUITY WARRIOR being taken three wide and without cover.  He said given the pace of the event continuing to be running inside of standard, he elected to remain racing in that position rather than attempting to go forward and cross SATIRICAL GLORY which would have resulted in the pace of the event increasing.  He further stated that from the 500 Metres FRUITY WARRIOR came under pressure and raced in a disappointing manner thereafter.  The Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Bentley were reasonable in the circumstances.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned regarding his riding, B Avdulla stated that he was instructed to ride KA YING VICTORY in a conservative manner in the early stages as it did at its most recent barrier trials on 15 and 26 March 2024.  He said as a result he elected in the early stages to obtain a position behind GRACIOUS EXPRESS where his mount travelled well.  He said in the Home Straight his preference was to shift to the outside of GRACIOUS EXPRESS to improve as he was concerned that had he improved to the inside of that runner, KA YING VICTORY may have experienced difficulty obtaining clear running due to both GRACIOUS EXPRESS and EIGHTY LIGHT YEARS being favourite runners.  He added when PARTERRE did not improve into the event he was then momentarily held up behind GRACIOUS EXPRESS near the 300 Metres before shifting to that runner’s inside at the 200 Metres to secure clear running where his mount found the line well.  Trainer D J Hall confirmed the instructions issued and advised that he had instructed B Avdulla to ride KA YING VICTORY in a conservative manner in the early stages as it had finished off both barrier trials well when being ridden in that manner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Approaching the 150 Metres bumped with LADY’S CHOICE and became unbalanced.  When questioned, A Atzeni stated that he was given no specific instructions other than he had expected to take up a forward position.  He stated in the early stages when positioned to the outside of SEA AIR LEGEND, his initial intention was to endeavour to obtain cover behind that runner, but when NORTHERN BEACHES improved to his inside and the early pace of the event was being run outside of standard time, he was unable to do so and raced wide and without cover.  He added as a result near the 900 Metres he commenced a forward move to cross SEA AIR LEGEND where he was able to obtain a position in the lead near the 750 Metres.  When questioned if there was an opportunity to restrain his mount to race behind LADY’S CHOICE, A Atzeni stated that he felt CHAMPION INSTINCT was racing comfortably and when he was satisfied that the pace of the event was not too quick, he was content to allow his mount to continue to maintain its position in advance of LADY’S CHOICE.  The Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Atzeni were reasonable in the circumstances.

Further assessment revealed that LUCKY SWEYNESSE has sustained a fracture to its left fore cannon bone that will require surgical intervention followed by a period of rest and rehabilitation before returning to training and racing.  Therefore, LUCKY SWEYNESSE will not race in the Chairman’s Sprint Prize (Group 1) to be conducted at Sha Tin on Sunday, 28 April 2024. LUCKY SWEYNESSE will be required to pass an official veterinary examination before being entered to race.

He added as a result STREET CONQUEROR was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight and, in his opinion, may be better suited being ridden more conservatively in the early stages. A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

K De Melo (SUPER EAGLE) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 1000 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of KING OBERON, resulting in KING OBERON having to be checked.  K De Melo was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Sunday, 28 April 2024 at Sha Tin.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good race riding record.

He said after riding his mount along in the early stages to comply with his instructions, when MR VALIANT held the lead, he elected to take up a position to that runner’s outside.  He added that in the Home Straight SAVVY CHIC failed to respond to his riding and gave ground.  Trainer F C Lor confirmed the instructions and stated that he issued such instructions on the basis that SAVVY CHIC was able to win in the same grade when racing in an on-pace position and also barrier trialed well on 2 April 2024 when it led.  He added that, in his opinion, SAVVY CHIC may have been better suited by being allowed to stride forward in the early stages and cross MR VALIANT.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Before being allowed to race again, SAVVY CHIC will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

When the pace steadied near the 900 Metres commenced to race keenly and was steadied away from LOVERO.  The Stewards considered a protest/objection lodged by Mr C S Shum, trainer of 5th placegetter, EIGHTEEN PALMS, against IVY LEAGUE being declared the winner alleging interference over the concluding stages.  After considering the evidence, the Stewards overruled the protest/objection when they found that whilst IVY LEAGUE had shifted in, crowding and resulting in EIGHTEEN PALMS being checked, they were not satisfied that had such interference not occurred, EIGHTEEN PALMS would have finished in advance of IVY LEAGUE.  Weighed-in was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.  At a subsequent inquiry, Mr Shum was fined the sum of $5,000 for lodging a frivolous protest/objection.  Approaching the finish was checked when crowded by IVY LEAGUE (K De Melo) which shifted in.  K De Melo was severely reprimanded for making insufficient effort to prevent his mount from shifting in.

He added when placed under pressure in the Home Straight SUNSTRIDER found the line reasonably well, but, in his opinion, would appreciate being stepped up in distance.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Before being allowed to race again, FLAGSHIP WARRIOR will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

He said over the concluding stages he stopped riding MODEST GENTLEMAN for one stride before realising his mount had not reached the winning post which resulted in him resuming riding it out to the finish.  Jockey Chau was reprimanded and advised that he must show better judgement than what he did on this occasion and ensure his mounts are ridden out to the end of the race.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Trainer K W Lui confirmed the instructions issued.
