When questioned regarding his riding in the early stages, H Bowman stated that the intention was to lead on the horse.  He said after commencing well he noticed JOY COMING to his inside being ridden vigorously by its rider L Hewitson.  He said approaching the first turn he was of the opinion he would have had to make use of his mount to cross JOY COMING and when he was satisfied that the pace of the event was sufficient to allow him to race outside of JOY COMING, he elected to remain to its outside.  He added that entering the Back Straight CELESTIAL COLOURS took some time to balance up and after being placed under pressure in the Home Straight CELESTIAL COLOURS’ run ended near the 100 Metres.  He further stated that, in his view, the horse would derive benefit from tonight’s performance.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

The performance of PARENTS’ LOVE was considered to be disappointing as compared to its previous race start. Noted to have blood at the left nostril after the race.  An endoscopic examination conducted on GOKO WIN found that there was no blood in its trachea and therefore the blood in the nostril was determined to be not coming from the lungs and as such the horse was deemed not to have bled.
Jumped only fairly.

Near the 350 Metres was bumped and taken wider by CAPITAL DELIGHT.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, EASON will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

The Stewards deferred the declaration of weighed-in whilst they considered if HAPPY FAT CAT had been afforded a fair start.  After taking evidence from Jockey M F Poon, Trainer W K Mo and Starter A Speechley, the Stewards found that as the start was effected HAPPY FAT CAT anticipated the start, lunged forward and made contact with gates.  This resulted in HAPPY FAT CAT then sitting back in its barrier and losing significant ground.  As the Stewards were of the opinion that HAPPY FAT CAT had been afforded a fair start, weighed-in was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.  The Stewards ruled that the barrier manners of HAPPY FAT CAT were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, HAPPY FAT CAT will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After travelling a short distance bucked and was eased down from the event approaching the 1100 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The racing manners of NOT USUAL STAR were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, NOT USUAL STAR will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial carrying a raceday saddle.
Passing the 250 Metres M Chadwick dropped his whip.  Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight and the reason he positioned his mount out towards the middle of the track, H Bowman stated that in pre-race discussions with Trainer P C Ng, he had been given the option of racing in this position as a number of winners tonight had won from this position.  He said after racing outside the leader CALIFORNIA TOUCH, he allowed KA YING CHEER to shift out on the Home Turn, without having to direct his mount to do so, in accordance with the pre-race discussions that he had with connections.  Mr Ng confirmed that Jockey Bowman was given the option of allowing KA YING CHEER to race in this position in the Home Straight.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Trainer C S Shum confirmed the instructions and said he had expected the horse to settle in a midfield position.  He added he issued such instructions as CHAMPION METHOD had not finished its races off strongly at its most recent starts when ridden in a forward position and CHAMPION METHOD had settled further back tonight than he anticipated due to the horse jumping awkwardly.

Was a late withdrawal acting on veterinary advice after becoming fractious whilst being transported to the course and subsequently being found to be lame in its right front and right hind legs.  Before being allowed to race again, GLORY B will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Jumped awkwardly.  When questioned regarding the improved performance, Trainer W K Mo stated that after the horse’s last start he removed the hood for today’s race and gave the horse light work during the week to freshen it up as it was backing up within 7 days from its last start.  He said as a result URBAN TRIUMPH was able to settle in a slightly more forward position where it travelled well which he attributed to the race being run outside of standard time throughout the early and middle stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 250 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running between MR GOOD VIBES and GOOD VIEW GLORY and as a result made contact with the hindquarters of GOOD VIEW GLORY.  Was then held up for clear running behind MR GOOD VIBES before obtaining a tight run to the inside of that runner near the 150 Metres.  Noted to have sustained a small laceration to the left front pastern after the race.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Bumped on the hindquarters near the 250 Metres and became unbalanced.  Bumped by MR GOOD VIBES near the 25 Metres.  Prior to declaring weighed-in, the Stewards viewed the patrol films to ascertain if there were grounds for a protest/objection on behalf of the connections of GOOD VIEW GLORY, placed 4th, against MR GOOD VIBES being declared the 3rd placegetter.  When Jockey Purton did not lodge a protest/objection and the Stewards were satisfied there were not sufficient grounds to do so having regard to the margin of ½ length between both horses at the finish, weighed-in was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.  Subsequently the Stewards interviewed Jockey Purton in respect of his decision not to lodge a protest/objection.  He stated that as he felt GOOD VIEW GLORY had sufficient time to improve past MR GOOD VIBES in the Home Straight and the contact occurred close to the finishing line, he was of the opinion there were not sufficient grounds to do so.  When questioned, Z Purton stated that his instructions were not to hold a forward position, but from an inside barrier GOOD VIEW GLORY commenced well today and as a result he took advantage of the good start to hold a more forward position.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Shortly after the start blundered badly, resulting in its rider K H Chan being dislodged and LUCKY QUALITY then completing the race riderless.  Subsequently K H Chan was examined by the Chief Medical Officer who said he was not fit to fulfil his remaining race riding engagement.

Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  After the race, K De Melo reported that his intention was to hold a forward position but not necessarily lead.  He said after his mount commenced well, it was able to assume the lead without being pressured to do so.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly.  When questioned regarding his riding in the early part of the Home Straight and as to whether there was an opportunity to improve between HAPPY DAILY and WAR OF COURAGE sooner than he did, C Y Ho stated that after following HAPPY DAILY and having WINNING TURN positioned to his outside, he commenced to shift out with a view to obtaining clear running to the outside of HAPPY DAILY.  He said when WINNING TURN did not continue to give ground as he had expected, he was then held up for clear running between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres before shifting to the inside of HAPPY DAILY to secure clear running.  He added that when both HAPPY DAILY and WAR OF COURAGE shifted ground slightly, SIXTH GENERATION raced tight between those two runners between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres.  C Y Ho further stated that his decision to shift out initially was influenced by the fact that he felt WAR OF COURAGE would shift out, resulting in the run which was already tight closing and he was of the opinion his best option at that stage was to endeavour to improve to the outside.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the race, Apprentice Y L Chung reported that from a wide barrier he was instructed to take up a forward position.  Trainer C H Yip confirmed the instructions and stated that he issued such instructions on the basis that HAPPY DAILY had barrier trialed well on 9 April 2024 when it led and also he expected the pace of the event not to be quick in the early stages.

When questioned, L Ferraris reported that the intention was to hold a forward position, but on jumping his mount blundered when struck itself and as a result made contact with ACA POWER and lost ground.  He said as a consequence he elected to ride THE ABSOLUTE in a conservative manner in the early stages to avoid making use of his mount to go forward.  He added throughout the early stages THE ABSOLUTE over-raced as he endeavoured to obtain cover behind GOLDEN TITLE and for this reason rather than continuing to restrain his mount to obtain cover he elected to allow THE ABSOLUTE to stride forward from the 900 Metres to obtain a trailing position behind YOUTH POWER.  He stated although obliged to race in a three wide position, he was able to obtain cover throughout the middle stages and when placed under pressure in the Home Straight THE ABSOLUTE lay out and finished the race off only fairly.    After the race, the horse was noted to be making an abnormal respiratory noise.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Before being allowed to race again, THE ABSOLUTE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

M F Poon (FOXHUNTER WAY) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 200 Metres he allowed his mount to shift out, resulting in SMART BEAUTY being crowded for room between FOXHUNTER WAY and NORTHERN BEAST and having to be checked.  M F Poon was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 1 May 2024 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good race riding record.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages. He said STRONGEST BOY did not travel well throughout the event and dipped on a number of occasions.  He added that in the Home Straight when placed under pressure STRONGEST BOY responded only fairly, however, was held up for clear running between the 200 Metres and the 100 Metres behind EXCEL WONGCHOY which was giving ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of STRONGEST BOY was considered to be disappointing as compared to its previous starts.  Before being allowed to race again, STRONGEST BOY will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be lame in its right front leg.  Before being allowed to race again, UNITED ENDEAVORS will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

In considering the incident, the Stewards found that as UNITED ENDEAVORS was shifting in, it became awkwardly placed behind GOLDEN DARCI when that runner shifted out, causing UNITED ENDEAVORS to be steadied from the heels of GOLDEN DARCI.

Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  The performance of ROBOT FIGHTER, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable. Near the 1000 Metres MUST GO shifted out slightly after being crossed by ROBOT KNIGHT, resulting in MUST GO making contact with SOLID SHALAA and SOLID SHALAA becoming unbalanced when crowded between LUCKY BANNER and MUST GO. <22/4/2024 Additional Veterinary Reports>The Veterinary Surgeon reported that SOLID SHALAA was lame in its right front leg on the morning after racing. Refused to load and was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  The barrier manners of MIRACLES were considered unacceptable.  The Stewards ruled that MIRACLES must barrier trial satisfactorily on a minimum of two consecutive occasions prior to racing again.
Bumped at the start.  Leaving the 1400 Metres shifted in before being corrected by its rider and then shifted out when awkwardly placed behind BEER PALACE.  Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned, H Bowman stated that his intention from the outside barrier was to go forward and lead the event if possible.  He said his mount jumped only fairly, however, did not show sufficient pace in the early stages to hold a forward position although he did not pressure his mount to do so.  He added that with the pace of the event being run quicker than its most recent start, LAUGH TALE settled further back in the field.

Noted to have blood at its left nostril due to a small abrasion at the Start.  Examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race. Taken wider near the 800 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Before being allowed to race again, CALIFORNIATOTALITY will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Noted to have sustained a small wound below the left stifle after the race.

Bumped on the hindquarters shortly after the start and became unbalanced. Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 200 Metres lay in and then made contact with PATCH OF THETA (H Bowman) which was improving to the outside of CHIU CHOW SPIRIT to obtain clear running.  As a result, MAGNIFICENT NINE and PATCH OF THETA made contact on a number of occasions between the 200 Metres and the 150 Metres.  H Bowman was advised to exercise more care in similar circumstances.

He said despite riding his mount along in the early stages, FUN TOGETHER did not show sufficient pace to hold a forward position.  He added that when caught wide in the early stages, he attempted to obtain cover behind VIVA GRACIOUSNESS, but as his mount was travelling strongly and laying out, he was unable to do so which resulted in FUN TOGETHER being obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Bumped at the start.
Jumped awkwardly.  Raced keenly in the middle stages when positioned to the inside of AMAZING DUCK.

Jumped awkwardly and then was bumped shortly after.  Making the Home Turn was crowded when racing in restricted room between FUN TOGETHER and MAGNIFICENT NINE (Z Purton) which, after shifting into a tight run to the outside of ORIENTAL TYCOON, was then taken out slightly by that runner.  Z Purton was advised to exercise more care.  Between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres VIVA GRACIOUSNESS continued to be crowded between FUN TOGETHER and MAGNIFICENT NINE which was taken out by ORIENTAL TYCOON (Apprentice Y L Chung), resulting in VIVA GRACIOUSNESS having to be steadied near the 300 Metres.  Apprentice Chung was advised to exercise more care.

On arrival at the Start, Apprentice Y L Chung expressed concern with the horse’s action.  ORIENTAL TYCOON was examined by the Veterinary Officer and after the necessary consultations said the horse was suitable to race.  Was again examined by the Veterinary Officer after the race and found to have no significant findings.  Approaching the 250 Metres was steadied when crowded between MAGNIFICENT NINE which shifted in slightly and PATCH OF THETA (H Bowman) which shifted out before being corrected by its rider.  H Bowman was advised to exercise more care in similar circumstances.

Held up for clear running from the 300 Metres until approaching the 200 Metres.  C L Chau pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 200 Metres (see CORDYCEPS ONE).

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings. <22/4/2024 Additional Veterinary Reports>After the race, ALL RICHES was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings. ALL RICHES was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer P F Yiu yesterday morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its right front leg. Before being allowed to race again, ALL RICHES will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

A Hamelin was fined the sum of $2,000 for failing to present himself in the Parade Ring by the required time.  Near the 1150 Metres, when racing keenly, was steadied to avoid HAKKA RADIANCE which was positioned tight to the inside of CORDYCEPS ONE.

C L Chau (FAST VICTORY) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 200 Metres he directed his mount out when insufficiently clear of CORDYCEPS ONE, resulting in CORDYCEPS ONE losing its rightful running and having to be checked.  C L Chau was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Sunday, 5 May 2024 and to expire on Sunday, 12 May 2024 on which day he may resume race riding (3 Hong Kong racedays).  In addition, Jockey Chau was fined $90,000.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 3 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his neutral race riding record.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of BEAR SLAM was considered to be disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, BEAR SLAM will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

A short distance later STRIVE FOR GLORY was checked when FAIRY HORSE was taken in slightly when MA COMET was crowded by LEAN MASTER (H Bentley), which shifted in.  A Atzeni was advised to exercise more care to ensure that there is sufficient racing room when he improved into runs.  H Bentley was advised he must stop riding and straighten when his mounts shift ground when not clear to do so. Slow to begin.  Near the 600 Metres when racing tight to the inside of STRIVE FOR GLORY was steadied and then ran out across the heels of STRIVE FOR GLORY and was checked.  Crowded approaching the winning post.
No report.

When questioned regarding his riding in the middle stages of the event and as to whether there was an opportunity to improve sooner than what he did, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that from the outside barrier he was instructed to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages and if possible to make his run to the inside.  He said after settling back in the field he was reluctant from the 800 Metres to shift to the outside of BROTHER PEARL to improve into the event as he was concerned that his mount then would have to make a wide run, which would be contrary to his instructions.  When questioned specifically if there was an opportunity to ride his mount with more vigour from the 600 Metres when he lost his position behind BROTHER PEARL, Apprentice Wong agreed with the Stewards that in retrospect he had made an error of judgement in not placing his mount under pressure sooner than what he did on this occasion, but was concerned that had he ridden his mount from the 600 Metres he may have had his running interrupted when being positioned close to BROTHER PEARL.  Trainer P C Ng confirmed the instructions issued, however, agreed that there was an opportunity for Apprentice Wong to place his mount under pressure sooner than what he did.  After considering Apprentice Wong’s explanations and his inexperience as a 10 lb claiming apprentice, the Stewards elected to take no direct action against Apprentice Wong.  However, he was advised that his riding between the 600 Metres and the 400 Metres lacked the necessary judgement and that he should have placed his mount under pressure sooner than what he did to ensure that it maintained its position behind the runners in front.  Apprentice Wong was also referred to the Chief Riding Instructor for further training and mentoring.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 1600 Metres was shifted in to obtain cover behind SUPER HORNET and then commenced to race keenly and was steadied away from the heels of SUPER HORNET for some distance approaching the 1500 Metres.  When questioned, Apprentice Y L Chung stated that his instructions were from an inside barrier to hold a more forward position.  He stated that after racing in a handy position throughout the early and middle stages, he was then held up for clear running making the Home Turn behind SUPER HORNET and to the inside of FOXHUNTER WAY.  He added that when FOXHUNTER WAY did not improve into the event, he then continued to be held up to the inside of that runner and then in the Home Straight was unable to immediately shift to the outside of FOXHUNTER WAY when CIRCUIT ELITE was positioned to his outside.  He said as a result NINJA DERBY was held up for clear running until near the 200 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned regarding his riding and the reason his mount raced wide and without cover from the 1200 Metres, C L Chau stated that after obtaining a position with cover behind ALACRITY, CHILL CHIBI was then taken wider when THE BEST PEACH shifted out.  He said whilst there may have been an opportunity to obtain a trailing position behind THE BEST PEACH, he elected to remain racing wide and without cover from that point as the pace had eased.  He added that as CHILL CHIBI is one-paced, he then attempted to allow his mount to stride forward into the event, but as the pace increased from the 800 Metres, he was unable to do so which resulted in CHILL CHIBI being obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

After the 200 Metres became held up behind SWEET ENCOUNTER and when being shifted to that runner’s outside had difficulty obtaining clear running until approaching the 100 Metres.  Again became held up for clear running behind FLAMING RABBIT over the final 75 Metres and could not be fully tested to the finish of the event.
No report.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight and the reason he did not shift to the outside of SPEED DRAGON, M F Poon stated that on entering the Home Straight his mount was under pressure and not responding to his riding.  He said as a result he elected to continue to follow CHILL CHIBI the favourite into the event with a view to then shifting to that runner’s outside should his mount improve.  He added that approaching the 200 Metres TURIN MASCOT commenced to respond to his riding and when he then improved to the inside of SPEED DRAGON, he was unable to shift to that runner’s outside which resulted in TURIN MASCOT being held up for clear running over the final 150 Metres.  Whilst the Stewards found the explanations provided by Jockey Poon were reasonable in the circumstances, he was advised, wherever possible, he should avail himself with opportunities to ensure that his mounts obtain clear running.
No report.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Bumped on jumping.  After the race, Z Purton stated that with the pace of the event increasing from the 800 Metres, SWEET ENCOUNTER found it difficult to run out a strong 1800 Metres and gave ground over the final 100 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

After the 300 Metres shifted to the outside of SWEET DIAMOND in an attempt to secure clear running and made contact with BEAU GOSSE.  After the race, Z Purton reported that when his mount commenced well tonight, he elected to make use of the good start to ride forward and take up a position outside the lead.  He said however, in his opinion, given the manner in which his mount finished the race off, it would be better suited by being ridden in a more conservative manner in the early stages.  Trainer M Newnham stated that he expected TACTICAL COMMAND to take up a midfield position but agreed with the assessment of Jockey Purton that once the horse jumped well, he took advantage of its good start.  He also concurred with the views of Jockey Purton that TACTICAL COMMAND is better suited when being ridden in a more conservative manner in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shortly after the start was steadied when racing tight to the inside of VIVA HUNTER which shifted in and away from RELIABLE PROFIT after making contact with that runner.

L Hewitson (RELIABLE PROFIT) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 1500 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of VIVA HUNTER, resulting in VIVA HUNTER being taken in across the running of GOOD LUCK WIN which was checked.  L Hewitson was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 8 May 2024 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent careless riding record.   A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

The Stewards considered a protest/objection lodged by L Hewitson, the rider of the second placegetter, SECOND TO NONE, against TOP GUN (K Teetan) being declared the winner alleging interference over the final 150 Metres.  After considering the evidence, the Stewards found that leaving the 150 Metres TOP GUN shifted in, crowding the running of SECOND TO NONE for some distance which resulted in both runners making contact approaching the 100 Metres.  The Stewards also found that over the final 50 Metres SECOND TO NONE was afforded clear running during which period SECOND TO NONE failed to make any ground on TOP GUN.  After considering the manner in which both horses finished the race off, the Stewards were satisfied that had the interference not occurred after the 150 Metres, TOP GUN would have still finished in advance of SECOND TO NONE, the protest/objection was overruled and weighed-in was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.  K Teetan was advised to exercise more care.  Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned regarding his riding in the early part of the Home Straight and the reason he shifted to the outside of TELECOM FIGHTERS, L Hewitson stated that after following TELECOM FIGHTERS, his initial decision was to improve to that runner’s inside.  He said as he commenced to do so near the 400 Metres, WONDER KIT did not immediately respond to his riding and when he then was concerned that TELECOM FIGHTERS would shift in, crowding his running and halting his momentum, he then elected near the 350 Metres to shift to the outside of TELECOM FIGHTERS and LUCKY ENCOUNTER to obtain clear running.  He added that when being shifted to the outside of LUCKY ENCOUNTER, his mount brushed SUPREME LUCKY before finishing the race off well.  Whilst L Hewitson conceded that the run had remained open to the inside of TELECOM FIGHTERS in the Home Straight, the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Hewitson in the circumstances were reasonable having regard to the explanations he provided. When questioned regarding his riding, B Shinn stated that he had expected to take a position towards the rear of the field as STAR CLUB had performed best when being ridden in this manner.  When questioned regarding his riding making the Home Turn and as to whether there was an opportunity to improve to the outside of STORM RIDER, B Shinn stated that his instructions were to not expose his mount too early in the Home Straight as STAR CLUB has only a short sprint and if he placed his mount under pressure too soon it would not finish the race off well.  He added for this reason he elected to remain racing at the rear of the field behind GUSTOSISIMO which he felt was still travelling reasonably well and would provide him with a horse to follow into the race.  He said when GUSTOSISIMO did not initially respond to his rider’s urgings in the early part of the Home Straight, he became held up for clear running behind that runner until near the 300 Metres when he shifted to its inside in an attempt to secure clear running.  He added that at this point TELECOM POWER was giving ground and he was then held up behind that runner before obtaining clear running after the 200 Metres.  Trainer D J Hall confirmed the instructions issued and confirmed that he had specifically asked Jockey Shinn not to improve into the event too soon as the horse had not finished its races off when ridden in this manner previously.  After considering his explanations, the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Shinn in the circumstances were reasonable, however, the Stewards advised that with the benefit of hindsight the better option would have been to shift to the outside of STORM RIDER making the Home Turn which would have allowed him to improve into the race in the early part of the Home Straight.

K C Leung was fined a sum of $40,000.  When considering the appropriate penalty, the Stewards took into account the consequential effects of Jockey Leung’s actions in that he failed to ride his mount out over approximately the final 25 Metres and had prejudiced his connections’ chances in obtaining 6th prizemoney of $440,000. When questioned, B Avdulla stated that his mount jumped awkwardly which resulted in his left foot shifting in his stirrup iron.  He said as a result he was obliged to re-position his foot in the stirrup iron and MUST GO settled further back than what had been intended. Trainer J Richards reported that he had been pleased with the horse’s work leading into the race and had expected it to run well.  He said the only explanation he could offer was that HINOKAMI KAGURA is still relatively inexperienced and may not have appreciated the kickback it received on today’s surface.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of HINOKAMI KAGURA was considered to be disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, HINOKAMI KAGURA will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination. When questioned as to why his mount raced in a three wide position after starting from barrier 1, H Bowman stated that he was requested by connections to attempt to have his mount race away from the rail as STAR MAC has performed better when ridden in this manner.  He stated that after travelling a short distance he shifted away from the rail with a view to obtaining a position behind the favourite in the event SUNSTRIDER.  He said leaving the 1500 Metres his mount shifted out slightly which allowed ILLUMINOUS to improve to his inside and as a result he was then obliged to race three wide.  He added that although he was obliged to travel wide in the event, he was satisfied with his position as his mount obtained cover behind KIMBERLEY, however, in the Home Straight STAR MAC finished the race off in a one-paced manner.  Trainer D A Hayes confirmed the instructions issued.

When questioned regarding his riding, A Atzeni stated that his intention was to ride his mount in a forward position in a similar way in which it was ridden when it performed well in the Hong Kong Derby on 24 March 2024.  He said in the early stages when MOMENTS IN TIME held the lead, he was aware that the pace of the event was being run inside of standard time, however, KA YING GENERATION was travelling comfortably in a position to the outside of MOMENTS IN TIME.  He added that from the 800 Metres KA YING GENERATION came under pressure and failed to finish the race off from that point.  When asked if there was an opportunity to take a trailing position behind MOMENTS IN TIME, A Atzeni stated that due to his mount carrying a light weight and it had raced well when being allowed to run freely at its last start, he felt that his best option was to remain racing outside of MOMENTS IN TIME to take advantage of the light weight.  He said however with the benefit of hindsight, he may have been better suited by obtaining cover in the middle stages behind MOMENTS IN TIME. Jumped awkwardly and then was crowded shortly after the start by LUCKY QUALITY which shifted out.  Approaching the 1000 Metres shifted out when being steadied away from LUCKY QUALITY. He added EVER SMART travelled only fairly during the running of the event and finished the race off in a one-paced manner. Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.

Jumped awkwardly and made contact with the left side of its barrier.  Near the 600 Metres was eased away from CHATEAUNEUF (Z Purton) which shifted in.  Z Purton was advised to ensure that he is sufficiently clear when shifting ground.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Approaching the 700 Metres commenced to race keenly and was steadied away from GRATEFUL HEART.  After the 100 Metres shifted out under pressure, resulting in its rider K C Leung having to stop riding and straighten his mount.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

Jumped awkwardly and made contact with BRIGHT INHERITANCE. Raced wide and without cover from the 800 Metres. After the race, B Thompson advised that his intention was to take up a forward position, but after his mount jumped awkwardly, he elected to obtain cover in a midfield position to avoid having to make use of his mount.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
No report.
Jumped awkwardly.

After the race, K De Melo stated that he had some concern with his mount’s action when it was under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Before being allowed to race again, GRATEFUL HEART will be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments.
Bumped at the start.

On arrival at the Start, L Ferraris expressed concern with the action of ARMOUR WAR EAGLE.  ARMOUR WAR EAGLE was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said the horse was lame in its left front leg and as such was not suitable to race.  Acting on this advice, ARMOUR WAR EAGLE was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  Before being allowed to race again, ARMOUR WAR EAGLE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Jumped only fairly.

At declaration time, A Atzeni was declared as the rider of both ACE ONE and SUPER GLORY.  It was established that A Atzeni had a firm commitment to ride SUPER GLORY.  As such, the Stewards permitted H Bowman to be substituted as the rider of ACE ONE.  For this declaration error, Trainer D J Whyte was fined $2,000.  When questioned regarding his riding, H Bowman stated that from the outside barrier he was instructed to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages as connections had assessed the early pace of the event would potentially be run inside of standard time.  He said after settling back in the field he rode his mount along from the 600 Metres to improve where ACE ONE responded only fairly to his riding.  He said entering the Home Straight he considered shifting to the outside of LUCKY QUALITY, but as ACE ONE was not travelling well enough to do so, he then elected to endeavour to improve into a run between LUCKY QUALITY and SUPER GLORY.  He added that when SUPER GLORY shifted out slightly near the 250 Metres, he then directed his mount to the inside of SUPER GLORY to obtain clear running, however, shortly after SUPER GLORY shifted back in and when ACE ONE was then positioned inside the heels of SUPER GLORY, he was held up for clear running between the 200 Metres and the 150 Metres.  He further stated that over the concluding stages ACE ONE finished the race off only fairly.  Trainer D J Whyte confirmed the instructions issued and stated that whilst ACE ONE had been ridden forward from wide draws in the past, such instructions were issued to offset the expected fast early pace of the event.  The Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Bowman, having regard to his explanations, were reasonable in the circumstances.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Blundered on jumping.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Knuckled over on jumping and lost ground.  In the early part of the Home Straight lay in when reluctant to shift to the outside of DOUBLE SHOW.  Then continued to lay in and had some difficulty obtaining clear running approaching the 200 Metres when positioned behind ALLOY KING.  After the race, B Thompson reported that after obtaining clear running approaching the 200 Metres his mount finished the race off only fairly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, H Z TOURBILLON will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Jumped only fairly.  Shortly after the start was crowded for room.  Leaving the 900 Metres commenced to over-race and for some distance thereafter got its head up when being steadied to avoid the heels of FIRE BALL.

Shortly after the start was steadied when crowded between ALLOY KING (H Bentley) which shifted in slightly and WOODFIRE CHAMP which was taken out by FIRE BALL which in turn was taken out slightly by HERO STAR (Y L Chung).  Both H Bentley and Y L Chung were advised to exercise more care.  From the 700 Metres raced very wide and without cover.
No report.

Was a late withdrawal acting on veterinary advice after sustaining a wound to the right hind leg and being found to be lame in the right front leg after becoming fractious whilst being transported to the racecourse.  Before being allowed to race again, YOUTH POWER will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly.  After the race, A Atzeni reported that from an inside barrier he was requested to take up a forward position.  Trainer C W Chang confirmed the instructions and advised he issued such instructions to take advantage of tonight’s racing pattern which, in his opinion, had favoured on-pace runners.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the 300 Metres was briefly held up behind MEDIC ELITE when being shifted to that runner’s outside to improve.
No report.
After travelling a short distance was buffeted for room between BEAU GOSSE and HANG’S CHOICE which shifted out and away from PRECISION GOAL.

Stood flat-footed as the start was effected and lost ground.  The barrier manners of FORTUNE PRESIDENT were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, FORTUNE PRESIDENT will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial.

Shortly after the start was bumped.  When questioned regarding the disappointing performance, H Bowman stated that from a wide barrier he elected to take up a forward position as instructed.  He said when unable to cross runners to his inside BEAU GOSSE was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  He added that when placed under pressure from the 400 Metres BEAU GOSSE did not respond to his riding and gave ground in the Home Straight.  Trainer D J Whyte advised that BEAU GOSSE had pleased him coming into tonight’s event but was of the opinion the wide run that the horse had endured was the reason for its disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Shortly after the start was tightened for room between HANG’S CHOICE and PRECISION GOAL which shifted out before being corrected by its rider.  After the race, B Avdulla reported that his mount was under pressure from the 800 Metres and failed to finish the race off.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

Shortly after the start raced tight to the outside of SO TREASURE which shifted out slightly.  Near the 550 Metres was momentarily crowded by VALHALLA which lay in and away from SPEED SWORD.  Near the 400 Metres was held up for clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Trainer C Fownes confirmed that from a wide barrier he had instructed C Y Ho to attempt to take up a forward position.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Apprentice Wong was advised to exercise more care.  Approaching the 150 Metres Y L Chung dropped his whip.

Making the Home Turn was held up behind SUPERB WITNESS which was giving ground.  Whilst the Stewards were satisfied that the riding of Apprentice E C W Wong, 6th placegetter, over the concluding stages did not affect the horse’s finishing position, he was nonetheless reminded of his obligation to ensure that he fully rides his mounts out to the finish of the race.  Sent for sampling post-race.

As the start was effected reared and lost ground.  The barrier manners of RACINGRACE were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, RACINGRACE will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial.  Approaching the 250 Metres was eased and shifted to the outside of DENFIELD to continue into clear running.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Prior to declaring weighed-in, the Stewards viewed the patrol films to ascertain if there were grounds for a protest/objection on behalf of the connections of CHAIN OF GOLD being declared 5th placegetter following it being crowded for room inside the 50 Metres.  When the Stewards found that there were not sufficient grounds to lodge a protest/objection having regard to the margin of ¾ length between the two horses at the finish of the race and no protest/objection was lodged by the connections of CHAIN OF GOLD, weighed-in was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.  At a subsequent inquiry, Y L Chung (LOVERO) was severely reprimanded for permitting his mount to shift out approaching the 50 Metres, causing CHAIN OF GOLD to be steadied when crowded between ZOOM BOOM and LOVERO.

He said in the early stages GIDDY UP raced a little keenly and from the 800 Metres when runners improved to his outside GIDDY UP got its head up and did not finish the race off from that point.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Noted to have sustained a small wound to the left hind leg after the race.

When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight and the reason why his mount became held up behind BEAT HOLLOW near the 150 Metres, M F Poon stated that his initial intention was to take a run to the inside of BEAT HOLLOW when that runner shifted out near the 250 Metres.  He said when BEAT HOLLOW shifted back in approaching the 200 Metres and the run closed, he then contemplated shifting to the outside of BEAT HOLLOW to obtain clear running.  He added when NOBLE WIN was positioned to his outside, he was unable to shift to BEAT HOLLOW’s outside and as a result was steadied away from the heels of BEAT HOLLOW for some distance thereafter.  He further stated that over the final 100 Metres when BEAT HOLLOW shifted out, JOYFUL FRIENDSHIP obtained clear running and finished the race off well.  The Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Poon were reasonable in the circumstances.

When questioned regarding his riding, H Bowman stated that the intention was to lead the event, but his mount stumbled on jumping and as a result lost ground.  He said in the early stages he then attempted to ride his mount forward, however, G LINER did not show sufficient pace to cross runners to his inside and as a result he took a trailing position behind MAYHEM.  He added that entering the Home Straight he was able to place his mount under pressure until near the 200 Metres where he was unable to improve between MAYHEM and TRIUMPHANT WARRIOR and as a result G LINER did not obtain clear running from that point to the finish of the event. When questioned, H Bentley stated that from the outside barrier and with his mount stepping up in distance today, he was instructed to ride it in a conservative manner in the early stages.  Trainer C H Yip confirmed the instructions issued.  When questioned regarding his riding between the 350 Metres and the 250 Metres and as to whether there was an opportunity to ride his mount with more vigour to obtain clear running between ACA POWER and STURDY RUBY, H Bentley stated that after shifting to the outside of ACA POWER, he felt that runner shift out slightly which resulted in him calling to the rider of ACA POWER, A Badel.  He said when he was not confident that there was sufficient room to improve between those two runners, he then did not fully commit to this position until approaching the 200 Metres when ACA POWER shifted in.  Jockey Bentley was advised that, whenever possible, he should ensure that he takes advantage of runs when they present at the first available opportunity.
Between the 400 Metres and the 350 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when being shifted to the outside of GRAND BOSS.
Shortly after the start was crowded by TOP SCORER which shifted in and away from HOSS.  Raced keenly in the middle stages.  After the 500 Metres was bumped by STURDY RUBY.
Jumped only fairly and then was crowded shortly after start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Bumped after the 500 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover from the 1000 Metres.  After the 500 Metres was bumped by STURDY RUBY.
No report.

Bumped on jumping.  After the race, L Ferraris stated that after leading the event, when placed under pressure in the Home Straight, he had some concern with the action of his mount.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  The performance of RIVER VIEWS, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, RIVER VIEWS will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Made contact with the left side of its barrier on jumping.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
In the early stages raced keenly and near the 1500 Metres was eased to avoid WINNING DRAGON when that runner shifted in.  Making the Home Turn was held up for clear running.
No report.
No report.

After the race, H Bowman stated that after obtaining a handy position one-off near the 1400 Metres, his mount travelled satisfactorily in the early stages. He said throughout the middle stages NOBLE PURSUIT was disadvantaged when it did not appreciate racing tight to the inside of GALLANT WAKING and when placed under pressure from the 500 Metres responded only fairly to his riding.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, NOBLE PURSUIT will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the race, L Hewitson reported that from a wide barrier he was instructed to ride his mount conservatively in the early stages and if circumstances permitted to make a mid-race move.  He said when DEVILDOM jumped well and runners to his inside did not show the intention to hold a forward position, he allowed DEVILDOM to shift in to race outside the leader FLAMINGO TRILLION without having to make use of his mount to do so.
Slow to begin.

After the race, C Y Ho reported that in the early stages he looked to obtain a trailing position behind NOBLE PURSUIT.  He said when that runner shifted to a one-off position near the 1400 Metres, GALLANT WAKING was left racing wide and without cover thereafter.  He added that GALLANT WAKING raced keenly in this position and was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.

On arrival at the Start, it was noted that SONIC BOOM had blood in its mouth.  SONIC BOOM was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Jumped only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted out after the 150 Metres, resulting in A Hamelin having to stop riding and straighten.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.
After the 150 Metres was steadied when crowded between TIMESTORM and ISLAND SURPRISE (A Hamelin) which shifted out before being corrected by its rider.  A Hamelin was advised to exercise more care.

After the race, Z Purton reported that after leading the event AUGUST MOON did not respond to his riding in the Home Straight and could offer no explanation for its disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the race, Apprentice E C W Wong reported that the intention was to lead the event tonight.  He said after CHEER FOR SOUTH jumped a little awkwardly, it failed to show sufficient pace to lead despite being ridden along in the early stages.  He added that as a result CHEER FOR SOUTH settled further back than intended.  He further stated that after racing wide and without cover for the majority of the event, CHEER FOR SOUTH finished the race off in a one-paced manner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Jumped only fairly.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

For some distance near the 350 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.  Near the 150 Metres improved into a narrow run between GOLDEN EMPIRE and GRACIOUS EXPRESS and did not obtain clear running until after the 100 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
In the middle stages raced keenly.
Jumped awkwardly.

From the outside barrier raced keenly when being shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 550 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from CALIFORNIA DEEPLY.  When questioned, H Bentley stated that he intended to follow CALIFORNIA DEEPLY into the race on entering the Home Straight.  He said when that runner did not initially improve, he then elected to shift to its outside, but then became held up for clear running behind E LEGEND and TELECOM POWER which resulted in PRAWNS ELEVEN not obtaining clear running until approaching the 200 Metres where it finished the race off well.

Raced keenly when obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  After the race, Z Purton advised that his intention was to lead the event, but his mount, when standing awkwardly in the barriers, jumped awkwardly and then did not show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned, C Y Ho stated that at its first race start he had ridden the horse in a rearward position after drawing a wide barrier.  He said today from an inside draw he was instructed to endeavour to hold a forward position and as a consequence he rode his mount along in the early stages to comply with his instructions.  Trainer J Richards confirmed the instructions and stated that such instructions were issued as connections were of the opinion that GUSTOSISIMO had raced well in Australia when ridden in an on-pace position.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of mucus in the horse’s trachea.
Jumped only fairly.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Approaching the 100 Metres shifted in and was bumped.
Approaching the 100 Metres TELECOM POWER shifted in and away from PRAWNS ELEVEN and made contact with E LEGEND.  Was obliged to race very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Approaching the 1000 Metres, when racing keenly, was steadied to avoid SWEET DIAMOND (A Badel) which shifted in when not quite clear.  A Badel was advised to exercise more care.
Leaving the 1100 Metres was bumped by COSMO NAVIGATOR which shifted in and away from SUPER AXIOM despite the efforts of A Hamelin, rider of COSMO NAVIGATOR.
Shortly after the start bumped with WINNING HEART.
No report.

When questioned, H Bowman stated that his mount was standing awkwardly in the barriers and received some assistance from the starting gate handlers.  He said as the start was effected GLORY CLOUD hesitated and as a result lost ground and settled further back than what had been anticipated.  He added GLORY CLOUD travelled well at the tail of the field and his preference would have been to save ground making the Home Turn by improving to the inside, but was unable to do so and as a result he elected to shift out approaching the 450 Metres to start to improve into the event.  He further stated that in the early part of the Home Straight GLORY CLOUD responded well to his riding, however, near the 100 Metres the horse’s run peaked and finished the race off fairly from that point.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, GLORY CLOUD will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped shortly after the start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Jumped awkwardly and lost ground and shortly after the start was steadied when crowded by CURRAHEE which shifted in and away from SWEET DIAMOND.

Was a late withdrawal acting on veterinary advice after sustaining an injury to the right front leg after becoming fractious whilst being transported to the racecourse.  Before being allowed to race again, MIRACLES will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped a rail on a number of occasions when entering the track, was examined by the Veterinary Officer on arrival at the Start and passed suitable to race.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly.  Lay in when under pressure in the Home Straight.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
In the early stages when being eased to obtain cover raced tight between SUPER EAGLE and DOUBLE BINGO.  Making the first turn lay in, resulting in its rider C L Chau having to correct his mount.

Leaving the 600 Metres was steadied when momentarily crowded by SPICY GOLD (A Badel) which shifted in and away from SIGHT SUPREME when racing tight to the inside of that runner.  A Badel was advised to exercise more care.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

After the race, Z Purton reported that his mount travelled well during the early and middle stages of the event and would derive benefit from tonight’s race experience and potentially being stepped up in distance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Near the 100 Metres was inconvenienced when crowded between HERCULES and FAIRY HORSE which shifted out.

After the race, L Hewitson reported that his mount travelled well in the lead, however, came under pressure on entering the Home Straight and gave ground from that point.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of E UNIVERSE, a last start winner, was considered to be disappointing as compared to its previous race start.  Before being allowed to race again, E UNIVERSE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the race, L Ferraris reported that his instructions were to take up a handy position.  He said he was caught wide in the early stages when SUPER EAGLE held its position to his inside and as a result was obliged to make some use of his mount to cross that runner where it raced outside the lead in the early stages.  He added that DOUBLE BINGO raced greenly during the event and after being crossed by PRIME MORTAR near the 600 Metres came under pressure before weakening in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Approaching the 150 Metres raced tight to the inside of HAPPY HORSE which shifted in and as a result made contact with HAPPY HORSE on a number of occasions approaching the 100 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Kicked a rail in the Parade Ring, was examined by the Veterinary Officer on arrival at the Start who said the horse had blood in its mouth but was passed suitable to race.
No report.

Approaching the 500 Metres was steadied when crowded between ONE FOR ALL and PHILOS which shifted out slightly.  For a short distance near the 100 Metres raced in restricted room between FORTUNE WARRIOR and CAMINO.
Shortly after the start was crowded between SERGEANT PEPPER and SIGHT HAPPY.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Shortly after the start was bumped by SUPER COMMANDER and became unbalanced.  After the race, K Teetan reported that his mount, which was having its first race start, raced greenly throughout the event and hung out making the turns.  Approaching the winning post raced tight between ONE FOR ALL and CIRCUIT SEVEN which shifted in slightly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Approaching the 400 Metres was briefly crowded by SIGHT HAPPY which shifted in when racing greenly.
No report.

After the race, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that after being crowded at the start SUPER COMMANDER then raced tight to the inside of ONE FOR ALL for some distance thereafter.  He said as a consequence he was not able to lead the event as instructed.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly.  After the race, A Hamelin reported that despite riding his mount along in the early stages GORGEOUS VITALITY failed to show any early pace and became detached from the field and took no competitive part in the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of GORGEOUS VITALITY, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, GORGEOUS VITALITY will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.

Bumped on jumping.  After the race, A Badel reported that his mount jumped only fairly and then as a result settled further back than intended.  He added that HEALTHY HEALTHY responded fairly to his riding in the Home Straight and may be looking to be stepped up in distance for its next race start.
No report.
Jumped only fairly and from the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Jumped awkwardly.  After the race, Apprentice E C W Wong reported that his mount failed to travel throughout the event and raced in a disappointing manner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly and was then bumped shortly after the start.  For some distance approaching the 200 Metres was held up for clear running between MAGIC PHOENIX and SUPER WINNER which was giving ground.  After the race, K De Melo reported that whilst his mount had some difficulty obtaining clear running near the 200 Metres, it raced "flat” tonight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Lay out making the Home Turn.
No report.
Jumped only fairly and from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
A Badel was fined the sum of $2,000 for failing to present himself in the Parade Ring by the required time.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Sent for sampling post-race.
For some distance approaching the 300 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.
Near the 300 Metres was bumped.  Over the concluding stages was crowded between COLONEL and TACTICAL COMMAND which shifted out.
Jumped only fairly and then was briefly crowded shortly after the start.

After the race, K C Leung reported that his mount raced keenly in the middle stages and after being steadied away from the heels of COLONEL near the 650 Metres was shifted to a three wide position.  He added that in the Home Straight KING INVINCIBLE failed to respond to his riding.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.

Approaching the 250 Metres became held up for clear running behind MULTIMORE which was giving ground and did not obtain clear running until the 150 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

Near the 300 Metres was bumped.  After the race, A Hamelin reported that his mount raced keenly throughout the early and middle stages and was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have bled from both nostrils.  Before being allowed to race again, GREAT DAYS will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

On arrival at the Start, Z Purton expressed concern with the horse’s action.  GOOD VIEW GLORY was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said the horse was lame in its left front leg and as such was not suitable to race.  Acting on this advice, GOOD VIEW GLORY was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  Before being allowed to race again, GOOD VIEW GLORY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Withdrawn on 18.5.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame left fore) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter MULTIMORE.  Before being allowed to race again, RATTAN WORLD will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly.  After the 1000 Metres commenced to race keenly after being crossed by HAPPY FOR ALL and was steadied away from the heels of that runner.  After the 400 Metres was shifted to the outside of HAPPY FOR ALL to obtain clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the 400 Metres was held up for clear running behind TAIHANG SCENERY and shifted to that runner’s inside after the 350 Metres to obtain clear running.  M L Yeung (SKY SONG) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 200 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of HAPPY FOR ALL, resulting in HAPPY FOR ALL being checked and losing its running.  M L Yeung was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Sunday, 26 May 2024 and to expire on Thursday, 30 May 2024 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 1 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his poor race riding record.  Noted to have lost its left front plate after the race.
Jumped only fairly.  Lay out on the Home Turn.

After the race, M L Yeung reported that his mount jumped well today and as a consequence settled in a more forward position.  M L Yeung was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 200 Metres (see HAPPY FOR ALL).

Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.  Approaching the 900 Metres after improving to the inside of HAPPY FOR ALL (K C Leung) was then steadied when crowded by that runner.  K C Leung was advised to exercise more care.
No report.
No report.

After the race, C L Chau reported that in the early stages his mount, after jumping well, raced keenly and as a result he was obliged to allow TAIHANG SCENERY to hold a more forward position.  He added that as a result TAIHANG SCENERY was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Jumped awkwardly and made contact with the left side of its barrier.

After the race, M F Poon could offer no explanation for his mount’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  The performance of SAKEWIN, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, SAKEWIN will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Was a late withdrawal acting on veterinary advice after sustaining a head injury in the stables and being found to have blood present at the left nostril.  An endoscopic examination conducted on CAMP FIRE found that there was no blood in its trachea and therefore the horse was deemed not to have bled.  Before being allowed to race again, CAMP FIRE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

When questioned regarding the improved performance, Trainer F C Lor stated that MASSIVE ACTION was advantaged by being able to dictate in the lead today together with the light weight.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Making the turn near the 1300 Metres hung out.  After the 600 Metres was momentarily crowded between M UNICORN and SO WE JOY which shifted out slightly.  Near the 150 Metres shifted in, resulting in its rider B Avdulla having to stop riding and straighten.

In the early stages raced keenly and got its head up when being steadied to allow WOODFIRE BRO to cross.  After the race, L Hewitson reported that his mount hung out making the Home Turn.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the 1500 Metres was steadied to avoid SO WE JOY (A Atzeni) which shifted in.  A Atzeni was advised to exercise more care.  When questioned regarding the performance, C Y Ho stated that after jumping awkwardly, his mount settled back in the field.  He said approaching the first turn M UNICORN was hampered when crowded by SO WE JOY but thereafter travelled only fairly.  He added in the Home Straight M UNICORN made a respiratory noise and when not in a competitive position he eased it down over the concluding stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race revealed that the horse was displaying an irregular heart rhythm.  Before being allowed to race again, M UNICORN will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, PACKING TREADMILL will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the race, A Badel advised that whilst he expected to hold a forward position, he was not instructed to necessarily lead.  He said due to the pace of the event in the early stages being run at standard time, he elected to take a trailing position behind the leaders where his mount settled comfortably.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

He added that, in his opinion, YOU’REMYEVERYTHING would benefit from being stepped up in distance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of mucus in the horse’s trachea.

Lay out on the first turn when being steadied away from FUN N FUN TOGETHER.  Continued to lay out in the middle stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

No report.

Before being allowed to race again, RUN RUN COOL will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Apprentice E C W Wong pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference after the 1500 Metres (see HOLY POWER).
No report.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Apprentice E C W Wong (GALLANT CROWN) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that after the 1500 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when insufficiently clear of HOLY POWER, resulting in HOLY POWER being checked to avoid the heels of GALLANT CROWN.  Apprentice Wong was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Wednesday, 29 May 2024 and to expire on Thursday, 6 June 2024 on which day he may resume race riding (3 Hong Kong racedays).  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his poor race riding record.  Over the concluding stages raced tight to the inside of MR ALADDIN and could not be fully ridden out to the finish.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Jumped awkwardly and from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  From the 200 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running and was shifted to the outside of TURIN WARRIOR.  Then lay in when being shifted to the outside of HOLY POWER and as a result was held up for some distance near the 100 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

In the middle stages raced keenly and near the 900 Metres was steadied away from MR ALADDIN and as a result was obliged to shift three wide where it made contact with RUNNING AHEAD.  Then raced wide and without cover thereafter.  Lay out making the Home Turn.
Jumped only fairly.  Near the 900 Metres was bumped and taken wider by FAMILY FORTUNE and as a result raced keenly for some distance thereafter.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned, Z Purton stated that his intention was to hold a more forward position, but LUCKY TOUCH was slightly fractious in the barriers and then was slow to begin and as a result settled towards the rear of the field.  He said making the Home Turn he commenced to improve into the event and after shifting to the inside of CELTIC TIMES near the 400 Metres he placed his mount under pressure.  He added that approaching the 300 Metres he was disappointed for clear running between ISLAND GOLDEN and GOLDEN DARCI which shifted in and as a result directed his mount to that runner’s outside.  He further stated that between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres he was unable to obtain clear running when improving into a narrow run between GOLDEN DARCI and FOOLISH HEART which was giving ground.  He said approaching the 50 Metres he then directed his mount to the outside of MISSION VOICE to continue into clear running.
On jumping was bumped by SUPER LEGENDS which shifted in.  Despite being ridden along thereafter failed to show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position.
No report.
No report.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly.  After the race, K Teetan reported that his mount would prefer a firmer surface.  Trainer W K Mo agreed with the assessment of Jockey Teetan.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

At declaration time, Y L Chung was declared as the rider of both D STAR and SUPER LEGENDS.  It was established that Y L Chung had a firm commitment to ride D STAR.  As such, the Stewards permitted H Bowman to be substituted as the rider of SUPER LEGENDS.  For this declaration error, Y L Chung was fined $2,000.

After the race, K C Leung reported that his mount was disadvantaged by being pressured in the lead by SKY HEART and with the race being run inside of standard time in the early stages was unable to finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  The performance of LOYAL BO BO was considered to be disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, LOYAL BO BO will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Bumped at the start.
Jumped only fairly and from the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Near the 1500 Metres commenced to race keenly and was steadied away from FASTPASS.  For a short distance after the 1400 Metres raced tight between GO GO GO and FASTPASS which shifted in slightly.  After the race, Y L Chung reported that after holding a forward position, his mount was unsuited when the pace of the event eased in the middle stages.  He said as a result his mount was unable to quicken when placed under pressure from the 600 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Raced wide and without cover from the 1000 Metres.  When questioned regarding his riding in the early stages, K C Leung stated that after obtaining a position on the rail in the early stages, he then elected to shift his mount out one-off near the 1600 Metres in order to follow NINJA DERBY.  He said he made such move to avoid FASTPASS being caught on the rail in what he thought might be a slowly run event.  He said after obtaining a position behind NINJA DERBY approaching the 1500 Metres, FASTPASS commenced to race keenly and as a result shifted out and away from NINJA DERBY into a three wide position.  He added shortly after when NINJA DERBY remained one-off, this allowed COLOURFUL BARON to improve to his inside and resulted in FASTPASS being obliged to race three wide thereafter.

Raced wide and without cover until the 1000 Metres.    The performance of CIRCUIT ELITE, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, CIRCUIT ELITE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

The performance of SUNNY SHINES, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, SUNNY SHINES will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Whilst the Stewards accepted that GOLDEN LUCK lay in during this incident and Jockey Hewitson had made some attempt to prevent his mount from shifting in, he was advised that in similar circumstances he should exercise more care and make a greater effort to prevent his mounts from shifting in. Prior to declaring weighed-in, the Stewards gave consideration as to whether SUPERB CAPITALIST had gained an unfair advantage at the start when it made contact with the starting gate as the start was effected.  After viewing the patrol films, the Stewards found that SUPERB CAPITALIST lunged forward simultaneously as the start was effected and as a consequence made contact with the starting gate, resulting in SUPERB CAPITALIST jumping awkwardly.  As the Stewards were satisfied that the horse had not gained an advantage from this incident, weighed-in was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Approaching the 300 Metres raced tight to the inside of MAJESTIC KNIGHT and made contact with the hindquarters of that runner.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Shifted in at the start abruptly, resulting in its rider Y L Chung having to correct his mount.  Whilst the Stewards were satisfied that the riding of Y L Chung, 4th placegetter, over the concluding stages did not affect the horse’s finishing position, he will be nonetheless reminded of his obligation to ensure that he fully rides his mounts out to the finish of the race.

CARROLL STREET, Standby Declared Starter, was withdrawn on 21.5.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (right front fetlock radiographic abnormality).  Before being allowed to race again, CARROLL STREET will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

He added as the horse is one-paced, the instructions to go forward were to endeavour to offset its one-paced racing manner.

When questioned regarding his riding and his decision to shift to the outside of RUN YES RUN near the 100 Metres, B Avdulla stated that approaching that point he felt that both SANTORINI and RUN YES RUN were laying out and this may have resulted in the run to the inside of RUN YES RUN closing.  He said for this reason he then elected to shift to the outside of RUN YES RUN to obtain clear running inside the 100 Metres, but as he did so, RUN YES RUN (M Chadwick) shifted out, resulting in CALIFORNIA MOXIE having difficulty obtaining clear running and being buffeted for room between RUN YES RUN and PATCH OF COSMO.  B Avdulla was advised he must ensure that there is sufficient racing room when he improves into similar runs in future.  M Chadwick was advised to exercise more care in similar circumstances.
