He added that once into clear running in the Home Straight, ILLUMINOUS ran to the line in a one-paced manner, however, found it difficult to make up ground due to the manner in which the race was run. A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be lame in its left front leg.  Before being allowed to race again, BOURBONAIRE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the race, C Y Ho could offer no explanation for the disappointing performance of his mount.  Trainer K W Lui stated that the only explanation he could offer was that HOLY LAKE may have been disadvantaged by being left without cover in the early stages of the event, but nonetheless was disappointed with the performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of HOLY LAKE was considered to be disappointing as compared to its recent starts.  Before being allowed to race again, HOLY LAKE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

When questioned, L Hewitson stated that from the inside barrier he was asked to hold a more forward position, particularly as BRAVEHEARTS had barrier trialed well  in this manner on 6 May 2024.  He said after jumping well, when runners to his outside improved in the early stages, he was able to obtain a position on-pace with cover.   When questioned regarding his riding from the 550 Metres and as to whether there was an opportunity to improve to the outside of HOLY LAKE, L Hewitson stated that whilst his preference was to obtain this position, he had continuously received a call from Jockey H Bowman, the rider of BOURBONAIRE which was positioned to his outside, and as a result he was unable to shift out as he was concerned he may cause interference.  He added that on straightening he then became disappointed for clear running between BOURBONAIRE and HOLY LAKE when both runners shifted ground slightly and as a result BRAVEHEARTS was held up between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned, M Chadwick stated that from the outside barrier his instructions were to ride his mount conservatively in the early stages to avoid having to race wide.  When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight, M Chadwick stated that after following BALLISTIC WIN, he was of the opinion that runner had lay out on the Home Turn and may shift out in the Home Straight.  He said for this reason approaching the 400 Metres he initially shifted to the inside of BALLISTIC WIN to obtain clear running, but when that runner was corrected by its rider, he was held up for clear running between the 400 Metres and the 350 Metres.  He added that passing the 350 Metres he was able to shift to the outside of BALLISTIC WIN where GANGNAM STAR commenced to run on well.  He added that over the concluding stages when improving to the outside of BALLISTIC WIN, GANGNAM STAR lay out away from BALLISTIC WIN and as a result was awkwardly placed on the heels of DIVANO and could not be ridden out to the finish of the event.  The Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Chadwick were reasonable in the circumstances.

After being placed in the barriers reared and got its front legs over the gates, resulting in the gates opening and CHATEAUNEUF completing the course riderless.  Was withdrawn by order of the Stewards and subsequently found to be lame in its right front leg with wounds to the right front cannon.  Before being allowed to race again, CHATEAUNEUF will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After being placed in the starting gates became fractious, reared and was cast underneath the starting gate.  Was removed from the starting gate and examined by the Veterinary Officer who said the horse was not suitable to race.  Acting on this advice, GAMEPLAYER WARRIOR was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  Was subsequently found to have sustained a wound to the right hind leg.  Before being allowed to race again, GAMEPLAYER WARRIOR will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Subsequently L Hewitson was examined by the Chief Medical Officer and passed fit to fulfil his remaining race riding engagements.

When questioned regarding the apparent improved performance, Trainer C H Yip stated that the horse was advantaged by being down in grade today and also advised that BRIGHT INHERITANCE had pleased him in its track work and in particular when it competed in a jump out on 21 May 2024.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.

On jumping was bumped by MARADO which shifted in abruptly, resulting in JOYFUL PROSPERITY becoming unbalanced.  Approaching the 100 Metres was taken in by BRIGHT INHERITANCE which shifted in before being corrected by its rider.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped shortly after the start.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Jumped awkwardly.  After the race, A Badel stated that whilst he was given the option to go forward from a wide barrier, when caught wide in the early stages, his mount was not travelling well enough for him to make use of it to take up a forward position.  He added as a result GOOD GOOD was obliged to raced very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Bumped shortly after the start.  Between the 400 Metres and the 250 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.  After the race, M F Poon stated that his mount lost momentum and was disadvantaged when held up between the 400 Metres and the 250 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shifted in abruptly at the start and was bumped.

Jumped only fairly, shifted out and made contact with ABSOLUTE SUNSHINE.  Despite being ridden along in the early stages failed to show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position.  After the race, A Atzeni stated that his mount did not appreciate racing inside other horses and as a result did not fully stretch out in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings. <27/5/2024 Additional Veterinary Reports> CHILLI BABA, which performed disappointingly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings. CHILLI BABA was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer P F Yiu this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its right hind leg. Before being allowed to race again, CHILLI BABA will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Bumped at the start.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of mucus in the horse’s trachea.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped shortly after the start. He said at its last start from a wide barrier, Jockey L Ferraris was obliged to make use of his mount to take up a forward position and as a result was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  He added as a result he had expected HUGE WAVE, which was advantage by being ridden in a midfield position today, to finish the race off well.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Crowded on jumping by HUGE WAVE which shifted in after bumping with RUBYLOT.  Bumped near the 350 Metres. A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped near the 350 Metres. After the race, Z Purton stated that his mount did not travel strongly due to the race being run slightly inside of standard time during the middle stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages. After the race, L Hewitson stated that, in his opinion, SUPERB KID, which was racing in blinkers for the first time, was not suited to this gear addition.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped awkwardly and then was bumped by BUNDLE OF CHARM.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the race, C Y Ho reported that his mount would benefit by being stepped up in distance for its next race start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

He said when unable to obtain this position, he was obliged to race further back in order to obtain cover.

Had difficulty obtaining clear running on the Home Turn.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

C L Chau (PACKING WISHER) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 1400 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of FLYING PHANTOM, resulting in FLYING PHANTOM having to be checked.  C L Chau was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Wednesday, 5 June 2024 and to expire on Sunday, 9 June 2024 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In addition, Jockey Chau was fined $45,000.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his neutral race riding record.

After the race, C L Chau reported that his mount raced keenly throughout the early and middle stages of the event.  C L Chau was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 1400 Metres (see FLYING PHANTOM).
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Slow to begin.

After the race, Z Purton reported that from the inside barrier his instructions were to hold an on-pace position preferably behind the leaders.  He said JUMBO FORTUNE commenced well, travelled strongly in the early stages and was able to hold the lead.  He added that JUMBO FORTUNE was then unsuited by being pressured in the lead and gave ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, JUMBO FORTUNE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned regarding his riding, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that his instructions were to go forward and either race in or outside the lead.  He said in the early stages CORDYCEPS ONE failed to show sufficient pace to comply with his instructions and he was obliged to obtain a trailing position three wide behind FOREVER GLORIOUS.  He said near the 1000 Metres when FOREVER GLORIOUS momentarily shifted in to race one-off, this resulted in CORDYCEPS ONE racing wide and without cover.  He said as a result he then elected to ride his mount forward with a view to complying with his instructions but was unable to cross the leaders and as a result CORDYCEPS ONE was obliged to race wide and without cover for the remainder of the event.  After considering Apprentice Wong’s explanation and having regard to the pace of the event being run inside of standard time throughout the early stages, Apprentice Wong was advised that he had made an error of judgement in riding his mount forward from the 1000 Metres and he would have been better suited by maintaining his position to the outside of FOREVER GLORIOUS.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 1400 Metres was steadied to avoid RED MAJESTY (B Thompson) which shifted in when it lay in away from ESCAPE ROUTE.  B Thompson was severely reprimanded and advised he must make a greater effort to prevent his mounts from shifting in in future.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Held up for clear running on the Home Turn behind SILVER UP and at the 300 Metres was shifted to that runner’s outside to obtain clear running.  Then between the 300 Metres and the 250 Metres raced in restricted room between SILVER UP and ORIENTAL TYCOON.

Before being allowed to race again, DIAMOND FLARE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination. K C Leung (LITTLE FAIRY) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 300 Metres he allowed his mount to shift out when not clear of KIMBERLEY, resulting in KIMBERLEY being taken out and causing STARSHIP EIGHTY to be checked when crowded for room between MISSION BRAVO and KIMBERLEY.  K C Leung was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 5 June 2024 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent race riding record.

H Bowman was fined the sum of $2,000 for failing to present himself in the Parade Ring by the required time. Jumped awkwardly and made contact with the left side of its barrier. YOUNG HORIZON was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer D A Hayes this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its left front leg. Before being allowed to race again, YOUNG HORIZON will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the race, H Bentley reported that when he felt that there was something amiss with his mount in the Home Straight and when not in a competitive position, he eased it down from the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race revealed that the horse was displaying an irregular heart rhythm.  Before being allowed to race again, IMPERIAL MAGEE will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the race, M Chadwick stated that the instructions were to attempt to find cover.  He said when caught wide in the early stages and unable to comply with his instructions, he allowed MIRACLES to stride forward to race outside the lead to avoid covering additional ground.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the race, L Ferraris stated that he became concerned with his mount when it commenced to give ground from the 700 Metres and whilst he was able to continue to ride MASSIVE TALENT out in the Home Straight, it did not respond to his riding.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  As this was the second occasion that MASSIVE TALENT had raced in a similar manner, the horse will be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments before being allowed to race again.

Shortly after the start was bumped.  When questioned regarding his riding out, L Hewitson stated that in the early part of the Home Straight his mount lay out and as a result he was obliged to correct it near the 200 Metres.  He said between the 200 Metres and the 100 Metres CHANCHENG GLORY then shifted in slightly and as a result he was again obliged to stop riding and correct his mount near the 100 Metres.  He added that over the concluding stages when riding his mount out his left foot was dislodged from his stirrup iron and although he advised the Stewards that he was able to continue to push CHANCHENG GLORY out to the finish of the event, he was being somewhat hampered by his foot being dislodged.  L Hewitson was advised, wherever possible, he must ensure that his foot is securely positioned within his stirrup iron to prevent a similar occurrence again.  Subsequently Jockey Hewitson’s stirrup irons were inspected by the Stewards and found to be in good order and nothing was identified that would have caused his foot to be dislodged from the stirrup iron.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Shortly after the start was crowded between CHANCHENG GLORY and THE GOLDEN SCENERY which raced tight to the inside of TAJ DRAGON.  Raced wide and without cover from the 1100 Metres.  The performance of ENCOUNTERED was considered unacceptable.  As this was the second consecutive occasion that ENCOUNTERED had performed similarly, the horse will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in consecutive barrier trials and be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments before being allowed to race again.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Withdrawn on 30.5.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (right front ligament injury).  Before being allowed to race again, SUPER SUNNY SING will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly and then was crowded by STELLAR EXPRESS which shifted in abruptly.  Between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when positioned behind STELLAR EXPRESS.  When questioned regarding his riding and the reason he did not shift to the inside of STELLAR EXPRESS in the early part of the Home Straight sooner, H Bentley stated that when following STELLAR EXPRESS, he was of the opinion that runner was travelling very well as Jockey H Bowman had not asked his mount for an effort.  He said when H Bowman commenced to ride STELLAR EXPRESS along and the horse did not quicken as he had anticipated, he then shifted to the inside of STELLAR EXPRESS approaching the 300 Metres to obtain clear running.  The Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Bentley, having regard to his explanation, were reasonable in the circumstances.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Was then shifted to the inside of STELLAR EXPRESS where it obtained clear running approaching the 50 Metres.

After the race, C L Chau reported that his instructions were to hold a forward position, but JAMES TAK bounded on jumping and lost some ground.  He said as a result he was obliged to settle in a midfield position, but JAMES TAK raced keenly in the early and middle stages and as a consequence was unable to finish the race off.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly.  When questioned regarding his riding rounding the Home Turn and in the early part of the Home Straight and as to whether there was an option to improve to the outside of STOLTZ sooner than what he did, H Bentley stated that his instructions were to endeavour to improve between runners as MUGEN had raced best when being ridden in this manner previously.  He added whilst the opportunity was available to shift to the outside of STOLTZ, having regard to his instructions, he persevered with a run to the inside of STOLTZ between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres before the run closed and he then commenced to shift to the outside of STOLTZ.  He further stated that MUGEN lay in as he endeavoured to shift to the outside of STOLTZ and as  a result did not obtain clear running to the outside of that runner until after the 200 Metres when MUGEN finished the race off well.  Trainer P C Ng confirmed the instructions and stated that he issued such instructions as MUGEN had performed best when ridden in this manner and in particular when it last won on 21 January 2024 when it improved in between runners in the Home Straight.  Mr Ng expressed satisfaction with H Bentley’s handling of MUGEN.
Jumped only fairly.

Bumped at the start.  After the race, H Bowman reported that whilst the horse was held up for clear running between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres, when asked for an effort thereafter, INVINCIBLE SAGE responded in a disappointing manner to his riding.  He added that, in his opinion, INVINCIBLE SAGE may have reached the end of its preparation.  Trainer D J Hall stated that INVINCIBLE SAGE had pleased him leading into the event and in particular it barrier trialed well at Conghua on 24 May 2024.  He added the only explanation he could offer for its disappointing performance was that INVINCIBLE SAGE was disadvantaged when it lost momentum in the early part of the Home Straight when held up.  Mr Hall confirmed that this would be the last run for the horse’s preparation.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the 700 Metres was steadied when placed in restricted room between GIMME FIVE and DRACO which shifted out slightly when racing keenly.  When questioned regarding his riding rounding the Home Turn and as to whether there was an opportunity to improve to the outside of GIMME FIVE, L Hewitson stated that his instructions were to settle his mount where comfortable and anticipated racing in a midfield position.  He said leaving the 500 Metres when GIMME FIVE did not improve into the event, he became awkwardly placed close to the heels of that runner and whilst his intention was to shift to that runner’s outside, he was unable to do so due to his mount being placed too close to the heels of GIMME FIVE and also because ACE POWER was positioned directly to his outside.  He added near the 400 Metres when he observed DRACO to improve forward, he elected to shift in to follow that runner into the event.  L Hewitson further stated that after riding his mount along in the early part of the Home Straight, SIGHT HERO then had difficulty obtaining clear running between SPEEDY SMARTIE and DRACO near the 150 Metres and could not be fully tested until after the 100 Metres where his mount finished off in a one-paced manner.  After considering his explanations, the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Hewitson were reasonable in the circumstances. M Chadwick was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Monday, 1 July 2024 at Sha Tin.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent race riding record. When questioned, Z Purton stated that his instructions were to lead on E UNIVERSE.  He said when positioned to the outside of SEA SAPPHIRE in the early stages, he was obliged to continue to ride his mount along to cross SEA SAPPHIRE to comply with his instructions.  He added as a result of the manner he was required to ride his mount in the early stages and under its top weight of 135 lbs and not appreciating the "Good to Yielding” track, E UNIVERSE gave ground in the Home Straight.  Assistant Trainer W H Ip, representing Trainer K L Man who was not present at tonight’s meeting, confirmed that the stable’s preference was for E UNIVERSE to lead the event as the horse had performed best when ridden in this manner and agreed with the explanations provided by Jockey Purton in respect to the horse’s performance.  Mr Man was subsequently contacted and confirmed that the stable preference was to lead the event, but Jockey Purton was required to make too much use of his mount to race in this position.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of E UNIVERSE, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, E UNIVERSE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

For some distance after the 300 Metres was held up when being shifted to the outside of CALIFORNIA TOUCH to obtain clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly and was then crowded by WINGS OF WAR which shifted out.
No report.
Between the 250 Metres and the 200 Metres raced tight between MEGA BONUS and KA YING CHEER which shifted out.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.

Shortly after the start was steadied when crowded between OUR LUCKY GLORY and KA YING CHEER, both of which shifted ground.  Raced wide and without cover in the middle stages.  Over the final 100 Metres lay in and proved difficult to ride out to the finish of the event.

Jumped only fairly.  After the race, C Y Ho reported that his mount resented the kickback during the running of the event and would derive benefit from tonight’s performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer”.
No report.
No report.

After the race, L Ferraris stated that from the outside barrier and his mount up in grade tonight, it did not travel well during the event and was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, MEGA BONUS will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Jumped only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Raced wide and without cover in the early stages and was allowed to stride forward and take up a position outside the lead passing the 1200 Metres.
No report.
Slow to begin and from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.

Jumped only fairly.  When questioned regarding his riding from the 700 Metres, K Teetan stated that after improving to follow ARTHUR’S KINGDOM, he observed both GO GO GO and HAPPY HERO to commence a forward move.  He said as his instructions included that YEE CHEONG WARRIOR is one-paced and likes to obtain clear running out wide, he elected to shift out to follow those runners into the event.  He added as he did so ARTHUR’S KINGDOM improved, however, YEE CHEONG WARRIOR responded only fairly to his riding and finished the race off in a one-paced manner.  Trainer D J Hall confirmed the advice given to Jockey Teetan that YEE CHEONG WARRIOR prefers to race with clear racing room to the outside of the field in the Home Straight.  After the race, an endoscopic examination was conducted on YEE CHEONG WARRIOR at the request of Mr Hall.  The Veterinary Surgeon said this examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, YEE CHEONG WARRIOR will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the race, M Chadwick advised that from a wide barrier he was instructed to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages. Trainer C H Yip confirmed the instructions and stated he issued such instructions as FASTPASS had drawn wide and had raced in a disappointing manner in its most recent starts when ridden in a forward position.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the race, H Bentley reported that his mount failed to travel at any stage of the event, lay in in the Home Straight and raced in a disappointing manner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.

Was found to have lost its left front hoof cast, which was part of its approved plating, shortly before being presented on course to race.  As the hoof cast could not be reset prior to the running of the event, GREEN LASER was withdrawn by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice .  Before being allowed to race again, GREEN LASER will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Jumped only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned regarding his riding out, H Bowman stated that approaching the 150 Metres his mount raced in restricted room between DRAGON DELIGHT and MY INTELLIGENT.  He added over the concluding stages when NOBLE WIN shifted in, HEARTY WISH again raced in restricted room for some distance thereafter.  Notwithstanding it did not affect his finishing position, H Bowman was reminded of his obligations that, wherever possible, he should ride his mounts out to the finish of the event.
From the 300 Metres was held up for clear running between TSUEN WAN GLORY and REGENCY HAPPY STAR which was giving ground and did not obtain clear running until approaching the 150 Metres.

Between the 400 Metres and the 250 Metres was held up for clear running between JAZZ CLUB and THE CONCENTRATION.  After the 250 Metres was shifted to the inside of THE CONCENTRATION but again approaching the 150 Metres was held up behind BEAT HOLLOW and did not secure clear running until after the 100 Metres.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

As the start was effected reared simultaneously and as a consequence missed the start.  The barrier manners of SUPER JOY were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, SUPER JOY will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial.
Leaving the 1100 Metres shifted out when being steadied away from HEARTY WISH.
No report.
Whilst in the saddling stalls, BEAT HOLLOW had its right front plate refitted.  BEAT HOLLOW was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.

Despite being ridden along in the early stages failed to show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position.  After the 300 Metres became held up for clear running between BEAT HOLLOW and TSUEN WAN GLORY and did not obtain clear running in the Home Straight thereafter.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover from the 800 Metres. A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly and from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

On arrival at the barriers, K Teetan expressed concern with his mount’s action.  MORE RICE was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said in his opinion the horse was lame in its right front leg and as such was not suitable to race.  Acting on this advice, MORE RICE was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  Before being allowed to race again, MORE RICE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Apprentice E C W Wong was fined the sum of $2,000 for failing to present himself in the Parade Ring by the required time.  Apprentice Wong pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 950 Metres (see FAST RESPONDER).  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
Bumped shortly after the start.  Over the final 200 Metres lay out.

Jumped awkwardly.  For a short distance near the 350 Metres was held up for clear running behind ACE VICTORY.
Jumped only fairly.  C Y Ho was fined the sum of $2,000 for failing to present himself in the Parade Ring by the required time.

Apprentice E C W Wong (BABY CRYSTAL) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 950 Metres he allowed his mount to shift out when insufficiently clear of FAST RESPONDER, resulting in FAST RESPONDER having to be checked to avoid the heels of BABY CRYSTAL.  Apprentice Wong was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Monday, 1 July 2024 and to expire on Sunday, 7 July 2024 on which day he may resume race riding (3 Hong Kong racedays).  In addition, Apprentice Wong was fined $40,000.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very poor race riding record.
Shifted in after the 150 Metres and bumped DUKE WAI.  Sent for sampling post-race.

The Stewards considered a protest/objection lodged by K Teetan, the rider of the second placegetter DUKE WAI alleging interference passing the 150 Metres.  After considering all the evidence, the Stewards found that COPARTNER PRANCE (Z Purton) shifted in after the 150 Metres and made contact with DUKE WAI, however, having regard to the minimal consequential effects of the contact and the manner in which both horses finished the race off, the Stewards overruled the protest/objection and declared weighed-in on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.  Z Purton was advised to exercise more care.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Slow to begin.
No report.
No report.
No report.

No report. <11/6/2024 Additional Veterinary Reports>The Veterinary Surgeon reported that NERVOUS WITNESS was lame in its right hind leg on the morning after racing. Before being allowed to race again, NERVOUS WITNESS will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Slow to begin.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped on jumping.  Z Purton pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 350 Metres (see ALACRITY). Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped on jumping.  For a short distance leaving the 1400 Metres raced tight to the inside of ESCAPE ROUTE which was crowded by FLAMINGO TRILLION which shifted in before being corrected by its rider.
Bumped at the start.

When caught wide in the early stages and racing keenly was allowed to stride forward and lead approaching the 900 Metres.  After the race, Trainer C Fownes confirmed that Apprentice E C W Wong was given the option of taking up a forward position if circumstances permitted.
On jumping was crowded between UNIVERSAL HORIZON an ALACRITY which shifted in abruptly.
No report.

Z Purton (STUNNING PEACH) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 350 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of ALACRITY, resulting in ALACRITY being crowded for room and checked.  Z Purton was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Thursday, 4 July 2024 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent race riding record.

After the race, K C Leung reported that his mount was unsuited by being pressured in the early stages and in particular when FLAGSHIP WARRIOR went forward approaching the 900 Metres.  He added as a result FLAMINGO TRILLION was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Near the 1100 Metres, when racing keenly, was steadied to avoid WINNING DRAGON.
Bumped at the start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the race, H Bowman reported that his mount travelled reasonably well but when asked for an effort approaching the 300 Metres got its head up and did not respond to his riding.  He added when he was concerned there may be something amiss with his mount, he eased it down from the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of STAR MAC, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, STAR MAC will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

On arrival at the Start, K De Melo expressed concern with the horse’s action.  NICHOLSON RETURNS was examined by the Veterinary Officer who after the necessary consultation said the horse was suitable to race.  From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the race, K De Melo stated that his mount did not travel well throughout the event and when he was concerned there may be something amiss with his mount in the Home Straight, he eased it down from the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of NICHOLSON RETURNS, which had performed similarly on the second consecutive occasion, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, NICHOLSON RETURNS will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in consecutive barrier trials and be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Shortly after the start was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.

Near the 250 Metres improved into a narrow run between CALIFORNIATOTALITY and MISSION VOICE and a short distance later was then steadied when crowded by MISSION VOICE (L Ferraris) which shifted in and away from SPECIAL HEDGE.  Whilst the Stewards accepted that L Ferraris had made an effort to correct his mount, he was advised in similar circumstances he would be expected to react sooner than what he did on this occasion.
Bumped at the start.
No report.
Jumped awkwardly and was bumped.
After travelling a short distance was steadied when crowded between CALL ME SUPREME and LUCKY TOUCH which shifted in despite the efforts of its rider.
Shortly after the start was bumped.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Jumped only fairly.  Held up for clear running making the Home Turn and near the 250 Metres was briefly held up behind TRADITION.  After the race, the Veterinary Officer reported that SUPER WISE DRAGON was a "roarer” which had previously been reported.

After the race, B Avdulla stated that his instructions were to endeavour to find cover on his mount.  He said in the early stages he was able to hold a forward position, but runners to his outside did not show sufficient pace to cross his mount and as a result he was left racing outside the lead.  He added in the Home Straight his mount came under pressure and near the 250 Metres was bumped on the hindquarters by TRADITION, became unbalanced and gave ground from that point.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned regarding his riding in the early stages, H Bentley stated that from the outside barrier his instructions were to hold a forward position.  He said after THE ABSOLUTE commenced well, his intention was to follow another runner across to sit outside the lead.  He stated that when MISSION VOICE improved to his inside in the early stages, he had expected that runner to continue forward to race in the lead and he would position his mount to the outside of that runner.  He added that when MISSION VOICE was unable to cross runners to his inside, this resulted in THE ABSOLUTE being obliged to race four wide and without cover and as a result near the 900 Metres he attempted to ride his mount forward to cross runners to his inside.  He said when MISSION VOICE then held its position to his inside and he was not able to cross that runner, he then elected to desist from going forward, however, his mount was obliged to continue to race four wide and without cover before giving ground in Home Straight.  Trainer K H Ting confirmed the instructions issued.  Jockey Bentley agreed with the Stewards that in retrospect he would have been better suited by riding his mount in a more decisive manner in the early stages to cross to the front and take advantage of the good start that his mount obtained.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.
Jumped only fairly and was bumped shortly after the start.   A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.
Sent for sampling post-race.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly.  Near the 1000 Metres was bumped by EIGHTY LIGHT YEARS and was steadied away from SILVER SONIC.  Over the concluding stages the whip of A Badel was caught behind the leg of B Avdulla, the rider of BEAUTY CRESCENT.
Approaching the 1000 Metres was taken in and bumped.

Bumped at the start.  Approaching the 1000 Metres was steadied when crowded for room.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shortly after the start was steadied when crowded between BEAUTY CRESCENT and SUPER GOLDI which was taken out by BEAUTY GLORY.  Leaving the 1000 Metres was checked to avoid THE HEIR.
Approaching the 1000 Metres was bumped, became unbalanced and shifted in.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Near the 1100 Metres, after improving to the inside of SILVER SONIC (L Ferraris), was then steadied to avoid the heels of that runner.  L Ferraris was reprimanded.

Bumped at the start.  Shifted out approaching the 400 Metres and was bumped.  M Chadwick (BEAUTY THUNDER) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that approaching the 1000 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when insufficiently clear of BEAUTY CRESCENT, resulting in BEAUTY CRESCENT being taken in and making contact with SUPER GOLDI and then forcing SUPER GOLDI in across the running of MOJAVE DESERT, resulting in MOJAVE DESERT having to be checked and also crowding THE HEIR which was racing to the inside of MOJAVE DESERT.  M Chadwick was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Thursday, 4 July 2024 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good race riding record.
No report.

Approaching the 1000 Metres was crowded between CHIU CHOW SPIRIT and MOJAVE DESERT which shifted out.  Approaching the 400 Metres was bumped by MOJAVE DESERT which shifted out.  After the race, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that his instructions were to endeavour to lead.  He said his mount was slow to begin, was crowded shortly after and settled further back.  He added EIGHTY LIGHT YEARS raced keenly throughout the early and middle stages and after being crowded near the 1000 Metres and racing wide and without cover thereafter was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

M Chadwick pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding for causing interference approaching the 1000 Metres (see MOJAVE DESERT). A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.
After the race, M F Poon reported that his mount hung in in the Home Straight and proved reluctant to shift to the outside for some distance approaching the 200 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Shortly after the start was crowded and became unbalanced.  Near the 100 Metres was directed to the inside of RUBY SAILING to continue into clear running.

Jumped only fairly and from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Shortly after the start was crowded.  Near the 1000 Metres when racing keenly was steadied away from NOT A FEW.  Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out to the finish when it improved close to TOP SCORER.

After the race, C L Chau reported that from the outside barrier he was instructed to ride his mount conservatively in the early stages to avoid having to make too much use of it to go forward. Trainer C H Yip confirmed the instructions issued.
No report.
Bumped shortly after the start.

In the early stages when being crossed by TOP SCORER raced keenly and was steadied away from that runner near the 1150 Metres.  Briefly held up after the 400 Metres.  After the race, K C Leung reported that as his mount raced keenly in the event, it failed to finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly. <3/6/2024 Additional Veterinary Reports>The Veterinary Surgeon reported that C P ONE had sustained a left front fetlock injury on the day after racing.  Before being allowed to race again, C P ONE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.
On jumping was bumped by DRAGON STAR which shifted out.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly and was crowded shortly after the start.  Held up for clear running making the Home Turn.  Bumped after the 200 Metres.
Bumped shortly after the start.  From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

After the race, K Teetan reported that he had to make too much use of his mount in the early stages to hold his position to the outside of VULCANUS and as a result DRAGON STAR did not respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Shortly after the start was bumped on the hindquarters.  Near the 1300 Metres made contact with FLYING PHANTOM when FLYING PHANTOM was racing tight to the inside of GOLDEN LINK.  Passing the 200 Metres was bumped by INVINCIBLE MISSILE which shifted out.  After the race, B Thompson reported that he had to make some use of his mount in the early stages to hold his position, but COURIER MAGIC failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the race, H T Mo reported that his instructions were to hold a forward position preferably with cover.  He said when VULCANUS jumped well, he elected to allow it to stride forward and lead to avoid racing wide and settled more forward than anticipated.  Trainer Y S Tsui confirmed the instructions issued.
Shortly after the start was bumped by CHATER GOLD which shifted in.
Bumped near the 1300 Metres.  Noted to have lost its left hind plate after the race.

Jumped awkwardly.  Was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  The performance of GOLDEN LINK, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, GOLDEN LINK will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly.  After the race, K De Melo stated that when he felt his mount may have gone amiss near the 400 Metres, he retired it from the event.  As the horse was unable to be fully examined by the Veterinary Officers after the event due to receiving treatment, THUNDERBOLTAURUS B will be examined by the Veterinary Officers tomorrow morning. <13/6/2024 Additional Veterinary Reports>  THUNDERBOLTAURUS B was examined by the Veterinary Officer this morning who said there were no significant findings. Before being allowed to race again, THUNDERBOLTAURUS B will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments.

Withdrawn on 10.6.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (right hind foot injury) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter SETANTA.  Before being allowed to race again, E LEGEND will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Jumped only fairly. The Veterinary Surgeon reported that the horse had sustained a left front tendon injury after racing.  Before being allowed to race again, MASTER OF LUCK will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the race, H Bentley reported that after settling towards the back of the field, KEEN UNITY found it difficult to make up ground when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Between the 1200 Metres and the 1000 Metres raced tight to the inside of SATIRICAL GLORY and was then steadied passing the 1000 Metres when SATIRICAL GLORY was racing keenly and was awkwardly placed to the inside of AMAZING BOY (M Chadwick) which shifted in.  M Chadwick was reprimanded.  For some distance after the 150 Metres lay out.

Raced wide and without cover from the 900 Metres. Approaching the 1600 Metres got its head up when being steadied when momentarily crowded by AMAZING BOY which shifted in before being corrected by its rider M Chadwick.  HOLY POWER then continued to race keenly for some distance thereafter.  Near the 300 Metres was briefly crowded between GOLD TACK and FOREVER GLORIOUS which shifted out slightly. He said in the early stages after commencing well AMAZING BOY was caught wide and as a result he elected to continue forward to cross runners to his inside.  Trainer C W Chang confirmed the instructions and advised he issued such instructions as AMAZING BOY raced in a similar position when it was successful on 24 April 2024 over the same course and distance.

Approaching the 250 Metres was shifted to the inside of FLYING WROTE to secure clear running.  Over the final 100 Metres raced tight between TRAVEL GOLF and FLYING WROTE which shifted in.  As a result, MR VALIANT could not be fully ridden out to the finish of the event.

Approaching the 1000 Metres was steadied when momentarily crowded between AMAZING ACE which shifted out slightly and TATTENHAM (A Hamelin) which shifted in.  A Hamelin was advised to exercise more care.  Approaching the 150 Metres was brushed by TATTENHAM which shifted out slightly.  Whilst the Stewards were satisfied that the riding of H Bowman, 4th placegetter, over the concluding stages did not affect the horse’s finishing position, he was nonetheless reminded of his obligation to ensure that he fully rides his mounts out to the finish of the race.
Jumped awkwardly and then was crowded shortly after the start.

When questioned, A Hamelin stated that from the outside barrier his instructions were to ride his mount forward, however, when unable to cross runners to his inside, he was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Trainer P C Ng confirmed the instructions issued.

Jumped only fairly and was bumped shortly after the start.  Near the 550 Metres was crowded between SUGAR BALL and TELECOM POWER which shifted to the outside of SPICY GOLD.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When being crossed by HERO STAR approaching the 1000 Metres commenced to race keenly and became unbalanced when being steadied away from HERO STAR.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, AMAZING ACE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Jumped only fairly and then was checked when crowded between TRAVEL GOLF and SPICY GOLD which was taken in by FLYING WROTE.

The declaration of weighed-in was deferred whilst the Stewards considered whether SWEET DIAMOND had been afforded a fair start.  After taking evidence from Jockey H Bentley, Trainer P F Yiu and Starter A Speechley, the Stewards found that as the start was effected SWEET DIAMOND lunged forward, made contact with the starting gates and as a result lost considerable ground.  As the Stewards were satisfied that such occurrence occurred as the start was being effected, SWEET DIAMOND was declared a runner as the Stewards determined that the horse had not had an unfair start.  Having regard to SWEET DIAMOND’s good record at the starting gates, the horse will be required to perform satisfactorily in a stalls test before being allowed to race again.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, SWEET DIAMOND will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Before being allowed to race again, SUGAR BALL will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After this incident, JOYFUL SUPREME then raced keenly for some distance thereafter.
No report.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Shifted out near the 50 Metres and was bumped.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Held up for clear running approaching the 300 Metres.  After the 100 Metres was shifted to the inside of SATIRICAL FAN to continue into clear running. After the race, the Veterinary Officer reported that NEVER TOO SOON was lame in its right front leg and had sustained lacerations to both hind legs. Before being allowed to race again, NEVER TOO SOON will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Also noted to have lost its right hind plate after the race.
Bumped near the 250 Metres.  Near the 150 Metres was steadied to avoid RED HARE KING (H Bowman) which shifted in when not quite clear.  H Bowman was advised to exercise more care.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

After the race, Z Purton stated that his instructions from a wide barrier were to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages.  He said whilst complying with his instructions, BEAUTY INFINITY raced keenly in the early stages.  He added that with the pace of the event run outside of standard time during the early stages, BEAUTY INFINITY was unable to run on in the Home Straight.  Trainer J Size confirmed the instructions issued.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Withdrawn on 11.6.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (left front ligament injury) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter SWEET BRIAR.  Before being allowed to race again, BIG RED will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

When questioned, H Bentley stated that at its last start from the outside barrier he was asked to ride his mount in a conservative manner due to it stepping up in distance.  He said today he was asked to attempt to obtain a midfield position with cover, however, was given the option to settle in a more forward position if cover was not available.  He added after commencing well today and with the pace of the event being run outside of standard time, RUN RUN TIMING was able to take up a more forward position than anticipated.
No report.
No report.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  At the time of declaration, C L Chau had claimed 1 lb overweight from his riding weight of 119 lbs to ride CHILL CHIBI.   At the time of weighing out, C L Chau requested a further pound overweight which is permitted under the Rules.   C L Chau then weighed in after the race at 122 lbs, 3 lbs over the horse’s allocated weight.   Jockey Chau was fined the sum of $7,500.

Shifted out at the start and was bumped. When questioned regarding his riding, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that his instructions were to lead the event at a comfortable tempo.  He said after obtaining the lead in the early stages, from nearing the 1200 Metres he eased his mount to attempt to comply with his instructions which resulted in the early sectionals of the event being run well outside of standard time.  Apprentice Wong agreed with the Stewards that in retrospect he had made an error of judgement by setting a pace that was too slow throughout the early stages which resulted in HELENE FEELING and MOMENTS IN TIME making a forward move near the 1000 Metres which disadvantaged TELECOM FIGHTERS.  Apprentice Wong was advised that in similar circumstances he would be expected to show better judgement than what he did on this occasion.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned, M F Poon stated that his instructions were to hold a forward position and after commencing well he was able to obtain a position outside the lead in the early stages.  He said from the 500 Metres MIDORI GLORY came under pressure before weakening in the Home Straight.  He added the only explanation he could offer was that MIDORI GLORY may be better suited on a firmer surface.  Trainer P F Yiu agreed with the explanation offered by Jockey Poon and also indicated that the horse may race better when it is able to obtain cover.   A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of MIDORI GLORY, a last start winner, was considered to be disappointing.  Before being allowed to race again, MIDORI GLORY will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the race, Z Purton stated that the intention was to hold a forward position, but despite riding his mount along in the early stages it did not show sufficient pace to do so.  He said when caught wide he then elected to shift his mount in behind runners in an attempt to obtain cover which he was able to obtain near the 900 Metres and as a result BEAUTY FIT settled further back in the field than what had been intended.
On the Home Turn raced tight to the inside of NORTHERN BEACHES and was bumped near the 450 Metres.

When questioned regarding his riding, A Badel stated that he was instructed to hold a forward position but not necessarily lead.  He said when his mount showed good pace in the early stages, he was able to improve to the front approaching the 1100 Metres.  He added although he was aware the pace of the event was being run at a genuine pace, he was reluctant to restrain his mount as it was travelling comfortably.  He further stated that he also elected to stay racing away from the rail as he was of the opinion the track was inferior due to the previous race on the turf being run towards the rail in heavy rain.

Slow to begin. A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have a continuous displacement of the soft palate.  As previous concern had been expressed with the horse’s action, HYPER DRAGON BALL will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in consecutive barrier trials and be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments before being allowed to race again.

He added in the Home Straight HONG KONG HALL did not respond to his riding and, in his opinion, this was due to the horse not being able to obtain a position on the rail.  He said the horse performed in a similar manner on 13 March 2024 when unable to obtain a position on the rail and this was the reason as to why HONG KONG HALL performed disappointingly tonight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of HONG KONG HALL was considered to be disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, HONG KONG HALL will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

When questioned, M F Poon stated that consistent with previous instructions he was asked to take up a forward position tonight.  He said LUCKY ARCHANGEL jumped well and showed good speed in the early stages where it was able to cross and lead the event in a race run close to standard time.  He added after enjoying a comfortable run in the lead, under its light weight, LUCKY ARCHANGEL responded to his riding in the Home Straight and as a result was able to finish the race off strongly to win the race.  Trainer F C Lor confirmed the instructions issued and explained such instructions had been consistent with previous race starts.  He added that LUCKY ARCHANGEL was advantaged by carrying the minimum weight of 115 lbs due to its rating being lowered in recent starts and also by being able to obtain the lead at a comfortable pace from a favourable barrier.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Trainer F C Lor confirmed the instructions and the reasons as to why he issued such instructions.  He added that such instructions were consistent with those that he had issued at previous race starts. Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped on the hindquarters shortly after the start and became unbalanced.  Blundered near the 900 Metres.

Jumped only fairly and from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight and the reason he shifted to the inside of SWEET SMILE after the 250 Metres, B Thompson stated that initially his intention was to obtain clear running between EXCELLENT DADDY and SWEET SMILE.  He stated that when SWEET SMILE shifted out slightly near the 250 Metres, he then directed JUBILANT WINNER to that runner’s inside in an attempt to obtain clear running.  He added his decision to do so was also influenced by the fact that JUBILANT WINNER lay in in the Home Straight.  He further stated that after obtaining running to the inside of SWEET SMILE, JUBILANT WINNER then became held up approaching the 100 Metres when disappointed for clear running between SWEET SMILE which shifted back in slightly and ROBOT MASTER which shifted out.  He said as a result JUBILANT WINNER did not obtain clear running until near the 50 Metres.  After considering his explanations, the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Thompson were reasonable in the circumstances.

Leaving the 700 Metres was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced. The Veterinary Surgeon said this examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea. Before being allowed to race again, EXCELLENT DADDY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Leaving the 700 Metres got its head up when being steadied to avoid DRAGON JOY and as a result shifted out and made contact with the hindquarters of EXCELLENT DADDY.

After the race, H Bowman reported that his instructions were to go forward but after his mount was bumped at the start and when caught wide in the early stages, he elected to obtain a position back in the field with cover to avoid racing wide.  He added in the Home Straight KIMBERLEY responded only fairly to his riding and its run ended near the 200 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, KIMBERLEY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
On jumping was crowded between MISTER DAPPER which shifted out slightly and FURY AND GOLD which shifted in abruptly.

The performance of AFFORDABLE, which gave ground in the Home Straight, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, AFFORDABLE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover until after the 800 Metres when it was ridden forward to race outside the leader LUCKY BANNER.  Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned regarding his riding from the 1000 Metres and the reason he shifted to the outside of SUNNY DARLING, H Bowman stated that after following SUNNY DARLING in the early stages, he was concerned that runner would not provide him with the opportunity to improve into the event from the 800 Metres.  He said when he observed YOUNG BRILLIANT improve to his outside leaving the 1000 Metres, he elected to shift out to the outside of SUNNY DARLING as he was concerned that his mount may have been held up behind SUNNY DARLING when YOUNG BRILLIANT held its position to that runner’s outside.  He added as a consequence of shifting out, this resulted in YOUNG BRILLIANT having to continue forward where it took up a position outside the lead.  H Bowman stated that whilst this resulted in G LINER racing wide and without cover from the 750 Metres, as G LINER is a horse that is not able to sprint quickly, he felt that that this was the best option for him to undertake at that part of the race.  The Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Bowman were reasonable in the circumstances.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Shortly after the start was bumped by KINGLY DEMEANOR which shifted out.  When questioned regarding his riding in the middle stages and the reason FASTPASS raced wide and without cover from the 800 Metres, M F Poon stated that his mount did not travel well throughout the event.  He said whilst he had a trailing position behind GO GO GO, he placed his mount under pressure near the 850 Metres to encourage it to travel and as he placed FASTPASS under pressure with the whip, it shifted out which allowed LEATHER MASTER to improve to his inside.  He added as a result FASTPASS was obliged to race wide and without cover from the 800 Metres, but never responded to his riding and gave ground in the Home Straight.  Trainer C H Yip confirmed that the intention had been to hold a handy position with cover, but agreed with Jockey Poon that FASTPASS had come under pressure in the middle stages which resulted in FASTPASS shifting out near the 800 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

At declaration time, A Atzeni was declared as the rider of both GOKO WIN and POLARIS.  It was established that A Atzeni had a firm commitment to ride GOKO WIN.  As such, the Stewards permitted H Bowman to be substituted as the rider of POLARIS.  For this declaration error, Trainer K L Man was fined $2,000.  Subsequently the Stewards approved for M Chadwick to be substituted as the rider of POLARIS as H Bowman was unable to make the weight.  Having regard to the circumstances of this case and in particular that Jockey Bowman advised the Stewards of his unavailability to ride prior to betting commencing, the Stewards believed that the appropriate penalty was for him to be fined a sum of $2,000.

A Atzeni was fined the sum of $2,000 for failing to present himself in the Parade Ring by the required time.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages. Jumped awkwardly and made contact with FASHION LEGEND, resulting in its rider Y L Chung becoming unbalanced. He added YOUNG SUPERSTAR was also disadvantaged by being pressured in the lead by JAMES TAK but failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight and was still, in his opinion, disappointing.  Trainer A S Cruz stated that YOUNG SUPERSTAR was disadvantaged by the track conditions, which, whilst still rated as "Good”, had some effects of the rain which had fallen earlier in the day.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of YOUNG SUPERSTAR, a last start winner, was considered to be disappointing.  Before being allowed to race again, YOUNG SUPERSTAR will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Before being allowed to race again, SILK ROAD GLORY will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Raced wide and without cover from the 900 Metres.  Near the 450 Metres was bumped by TOP GUN which shifted out to improve.  L Hewitson (THRIVING BROTHERS) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that leaving the 400 Metres he directed his mount to the outside of STELLAR EXPRESS, resulting in THRIVING BROTHERS making contact with ACE VICTORY, taking ACE VICTORY out onto TOP GUN which was taken wider, resulting in JOLLY RULER being checked to avoid the heels of TOP GUN.  L Hewitson was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 10 July 2024 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good careless riding record.

Bumped at the start.  At the 450 Metres was shifted to the outside of ACE VICTORY to obtain clear running and bumped JOLLY RULER.  After the 400 Metres was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.  After the race, K Teetan reported that his mount shifted ground during the running of the event but finished the race off only fairly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, TOP GUN will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Before being allowed to race again, MAGIC PHOENIX will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

When questioned, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that his instructions were to endeavour to lead the event if possible.  He said his mount jumped only fairly and when ONE FOR ALL showed superior pace to his mount in the early stages, he elected to allow that runner to cross as he was of the opinion if he contested the lead, the pace would be too fast.  He added after being crossed by ONE FOR ALL, LEAN MASTER commenced to race keenly which it continued to do throughout the middle stages.  He said making the first turn he was reluctant to shift to the outside of ONE FOR ALL and race outside the lead as he was content to maintain his cover to endeavour to prevent it from racing too keenly in the middle stages. No report.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  When questioned, H Bowman stated that his instructions from a wide barrier were to ride his mount conservatively in the early stages.  He said DENFIELD travelled satisfactorily in the early stages but from the 600 Metres he became concerned with his mount’s action, particularly when leading on its right leg.  He said for this reason after entering the Home Straight he was reluctant to place his mount under full pressure as he continued to have concerns with its action until DENFIELD changed stride near the 250 Metres.  He said once balanced he then commenced to ride his mount out fully to the end of the race.  He added however he did not use the whip on DENFIELD as he felt his mount was responding strongly to his hand and heels riding.  H Bowman was reminded of his obligation under Rule 105 to report to the Stewards immediately following the race any condition which may affect the performance of his horse during the running of a race.  Trainer C S Shum confirmed the instructions issued and also confirmed that immediately after the race Jockey Bowman had expressed concern in relation to the horse’s action during the running of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The Stewards determined that DENFIELD will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments before being allowed to race again.

Crowded at the start, bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.  Near the 1000 Metres commenced to race keenly and got its head up when being steadied away from GRAND BOSS.  Sent for sampling post-race.

On jumping was badly crowded between GRAND BOSS and FIGHT TIME which shifted out.  Prior to declaring weighed-in, the Stewards gave consideration if there were sufficient grounds to lodge a protest/objection on behalf of the connections of FORERUNNER when that runner shifted out slightly away from SMILING COLLECTOR near the 175 Metres.  When the Stewards were satisfied that there were not sufficient grounds and the connections had elected not to lodge a protest/objection, weighed-in was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.  When questioned regarding his riding and the reason he elected to shift to the outside of SMILING COLLECTOR near the 250 Metres, H Bowman stated that his initial intention was to improve between GRAND BOSS and SMILING COLLECTOR, however, when SMILING COLLECTOR shifted in slightly approaching the 250 Metres, he was then committed to shifting to that runner’s outside to improve.  After considering his explanations, the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Bowman were reasonable in the circumstances.  H Bowman pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 200 Metres (see SOLID WIN).  Sent for sampling post-race.
Crowded at the start.
On jumping was steadied when crowded between RIVER VIEWS and MR ALADDIN which shifted out.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Jumped only fairly and was bumped heavily by MARADO which shifted in.  Near the 400 Metres was disappointed for clear running between WAR OF COURAGE and FIGHT TIME, both of which shifted ground slightly.  Then had difficulty obtaining clear running until near the 300 Metres.

H Bowman (FORERUNNER) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 200 Metres he allowed his mount to shift out when insufficiently clear of SOLID WIN, resulting in SOLID WIN being checked to avoid the heels of FORERUNNER.  Having regard to Jockey Bowman holding confirmed riding engagements for the remainder of the season and in accordance with previous practices, he was fined the sum of $60,000 in  lieu of a one-day suspension.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent race riding record within his last 200 rides.
No report.
After the race, A Badel stated that from a wide barrier and with MR ALADDIN dropping back in distance today, it settled further back than its most recent starts.

When questioned, Y L Chung stated that his instructions were to hold an on-pace position and to obtain cover if possible.  He said in the early stages when positioned to the outside of LAPRAS, he was of the opinion that he would have had to severely restrain his mount to obtain a trailing position behind that runner and as a consequence he elected to remain positioned to its outside.  He said entering the Back Straight he had expected LAPRAS to attempt to look for cover and as a result he then encouraged his mount forward to cross that runner.  He added when SO AWESOME did not show sufficient pace to cross LAPRAS, he was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.

On arrival at the Start, the tongue tie applied to COSMO NAVIGATOR was refitted.  Shifted in shortly after the start and was bumped.  When questioned regarding his riding, A Hamelin stated that his instructions were to hold a forward position and if possible to race outside the expected leader HAYDAY.  He said in the early stages when LAPRAS and SO AWESOME showed good pace to his inside, COSMO NAVIGATOR was obliged to race very wide and without cover on the first turn.  He added that during this section of the race COSMO NAVIGATOR lay in which required him to take corrective action to prevent it from crowding runners to his inside and as a consequence he was unable to ride his mount forward with his usual vigour as he was concerned that COSMO NAVIGATOR may shift in.  He further stated that when SO AWESOME held its position to his inside, he then elected to restrain his mount and obtain cover near the 800 Metres when he was of the opinion that COSMO NAVIGATOR was not showing sufficient pace to cross runners to his inside.  After considering his explanation, the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Hamelin were reasonable in the circumstances, however, he was advised, whenever possible, he should endeavour to ride his mounts in a manner to comply with the instructions issued.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bounded on jumping and lost ground.  In the early stages then raced keenly and got its head up.  Between the 150 Metres and the 50 Metres was held up for clear running between MULTIDARLING and COSMO NAVIGATOR which was giving ground.

As the start was effected reared and as a consequence lost ground. After the race, K Teetan stated that his mount settled further back in the field after rearing at the start and losing ground.  He said PATCH OF TIME, which was having its first race start at Happy Valley, did not appreciate racing around the Happy Valley circuit but was still somewhat disappointing.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned regarding his riding in the early stages and in particular the fast pace set, L Hewitson stated that his instructions were to hold a forward position and either lead or obtain cover if circumstances permitted.  He said in the early stages when positioned to the outside of CORDYCEPS ONE, he was unable to obtain cover as he was positioned in advance of that horse and for this reason he elected to ride his mount forward to cross runners to his inside.  He added as a consequence he was obliged to make use of his mount to cross those runners which resulted in a fast pace being set.  He said after obtaining a position in advance and to the outside of SUPER BABY, he then continued to ride his mount forward to cross that runner as he was of the opinion that SUPER BABY would not contest the lead.  Trainer K L Man confirmed that the instructions were to take up a forward position.  After considering his explanation, the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Hewitson were reasonable in the circumstances.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
